I’ve owned ALL generations of WiFi only iPad Minis so I guess this is the first time I’m experiencing a really major change to a device I’ve been using for several hours each and every day for approx the past 8+ years. This change takes some getting used to.,My spouse and I both have iPhones and iPads so we have lightning connector cables scattered all over the house and the cars. In comes the USB-C equipped device which means I have to get appropriate cables for strategic locations where I would need it. I suppose in several years when all our Apple devices get updated to USB-C this would no longer be a problem. Also good that the battery capacity is remarkably better on the mini 6 so less need for plugging it in often.,The display is quite stunning. A definite improvement over the old one. I like the ability to display smaller icons, it helps me find things a bit easier. The fingerprint sensor location is not yet intuitive as I tend to tap the keypad instead to turn on the device. The processor appears noticeably quicker (but not by much).,It’s been about 2 years since my last update to a new device (iPad mini 5) and i’ve forgotten how “painful” the process is, particularly since I have a good number of apps that I use. Logging in to each and every one of them just takes time to get everything working seamlessly again.,Overall the 6 appears to be a substantial upgrade and worth the wait although I consider the mini 5 still holding its own against the 6.

Nice and fast, good battery life, good cameras.,The jelly scrolling is a noticeable issue and it's weird they oriented the screen in this direction. In general the screen is low quality enough that it was initially causing me eye pain and a headache but just took some getting used to as after ~10 days it's not currently issue.,Pressing too hard on the screen will cause some distortion on the lcd.,Other then resolution, my old Samsung Galaxy Tab S 8.4 (2014) had a vastly better screen, more vibrant, better colors, no jelly scrolling, doesn't have the screen press issue.,The Mini 6 just feels like Apple cut corners but kept the premium price.
I love this for travel. My regular iPad is too big as reader and my kindle stinks for email and games. This is perfect

I have just recently returned the Sennheiser Momentum 3 for their muddy bass.,Did I expect these headphones to sound neutral and tuned like my favorite audiophile headphones? No. In fact I prefer the more easygoing, bassy profile of the M3’s but these beat them where it counts for me overall.,So with those expectations not even being there, I was pleasantly surprised in other ways.,First impressions,Sound:, The bass… is very developed. Perhaps just a shade less in quantity than some of the typical portable headphones that are boosting a bunch of smooshy indistinct low end frequencies (eh ehm beats and most others). But it is much more dense and solid than it’s competition. It could use some more control but it still does better than the headphones I have had a hand on. Good extension as well. No big mid bass hump. Way more slam than the beats solo pro and more volume, but less than the M3, yet more solid.,Mids…are there and pretty clear. Very clean. They sound a little digital and artificial to me. But not much. There is a fast decay. The cups don’t sound like there are a lot of reverberations in them. That chip must be working overtime. They actually sound realistic in balance. Not too lush, not too recessed, but clean with a metallic like timbre to them. A little hard to describe. Hard to fault but they sound pretty good. The upper mids have jumped at me a few times though.,Highs…these have a similar tuning right off the bat to the airpods or beats. Just a little less bright but more detailed. The new beats solo pro are more bright by a little than these to me, but more scooped in the mids. I personally feel they are a little tilted in the highs and definitely spritely. These headphones feel just a little U- shaped. The highs are just a little sharp sometimes, but they hold their character very well and when music gets real busy, they keep from sounding splashy. But they are a little over sharpened to me. Kind of like a picture with the clarity turned up a little to high.,Instrument separation: better than any portable  headphone I have heard hands down,Detail retrieval: excellent for its class,Clarity/Transparency: none better out there for the price that I can say without hesitation. More clear to me than other portables I have tried.,Soundstage: nothing that really impresses me, but it feels relatively spacious for its class. Edit: best in class for sure. I find the soundstage to be really good for a headphone like this. A little more wide than deep but with excellent layering.,Flaws:,- you better get some protection cause those cups are gonna slap together and make blemishes later on. I can only imagine what these will look like after some time.,- if you lay down they feel like they can start to slide a little bit off the ears,- no eq!!! Come on. I just use boost for EQ on these as an app,- I see them trying to be innovative with this stupid cup cover as a case but these should come with a carrying case for all this money.,- Cabin pressure is no joke on these.,Cool things:,- Just tap them to your iphone to connnect,- The volume knob that multifunctions as a pause and play is awesome,- transparency mode is mind blowing. When you put them on, things sound almost identical to having no headphones on. You hear your surroundings naturally.,Verdict so far:,These sound better than: nuraphones, Sennheiser M3’s, Beats solo Pro, Bowers and Wilkins, Sony Mx10004,If I owned an android phone I would still pick these over other headphones for sure, just for the sound and premium build.

These are my favorite headphones. When you account for the sound quality, noise cancellation, convenience, comfort and the quality of the build, it makes the price more palatable.,That said, there's no denying that they are expensive. At the same time, they pretty much reside in their own category of headphones. You can easily get better sounding headphones for less than $200 - but those are wired and lack active noise cancelling. You can shop around other Bluetooth headphones with ANC (XM4, QCII35, 700 etc…) but those don't sound as good. Though they certainly don't sound bad and they're a couple of Benjamins cheaper. I firmly believe the Max's ANC is also better than all the previously mentioned gear, though not by much when compared to the XM4s. One very nice thing about the AirPods Max is the ANC causes no hiss at all, not even a little.,But there's just no comparison when you compare the build and comfort. Other Bluetooth ANC headphones feel cheap. Once you handle the faux leather and creaky plastic parts you understand why they're much less expensive. The cloth and foam ear pads on the Max are nearly perfect. They form a good seal, even with glasses, and they’re comfortable for long listening sessions. The aluminum and stainless steel parts feel both durable and even luxurious. The mesh headband distributes the Max's substantial weight very evenly. Moreover, everything is modular and repairable on the Max. The circuit boards, batteries, cups, pads, the headband itself - all disassemble with relative ease so your purchase may just last for decades.,Much has been made of the Max’s weight. In my experience, it’s a non issue. Lounging in the house, washing dishes, sitting at the computer - the weight is fine. BUT, the clamping force is another matter. These things firmly squeeze your head. Initially, I thought I was going to have to return them. Having used them for a couple weeks, they’ve loosened significantly. Possibly, I’ve also acclimated to them.,Transparency mode is amazing. Without doubt, it’s the best implementation I’ve heard. I’ve yet to try out Spacial Audio because until it works with my TV, it’s a gimmick that I don’t care about. I don’t watch movies on my iPhone or even iPad. If you do, you may feel differently.,I do wish I could use them to block out sounds without playing music or white noise. But when not playing audio, the ANC causes too much pressure on my eardrums.,I also wish there were an accompanying App that enabled more intuitive EQ or control of other settings: like perhaps degrees of ANC or better monitoring of battery life and standby. This seems like an oversight on Apple’s part.,Yes, the case isn’t much of a case and it is annoying that they don’t include a cable for wired listening. But those are small things and do not detract from the sound quality, convenience and materials of the headphones themselves.,The ear pads do make my ears warm in my usage. I don’t see how any closed back headphone with a decent seal wouldn’t make one’s ears warm. That said, the warmth doesn’t bother me at all and I don’t feel that they’re uncomfortably hot.,Recently, there have been many reports of condensation and/or sweat accumulating beneath the ear pads on the plastic housing that protects the drivers. Though I don’t doubt these accounts, I have yet to have it happen. After using the AirPods Max for three to four hours, at my desk and around the house, they’re as dry as can be. I don’t know what combination of temperature, humidity, body heat and time causes moisture to appear. All I can suggest is that if you purchase the AirPods Max, try and reproduce the issue with your normal usage. Hopefully, it will be a non issue for you as well.,If you own a couple of Apple devices, say a Mac and an iPhone, the Max’s convenience makes them even more compelling. Normal Bluetooth pairing can be mildly annoying or, depending on your devices, VERY frustrating. There’s no such hassle with the AirPods Max. They just connect. They just switch. They just work.,If you’re cross shopping, there are a couple of Bluetooth headphones that might sound slightly better, but they lack ANC. There are many, many headphones that are both cheaper and sound better, but they are wired and lack ANC. The AirPods Max really are in a different class compared to the $350 range of Bluetooth ANC headphones the market has become used to.,In my opinion, these should not be compared with lesser ANC BT headphones but with the BO H95s. Though I've never owned the H95s, I have held, listened to and envied them. They’re amazing. But they’re also $800 and the ANC is not as advanced. In comparison, the AirPods Max are a bargain, even if they don’t sound quite as nice as the H95s - though they are very close.,I’m very pleased with the AirPods Max. As a complete package, I’m not aware of any other headphones, at any price, that are competitive.,*UPDATE*,This morning I shoveled snow for a little over an hour while wearing the AirPods Max. Admittedly, my understanding of atmospheric physics is pretty low, but I figured my very warm head combined with freezing temperatures affecting the aluminum would likely induce some condensation. But, after shoveling, they were as dry as can be. Again, I'm not casting doubt on the many reports of moisture below the ear pads, but I can't reproduce the effect.

I was not impressed at all by these. The noise canceling was just alight to the point i wasnt even sure if they were functioning properly. I felt like my old sonys did better at noise canceling. I couldnt find a single thing that justifies the 550 dollar price tag. What a waste of time. I dont understand what they hype was about at all

For Apple's first attempt at over-ear headphones, these are not horrible.  I wanted to like them, and being in an Apple ecosystem, I tried to like them, but until they figure out the battery issue these are a non-starter for me.  Noise-canceling is awesome.  Transparency mode is awesome. I do wish there was some adjustable settings in-between those two but for now it is all or nothing.  These things are heavy compared to most other headphones.  They are comfortable on the ears and the headband (goofy as it looks) is comfortable as well.  The phone call quality is excellent. The audio quality is pretty good as well (not an audiophile, but sounded good to my ears).  The build quality is nothing short of spectacular.,Unfortunately, until they get the battery issues resolved, these are a no go for me.  I cannot understand not having an on/off button, but I could accept that if the headphones properly conserved power, which they do not. Whether I put these things in the case or do not put them in the case, they drain 40-50% a night (about 14 hours from the time I take them off when done with work and put them back on in the morning).  I put them in the case on a Friday night at 100%, did not use them on Saturday, went to use them on Sunday and they were dead.  That is unacceptable.  So, until they allow on of the buttons to turn them on and off, or fix the low power mode so it actually works correctly, I will not consider these useful in any way.  And it's a shame because I really did like them.

Quality is superb. Fit and finish are pristine. All that comes with a significant weight penalty. Clamping force is a bit much. Weight and clamping force make them uncomfortable for longer sessions.,Sound is just okay. Soundstage for stereo is not wide open and leans a bit cool.,Controls are pretty good and ambient pass through is easy and excellent. Big miss- no power off. Seriously- no power off without the case.,The case is poorly conceived but that should be obvious to anyone that has seen a picture.,Price-  you are paying for premium materials but give up something to Sony and Bose in most of the othe ANC headphones.,What would I do?  Buy the Sony mx4 and a pair of the AirPod pros and have headphones and ultra portable. Then pat youself on the back for making a wide choice. If you can catch both on sale, the difference is negligible considering what you get. If on a budget, just get the Sony headphones.,My 2 cents.

I really like this product it’s perfect if you don’t want to hear your brother and sister sing in the car it’s really great to cancel out sound I would not say it’s waterproof or water resistant like if you sweat it’s not great but the noise is unbelievable it’s great but it does kind of look like earmuffs a little bit . But yeah I do love it

Well, I was having difficulty deciding after spending hours each of several days doing research. Most reviewers chose the Sony XM4 because of its much lower price, less weight and proven comfort and reliability. Of course that wasn’t good enough for me because I thought I was a little more audoholic than many so I needed to make a more insightful discovery., I had a Sennheiser several decades ago that was nothing more than a small piece of foam over a small driver and wired of course. It sounded awesome believe it or not so I moved on over to the Sennheiser Momentum 300 which most reviewers rated at or near the top in sound quality and build. It was marked down for modest noise reduction capability and a weight of 300 grams lying in between the Sony at 245 grams and the APMax at 385. Sony is plastic, Apple is metal and fiber and the Momentum is metal and real leather on the ear pads and headband. Apple Earphones are new age sexy, Sennheiser Momentum 300 are retro cool and Sony let’s call modern but plain. Price wise Sony is no higher than $348, Sennheiser is available for $330 down from $400 at introduction in 2019 or so and Apple is $550.,Apple does Apple and I have discovered first hand how brutal they are about forcing you to do what they want. If you try to do anything other than pair them with your iPhone or iPad you will meet roadblocks. They only offer music at 48 kilobits per second so that is all they allow you to listen to in their headphones. If you try to hook up to a device with a higher bit rate it will be reduced before it passes through to your headphones. You can theoretically pay $35 for a special little wire that allows you to connect to a device that would otherwise allow you to plug into a receiver. You can only get it from Apple and even then the 3.5 mmonnection won’t fit into receivers because they take a larger jack which is 6.35., So while they sell adapters that will fit the bill they aren’t Apple approved. In short they don’t just want you to buy and use all their equipment. They force you to use their other products to use the headphones successfully. The weight of the Air Pods Max coupled with what they call clamping force makes them very uncomfortable to wear and don’t even think about exercising or running in them. They will bounce around as you move and I began to feel strain and stress from the fit within ten minutes. Sure, I bought them to entertain myself on long walks but I don’t know where I would put them for the walk home when they are too heavy to wear. You cannot hang them around your neck without choking yourself and then there is the bra/purse like carrier if you was to carry that. Won’t fold in on itself like many of most headphones.,No matter how sexy it looks or how cool it makes you feel to be envied for your coolness the grimace on your face after an hour with these on your head will not attract anyone. I really wanted these as I was telling myself they must have the best sound quality and that is what I am all about. Still  if I don’t like wearing them the music doesn’t help much and I am left with hoping a really cool person or persons will see that I am cool also. I don’t hate Apple and I have an IPhone 10max and an iPad(I bought my first one in April 2010 when the first one was introduced and was the very first truly friendly computer like device) and a MacBook Pro which I won’t replace.,With these headphones they have gone too far with the silly and unnecessary allegiance to Apple required to use it easily. You can search for hours online to find workarounds but half or more of what people suggest doesn’t work. Meanwhile Apple knows all of this and basically gives us the old high hat if we are willing to buy products that compel us to buy only their other products to make them work. Connecting instantly to my iPhone when picked up or put on rather than having to use a typical Bluetooth prompt to accept a connection is not worth enslaving myself just to show aluminum on my ears., I am boxing these up even though they arrived earlier today. I bought them from Amazon because of their stellar return policy and I recommend you do the same if you want to try these. If I kept them I would be doing what many who read my review will do and that is defend and rationalize my choice. That is what human beings do. So if Apple product allegiances are important to you after spending this amount of money on top of all the other products you have bought from them feel free to put it on blast. I know this is a lot of money to spend for many if not most people and I wanted to write something for folks who haven’t had time to do a lot of research and are at a decision point.,I am torn between the Sony XM4(leaving me light headed and looking average) and the Sennheiser Momentum 300(xciting to listen to but making me look my retro like my age). If you want to check out online reviews you will find that deciding who to listen to and trust is every bit as difficult as making your headphone choice. I don’t know who receives what in the way of free products to use or resell or even monetary compensation which might disappear with too much honesty. All I can do is tell you what I think and let you take it into consideration if helpful.,I don’t care about corporations especially large ones as they take care of themselves just fine. I have learned,that there are people who are loyal to and defend corporations and don’t like others criticizing them or their products. In my own life I find that my weakest point is often my best point pushed too far. I think the exuberance for these Air Max headphones and Apples marketing games has likely reached that place with these headphones. Who knows? Maybe I will update my review once I try the Sony or the Sennheiser or both. For now I will be happy to merely take a heavy load off my head!
500 and plus headphones and won’t connect ?,iPad Pro detected them but no sound .,Drops connection to the iPhone . Will keep trouble shutting see if some how I can get this fix .

These aren’t worth the money. I bought the black pair and they sounded good but good enough to justify the price. Tried to return them and Amazon is saying they are non-returnable due to “health and safety concerns” so unless you’re absolutely sure you want them, buy them somewhere else because you’ll be stuck with them if you decide you don’t like them.

Wow, just wow!!!! I used to have a pair of the Sony WH-1000XM4 and decided to try these since I’m a complete Apple user. The sound quality on these is absolutely AMAZING!!! You really have to hear it to truly experience it. The design is beautiful, I don’t feel the weight at all and I can even say they’re more comfortable than my XM4s, especially over longer use periods. The Digital Crown makes precise volume adjustment easy and convenient. The transparency mode is the best I’ve ever heard on any headphones, even better than the AirPods Pro. Call quality is incredible. Yes, the smart case is ridiculous but there are plenty of third party options now, including really nice ones from Waterfield Designs (which I got). Yes, they’re also very expensive but I can assure you they are definitely worth the price IF YOU’RE ALREADY AN APPLE USER! (Because great features like spatial audio, automatic device switching, settings adjustments, etc. are only available when paired with an Apple device. They can be paired with other Bluetooth devices but you miss out on all these features.)

So, you’re in the market for a premium laptop not running macOS (if you are, the answer is simple. The Macbook Air + M1 is elite.),The bigger iPad Pro is better than most ultrabooks, and for two main reasons: The M1 processor, and the versatility of the hardware.,The M1 is either as fast or quicker than any 15W processor, but where it really shines is by outlasting them. A workday that uses 5+ hours of screen on time would kill most Intel-based laptops, and the iPad Pro would have another 4 REAL use hours left in the tank.,Alone, the iPad is a great multimedia tool. With the right accessories, it turns to a laptop replacement. I use the Logitech Combo Touch, but the Magic Keyboard is another good option. I prefer the duality of the Combo Touch; it turns the iPad Pro into a Surface Pro with the case.,The Apple Pencil is the best tool for note-taking, drawing, or alternate input.,The only thing holding back the iPad Pro is the operating system; Apple wouldn’t want to cannibalize the Macbook series. If you don’t use any x86 exclusive workflows (for me, that’s general programming), I think the iPad Pro and its vast series of accessories is the best computer you can buy today.
you really dont need this

Likes,Screen quality, and brightness,Friendly support, so far,Battery life, for the most part, but it's losing it's stamina already,Dislikes - a long list,Apple develpers like old underwear. This software is like cyber-prison and has barely changed at all in over a decade,Voice to text- never satisfying. The word "too" in a sentence shows up as "to" and when it feels like it, "too" or when it should be "two" or "2" iOS wants "to" again.,Dictionary by Apple is a cancel culture nightmare. My literacy in speaking is grammatically correct. Apple's dictionry is not. I do not apprecite a one track thought process in an AI. Apple needs literacy implementations in their AI for voice to text. Android and Windows do this so much better. Apple wants to deny the use of words that have literal meaning in the English dictionary. Improper use of words causing someone to be offended is no excuse to cancel the words that have literal, non-offensive meaning. What if I make the word "APPLE" trend, defining it as something offensive to millions of people, and suddenly, those people claimed it was racist when they hear someone say the word APPLE? What then?,This ipad, is a poorly managed device for users due to poor software implementation when compared to Android. No way could demanding users benefit with iOS, after using Android. Android lets me define my own dictionary with words they may have omitted or forgotten. This is how I'm interpretting what Apple wants me to do......to stop saying "too" in voice text, and instead say "also" which they get right all the time. Well, if there's more than one way to say it correctly, Apple should consider spending more time developing software instead of boasting high end hardware, which is not so high end if it can't manage memory with many apps open. And it does not. Without an option to close all apps at once? Apple responds with BS. Forcing me to swipe multiple fingers for a few to close is all. I've had memory filled with all the apps I use. Tedious closing of apps how Apple requires is a joke and I've needed to close them as I've experienced so many slow downs, lockups, etc due to this very issue.,. This ipad pro could not keep up with a high end android tablet, yet Apple insists it is the fastest processor ever in a tablet. Maybe an iOS tablet, perhaps a single threaded app. I can't respect a device or operating system that limits capabilities like Apple. I don't need a parent to govern how I use a device. Especially a closed minded one.,The hilarity, every time I boot iOS, I see an Apple, with a bite out of it. Was Eve here? Atom should have saved his rib. I'll keep it for facetime with family and emergency backup access to things. I ditched iphone 13 too. Returned and went back to a faster LG v20. Yes, faster. iOS is truly the problem, not sure if they will ever get it. Security on apple devices is not more secure than other platforms as others suggest. Jailbreaking is easy, software hacks are possible, just like any other platform. Just ask a hacker. Rumors of Apple superiority are just that.,Overhyped, over-priced, and iOS is over-the-hill. Like my old underwear from 10 years ago. I should've washed them and got new ones

I was in the market for a drawing tablet. Tried a intuos which was great except you are drawing on a pad and looking at a screen which takes some getting used to. Then I bought a huion kamvas 16 pro and it was not that great at all. Really cheap, software/drivers are not good.,So I returned it and eventually bought this 5th gen iPad pro. And so far I really really like it. The drawing experience is pretty nice. I would recommend a screen protector as the glass is somewhat glossy and not the best for a drawing surface but it works. And try out procreate.,Have also watched a few episodes of foundation on apple tv and there are alot of scenes worth white on black. Ppl have complained about the bleeding/fuzz effect but I can't really notice it. It looks awesome while watching 4k medium's.,Overall excellent. I wish apple would include a cloth or apple pencil or something for a 1200 tablet but you get what you pay for and it's worth the money.

This is a 5th generation iPad Pro, 2021 Apple 12.9 inch  Wifi+ Cellular with 256GB. I love this iPad because it is unique, nice, strong, and fast connection. I can use this iPad pro both with wifi and cellular. I insert a mobile sim card into its sim tray and I can be used it as a cellular phone. I can surf, watch youtube, listen to music online, and much more. I can use it anywhere and anytime with the cellular. When I am at home or any place with a wifi connection, it automatically switches the connection to the wifi. This Ipad Pro has a 5G connection. Any place that doesn't have a 5G connection then it will automatically switch to LTE. I have to buy an apple pencil separately, and it works very well. I love this iPad pro because I can do much more with it. Its battery lasts long. It can be used as long as 3 days before it recharges. I purchased this iPad pro on Amazon through Apple Store on Amazon. It is safe to purchase an iPad pro here on Amazon. I received this iPad pro exactly as to what it describes. They shipped fast and they wrapped very carefully. There are no cracks or dents when I received it. On the day of delivery, they required a signature when I received it. I decide to purchase this iPad pro on Amazon because I don't want to wait a long line at the Apple Store. Overall, this is a perfect iPad Pro and I love it very much!

profile-name: 𓀕 𓁆 𓀟 𓁆 𓀕 𓁆 𓀟 𓁆 𓀕 🕳
review-body: Look up “iPad Pro blooming” before buying this. It’s pretty bad. Hard to believe that Apple thought this was ok for a “Pro” device.,I’m in a fully lit room, screen brightness is at about 40% and since most apps I use are on Dark Mode, the blooming is constant. The first time I opened the Calendar app, I was shocked.,I mainly use the app Procreate and most of my art has a lot of contrast. Whenever I use the Pencil brush, it looks like I’m also using the Airbrush. Everything glows. It’s crazy. I need the larger format for now but I’m switching as soon as they upgrade to MicroLED or OLED. If not, I’ll eventually go back to the good old 11”.,My suggestion would be to see it in person at the store or check your return window and try it out for as long as you can and see if you get used to it. That said, anything bright POPS and looks amazing.

Upgraded from generation 4, the display looks better on this 5th generation. seems faster surfing the web. Transferring all my data from the old to the new was very easy. You put the two iPad together and the new iPad transfers right off the old iPad.

I brought this IPad on July 2, 2021 and 3 months later I go to use it and it doesn’t come on this iPad cost me over $1400 and it doesn’t work … like what the F…., I’m Pissed annoyed I’m,Telling you do not buy this device from Amazon go to the store .. you call Amazon and no one can freaken understand you or help …

Best in Class :,Performance,user interface,longevity (updates),Cameras,very good :,Screen is really good with noticeably deeper blacks compared to previous iPads and blooming is not issue, 95% of time you can't see blooming at all but all in all overall image quality is still not on same level as Galaxy Tab S6/7+ OLEDs but it is relatively close.,4 Speakers are really good sounding,good :,Stylus placement is good but better on Galaxy Tab S6/7 (back side) and because of that you can use more compact sized cases.,Overall : Very Good tablet overall on all fronts and it will last years and you can't go wrong buying iPad pro 12.9 M1 but if you are on tight budget and want really good overall performer for cheaper go and buy Samsung Galaxy Tab S7+ or even S6 if you want to use it mostly only for movies and web surfing.

I owned this iPad for a week to see what may be different from my iPad 6th generation.. other than size, they did the same basic things. I did like it with the larger size but my laptop would do the same thing.,I used the Apple magic keyboard with it and it worked well however, when in Facebook, you lose the use of your imoji’s,Overall it is nice but I didn’t need it just because it was bigger so I returned it and will continue using my 6th generation for now.. wasn’t worth the $1000 + price tag.

I've avoided upgrading for years because I wanted the ability to CHARGE the phone and PLAY AUDIO through a WIRED connection at the same time. Now I have to make another trip....place another online order...pay more money...whatever. It's stupid and inconvenient. The Ghost of Steve Jobs should haunt those fargin' icehole bastages at apple. This phone is amazing! Photos are out of this world. Went from iPhone 8 to this. Wow.,Now for some reason with this buy it was required to buy a cricket phone plan through Amazon. I already have a cricket account so this was stupid. I was just going to buy the phone then cancel the Amazon required cricket account. Figured it would be just a lost $55.00.,But after I made the purchase my Amazon credit card flagged the purchase of the cricket card and canceled payment of it but still processed the phone lol so lucky me. They still sent the card though. So I just threw it in a drawer.
Cricket says it's Amazons fault. Amazon says it's crickets fault. No matter the issue. Neither one will help. I will be returning this. Not paying $1400 for a phone that won't send a picture.

Since I didn’t buy mine on Amazon, this isn’t a confirmed purchase review, but Apple has released these before they’ve worked out their issues and is expecting customers to pay to be beta testers. When I tried their help people, they told me to try restarting the phone, forgetting the car, all the simple stuff we do first thing. Then they sent a link to reading, expecting me to figure it out on my own. I don’t know about anyone else, but I don’t buy a $1000 phone to help some billionaires work out their bugs. And the naked greed is getting disgusting. Even when you buy the new magnetic charger, they make you buy a $20 plug separately. What?! A charger that doesn’t actually plug into the wall. Are they kidding with this? Apple should be ashamed for putting out equipment like this. We have an Apple house, but I’m ready to switch after this experience.

If you have an Iphone 12 Pro or 12. Then it's not worth the upgrade as you are getting a very similiar phone. But if you have any other phone you won't be dissapointed. Compared to all other iphones this new phone truly does have an amazing battery life. I on average get 24 ish hours of battery life out of mine. Cameras compared to samsung's are pretty good. Though I would like to make it clear. It's only the software that makes these cameras so good. Without the software, compared to samsung the cameras on this phone suck! This phone has 3 12 mega pixel cameras while samsung's flagship phone has camera's with up 108 megapixels. The thing I love about iphone is ios. And just how easy to learn to use and to continue to use this phone is. In the end I would definetly recommend this phone.

This phone is the full retail cost, but you're locked in to only Cricket wireless, instead of being able to take it to any carrier that you like as you'd be able to if you bought it directly from Apple - for the same price.
Apple tried to transfer between two phones and bricked my phone.  Now need to spend countless hours just to get my phone back (if at all).  Customer support was useless.

Yep, that's right. Apple has decided not to include a necessary battery charger in the box. They require you to go out and buy your own after you just spent $1000 on a new phone.  My, my how times have changed.

The "slide up from the bottom" replacement for the thumb button is comically amateurish.,When you slide your thumb up very slightly off-axis, the app screen is moved slightly left or right -- this has no effect at all, other than to annoy the user. iOS is telling you that it understands what you mean, but the developers thought you shouldn't get the desired result.,They kept the moronic misfeature where sometimes, when you swipe, the app is shifted down so it only takes up the bottom half of the screen. The top half of the screen is black. This serves no purpose other than to inconvenience the user.,Taking a screenshot is incredibly awkward now.,All of the things they broke, were broken so they could force you to use face recognition. But face recognition is one of the worst ideas Apple ever had. Face recognition is a nightmarish security hole. It's often awkward and painful to use. It doesn't work with masks. It doesn't work with motorcycle helmets. It doesn't work if the phone is lying flat on your desk. It doesn't work in the dark unless you first turn the phone on.,These people are idiots.

Love this phone!,1.  You can use your own lightning to USB charger and cords if you don’t want to spring for USBc charger and cord.  Magnetic charger is not necessary.  The phone does charge faster using usbc.,2.  After reading comments about people wishing the phone still had a Touch ID, I was a little concerned.  However I transitioned to Face ID I found that the newer technology was very easy to use and seamless.  I don’t miss Touch ID at all.,3.  Have no opinion on the phone connecting to apple CarPlay yet, but will know in a few weeks when I get a new car.,4.  Photography is a major upgrade from my 6s.  I can even take photos with the sun in my eyes and the photos comes out great.,5.  Connecting to my car’s hands free system was easy, as was connecting to my Bluetooth headphones (an inexpensive pair bought on Amazon, which has pretty good sound for $20),6.  It is fast!,7.  Taking a screen shot is easy.  All you need to do is press the power button and the volume up button at the same time.

I’m a little perturbed. Received the watch and was unable to set it up because battery is low and there is no way to charge it. They no longer use the USB standard connector. It is now a smaller connector and of course all the 30 odd chargers I have around the house none will work.  I know the watch will be great once I get it charged.  But just be aware!

I bought this watch for myself in May 2021 with no issues.,Bought the same watch in Nov. 2021 as a Christmas gift for my daughter but the charging cable is NOT USB unlike my other one. So now I need to go buy a charging block for the other type (USBC?) of plug just to charge this.,Kinda lousy way to sell something.

I bought the SE since this was my watch Apple Watch and I wasn’t sure how efficiently I would use it. But after having it I realize that it fills so many gaps! I love the watch faces, one shows time and with a simple swipe the next face shows temp, altitudes, weather, battery life, heart rate, and a compass. I use it while kayaking since the workout app has a row setting, as well walking, running, and literally everything else. One of my favorite aspects of the watch is the noise app that monitors your environment’s decimals for damaging amounts of noise. I work in a restaurant and the app has alerted me to harmful noise levels multiple times and each time I distance myself.

I had the original Apple Watch and decided to upgrade. There is not a big difference but the battery life is better and I like the larger face. I change the band to one with Velcro as I can make small adjustments for the best and most comfortable fit. Like having the fall detection and being able to call for help easily.

It's a great watch. I use it to track when I'm walking the dog and general exercise. It tells you when you've been sitting too long and asked me if I'd fallen one time when I'd bumped it. I love that you can talk on the phone with it and with good clarity. I'd highly recommend it to anyone who is sitting on the fence about it.

I am an Apple user of Macs, IPhones, and IPads.  Needed to upgrade my Garmin.  The SE does everything I  want.  Battery life could be better, just remember to charge at night.  The primary reason for purchase was to monitor Dexcom G6 glucose.  I highly recommend anyone using Dexcom CGM get an Apple watch, If you are using an IPhone to monitor your glucose.
The SE is an ideal watch to get benefits of full tech, and not pay most current version pricing!  Outstanding watch! Highly recommended and quick delivery by Amazon.
Well I was very excited to have my first apple watch.,I can't charge it. Really.,You must look at fine print before you buy.,Really upset...
I love my iPhone watch it’s so beautiful but what I am not happy with its the charger it’s not go to any of my iPhone plus I don’t know what to do now.

Why wouldn’t you tell the buyer you had to have a c cell connector to charge a phone you purchased?  Doesn’t do much good without. Now I have to wait for that to come and hope I purchased the correct one

This is about my 7th smart "watch". I've have a couple of Fitbits, a Jawbone, a Zenwatch 3 (prettiest of the bunch), a Samsung Galaxy, and an Amazfit Bip (good watch for the money). I've basically got a smart watch museum. I got the Apple Watch because, honestly, I'm getting older and I wanted the fall detection and health features. I've had it for a couple of weeks and here's what I think, from bad to good.,1. Battery life sucks. It'll get through one day, but that's it. The Bip would last for 3 weeks on a charge.,2. The screen isn't great in direct sun. It's better than some others, but doesn't hold a candle to the Bip, which was somehow reflective in bright light, sort of like a Kindle.,3. The sleep tracking is ok, about what you'd expect from a movement detecter, but the app for it isn't very good. Stick with one of the gadgets that goes under your mattress for now.,4. It has some very nice watch faces, with custom complications. Best of the bunch.,5. Very comfortable to wear. The big stem doesn't get in the way at all.,6. The health features work great. It accurately tracks you pulse, and will check you blood oxygen and ECG on demand. I wish it would do the blood oxygen periodically with low saturation detection, but battery is likely a problem.,7. The fitness features rock. Even without a subscription, the watch has helped me get my exercise.,It has a ton of other useful features. Siri works fine, you can control Spotify with it, maps are kind of fun. Lots of other things. The really good thing is that, as the practical king of smart watches, there are 3rd party apps/integrations to do just about anything that could make sense, and it's unlikely the watch will be orphaned like my AndroidWear watches were.
Just wasn’t as much of an upgrade as advertised.

I received this watch yesterday.  Today I needed to re-charge the battery.  Guess what!  The charging cable does not fit into any of my Apple charging adapters!  I called Amazon, and was told that the adapter does not come with the Apple Watch!  The charging adapter must be bought separately!  Are you kidding me?!!  What a rip-off

It took me a while to decide to upgrade my apple watch. Hard to justify a smart watch over $300, in my opinion, however, my Series 3 was so slow, took forever to install an update, no space for apps/data storage, etc...,I got a Fitbit Charge 5 as a temporary place holder, tried to convince myself I liked it more than an Apple Watch, ultimately I came back to Apple.  I opted for the 41mm Series 7 because I didn't need an extra 4mm for another $100.,It moves so seamlessly, fast to charge (lightyears ahead of the series 3), lots of new watch face templates to choose from, beautiful edge to edge display. Of course you can choose to have "Always on Display" but that will quickly deplete your battery life.,Ultimately, just get the upgrade that is within your budget and you won't regret it!

I ordered this on 11/26 and received it at 6am on the 27th (gotta love rush overnight shipping being a prime member).,This was an upgrade for me coming from the Apple Watch 3 and then going to Whoop for a year and a half. Ultimately decided back on Apple for the smart watch features.,Few things to note:,1. The screen is a lot bigger if you’re used to a  41 or 42mm. Personally love the bigger screen but I also have a bigger wrist so it fits very well.,2. The watch does NOT come with the “butt” part of the charger you plug into the wall. If you have a newer charger for your apple devices (Ie when I got my iPad earlier this year I had gotten a full charger that I can swap the wires out with this) you’re all set. If not, go buy a charger when you’re purchasing this,3. The watch, for me at least, was closer to 90% charged so wouldn’t have been a huge deal if I had to Amazon prime or run to the store for a charger,4. Features are advances compared to the 3 but still have a lot of similarities.,5. Box comes with two band sizes. Small and then medium/large,6. The packaging is very well done. I was impressed when I opened it up,Overall I’m happy with this purchase (I knew I would be) as I spent probably 2 months comparing the new Apple Watch to the Garmin to find what would be best for me and my specific needs.
It did not work with my phone

Series 7 is the best!! I love this watch and the larger face is amazing!! My watch was delivered with care on time and was a breeze to set up and pair with my iPhone. The size of the 45mm is insane!! I upgraded from a series 3 to series 7 and I’m so glad I did. Get you one it won’t disappoint!!!

Not the color I ordered. There is no charging block with watch. The end is different. It does not take regular charging block. Still have not found right block with a end to charge watch. So I can’t set it up to even see if I like.

First, I just want to say that it DOES NOT come with a charger block for the USB type C, so if you don’t already have one, buy it along side it as I had to take a trip to two different Walmarts and a target to find one.,Next, I highly, highly, highly, HIGHLY recommend you measure your wrist and go by the recommended wrist size that apple suggest for each watch. I’m fairly okay in terms of body weight sitting at 210 lbs and dropping with a height of 6’1.  My wrist size was measured to be 210mm so it was recommended that I go for the 45mm version but instead I decided to look at reviews on YouTube and I saw that majority of them recommended the 41mm version as the 45mm was “too bulky and was like wearing a TV screen on their wrist” so because of that I went for the 41mm. When I placed it on my wrist with the band, it felt like I was wearing the smallest watch ever, it felt as if I was trying to put on a watch made for children. Then I went to my friend’s who had a 45mm Apple Watch and tried his on and it fit perfectly, lesson learnt, listen to the manufacturer instead of random people in a video.

Was excited to get my watch only to find out there isn’t a charging block to charge the watch. So what good does it do if you can’t charge it. Don’t even know what to do now. All this money spent. Ugh. Very disappointing.

It took six hours to set up,I am a techy electronics engineer.  I have dozens of patents in electronics and have written thousands of lines of computer code, in three different programming languages.  But this watch is quite a challenge.,When I tried to pair the watch to the phone, the phone said I must update the phone to OS 14.8.1.  Yet I have always had "automatic updates" "on" in the phone menu.,So I spent a half-hour updating to OS 14.8.1.,I tried to pair the watch to the phone again and the phone said my OS must be updated.  But I had just updated it.  So I called apple support.  They directed me to update my OS to 15.1.  Why was I previously directed to update to 14.8.1 when that was obsolete?  Updating to 15.1 took an hour!,Next when I tried to pair the watch, the message on the phone says that I need to charge the watch.  I examined the watch charge cable and it must plug into a USB "C" charger which is not included with the watch.  Do you have such a charger?  I didn't even know such chargers existed.  I have ten chargers, including several made by apple, and they all only accept the original USB plug, called USB "A".,I recall reading a few weeks ago that apple was no longer including chargers.  I thought, that's ok, we all have lots of chargers.  But nobody has USB "C" chargers, they are very new.,So I ordered a USB "C" charger.,The charger arrived I started the pairing process.  But the phone stuck for 30 minutes during the pairing process so I called support.  They couldn't get it to work by the standard way, which is to update the watch software, so they opted to install without updating the watch software.  That worked with lots of hand holding and took about 45 minutes,All together I spent about six hours getting the phone to work.,Has apple lost their mind?

The Apple Watch 7 is nice. Especially if you are upgrading from a version that is several years old.,But beware, it only comes with a charger that is USB C. So if you don’t already have a usb power brick or old Watch charger, you have to buy that and won’t be able to charge your watch
If I knew that they were going to make all their chargers USB-C and not provide any blocks for no reason other than to force people to spend more money, I wouldn’t have bought it.

This is my first Apple Watch. I feel incredibly stupid for waiting this long to buy one! This thing is SO amazing! I decided to go with the Graphite Stainless case. It’s certainly more expensive than the aluminum models which are also super nice. The watch is very easy to setup and connects nearly instantly to your IPhone. The apps and available customizable watch faces are nearly limitless. The 45mm fits my wrist perfectly - it’s not too big. It looks amazing! Make sure to order a USB C charger when you order your watch. I’m not sure why it’s not included. Other than that it’s perfect!! Absolutely love it. Probably one of the best little things I’ve ever bought for me!

So far. Got the watch. Turned it on. When it tried to link to my Iphone it said I needed to update my Iphone. So I updated my Iphone which took hours. By that time the watch had run out of the factory charge. Dead watch. They give you a magnetic charger which has a USB C male end which fits nothing I have. Seriously! I paid over $700 for this thing and they couldn't include a real charger?  So, at this point it sucks.

I’m upgrading from a series 1, so it is a completely different watch. I am very satisfied with this purchase. Most of the heart monitoring functions only work with people older than 22 which is frustrating for me especially since I paid for the watch, so I should get access to all the features. Nonetheless, I really like the starlight Apple Watch and band. It’s very subtle and nice to look at. Hopefully braided solo loops get a sale soon bc I really would like one. It is a pain that they don't give power bricks, but this is the new age. I highly suggest you purchase many usb c power bricks and switch all cords from usb a to usb c. Anker has great ones and you can always find deals for them.

the magnet on the armband is too weak. the armband keeps slipping loose and ends up dangling on my arm every 20 minutes. and this is just while walking around the home or office. this band is absolutely unusable when exercising. the watch slips right off. i paid about $300 extra for a pretty armband, and it turned out to be a complete turd. i will be returning it and getting one of the base models

Got my series 7 45 mm stainless steel in graphite was lucky to get it today on the 24th of October 2021 and ordered it 2 days on the 22nd coming from a 44 mm series 6 in product red loving the new series 7 in graphite color to match my 13 pro max in graphite and first impressions of it was screen is big even though it’s not much bigger also the watch face I’m using is called Lumy. You can find it on AppStore on your iphone shoutout to zollotech the youtuber for showing it in his videos

My husband went to open up his birthday gift of this Apple Watch and there was the charger the band but there was NO Apple Watch in the box. This is the SECOND time I’ve ordered an Apple Watch off Amazon and received no Apple Watch
Does not come with the a charger for their new “C” cable. Does not work with older USB chargers so you need to order the new charger.

I got my new MacBook Pro M1 two weeks ago and could not be more happy with it. This machine is absolutely incredible in terms of speed, looks, weight/size, display, and battery life - and texture (it feels so good against the skin on my wrists as I type) and basically anything else you can think of. I also love the space gray color, the new keyboard, the Touch Bar, and the larger trackpad. There are so many options to customize the system to work just the way I like.,My previous MacBook was the 2011 model and it still works today, but after 10 years it became too slow and the trackpad had trouble clicking, so after a TON of research, I decided to pull the trigger and get the New MacBook Pro with the M1 chip.,A couple suggestions I am able to give after spending almost two months and probably over 30 hours researching the new MacBook are: go with the standard model of 8gb of RAM and the 256 ssd - you can get this on Amazon for $1239 vs $1299 at Apple - so you get to save 60 bucks, and you have the added satisfaction of not having to deal with the snobby nerd losers that work in the Apple Store, who asked me rudely when I went in to get a new laptop "umm, do you have an appointment? Well, you're going to have to make an appointment if you want to go in the store". I love Apple products and will never use another phone or computer besides the iPhone and MacBook, but after that experience I will never again give my business to the physical Apple Stores. I mean, seriously, do you really need me to make an appointment to buy a $1300 laptop? Whatever dude.,Anyway, in several YouTube videos that compared the 8GB ram model along side the 16GB ram model (costs 200 bucks more), the 8GB performed just as well in nearly every task - and they really pushed it to the limits. The only reason to pay up for the 16GB RAM is if you want to edit 8K UHD videos or are a super serious music recording artist or highly advanced professional photographer - and even then it's not too much of a difference. For the every day user (me or basically anyone who is not a computer professional) the 8GB working with this new M1 chip is mind-blowing, blows any other laptop on the market completely out of the water, and actually even performs just as well as the $2200 15 inch MacBook Pro using the Intel chip. As far as the storage goes, 256 ssd is standard - that's what I got - and you can pay 200 bucks more for 512 ssd or 400 bucks more for 1 TB. But with the Cloud storage available now, you don't really need to keep much on the laptop drive, you can just save it to the cloud.,Overall I honestly could go on for hours about every little detail that I absolutely love about this machine. A free one year subscription to Apple TV is also another little perk. But I am still mystified every day at how incredible this machine is. I've been online for over 3 hours now and its still on 92% battery. The new Retina display is brilliant. Everything is perfect. I truly am in love this laptop and would recommend that anyone looking for a new laptop to last a long time and outperform everything else on the market gets the new matchbook 13 inch M1.

I bought my Mac from Apple directly not from Amazon. This thing is amazing. Battery life is awesome. Hard to believe that I can work with it all day and do not have to charge at all even with bright screen.,No issues with speed at all. I use Matlab a lot and this computer is even slightly faster than my desktop with 12 core AMD CPU and 32 GB ram.,Excellent machine. Happy I bought it.

I own over 50 computers and it blows away my 11th gen Dell XPS 13 i7, My surface Book 3, my Ryzen 7 Thinkpad. the first week I got it the battery lasted for 5 days and 22 hrs of use and still had 20% left. I felt guilty and charged it. The Geekbench 5 rating beat all those listed laptops and they had 16 or 32GB of memory and the MacBook Pro M1 had only 8GB of unified memory. The keyboard felt great, the sound was superb, the screen bright, and it was blazing fast in all I did. I'm an IT consultant and deal in Windows based databases and this Mac has now become my daily go to system at home. It has become my new front end.
It's a Mac once you go Mac you never go back. This is my second Mac my first lasted almost 9 years.
Dead at arrival.... kernel error. Took it to the Apple store they told me looks like a hardware failure and to send it back to Amazon.

I'm going to preface this review with the 1 thing I dislike so we can get that out of the way.,I mean let's be honest, that's what most people are looking for when buying a product-the down sides.,It has a standard 3.5mm headphone jack EVEN THOUGH apple quit using that on it's handheld products years ago.,Not that I care, it's good that they include the 3.5mm jack-but how come they didn't include one for their lightning connector that their headphones come in out of the box? Forces you to either change to a standard headphone jack or BT headphones (probably trying to push their AirPods line).,Other than that, I have no issues. It's fast, efficient, reliable and easy to use. If your familiar with iOS on these then it'll be a great addition to the tech team you have at home.

The battery lasts forever and its fast. My last macbook had a pretty good battery and worked very well for years too.,The M1 does allow for dual external monitors and there are two usbc ports total. These two things can be worked around with dongles and a video hub but now I have $200 worth of accessories and a tangled mess on my desk.,How is a 2020 Mac not compatible with dual monitors but my 2005 HP works great with the same monitor setup?!? I really can't get past that.,Get the intel version with 4 USB ports and you can use it in your Covid home office out of the box.

I love my new MacBook Pro!!  It’s the 13” and not too small. It’s very lightweight!  It’s so fast!  I was using an older MacBook Pro from mid 2012. It worked well, just so slow. This one flies!!  I was disappointed that there are no USB ports or CD player. I spent about $65 at Best Buy and got an adapter that works very well!!!

There is no fix for this, and now it can't be returned.  All that money wasted!!! There is a vertical black line on the screen.  I tried to fix it using tips from youtube videos and none of it worked.  Proceed with caution!

I really wanted to love this laptop. I've had only Macs for years. This was supposed to be an upgrade from my 2014 MacBook Air. I previously had a 2020 16" intel based MacBook Pro for work configured with two HP monitors. No issues with the monitors and connected instantly with zero effort to get the screens to work with the laptop. Bought this one and connected to my Belkin hub for the HDMIs. Would only connect a single monitor. Googled the issue and found that the new M1 apple chip only supports a single monitor. News to me and I guess I should have researched more. However the low rating stems from the fact that this is a PRO laptop. A professional would want two monitors and should not have to google whether a PRO laptop supports more than 1 monitor when the intel version does seamlessly. Despite this I had planned to keep it and just deal with 1 monitor because of the cost savings over buying the Intel based MacBook Pro and wanted the longer battery life. Now brings me to the issue that made me return the laptop. This laptop just would not configure to show a clear resolution with my monitors. The scale was off and the display just stayed blurry no matter what setting I changed it to on the monitor or the laptop's settings. Tried and tried and just gave up. Returned this and ordered an Intel based 13" MacBook Pro. No issues, supports dual monitors, and seamlessly integrated to the laptop. No blurry screen and no having to set or change any settings to get it to work. I am floored that Apple would produce a Pro for business that only supports a single monitor. I love Apple but will not buy anything with their chip until the kinks are worked out.

picture/video quality is outstanding, battery life as advertised,i watch prime videos-- with my 10 year old ipad or cheap chrome book never a problem--however with this, there is typically an add that appears before the video, a few seconds into it is the ability to skip it--however once i chose to skip this ipad cannot make the video connect, just gives me the ball that goes round and round no video connection. through experimentation i found i could use the old chromebook to make the connection to the video, then use the ipad to go back to prime and pick it up at that point. which is ridiculous

It’s an okay device but touchscreen doesn’t always respond and for the price you can’t even upload files and edit Office Excel or Word without a monthly subscription and I already own the Full Version of Office, but you can’t get those types of files on the device via usb c which can be done on a real computer. This is 100% NOT a desktop replacement as they advertise.

One word that describes the overall experience of this product. FLAWLESS. It’s sleek, light-weight, well designed, very powerful in computing power and seamless in it’s delivery. Plays well with others (apple devices, seamlessly connects/disconnects) what a joy. I sometimes forget how small this thing is (11”, M1 Chip) but, wow, isn’t that the point!?

This was my first iPad I purchased through Amazon. The shipping was fast, and the iPad arrived undamaged and intact. So far, after 6 months of use the device is still working properly with minor issues.,Below are the most amazing features,1. Find my iPad,2. Facetime screen share,3. Air drop,4. iMovie,5. Siri and search,6. 3D Apple Maps,7. Center stage in video calls,8. screen recording,Below are the pros and cons,Pros,1. Super good software (this device will keep on getting more features),2. Super-fast for gaming,3. Perfect brightness control,4. fast charging speed,5. Center stage for video calls,6. screenshare with other iOS users,7. Mind blowing refresh rates,8. Large screen,9. Loudspeaker,10. Sensitive touch,11. Decent Ram speed,12. screen record,I personally love Apple products, but they have their own problems.,Below are the cons,1. Terrible battery (in normal use, my iPad dropped around 20% of battery capacity in only 6 months),2. Slow at loading webpages,3. screen very fragile (be sure to install a screen protector),4. poor camera resolution,5. second-grade microphone,Hope this review finds you well!

Quite frankly, decided to try something Apple, after my family all started using iPhones and iPads.  Reviews were mixed in preference, so that was not much help to me. I also liked the screen ratio (not so wide-screen movie-centric) for a tablet.,Apple is quite a bit more expensive, especially with the Apple "pencil" which is included with. I did the purchase based on plan to keep and use for a few years. In other words, I paid for iCare, got 256 GB version, cellular connectivity, and kept in mind the higher resale value of things Apple.,Going in, I was expecting to have a learning curve, and was braced for it. My initial judgement was that I would probably be mostly satisfied with either one.,After using for a couple of weeks I have to stick by my initial assessment. Apples biggest faults (in my opinion) are that they are so restrictive in their policies.,More Later,1-26-22,-Yes, still do not like Apples proprietary tendencies.,-Hardware is pretty good, but slow to charge (no matter what charger) and battery does not last that long.  My experiences with Samsung charging and battery were FAR better than with the iPad.,-Interface is neither intuitive or particularly easy.  I use it every day and it is a constant learning process.  Not only must you memorize countless gestures, but you must be very precise in doing them. Result is a quick gesture often means I have to do it over again.,- I love being able to get pictures and use Facetime with my Apple-centric family, but other that that I am wishing that I had gone with the Table S7+.
This is a 3rd gen iPad Pro which is 2018. False advertisement.

My old iPad was dying after almost 10 years. I’m not tech savvy at all! I was wondering how I was going to get all my stuff from my old one on here. All I had to do is follow the prompts it gives and set my old one next to it and it did everything for me! Yay! The tablet itself is the same size as the old one but this has more screen area than the old one.,New features I’m still learning! But I love it! Now…what to do with my old one?!

I've owned iPads in the past but never kept them for long. The M1 performance paired with new features like touchpad/mouse support and iPad OS, this is good enough for everything I need to do for personal use. I'm a software engineer and use a MacBook for work, but I don't really need any PC software for my personal life. iOS/iPad OS apps can handle everything else. I also love the design these have had for the past few years. I've been in love with the non-curved edges since the iPhone 4.

a great tablet with more than enough power for most users. nice build quality and form factor as you would expect from apple. combined with the magic keyboard, this iPad is a joy to use. the only issues ive had is that it doesn't connect to wifi after wake from sleep but that is most likely due to a software issue and should be resolved shortly. my unit had a small chip on the right side on the bezel but it doesn't affect the iPad in anyway. also, the unit runs a bit warm and battery life is a bit worse than i expected. makes me wonder if i should have gotten last years model instead.

This ipad was sold as a 2021 Ipad pro, and it’s actually a 3rd gen from 2018!! The listing even says “2021” in the headline while stealthily avoiding saying what generation it is. Which I’m sure it will do what I want but I paid freaking $1,300!!! They are available all over the place for half that. I’m super disappointed in this lie of a sale and working on getting rid of this device.

I’m a little perturbed. Received the watch and was unable to set it up because battery is low and there is no way to charge it. They no longer use the USB standard connector. It is now a smaller connector and of course all the 30 odd chargers I have around the house none will work.  I know the watch will be great once I get it charged.  But just be aware!

I bought this watch for myself in May 2021 with no issues.,Bought the same watch in Nov. 2021 as a Christmas gift for my daughter but the charging cable is NOT USB unlike my other one. So now I need to go buy a charging block for the other type (USBC?) of plug just to charge this.,Kinda lousy way to sell something.

I bought the SE since this was my watch Apple Watch and I wasn’t sure how efficiently I would use it. But after having it I realize that it fills so many gaps! I love the watch faces, one shows time and with a simple swipe the next face shows temp, altitudes, weather, battery life, heart rate, and a compass. I use it while kayaking since the workout app has a row setting, as well walking, running, and literally everything else. One of my favorite aspects of the watch is the noise app that monitors your environment’s decimals for damaging amounts of noise. I work in a restaurant and the app has alerted me to harmful noise levels multiple times and each time I distance myself.

I had the original Apple Watch and decided to upgrade. There is not a big difference but the battery life is better and I like the larger face. I change the band to one with Velcro as I can make small adjustments for the best and most comfortable fit. Like having the fall detection and being able to call for help easily.

It's a great watch. I use it to track when I'm walking the dog and general exercise. It tells you when you've been sitting too long and asked me if I'd fallen one time when I'd bumped it. I love that you can talk on the phone with it and with good clarity. I'd highly recommend it to anyone who is sitting on the fence about it.

I am an Apple user of Macs, IPhones, and IPads.  Needed to upgrade my Garmin.  The SE does everything I  want.  Battery life could be better, just remember to charge at night.  The primary reason for purchase was to monitor Dexcom G6 glucose.  I highly recommend anyone using Dexcom CGM get an Apple watch, If you are using an IPhone to monitor your glucose.
The SE is an ideal watch to get benefits of full tech, and not pay most current version pricing!  Outstanding watch! Highly recommended and quick delivery by Amazon.
Well I was very excited to have my first apple watch.,I can't charge it. Really.,You must look at fine print before you buy.,Really upset...
I love my iPhone watch it’s so beautiful but what I am not happy with its the charger it’s not go to any of my iPhone plus I don’t know what to do now.

Why wouldn’t you tell the buyer you had to have a c cell connector to charge a phone you purchased?  Doesn’t do much good without. Now I have to wait for that to come and hope I purchased the correct one

The audio and mic quality is amzing. They turn on automatically when you put them in your ears, even if it’s in the middle of the conversation they connect and the audio switches automatically. I could not be happier with these. Worth every penny!!!
I was sent fake product check your airpods

For me the AirPods Pro  connections on them are unstable, sometime It just disconnected or sometime when the videos playing the sound  on the AirPods Pro Are gone,  this has never happened on my old AirPods ,and AirPods Pro,Quite disappointed, it feels like their are so many Defective and Quality control on them are poor

I was on the fence about getting the pro's or the new AirPods because my original AirPods have been dying on me for a while. I was seriously considering getting the AirPod 3's because I was not sure if I would like the style of these, the noise cancelling and the fit compared to the originals. All I can say to myself now is whyyyy did I wait so long?,I use my AirPods everyday at work and at home on my phone and my computer. The original AirPods never stayed in my ears and more so recently. They are instantly uncomfortable and I am constantly fidgeting with them. These ones I am still working out the fit (I cannot pull hard enough to get the standard size off to try a smaller one) but with the in ear tips they are 100x more comfortable. They are quite a bit bigger so stick out of your ear more so they get in the way when laying down or on your side but not super noticeable for most things. They are so noise cancelling I have NEVER heard anything so silent. But when you wear them in transparency mode you can still hear just fine. This was something I was a little worried about since I did not want to be dead to the world.,Bottom line - if you're on the fence GET THEM. You won't regret it. Especially right now with the sale price, so worth it.

ALL you have to do is read/do your research. If it was a new AirPods Pro don't you think there would be like....a "2" or something after the name? The "New" is describing the MagSafe charging case which you can clearly see marked on the box or if you put it on a wireless charger, not the AirPods themselves. Who is complaining about "no charger in the box" in 2021? Clearly someone living under a rock!

So first of all, these are the real Apple AirPod Pros, I was a bit skeptical because this is a new posting by Apple but is only because the case is now MagSafe charging capable, the active noise cancellation is so good that it’s scary, I feel like I’m my own world, the Audio is great and loud, very comfortable and automatically got setup, if you have the money… go for it! I love these.

Let me just say these are cleannn! They are made in Vietnam, which is a fact, because they do have assembly lines in Viet. Quality is not compromised and they are legit. Sound is perfect, and the noise cancellation works like a charm. Spatial Audio has been working amazingly, everything is great with these, no complaints!

Upgraded from the airpods 1 to this since it was on sale for Black Friday and it was worth it. The sound on these sounds like headphones surround sound, way better than most headphones and earbuds I use. Great bass, clarity, and the spatial audio and noise cancellation is decent and a bonus. Also the “new” in the title is because it has the magsafe charger case. Get these airpods you won’t regret it.

If you guys are doubting this or not sure if they are authentic, we'll I'm here to say that they are the real deal. It's 100% worth it. This model, comes with the newer magsafe wireless charging case. It comes with the Airpods pro, a charger cable, and a interchangeable ear tips of 3 sizes. The only thing it doesn't come with is the charging adapter brick. The sound quality is great and so it the noise cancelation. The noise cancelation doesn't block out every sound. If you've never had noise canceling earbuds, the sensation is very weird when you put them on as it goes really quiet out of no where. The good thing Is you can turn off the noise cancelation if it bothers you. They also feel kind of weird inside of the ear because they go deep to create a seal for better quality. If you are on the fringe about buying these, I highly recommend them!

I’ve always been an Apple user and never thought as to why I wanted AirPods sine the original headphones really hurt my ears. Since they came out with the pros I’ve been wanting to try them and finally got myself a pair with my chase rewards and these are very comfortable and so easy to sync with your phone. I carry them in my purse everywhere I go and the noise cancellation is great especially at work. I use them around the house a lot but not enough complete cancellation to not hear the vacuum because that is very loud obviously. The silicon tips still made the headphone slip out my ear but I purchased some memory foam tips to replace them and they stay perfect and fit in my case perfectly. I would have never spent that much $ on headphones for myself but I do enjoy them very much and would never go back to my other headphones unless I forgot them at home. Definitely worth my reward points. You can find the cutest cases off Amazon too!

I recently took a new position where I would be flying weekly.  I went online and started reading reviews about the best noise canceling headphones, Apple constantly ranked above the Bose and Sony models.  So I dove in.,I am really glad I did.  What Apple does not market is how well these integrate with an iPhone.  Bluetooth that finally works like Bluetooth should.  You put them on your head and the pair automatically.  No searching in menus, no “forget this device”. None of that.,Now, the sound is great.  Period.  Moving on to function.,If you travel these are for you.  The noise canceling is perfect.  During a flight, the plane just disappears.  It is completely silent.  While walking through the airport you can listen to music and activate Transparent mode and hear all the announcements.  If someone texts you, music dims, Siri announces the persons name, and reads the message automatically.  No stopping to dig out your phone and look at the message.  And, you can reply hands free.  Great, great, great when your hands are full.  I wear these for 8 hours straight and do not take them off, extremely comfortable.,There are a lot of other features that work with the iPhone that are great, you just have to experience it.  But them, 10/10.

I am going to forego the normal discussion regarding how much they cost and if it is worth it. That's seems to be strictly individual to me. They are expensive and I will leave it at that. I also own the Sony XM4's, which will I compare them to.,Comfort. These are heavy headphones and definitely taking some getting used to.  In addition, if you have a large head, as do I, the clamping force on your head may be a dealbreaker for you. I have learned to adjust the position on my head to mitigate that. Unlike many headphones,  you will spend a little more time adjusting them for comfort. The Sony XM4s are definitely more comfortable.,Controls. The two button controls are simple and easy to use which is the same setup on the Apple watch. I prefer this setup to the touch controls on the XM4, which can be hit and miss. You can adjust the direction for volume up or down based on what is more intuitive to you.,Sound. The sound is absolutely amazing. Hands down the best I have ever heard. While listening to music is often discussed, not much is said about using them with AppleTV which is actually the primary reason I purchased them. Listening to a movie or TV show through the Airpods Max is simply unbelievable.  Spatial audio is a brilliant audio enhancement.,Battery life. I have been able to get the 21 hours they advertise. Battery life is not nearly as robust as the XM4s however. Much has been made about the fact that they can't be turned off. I have not found that to be an issue, although it does force you to put them in the case in order to put them in sleep mode. Noice cancellation is excellent.,Miscellaneous. Yes, the case is ridiculous. I purchased a more viable case for. It does not come with a charging adapter (brick). That was a not a real issue for me. I was far more upset when they shipped iPhone 12s without them. I find them too heavy to for exercising. I use the XM4s for that. I do not use them for business meeting calls (Zoom, etc.), so I have no opinion on that. If you are going to purchase AppleCare, purchase it through Amazon. Adding it with Apple  is a hassle if you purchased them from Amazon.,Summary. The construction of the Airpods Max is something to behold. If you are an iPhone, Apple Music, AppleTV user, you will  definitely want to consider these. I was on the fence for awhile because of the price, but after using them I have no regrets. I give them 4.5 stars. The weight prevents me from giving it 5 stars.

BEWARE: the Space Gray color is non returnable new or used! All other colors are returnable as of the writing of this review!,Bought these used. I know! What a silly thing to do right? Anyway. They arrived and what do you know? They won't turn on. Went through all of the Apple troubleshooting steps, talked to the Amazon tech support rep, and still no dice. Finally get to the Amazon customer support team and they say too bad, you have to deal with Apple.,Kind of inconvenient, but okay, I guess that's fine. Get in contact with Apple and come to find out the serial number on the product and the serial number on the box don't match. Weird.,No help from Apple unless I reach further into my pocket to fix them at my own expense and wasted 2 hours on the phone with Amazon.,I have a $450 paperweight. Maybe someone from Amazon will see my review and figure out how to make sure I have a working product.,But hey! They fit really well on my head! I'm sure they're great if they weren't broken out of the box.,4/5 fit,0/5 customer service

First the good. They have pretty good controls and connectivity. The noise cancellation is one of the best. Build quality is very solid like almost everything Apple makes. Very long battery life lots of use out of one charge.,Now for the bad, they’re too heavy for the head to be worn for a long time. They will start to feel uncomfortable after ten minutes of using them. 3-D tracking sound is almost nonexistent to my ears… Maybe I got a A defective one, I don’t know! The sound seems a bit too bright on the meds and high for me. They can get fatigue quickly. The base is good but not great. I was a bit disappointed in some of the areas expecting maybe too much from this product with the high price tag! Overall it’s a OK  to good Product but it’s deafly not worth the money.

These are good (not amazing) headphones.,First the good:,1) the noise cancelation is EXCELLENT,2) the ambient sound mode is EXCELLENT,3) they sound very good,Now for the bad:,1) they're uncomfortable to wear.,2) after 30-45 minutes my ears are hot and it's too uncomfortable to wear.,3) no way to know how much battery you have (or don't have) without looking at the battery widget,What I've found is that I actually prefer other headphones more. Even with Apple. My Bowers & Wilkins  PX7 sound great and are way more comfortable.,That being said, as of this writing (July 2021) I don't know if Apple is going to release an update to enable hi-fi with these headphones and Apple Music.,I'd say buy these if you're heavily sunk into the Apple ecosystem and don't plan to ever wear your headphones for more than 45 minutes.
