not good

If you have an iPhone it makes sense to get the Pro Air Pods because they are superior.  I have Sony WMX003 whateve over ear (three sets), 2 sets regular AirPods 1st Gen, 3M worktunes pro, 2 sets Jabra 75t, Beats Flex, Bose wired, DeWalt overear.  I've used all of them a lot.  I used these with my skidsteer yesterday without a problem noise-wise.  They cancelled the steady noise well enough the machine didn't bother me.,These are by far the best of anything I've used so far because the size and also the feature set.  The auto-connect is great.  I don't know how to check the battery level like on other ones but I might have missed it.  What boggles my mind and blows my mind is the spatial feature.  I started looking around after starting to listen to an audio book with that feature on.  It's like the narrator is behind and all around.  Spooky.  I just replied to a text message without touching anything.  Weird.  It's like the future is now.  This is a quantum leap over other products.

Sound quality is good although for me, once you get over $50 for earbuds I don’t notice any huge improvement in sound quality for the extra money. Noise cancellation is good, not great.  They are a little difficult to get out of the container but no big deal.,My biggest issue is that they don’t stay in that well.  Better than some others because they are streamlined and don’t have a big mass hanging out of the ear but I can’t imagine running in these.  I am constantly pushing them back in. To make matters worse, there are controls on the earbuds that I can’t seem to disable, so every time I adjust them I inadvertently pause or skip a track.  I’ve tried each of the three sizes of the rubber pads but it doesn’t seem to make a difference.  I’m guessing this depends on the shape of your ear, since I’ve seen people running with them on.

I got them on sale during cyber Monday. They do not come with a plug, which is a bit infuriating considering the price. They do fit in my ears compared with the often lamented universal Apple headphones. The good news, they pair easily with your modern devices -- just open the box to enter pairing mode. If you have an updated OS on your Mac/Phone/IPAD, it is a breeze. I was even able to pair them with my 10 year old IMAC whose operating system is not able to be updated anymore. I listen to music most of the day and I am accustomed to some rather large antique speakers which have a big sound (esp. bass), so these were slightly disappointing at first. You must make sure that you have a good fit with your ear for the optimum experience. The noise canceling is very good as is the transparent mode which allows the world to rush back in. I often stream TV content on my old iMac, so they will come in handy for that and when I travel. Will I use them every day -- probably not, but I think I am probably the exception here. I do not spend large amounts of time on the phone. Will these replace large speakers of a top notch sound system -- no, and I find I miss the ambient sound -- but the sound is very good. I do like to game a bit on the iPad, but the iPad pro has such good sound to begin with, I didn't find that they enhanced my game experience that much but my experience is hardly conclusive. The auto-recognition (when you have them in your ears) did not work for me several times -- I may have put them in backwards because they felt better that way, but the feature where Siri can announce your calls, etc. is nice. You can turn it off if you want a more immersive experience. I doubt I will use the haptic feature much - to be honest these things are pretty small and I would rather just change the settings on my device.

These are great pairs of earbuds if you get a good pair and you buy it from somewhere other than Amazon. I order two of these while they were on sale during Black Friday, and BOTH of the AirPods had defects. One had a faulty case which would not pair with the phone or any apple device. The other had a bad in-ear sensor (which is required if you ever want to turn on noise cancellation). I called Amazon to ask for a replacement and received the run around and was being transferred between agents like a ping pong each one asking me the same information again and again, fed up with this I asked to talk to a manager and was transferred to another agent posing as a manager, and I only found out after I was transferred again to yet another agent who said that they cannot offer me a replacement and only a refund. What will I do with a refund now that all the Black Friday deals on AirPods are over. Either One buy the AirPods at full price $90 more than I initially bought them for or wait until next year. I have had great experiences with Amazon in the past but this incident has forced me to cancel my membership and never use Amazon again. Next year I am going to Walmart, Best Buy or Costco for my shopping, anything but Amazon.

i was looking around to buy airpods from the actual apple store about a week ago right before Black Friday. I saw these while shopping on Amazon and was curious about the price..! They were on sale I believe 159$ HECK YESS. I’m so glad I bought em at this price not knowing they’re actual apple Airpods pro!!. The shipping was good three days only and they came packaged real good! Now let’s talk about the product itself, i was nervous reading the reviews saying it came damaged or used etc.. i did a comparison between my brother’s Airpods pro from apple store 249$ Vs these mysterious (apple Airpods pro 159$) they both looked exactly the same i was surprised apple assembled them in Vietnam but after all both of our Airpods pro are 100% no difference. I wanna mention battery life and sound cancellation, holy cow i love them so much and they last exactly how they’re described on Amazon! 4h plus on full charged, and the case can charges up to 24h. SIDE NOTE:: THESE AIRPODS PRO DO NOT COME WITH CHARGING ADAPTER (CUBE,POWER ADAPTER) only comes with C USB cable and two extra sizes of ear plugs. Don’t forget to buy your power adapter like i did, it came in the same box as the Airpods pro.

Cut to the chase -,**Fantastic sound quality on phone calls. The noise reduction works very well and phone calls do not sound too compressed. I don't listen to music on my phone so I can't give an opinion of how they sound in that regard.,***They fit comfortably in my ears and stay put when walking around, bending over, and doing household chores.,***Charger not included. There's a USB C cable, but that doesn't help me at all so I had to buy an adaptor. Annoying. For the price that you pay for these things Apple should include a wall charger which likely costs them 5 cents.,***The airpods are very difficult to remove from the case. Being so round and so smooth there is nowhere to grab them to pull them out easily. To make things more difficult, they are held inside the case with magnets so you can't get them out by turning the case upside down. Not having the case magnetized would have made it better.,***There is no way to adjust the volume on the air pods. While on a phone call I don't want to say "hey Siri, turn down the volume" - you know? The volume has to be adjusted on your phone. Other bluetooth earpieces have a volume button on the earbud - I don't know why these don't.,Great sound quality, not user-friendly. 3 stars.

These airpod pros are the most comfortable earphones I’ve ever used. I barely feel them in my ears - they just feel light and airy. The music sounds so clear and crisp and warm. I had been using Sony wireless WI-1000X prior to switching to these AirPods. I love Sony for the deep bass but those particular headphones really didn’t work well for conversation and also when it’s hot out, the battery part you wear around your neck just gets clammy and uncomfortable, so I was ready for less physically intrusive headphones. Initially I was wary of the AirPod design (how the heck do they stay in your ears?!) but now that I’m wearing them for the first time I’m sold on this design. Also they paired so quickly and easily with my iPhone straight out of the box. I’ve been using noise cancelling headphones for over 20 years and personally I wouldn’t bother with any headphones that didn’t have that feature. It really makes a huge difference in clarity and what you can actually hear in loud environments. Even something as simple as a dentist visit - when they’re drilling or cleaning - you can actually hear your music or podcast. And if you’re on public transport or a train or plane you can actually hear whatever you’re listening to well without having to crank up volume. Spatial audio is really nice too when it’s available. Very psyched about my new AirPods Pro.

!!!WARNING!!! 100% FAKE AirPods directly from Amazon Prime! 3 different serial & model numbers on each earpiece & box, but looked very very legit! Thx for the Christmas fight Jeff! Returning the other AirPods without even opening them! I thought purchasing directly from Amazon was safe but nope!.. I’ll GLADLY pay more to get legit products!!! BYE POS BOEZOES!!! 👎👎👎🤬🤬🤬

Love these AirPods Pro. Came packaged well, fast shipping. The features are amazing. I’d not purchased AirPods in the past because they were too big and hurt my ears (I must have little ear holes). These come with three sizes to put on the devices for comfort. The sound is awesome, noise cancellation is great for when you just want to hear what you are listening to or the person with whom you are having a conversation,  and the transparency allows you to hear other things, but still hear your music. It doesn’t come with a charging block, but it does come with a cable. I use this with a wireless charging pad and it works great!

I've been in 1 (or 2nd??) gen airpods with no problems except that I.....lost them.  After reading about the Airpod 3's, I decided to wait and go with the Airpod Pros.  First try, the noise cancellation made me smile--almost *zero* noise!  Big change.  Love it.  As for fit, I the added rubber tips are a game changer for me.  In fact, I bought several 3rd party "rubbery" covers to fit over my old pods to make them better stay in my ears--which became a real pain once they got oily.  If i'm splitting hairs, the case is larger and because the pods are a totally different shape, they are very "slippery" trying to remove them from the case.  I'll prob get used to but worth mentioning if that's a hassle for you.  They were/are on sale as well.  Oh, I bought the 2-yr "protection plan"--which I rarely do on anything--after reading the benefits.  Try'em out--free returns!

DO not waste you $ -- there is NO volume control - and lacking other features of other less expensive brands... sound quality is NOT that different..  NO MAG CHARGER.... really for 180.00  you cant send a mag charger.. really ?

I don't care what anyone on YouTube says, these Air Pods 3rd generation have audio and comfort levels that are vastly superior to the Air Pods Pro. I now have BOTH the Pro and the 3rd gen (and many, many others that were reviewed as the "best")  and will take the 3's every time over all of them. I have heard all the glory about noise cancellation and frankly its a marketing ploy. These 3rd gen are the most comfortable ear buds I have ever worn. Between music and phone calls they are in my head 4 hours and more at a time. I even forget that they are there until Siri announces a call or text through them. The sound is also amazing with rich full bass that is balanced and enjoyable across many genres. If you just want a great comfortable sound and not worried about drowning out airplane noise or train clatter, then these are the one you want.

These are great headphones and good quality. Not sure why people gave horrible reviews of a new product without even giving it a try? Or even purchases it? I own the first gen, and think this one is great with awesome quality. Provide honest reviews, this is not a place to complain other generations.

All my opinions:,Needed a new update for my 2nd generation AirPods. So I bought these and let me tell you it’s a learning curve.,Pros:,Sound quality is top notch,Spatial Audio is amazing!,Battery life is great.,Stem Size is perfect,Cute compact case,Indicating Light is on the outside now,Cons:,-Takes getting used to the size and feel of them.,-These sit deeper into your ear, not as deep as pros but they need to be wedged into the ears.,-if you wiggle your ears or smile widely it moves your ear canal and these suckers will fall out.,-Also Apple changed the charging cord to type C, so old cubes will not work. 🤨,So far these are working great besides the learning curve every new thing requires! Will update after a month of use!

In my experience, the spatial audio is a gimmick, not sure who would want to continue listening it that mode after 2 minutes... Good to just to experience the feature, but that's it.,Fit : poor fit compared to the original airpods + it starts paining after a while - this is the main reason I decided to return.,Sound quality: at par with the original airpods.,I don't use this for calls, so the wind cancellation is a feature I'll never use.,Also with deals, price similar to that of airpods pro, wonder why would someone go for this!

The listing says they’re new but we noticed when we unwrapped them they had 0 battery which was peculiar for a new apple product. When we turned them on and synced with Bluetooth we saw the AirPods were named “John’s AirPod’s #2” so they definitely have been used.,Otherwise they seem to be working, but I could have bought used AirPods literally anywhere. Super disappointed honestly and I hope these weren’t stolen or something. John if you’re missing your AirPods just let us know. We have them lol

Significant upgrade from my 1st gen. At the beginning I thought the spatial audio is more of a gimmick. But listened few songs and it completely changed my opinion. Head tracked feature is really good. You can definitely know the difference when it is off and when it is on.,If you are upgrading from 1st or 2nd gen, you will feel the difference when you try to fit them in ears. I also did not like it at the beginning, but they are actually more comfortable compared to their predecessors and do not fall off from my small ears even during workouts.,If you don't like in-ear headphones, this is the one to buy. I would definitely recommend this.

This is my first experience with Apples Airpods. I was sceptical as to them being something that I would like because people do complain about them falling out of their ears & I have always have had trouble keeping ear buds to stay in my ears. I primarily use the Bose around the ear headphones & I love them. I also have the Helm true wireless earbuds that have a built-in wing that nestles in the ear cavity so that they don't fall out. These ( Helm), have the best bass response, but are a little bulky. They do have a volume control that Apple does not.,  When I first got the Airpod 3's in I was blown away by how good they reproduced the music. The spacial audio is an amazing experience in itself. Battery life is good, but not even close to the Helm or Bose around the ear phones. A friend who owns the Airpod Pro's tried mine & he confessed that the 3's sounded way better than his. Pro's. I still can't seem to feel comfortable wearing the Airbuds when I'm moving around as they tend to come loose from my ear. No problem when sitting or lying down in bed, but as soon as I start to move, they slip. I've ordered a set of wings that attach to the buds, so we'll see how that works out. The downside of them is that they don't fit in the case & have to be removed to put the buds in the case.,  With that all said, I really like these Airpodd 3's. I don't have an iPhone, but do have an iPad. The pairing is instantaneous. I really miss having a volume control on my buds, that's where the Helm's are much better.,  I was fortunate to get them at a nice sale price on Amazon, so that won me over in making the purchase.,  I highly recommend these Airpod's.

I bought the Airpods 3 because I was very curious about spatial audio. They basically play some layers of the song out of one ear and others out of the other ear such that it sounds like the song is playing all around you. But that's the only stand-out feature I like.,These do not go inside the ear canal at all. They hang outside the ear canal and you're basically walking around hoping that they don't fall out. It's very uncomfortable. I find that it helps to wear them upside down (with the tail end up and the left one goes in the right ear and vice versa). Another problem I have is that when you're walking outside with your phone in your pocket, the connection drops.,I was going to return my AirPods but I couldn't bring myself to do it because the audio quality is still amazing and my other headphones just don't compare.

I have had every generation of AirPods so far. These are my least favorite.,I loved the first/second generation because they fit nicely. I don’t love the rubber tips of the pros, but wanted the sound quality of them. I hoped that this generation would be a happy medium, but I’m disappointed. They do not stay in my ears. Admittedly, I have small ears and wear the smallest size tips of the AirPod pro, but these just do not stay in.,I really wanted to love these, and the sound quality is good. I can’t speak to the battery life, as I don’t think I’ll be able to keep them in long enough. Sadly, I’ll be sending these back and ordering another pair of gen twos.,I think these would work great for people with bigger ears though.

New to the Apple watch and am very satisfied with switching over from Fitbit. Love the screen response, always on feature, and the size/weight. The water proof feature, heart rate, ECG, and SpO2 monitoring are great features as well. I was also concerned about the battery life but am surprised not only how long it has been lasting, but also how quickly it charges. My only complaints (coming from a former Fitbit user) are that the work out tracking detection is about 20-30 seconds delayed, the sleep tracking is not as detailed as Fitbit (if that matters to you), and the App could offer a few more customization options. Overall, very satisfied and would definitely purchase again.
My first apple watch! I love 45mm big screen so much even with my thin wrist!! Sport band feels so soft and watch is very light! Very useful to wear this during physical activities!
Received the watch without Any seal on the box. The watch steel was already opened up. Ended up returning the watch and just buying it straight from Apple.

My 14yr old got his first iPhone for Christmas. I wanted to get him an older Apple Watch (I had the series 4 & was just going to get him that) but they are still so expensive! Spent two days looking online and couldn’t justify it. Came across this one on Amazon and noticed the green one was 338 bucks; sixty bucks cheaper than all the other ones. So I snatched it up for myself and gave my son my series 4 with this green band on it. So far I’m not really noticing much of a difference, and I can’t seem to get the same watch face complication that I had before; that bums me out. The battery life seems to be a slight improvement from my series 4, but there’s still no way to wear it all day and track your sleep too. I charge it overnight. I’m still not sure it was with the upgrade at this point, but I love all the functionality of it. I get Ring doorbell notifications pushed to my watch, Life360, and I love being able to answer calls without pulling out my phone. I’ll be an Apple Watch wearer for life (this my third one).
Twice I tried to post an honest review and it wasn’t published. The watch is fine, it’s everything else that sucks.

I had the Apple Watch series 6 and hated how short the battery would work. This one’s battery lasts way longer, a lot quicker to charge, item was as described, amazing resolution, I love everything about this watch honestly. Super simple to install and start using, I believe it took me 30 mins tops! I love how it is way more accurate on my sleep, heart rate, and all my movements and stats. My issue with series 6 is it wasn’t accurate as well, and wouldn’t track my sleep no matter how much troubleshooting I did. This one I have my sleep tracked on here, and way better application overall. I highly recommend this watch for people wanting something to have that does so much more than other watches and has a iPhone so they are connected all day long. I’m so happy to get this for Christmas and will never look back! ☺️💜

The watch is very pretty, but finding out how to find different settings is confusing,I went to the Apple store and they upgraded my phone and the watch but wouldn’t give me any tech help. They claimed they don’t do that anymore

I’ve owned an Apple Watch since the 2. I had the 4 and loved it. The 7 is equally as great and is faster, bigger, with always on and blood oxygen detection. The stainless steel feels more substantial and looks better but the aluminum is great too. I haven’t owned a titanium or ceramic version. All my bands work with this bigger size.

Watch is fine overall, does all as expected. The band, however broke the second time I took it off (see picture). Highly recommend buying at least 1-2 more bands when you purchase the watch to avoid the down time. The cheaper bands appear to be higher quality than the one it comes with.

I bought this primarily to call for help in case I fall. I have not tried this feature.,UPDATE: I accidentally call 911 while putting on a stainless steel band. The response was immediate, was able to talk on the watch, I explained what happened, operator ask my telephone provider I assume to to verify I was lucid. PERFECT.,At first blush this seems to be a nice device full of nice features.,The documentation is non existent, you will spend hours researching. There is no connectivity to an iPad only an iPhone. While it does come with a magnetic charging cable, there is no charging brick and the cable end does not plug into a lightning port which means you will have to buy a charger specifically for this device.,Once you figure out the different nuances you will probably like the watch.

If you are like me and you have not tried to get an iPad since the original iPad release because you believe they have no utility, I recommend you take a second look at the mini. It fixes the problem of the iPad being so bulky and large that you think “why didn’t I just bring my computer” you can literally fit this thing in your back pocket in some mens pants. Perfect as just the ultimate notepad with the pencil. Hook up a wireless PS4 controller with Bluetooth and play old school GTA games, or download hundreds of gigabytes of movies and TV shows for a long car ride. The utility is there, and it is the ideal size. 2 Pop sockets for the back, one in each corner will help you A LOT and they help you not hold it upside down which makes attaching the pencil and using the buttons easier. 256 Gb version Wi-Fi only is connecting to my phones hotspot and will take calls when the phone is nearby and I have iCloud to automatically keep all the info on the iPad and phone the same so it’s literally my other easier to use phone. Will definitely enjoy taking it hiking for the first time, perfect compromise between a bulky computer and a small screen phone

I’ve wanted an iPad for a while but not anything too big. I also didn’t want something as small as my phone so this is the perfect in between. I can put this on my desk and listen to podcasts or watch things on it while I’m doing other things and it doesn’t take up a lot of space at all. The battery lasts all day. It’s a little expensive but apple in general is expensive. It’s definitely worth it though if you are looking for something that’s a size between a big iPad and an iPhone.

I love this thing!  This is my first iPad mini, my previous iPads were the Air 2 and the 2017 iPad Pro 12.9.  This thing is perfect.  It is so portable and so powerful at the same time.  Jelly scroll is a real thing, and it is somewhat noticeable, however it is on ALL iPads, it just so happens that this one’s orientation is in the vertical position while all others are in the horizontal position.  It’s only noticeable if you’re thinking about it and looking for it.

This is a beautiful update of the IPad mini.  It is my third IPad mini and I am so disappointed in the jelly roll screen.  As much as I want it, I will not accept this flaw or Apple’s explanation of it.  Whether they can’t or won’t fix it I am not sure.  I sent mine back.  Shame on Apple, not so much for the jelly roll screen, but for not admitting the problem and trying to pass it off as normal behavior of the screen

I’m sure this mini is a step up but trying to move the data contents from my old to this new proved to be an impossible task for me. Some of the new ways of scrolling was more than I could get used to. I sent the devise back to the seller. Hope you have more patience and smarts than I have.
The issue known as “jelly scrolling” is so bad that nothing else about the Mini matters. It's Antennagate all over again, pretending a major design flaw is normal.

Has to be charged twice a day. Good point is new USB is unbelievably fast.  I updated from the iPad Mini 5 mainly for Apple Pencil  2. . I lost or broke Apple Pencil 1 more than once, which of course is completely on me but the Apple Pencil 2 is so much safer charging and connected to the side of the 6. The 6 is slightly lighter which is great too. Overall the iPad mini is great and I would definitely choose this one if it were my first one.

Packing (box inside a box zero padding),Arrived same day!,Jelly scrolling (Real and dizzying keep one foot on floor),Blacks (Not deep enough more like a dark fade  wash),5G (Waiting on Visible to get their poo together meanwhile a hotspot will do),Full  spacious desktop work station (With special well worth it attachment for full mirroring everything!) add the apple trackpad /mouse /keyboard .. it all works to take a break from screen touching..,Placing a metal plate on back snaps it to a magnetic car mount great for waiting at a super charging station watching a movie…,It’s light and small, and I don’t mind the strange frame borders and am saying just the screen quality/ behavior is it’s top shortcoming. Everything else is as good as iPhone 13.  Its like three 13’s  side by side wide.  With a pro screen it would be perfect.,Will keep it till apple raises the price another $100 for a pro version?  I can’t see getting a larger ipad though They are too large. Would rather magnify mirror scale it up if needed on a large monitor

Got this to jot down notes and it's my primary e-reader for the books and research articles I read every week. Getting all-day battery life and it is much zippier than the previous generations of the iPad Mini. Makes a nice tablet for using at the gym to watch videos or read while I go on the treadmill or StairMaster. This is a great tablet for kids as well. I got another one for my little brother who is in grade school. He uses this to doodle and draws on ProCreate. Overall, for under half a grand, this is worth it if you are looking to get into the Apple community and want a tablet with a USB-C port!

I love this iPad. I’ve had other tablets that were frustrating to use because they were slow, short battery life, etc. But this iPad is wonderful! It is fast and the camera quality is amazing. I am very pleased with this purchase!

This is about my 7th smart "watch". I've have a couple of Fitbits, a Jawbone, a Zenwatch 3 (prettiest of the bunch), a Samsung Galaxy, and an Amazfit Bip (good watch for the money). I've basically got a smart watch museum. I got the Apple Watch because, honestly, I'm getting older and I wanted the fall detection and health features. I've had it for a couple of weeks and here's what I think, from bad to good.,1. Battery life sucks. It'll get through one day, but that's it. The Bip would last for 3 weeks on a charge.,2. The screen isn't great in direct sun. It's better than some others, but doesn't hold a candle to the Bip, which was somehow reflective in bright light, sort of like a Kindle.,3. The sleep tracking is ok, about what you'd expect from a movement detecter, but the app for it isn't very good. Stick with one of the gadgets that goes under your mattress for now.,4. It has some very nice watch faces, with custom complications. Best of the bunch.,5. Very comfortable to wear. The big stem doesn't get in the way at all.,6. The health features work great. It accurately tracks you pulse, and will check you blood oxygen and ECG on demand. I wish it would do the blood oxygen periodically with low saturation detection, but battery is likely a problem.,7. The fitness features rock. Even without a subscription, the watch has helped me get my exercise.,It has a ton of other useful features. Siri works fine, you can control Spotify with it, maps are kind of fun. Lots of other things. The really good thing is that, as the practical king of smart watches, there are 3rd party apps/integrations to do just about anything that could make sense, and it's unlikely the watch will be orphaned like my AndroidWear watches were.
Just wasn’t as much of an upgrade as advertised.

I received this watch yesterday.  Today I needed to re-charge the battery.  Guess what!  The charging cable does not fit into any of my Apple charging adapters!  I called Amazon, and was told that the adapter does not come with the Apple Watch!  The charging adapter must be bought separately!  Are you kidding me?!!  What a rip-off

It took me a while to decide to upgrade my apple watch. Hard to justify a smart watch over $300, in my opinion, however, my Series 3 was so slow, took forever to install an update, no space for apps/data storage, etc...,I got a Fitbit Charge 5 as a temporary place holder, tried to convince myself I liked it more than an Apple Watch, ultimately I came back to Apple.  I opted for the 41mm Series 7 because I didn't need an extra 4mm for another $100.,It moves so seamlessly, fast to charge (lightyears ahead of the series 3), lots of new watch face templates to choose from, beautiful edge to edge display. Of course you can choose to have "Always on Display" but that will quickly deplete your battery life.,Ultimately, just get the upgrade that is within your budget and you won't regret it!

I ordered this on 11/26 and received it at 6am on the 27th (gotta love rush overnight shipping being a prime member).,This was an upgrade for me coming from the Apple Watch 3 and then going to Whoop for a year and a half. Ultimately decided back on Apple for the smart watch features.,Few things to note:,1. The screen is a lot bigger if you’re used to a  41 or 42mm. Personally love the bigger screen but I also have a bigger wrist so it fits very well.,2. The watch does NOT come with the “butt” part of the charger you plug into the wall. If you have a newer charger for your apple devices (Ie when I got my iPad earlier this year I had gotten a full charger that I can swap the wires out with this) you’re all set. If not, go buy a charger when you’re purchasing this,3. The watch, for me at least, was closer to 90% charged so wouldn’t have been a huge deal if I had to Amazon prime or run to the store for a charger,4. Features are advances compared to the 3 but still have a lot of similarities.,5. Box comes with two band sizes. Small and then medium/large,6. The packaging is very well done. I was impressed when I opened it up,Overall I’m happy with this purchase (I knew I would be) as I spent probably 2 months comparing the new Apple Watch to the Garmin to find what would be best for me and my specific needs.
It did not work with my phone

Series 7 is the best!! I love this watch and the larger face is amazing!! My watch was delivered with care on time and was a breeze to set up and pair with my iPhone. The size of the 45mm is insane!! I upgraded from a series 3 to series 7 and I’m so glad I did. Get you one it won’t disappoint!!!

Not the color I ordered. There is no charging block with watch. The end is different. It does not take regular charging block. Still have not found right block with a end to charge watch. So I can’t set it up to even see if I like.

First, I just want to say that it DOES NOT come with a charger block for the USB type C, so if you don’t already have one, buy it along side it as I had to take a trip to two different Walmarts and a target to find one.,Next, I highly, highly, highly, HIGHLY recommend you measure your wrist and go by the recommended wrist size that apple suggest for each watch. I’m fairly okay in terms of body weight sitting at 210 lbs and dropping with a height of 6’1.  My wrist size was measured to be 210mm so it was recommended that I go for the 45mm version but instead I decided to look at reviews on YouTube and I saw that majority of them recommended the 41mm version as the 45mm was “too bulky and was like wearing a TV screen on their wrist” so because of that I went for the 41mm. When I placed it on my wrist with the band, it felt like I was wearing the smallest watch ever, it felt as if I was trying to put on a watch made for children. Then I went to my friend’s who had a 45mm Apple Watch and tried his on and it fit perfectly, lesson learnt, listen to the manufacturer instead of random people in a video.

Was excited to get my watch only to find out there isn’t a charging block to charge the watch. So what good does it do if you can’t charge it. Don’t even know what to do now. All this money spent. Ugh. Very disappointing.

I got this for $1099, which it's $1299 if you buy it from Apple, which makes no sense!  It was either this or the Macbook Air for $899 (which is $999 at Apple).  I got this because I've had many Macbook Airs and wanted something different.  If I had to do it again, and wanted to save money I would have gotten the Air.  The difference is this has a fan, a touch bar, a better gpu, and a brighter screen for $200 more.  I was worried because some people don't like the touch bar but I think it's great!  And besides, you can even set the touch bar up so it's just like the old function keys you're used to, but as touch keys.,There really is no competition for a Macbook.  I've tried them all, the Dells, the Surfacebooks, etc, and they're never as good as an Apple Macbook.
Excellent battery backup and very smooth and powerful machine..

I was excited to get the new macbook pro M1 as reviews described it as a very fast powerhouse computer. My first impression was strong. I started to play with all the features my old MacBook Pro is missing. I was excited about extending the screen to my iPad pro will be able to paint in photoshop (with Sidecar). This feature is completely underwhelming and unpractical to use (mostly due to how interface of this feature is set up). The next feature I was excited to try was installing iPad/iPhone app to MacBook Pro... Well, this works here and there, applications are crashing... again very underwhelming. Three weeks later my new MacBook Pro started having issues when plugging into the power source through thunderbolt. After I unplug it from power, the second time when plugin it wouldn't charge. I had to unplug the thunderbolt cable both from the power adapter and from a computer and plug it back to the charger first then to the computer in order for mac to charge again. I ran self-diagnostic on startup and it would freeze. Luckily I was still in the Amazon window to return this now broken computer. I don't understand how Apple machines became so unreliable. Now I'm hesitant to order another Apple computer as this is the very first new computer I ever purchased turns out to be a lemon.
Quality product. Light weight and superior design. Great audio and video performance..

I've been an Apple user for over 35 years, and I was pretty excited to make the M1 migration now that many apps have been updated for Apple Silicon. I expected to be blown away, and while this is an excellent Apple laptop, and the battery life does live up to the hype, I overall I found it disappointing compared to the reviews. Three things:,1. Sure, it may fly if you're doing really CPU heavy things, but for things like "heavy" productivity, I found it no better than my Intel 16". In fact....,2. This could be related to all the stories I read saying, "8GB on Apple Silicon is like 16GB on Intel."  Yeah, don't believe those. Again, this may be true for tasks that are well suited for ARM, but heavy productivity work is no better. I keep a decent but not insane amount of Safari tabs open at any time, and that plus having much of anything else open kept the memory pressure graph constantly in the yellow, if not red. And that may or may not be related to the biggest problem which is....,3. I had significant problems using my LG 5K display which has worked like a champ with my 16". Sometimes it would take up to 4 minutes before things "settled down" and I was actually able to use the computer again. That was a dealbreaker.,Would 2 and 3 have been better with more memory, or are these M1 growing pains, or something else? I don't know. I'll probably give the 16" a try with 16GB whenever it comes out. For now, this 13" was just too underpowered for my fairly average professional needs.,I realize that reviews below 5 stars on this are rare, which I find puzzling for the reasons above. Hope this is helpful to anyone who might be wondering about the downsides.

I love my MacBook Pro! I had the 13 inch macbook air 2017 and I hated that thing, used it for college and i wanted to get rid of it so bad so i gave it away. I always wanted the macbook pro because i thought they were just built better and i the interface of how its designed looked way better. Finally was able to buy one and so far so good. I really hope and pray this one doesn't start going slow like how my macbook air did after a year or 2. Bought one for my friend as well and she loves hers. I mainly use it for work, school/zoom calls and a little bit of streaming. Not a gamer so battery life is something i never have to worry about. Battery life was amazing for the first 2 weeks but  I can tell now the battery has been dying slightly faster but i believe it's from how much i've been on it lately but if i put it down for a few days (most likely 2) battery life hangs in there.

Hyper portability, ridiculously speed and responsiveness, and a VERY robust battery are some of the highlights of this little Mac. It's up and running from sleep as fast as a smartphone wakes, the trackpad + gestures make me forget I don't actually have a touchscreen here, and the M1 manages battery draw like nothing I've ever seen in a laptop.,The Touch Bar is controversial, but I love it. It's a great premium feature, but not necessarily a great "pro" feature. Replacing the F# line of keys with a touch screen that changes function based on what app you're using is actually pretty great and it ties in well with the idea of gestures via the trackpad as a method of interacting with the computer.,If you've never tried a Mac before, I highly recommend starting here.

This is my first Apple Computer and I am blown away! I will never be going back to Windows computers again. It’s a Thousand little things and quite a few big things that make Apple computers just better. I wasn’t a true believer but now I am. I love this MacBook Pro! I have it hooked up to a 30 inch Apple display and it is wicked cool. And I have the Apple Magic Mouse 2 and Apple keyboard.

The media could not be loaded.
                ,
   On the right hand side you can see a black line of dead pixels that quickly became much worse. And although it was on every window you can really see it on the graph where the image burned into the 3 week old screen that I barely used and bought specifically because it was considered the best option for trading view the program in the video. You can see. Facebook logo burnt in on the right but the whole screen was ghosting everything bad.  It’s just hard to see most of it. I have no idea what caused this. As it’s not a 20 year old crt display with an nes left on for years. It’s a brand new Liquid Retina I’m sure I’m not the only one to experience this but do keep in mind I was lucky and able to return because this happened one day before my 30 day window closed. My experience with apple has always been with second market items aside from my phone they are not very helpful unless you pay  a very high service fee. I’m sure I could have had this repaired for free but at the price and the fact that it was my very first Mac I sent it back and have no intention on owning another one. Best thing I could suggest is if you must own a Mack buy apple care they will replace  it twice brand new. U may need that done. The build quality outside of the electronics is unmatched. Absolute perfection in every seam. I wish it would have worked I bolutely loved this machine until the day it broke down. Now I won’t ever feel comfortable owning a new one again. I did purchase the m1 iPad instead and love it. Well my 2tb model. The 128 is not enough storage 2tb I’m sure will be plenty. I think apple is a great product as long u never have any issues. If you do be ready to spend like you did the day you made your purchase.

I have an aging MacBook Pro (15") which I use a great deal. At some point I know it will cease to function well, so I made the leap to the smaller 2020 MacBook Pro (13") with the M1 chip. It runs fast, stays cool, and after a month or so of pretty constant usage, has been doing beautifully. Some of the newer features like the touch screen pad have taken me some time to get used to, but I'm learning to appreciate them. A word of caution...not all apps and software are quite ready for the M1 chip / Big Sur yet. I'm still straddling the world of two MacBooks, the older one running High Sierra and the new one running Big Sur, because some of the apps don't work perfectly on the new MacBook. But all in all, it's a good transition for me.
Entrega antes do previsto. Porém, para nos dar mais credibilidade vcs deveriam deixar a embalagem lacrada com o plástico, como vem nas lojas. Aparelho funcionando normal.
Empresa muito atenciosa, entrou em contato comigo por um erro meu, se mostrou atenciosa em todo o processo, produto recebido muito rápido e muito bem embalado, recomendo muito!
O aparelho chegou em perfeitas condições. Porem esta bloqueado pela AT&T, sendo impossivel fazer a ativação.
Muito bom!
O celular é muito bom, apesar de muito caro.
Amei , como sempre perfeito
I have a Mac, iPad and iPhone. I didn’t think I needed a watch but there is an app on the watch that I wanted/needed for my lifestyle. I got much more than the App!!!
Este fue mi regalo de navidad, a parte tiene buena funcionalidad, muy buena marca siempre.
Great watch! My first Apple Watch.  I had many of the other Fit Bit watches previously and I like this one much better! Easy to use, very reliable!
So the watch is great…. But the charger does not fit any hub I have have to use my spouse’s charger till we can figure this out

No puedo descargar el whatsapp en la app, pero si llegan las notificaciones. El cargador solo viene el cable, no trae el conector y no es de los usuales de usb hay que comprarlo aparte.

I bought this for a Christmas gift and it was awesome, until it died. It comes with a cord but not no cube to connect it to the wall. And it doesn’t fit into any standard apple charging cubes. So we had to order one. After we revived it it still would not charge. Just a sad red lightening bolt. Such a disappointment. If after a few days of attempting to trouble slot it doesn’t work I will definitely be retuning it.

I really like the Apple Watch SE so far. There are some little things that are kind of annoying, but overall the experience has been pretty good. The thing that really bothered me is not the watch itself, but the charger. It comes with the USB-C charger, which if you are someone like me who didn’t know what it was could be annoyed by it. But other that that, I would say that it is so far good.

Excelente, nuevo...funciona perfecto, hermoso reloj...solo un detalle. Mi hija tiene un IPhone 11 y el taquito conector es diferente al original que trae el teléfono...de resto espectacular 👌,100% recomendado...
I am so glad I made the switch! Love all the watch can do with tracking my fitness and being able to compete with others is fun!

I've been using iPads for only about 3 revisions so far. They are wonderful, and I use them constantly. My only complaint about this revisions is that it seems the battery lasts less time than previous ones. That's quite weird though, as I hear good things all the time about the battery life from others. If the iPad is doing any work, it drains rather quickly. Doing this and that though, it lasts longer than the previous average.

This is my first iPad or tablet, it’s amazing!!! I am very impressed!  The screen is beautiful!  The processing power better than my laptop.,I use it mostly for art, but find myself using it instead of my laptop for many things.

White text on the black background creates a glowing effect. It is usable but should not be something a customer should expect with a $1500 tablet. I would wait for a true OLED version of the iPad or stick with the LCD display on previous models.
I've had the iPad Pro for about a month now and love it.  The large 12.9" display is beautiful and the M1 processor is fast.  The battery lasts all day and recharges quickly.

Screen quality is best I have seen on any I-pad. Fastest I-pad I have ever used. Very good battery life. I am hopeful that future apps will take advantage of this new Apple chip to deliver even more benefits now available only on laptops, since the inherent speed and thunderbolt input make this possible. Camera much improved, although most of my picture taking still done on my phone.

Best tablet on the world. It’s fast, it’s powerful, it’s reliable and it’s really expensive.  There’s nothing wrong with this iPad, actually it performs amazingly great.  However if you already have last year ipad, it’s not really worth upgrading.  It’s basically the same thing as the 2019 model.  Still love it though.

I am very pleased with my new 2021 iPad with a 12.9 inch screen. Great speed and graphics and easy to use. And battery life is comparable to my other smaller iPads. But where this iPad really excels is with very detailed boating charts and it easily replaced my older navigation equipment. I am extremely pleased.

I’m still trying to learn everything about this iPad but I do love it! The only thing I found a little disappointing was the battery life ( not as good as advertised). I thought this size would be too heavy but after awhile you get used to it. I love the touch screen. This iPad seems more solid than my old iPad.

I really wanted a bigger screen. When I tried to use it my eyes hurt! I turned the brightness down, I turned the white point down, to the point where it looked kinda dark. Even then it hurt my eyes pretty bad! Can’t use it in dark mode to read because it glows, like a blooming effect. I returned it, cuz I certainly can’t use it.
Authentic Apple product that works well like all Apple products, the screen is beautiful and the battery lasts a long time. Very happy I purchased this iPad.

The IPhone 13 is nice and sleek. I upgraded my iPhone 8 to iPhone 13 because the battery was low. The quality of the camera and video are definitely pluses for me. I got mines on an installment plan, just wish the price was cheaper.
It doesn’t come with a way to charge it- you have to buy all of that separately. So they send you a phone and you can’t charge it.
Amazon prime shipped me the phone fast and in working order
Yeah no

I love Apple products. The sound of these AirPods is absolutely AMAZING, and the noise cancelation feature is superb. However, none of that matters because they keep falling out of my ears. They come with 3 sizes of cushions, and shipped with large ones on the device, and they are very easy to change out. I tried the medium and the small cushions, but each size falls out of my ears while working out, which is so annoying because I have to keep reaching up to push them in. I was just walking in the grocery store and the one it had in fell out of my ear, I tried to catch it before it hit the floor but wasn't quick enough. There was no way I was going to put it back in my ear until I cleaned it with a disinfectant wipe. So I ended up walking around with an amazing and expensive device meant for my ears in my pocket. Stop moving around you say?.. Well, I was just sitting at my desk eating and suddenly, plop, it just fell out.  It's not the size because I have other earplug devises the stay in my ears perfectly even when I sweat while working out. Oh, the do come with a charging table but not the block, and the battery life is average. So I have to give Apple a thumbs down on this one, because they don't work. I would return them but I got rid of the shipping box. I still have the product box though and it'll make a very pretty storage box.

I'm a cheapie and tend to get $50 earbuds...so when the AirPods Pro went on sale for $150 I took the plunge..,Initial observation is that it's typical Apple well thought out design.  Very slick. The case is tiny and slippery.  First thing I'd recommend is buying a case for the case...see my other reviews,In use it's brainless when pairing with Apple products....and not much harder with non Apple products.  Good thing when using Apple products is if you leave your AirPods and walk away...you get a notification that you left the AirPods...making it less likely to forget them at a coffee shop or something.  There are different size ear pieces to fit most ears...the default one fits me fine.  It's definitely not for work out...they will fall out.,Sound quality is very good....much better than my JL $50 earbuds...but not as good as a high end over ear head set.  There are basically 2 modes....with noise cancellation or transparency.  Transparency mode actually amplifies the surrounding sound...not sure who'd want that.  Noise cancellation is really good, if you fit the earpiece snuggly into your ear canal.  Not as good as good set of Bose/Sony, but very noticeable improvement.  The spacial feature is pretty cool as well.  Basically it puts the source of sound at your iPhone/computer....if you turn your head or walk around, it makes the sound move based on where your source is.,Am I happy with my purchase?  Yes...it's noticeably better than the $50 set....the noise cancellation is really good and much more useful than I'd thought.

I took my time before deciding on purchasing these Airpods. I am so happy that I decided to go with these Airpod Pros.,I was tempted to do a third party airpod brand, but happy I made the choice to go with these airpods.,The sound is amazing and the noise cancellation feature is just amazing. I noticed a lot of people complaining about not having an option to adjust the volume only by saying "Hey Siri" or adjust the volume on your iphone or device. I have no problem with this and its really not noticeable.,The best thing about these airpod pros is if you have an iphone or other apple devices, its going to pair easily and you are going to unlock a lot of nice features.,Comfortably fits in my air, I don't even notice any kind of irritation or strain in my ears when I am wearing them, and I wear them all day long.,That being said, the charging case, is great! in 5 minutes of charging it practically almost fully charges the airpods pro. I really like this quick charging feature as I can just take 5 mins and have the airpods ready to go.,I highly recommend making the investment on these Apple Airpod Pro.,I want to point out, some people were making me worried saying they were getting fake airpod pros, this was not the case for me, I received genuine airpod pros. There are videos out there showing the fake ones from the real ones, so you can get an idea what to look out for, but I had no problem with Amazon supplying genuine airpod pros, just make sure when you are buying them you buy them NEW! Not used!

I normally do not review stuff, but I had I bought these headphones and they stopped working the next day. I took it to the Apple store and they said it was a fake.    Fits super comfortable in my ears and also stays in while I’m running. Love the noise cancellation feature, it really works (tested this on the plane with a a crying baby behind me and I was able to sleep). I’m so glad I upgraded from the regular AirPods

I ridiculed AirPods for years, but I am a reluctant convert. The last few years I’ve been very happy with behind-the-head Bluetooth headsets like Aftershokz, and I still think those are great. But i really, really like these.,The audio quality is great. The carrying case not only helps fast-charge, but it also keeps the buds cleaner than if they were floating around in a pocket or bag. They sense when they’re in your ear, so there’s not even a need to pair them or even turn them on. They seamlessly connect to your iPhone and pairing with other non-Apple devices is straightforward (using a button on the case).,There are three settings for noise cancellation. I find that Active is very comparable to my Bose QC3s which are much bulkier, but last longer. I’d still prefer the bose for flights because of that. Off is still quieter than the regular AirPods since the silicone cups naturally block some sound. And Enhance truly does make it feel like you don’t have them in—at least for nearby sounds. If someone is speaking in front of you, it’s crystal clear; if they’re speaking in another room, not so much.,Cons are twofold— the price, and battery life. I got these on sale with two gift cards and bonus points. I’m not sure I would have sprung for them if I had to pay full freight. Battery life is impressive for the small size, but not even a full workday. They do charge pretty quickly though, so at least both cons have potential mitigations.

Moving up from AirPods to AP Pro. Sound is a bit better, noise cancellation is great (blew my driveway yesterday; loud blower could hardly be heard) and battery life is much better. However, I don’t like the difficulty I have sliding the pods back in the case (believe me, it ain’t smooth) compared to the 1st generation and I seriously doubt I’ll ever be content with the fit in my ears. I still have a few more weeks to decide to keep or return. I’ll let you know.,Update: I've found a bit more satisfaction with the AirPod Pros recently. Now I have two different size silicon tips in my ears; I discovered that my right ear conforms to a larger tip vs my left ear. So, for simply walking the dog or doing my daily morning exercise walk, the buds stay in pretty good. But if I have to do a lot of head movement (like when I'm reaching down and lifting back up frequently (as in bagging leaves in the front yard)) the buds aren't too long in my ears. I can feel them slowly pulling out. Bottom line? Still have a couple of weeks to see if I can make these things right for me. Again, I'll let you know.

I highly recommend this product!,I use these all day for work taking calls, making calls, and in between listing to music. This is my second pair of Apple AirPods, and I also own a few other high-end brands versions as well to compare these with.,The Apple AirPods Pro is by far the superior version all the way around for noise canceling, comfort, battery life, and overall integration.,These are so seamless when pairing to your phone that when a call is coming in; and you do not have the AirPod in your ear, you can pull it out of the case, place it in your ear and still answer the call by the third ring. The sound quality is amazing whether you are listening to music or on a call. With the interchangeable ear-opening tips you are sure to find a size that is comfortable enough to wear all day long and not even notice that it's in your ear. The integration with Siri works very well and reads your incoming texts to you in a very pleasant way. No annoying notification ding in your ear here!

I am writing this review focused primarily on people who are considering jumping from the 13" MacBook Pro to the 14" MacBook Pro, which is what I did. I moved from the 13" MacBook Pro M1 with 16gb of RAM to the 14" MacBook Pro M1 Pro with 16gb of RAM.,Size: So, 1" of screen might not seem like a lot on its face, but the difference is pretty substantial, in my opinion. Even the pictures don't quite do it justice. The screen feels considerably larger in a package that isn't considerably larger. For me, it's the perfect sweet spot for someone who wants something larger than the 13" model, but smaller than the 16". I had a 16" MacBook Pro i9 and it was just too much for me. This one feels perfect.,Form Factor: The new 14" and 16" MacBooks both adopt a thicker chassis, which is shown in the pictures. As such, Apple decided to make the casing flat instead of gently rounded. It honestly reminds me of the pre-unibody builds, but still sleek and modern. If I didn't know this one was new and you just laid them side-by-side, I might say that the old form factor looks a little newer, but that isn't to say that it looks bad.,Aesthetics: Overall, I touched on the aesthetics a bit in the "form factor" section. It looks like a high-end laptop, but at the same time I can see some people thinking it looks dated. I personally like the flatter look over the more rounded look, but it will depend on the person. Another thing I like is moving the "MacBook Pro" branding from under the screen to the bottom of the casing. I just think it provides a cleaner look during use. The black background of the keyboard is also a plus for me. The old space gray background was fine, but I really like the black.,Function: Most people probably won't notice a massive difference in the previous iteration and the new iteration. For the 14" and 16" MacBook Pros, the touchbar has been removed. This will make a lot of people happy. For me, I was always pretty ambivalent about the touchbar, but I'm not going to complain about a key row there. The keyboard appears to have ever so slightly more travel and bounce. It's not a huge amount, but it is noticeable. I'll touch on The Notch later.,Performance: My 13" had the M1 chip and now my 14" as the M1 Pro. So far, I haven't noticed a tremendous difference when using programs like Logic Pro, Illustrator, Photoshop, and Lightroom, but I wouldn't say those are super intensive programs. If you're exporting massive 8K videos, you might want to jump up to the M1 Max. One thing I have noticed is that the thermals are maybe a little bit worse. Just a touch. I have noticed it warming up a bit, but the fan still has not come on once. I only mention this because my 13" M1 stayed cold at all times. It's not as bad as my i9, which sounded like a jet engine revving up while it jumped well over 100 degrees, but it's something to be aware of.,The Notch: Honestly, so much has been made of the notch and I think it's mostly overstated. Yes, it's fun to meme the fact that Apple still hasn't found a way around the notch, particularly on iPhones, but it's really not a huge deal. Were it up to me, I would have just left a bezel up there, but I can understand why Apple didn't. I use a Dell XPS for work and it has razor thin bezels with no notch, but at the same time the camera is an absolute joke. Looks like it's from 2002.,The Notch (cont'd): The notch behavior can be inconsistent from app to app, but not to the point where it's bothersome. I have seen some programs with very large nav menus up top bump the status bar out of the way to make room. And while this particular phenomenon is not something new for MacBooks, losing a big chunk of that bar to the notch will likely make this a more regular occurrence for people. Do I wish it didn't have a notch? Yeah, probably. Does it hurt the experience? Very, very little.,Screen: For everyday indoor use, which is almost exclusively what I do, I think you will be hard-pressed to find a better screen on the market. The 120Hz refresh rate is something I waited a long time to get on the iPhone, so I was pretty shocked to see it implemented on the new MacBook Pros just a month later. It actually has more pixels/inch than the iMac 27" 5K screen, which I also use pretty regularly. All-in-all, the screen is just the best in the business.,Overall: It's a great and powerful laptop for someone who is wanting a little more than web surfing and word processing. I use mine primarily for recording music, as well as live performances using standalone plugins, so I need something that is powerful and easy to use. The MacBook Pro has always fit the bill, but now with the M1, M1 Pro, and M1 Max chips, I have absolutely no concern for performance or consistency.,My 13" M1 did just what I needed in this regard, but I'm someone who wanted a slightly larger screen without drastically increasing my footprint and weight. The 14" MacBook Pro with the M1 Pro chip is just what I needed. If you're someone who needs absolutely top notch performance, I'd recommend upgrading the RAM and going with the M1 Max.

I haven't upgraded my computer for more than a decade, so it would stand to reason any recent releases would impress me, but this macbook pro has gone above and beyond in the small time I've had it.,The screen is truly something to behold. Smooth, clear, just beautiful. I don't typically care about bezels, but I might start. The expanded screen makes an unexpected difference. Meanwhile, I barely notice the notch. Apple said they'd find workarounds to make it scarce, and they have.,The speakers are wonderful as well. I was skeptical at first -- thought I caught some tinny effects on a couple songs, but the more I listen to them, the more I'm convinced the tinniness was in the recording (it was a live album, which might explain it). As for the spatial audio, I've only heard a couple songs, but it's pretty trippy. This is my first experience with it, and it doesn't disappoint.,In the short time I've had the computer, it's been nothing but fast. Probably more computer than I need, so if you're a sound editor or photographer, this review probably isn't for you. But for those of you casual users who want a solid machine that will last (as I said, my last macbook pro made it more than a decade), this is the one. Excited as I was for my last macbook, I could see room for improvement at the time. Right now, I don't see how things get better than this.

M1 pro chip is super powerful - photo/video editing, graphic design - this thing just kills it. Compared to previous MacBook Pro, it's a giant leap ahead. These tasks are a main reason to buy the pro version of the Macbook. This particularly model is the lower end of the spec you can get for a pro,  but it still kicks butt. You can get the Pro Max chip and bump up the RAM to 64GB if you want - and add tons more storage. The 14 inch MacBook pro is the perfect size for a balance of portability and power. It can do pretty much everything the 16 inch version does. The display is stunning. Just gorgeous. 120hz capability (pro motion) gets rid of blur when scrolling and makes for clearer action when viewing movies. The brightness and black levels on the display are awesome. Real HDR viewing -  a big difference. You will hear about "the notch" at the top of the screen where the camera is. After 10 minutes I don't even notice it. It means nothing for your experience. Its just something critics have chosen to harp about. in most apps the notch is no even visible. Camera is now a full 1080p and is a big upgrade over previous MacBooks. Six speaker sound system with new woofers - sounds incredible. Music/movies it feels like surround sound. For video conferencing the microphones are studio quality and you can tell - this is great for video conferencing. The keyboard is a dream to type on. Very solid like all MacBooks, no spongy feel you get with so many other laptops. The Apple Magic Keyboard is the best - as is the track pad. Battery life is amazing. I have gone all day on battery without needing to plug in. At best its spec says 17 hours, which is crazy! Especially for this spec...but for real world use with a mix of tasks, it won't be 17 hours but I did a 9 hour session yesterday, and still had a ton of battery left. The power efficiency is ground breaking. They have added back the MagSafe power plug - which is great! And added back an SD card slot and and an HDMI port - which many of us hated the previous macs that deleted these ports. I wish it had at least one USB-A old style port - but it doesn't. You get three USB-C thunderbolt 4 ports that you can use with adapters if needed. They got rid of the touch screen bar at the top of the keyboard from previous pro MacBooks and put back the regular mechanical keys for the controls. Apparently they listened to a lot of users who didn't really like the touch pad. The shape and style of this laptop is great. Some say the edge of the laptop looks "sharp" where your wrists rest. That is BS. I have been typing most of the day and I don't feel any issue with the edge of the laptop at all. Very comfy for typing. Some haters may try to find reasons to bash this new Macbook Pro, but I am telling you - from any perspective, all brand bias aside -  this is an amazing laptop - the best Apple has ever made, hands down. And I would say you won't find a better power laptop anywhere.  All that said - this is not a gamers machine. Apple is not for hard core gamers. I mean you can play games on it that you get from the app store. I am a hard core gamer and a PC geek  - I have a powerful windows PC for gaming. And always will. But for everything else. this MacBook is king. I use to for music, for photo and video editing, for productivity. I can plut into a giant monitor if I want a bigger screen - it works great on my 34 inch IPS panel. So if you are wondering if this Macbook 14 inch pro is the real deal or not - I am here to tell you, its the real deal. I finally upgraded from my 2015 MacBook pro because this new one hits so many sweet spots - revolutionary power and battery life, excellent ergonomic design, great sound, stunning display - its the whole package. If you are thinking of getting one - you won't be disappointed. One last comment. I am an old timer windows guy, and I know all the counter arguments for the Mac. Many wills say this is overpriced compared to a windows laptop with similar spec. First, show me an intel based laptop that can match these new M1 Pro chips - you can't. And aside from that, the Mac OS is secure and stable - rock solid - and is intuitive with amazing features - like the ability to copy and paste text FROM A PHOTO! Whaaat? And the design/ergonomics/quality of these MacBooks is unmatched. So, yes you pay more - but you get more. My last MacBook pro lasted me almost 7 years and it still works great. If you want this laptop - get it! It rocks.

I’ve previously owned an Apple Watch (series 1). A lot has changed since then. The set up took me hours. I had to update my iPhone to the lasted iOS. Okay. Now once it “paired” it was once again needing a Watch app update to fully connect.,Another downside. No charging block included. So it costs me another $20 to get a charging block as my iPhone 11 Pro Max was still utilizing the traditional USB to Lightening charging cable and block when I bought it in 2019.,Battery life. I love the feature of the screen staying on without wrist movement. Watch charges fast and the battery life is better than the older Series 3 I had. I previously had the 42mm and debated on the 41mm vs the 45mm. Went with the 41mm because I have small wrists and it's hard to get bands to fit. I do not miss the 1mm difference from my old watch. The watch has been an interesting investment.  I bought it for several reasons.  I liked the ECG function since I do have a genetic heart valve problem.  The ability to get my heart rate by locking into the gym's treadmill is a great feature.  The one feature that I wanted that the watch does not have is sleep monitoring.  I wanted to know how long I actually slept and how deeply.  The watch either does not have that feature or I have not found it yet.  Not using that feature does allow me to charge the watch overnight.  And, what the heck is it with Apple that they sell you an overpriced watch and then are too cheap to supply a charger.  Get real!
