I had to give this purchase 2 stars as an “average” of all the “qualities”.  I had to round it down because there’s no way to give half stars.,Anyways, I am extremely disappointed in this iPad Air.  I even purchased the magic keyboard and new 2nd gen pencil!  The battery charge on this thing, to be blunt, SUCKS.  The battery steadily loses charge even while the screen is of and its in stand by mode.  It acts like an aged, used battery.  My Pro I have is a few years old and was used heavily and just recently started quick battery drains.  It’s very frustrating because this stuff aint cheap!  And I expect Apple to be way better!

Pros:,Charges fast with nice battery life (some apps use a lot more battery than others, as per usual). Screen is crisp and large (needed for my aging eyes). Fingerprint scan was tedious to get started but useful once you've got it running.,The rose gold is nice, leaning more towards either pink or gold depending on lighting and perspective.,Obviously it has plenty of memory, and takes decent photos.,Lack of home button adds to screen size. An on-screen home button is available and can easily be moved around on the screen so it's not in the way.,Cons:,I don't know if it's the iPad or the iOS, but only thing that really irks me is that the battery percentage doesn't show on the lock screen and there is no way to enable it that I've found. I wish the iCloud came with more memory than 5G before you have to pay for it, and easier ways to download photos and videos from iCloud would make me much happier.,Uses a USB-C to USB-C cord, and like many adapters it's somewhat bulky. I generally plug mine into a surge protector with charging ports, so I did have to buy new ones that also include a USB-C charging port (eh I wanted new ones anyway). Connects to your computer the same way, so depending on your model you may need a different cord or adapter to connect if you go that route.,Lack of home button is a PITA for me, but if you go into Setting>Accessibility (I think that's where I found it) there is a way to place a home button on the screen and program it for the app switcher.

I love it and I say that as someone who wasn’t an apple fan. It took some getting used to as I’m an android guy. But once I learned the interface it’s ok. Moving files isn’t as nice as android but it’s ok once you’re used to it. The Apple Pencil 2 works awesome and doesn’t really lag or look displaced when drawing. I switched chrome out for safari and if you want to add a home screen button that opens a webpage in chrome then use thier shortcut program. That one took me a bit to figure out.

I've used computers since 1969, as a programmer and a consumer. At home I've gone through about ten different computers over the years, starting with the original IBM PC which I bought in 1983. This is the first Apple product I've ever bought.,Aside from a few quirks, the iPad Air 4 is the ideal household computer. It's extremely compact, has a supremely powerful and fast processor, a nice camera, excellent WiFi 6, and a breathtakingly beautiful video processor/monitor. It comes with no keyboard, case or prop. I suppose it's just supposed to sit in your lap as sold.,Luckily I've found several different mounting clamps, ergonomic Bluetooth keyboards, Bluetooth mice, a case/keyboard and a hub I can plug into its single USB-C port. It's the only port you need, handling everything from power to video to extra memory easily and all at once if you plug a hub into it. I have one iPad Air 4 that I move between several locations around my home, each with a large ergonomic Bluetooth keyboard and mouse at ideal typing level and the mount for the iPad at eye level on a desk shelf. I can type away comfortably for hours -- or watch a movie as I snack. With the hub, I can use a wired Ethernet network -- much faster than WiFi and more reliable. I expect it to last several years, so I use a screen protector and case. I've cracked one screen protector already with no damage to my iPad.,Now for the quirks. The hub I bought has an HDMI port for an external monitor. Unfortunately, you can't change the aspect ratio of the picture, so you end up with an image narrower than that of most monitors. You better have a monitor with sound, as using the HDMI port cuts off the iPad Air's otherwise nice speakers. This machine runs iPadOS, a version of IOS. It doesn't have as many features, making it harder to run productivity software -- my principle use for my iPad. MicroSoft Office's iPad version is hobbled as a result. So, my older Windows tablet must fill the gap sometimes. It takes the dongle to use wired headphones. I have some nice Bluetooth headphones, but I miss the super high fidelity of my wired cans if I can't use the hub. Video calls with Apple FaceTime and Google Duo are glorious on that screen, but if you don't have it rotated to portrait mode, the selfie camera ends up on the left edge. However, I quickly got used to that.,I'd recommend it.

I usually don't write reviews on tech items like this, but I was really disappointed with the screen quality compared to my old standard iPad.  I decided to upgrade because my old 4th gen iPad was just so slow.  All the reviews seemed pretty stellar for this model in terms of hardware so I decided to pick it up.  On the speed front it is amazing; loads documents, web pages and apps very quickly.  No performance issues.,The screen quality on the other hand is terrible in my opinion.  Not sure if this is standard or if mine was just defective, but the viewing angle is noticeably worse than my old iPad.  Even rotating it a few degrees while reading in bed changed the colors on a white background to pink and darkened the edges.  This remained unchanged even when adjusting the automatic color correction.  This led me to look up issues with the screen on this model, which also showed that there was significant backlight bleeding in one corner.  Further, when comparing the screen to my old iPad there is much more reflection on the iPad Air.  All this combined resulted in an annoying game of adjusting my wrist to maintain the exact right angle so that it didn't distract me while reading a news article or .pdf.,I'll make one more observation in my albeit limited time with this product.  The battery also seems to drain faster while doing the same activities I would normally do on my old iPad.  It came out of the box at 96% and after less than 8h of intermittent use (surfing, checking e-mail, reading news article and documents) it had dropped 25%.  I can't make a direct comparison to my old iPad, but it feels like that was a considerably faster rate of battery usage.,In the end, the increased performance simply could not make up for the poor screen quality.  I guess I'll have to wait until the pandemic is over and I can actually utilize the next gen ones in a store before purchasing.

I love this thing. It is lightweight and fast. Battery life is amazing unless you are watching a ton of videos which is the only time I have to charge it in the middle of the day. I paired it with the Magic Keyboard and it has replaced my MacBook Pro but I am not a power-user. I have the pencil as well which is nice but not as useful as the keyboard for my uses. The screen quality is also terrific, very clear and bright. If you require an iPad for more intensive tasks consider the iPad Pro but for most casual users this has plenty of power and speed. I mostly watch videos, browse the web, edit some photos, email, and work on the occasional document or spreadsheet. My MacBook Pro doesn’t have a touchscreen and I get to use apps for banking and other things which I feel is more intuitive than using the web in most cases so this is my go-to “computer/laptop” now.

I choose this ipad mostly because of the screen size, I think that 11 inch is the best size for a ipad. The camera was so clear, bought for myself as a gift I have used it for more than one week, and till now everything works so well. would like to recommend it to all my friends.  I love my purchase, and this new iPad Air was indeed a nice step up from the iPad 7th gen. I highly recommend this new iPad Air!! I choose the color green because summer is coming, it was a nice feel to watch videos with a ipad with color green. The best gift that I have ever had.

The screen on my 2014 does, and I didn't;t want to send the money on a new one, but the exterior screen started giving me problems, too, and I threw in the towel. Boy, am I thrilled that I did! This little MacBook is perfect! It's even more user friendly, has amazing colors, and functions with all modern apps. I'm absolutely in love with it!

I was impressed that there was no lagging when photo editing it.  I switched from PC to Apple which might take some adjustment.  If you’re like me,  I recommend that you watch some YouTube videos on some handy tips.,The only thing that irritated me was that the package was left on the doorstep for hours.  Nobody signed for it.  I shuddered to think what might happened if it got stolen. Definitely worth investing Nest or Ring door bell even if nothing got stolen.

I ordered the 2020 MacBook Pro for my wife to replace a Lenovo laptop that we bought brand new in 2017 and the Lenovo starting having all kinds of issues. I’ve had 2 iMacs and my brother has used lots of MacBooks over the years so he suggested the MacBook Pro. So far, so good!!

Couldn't get through the setup phase.  Wouldn't connect to my network.  Two other computers are connected plus a smart TV and two phones.  I know which is my network and my password.,They come without a manual or a quick start guide.  Have never used a Mac before.  You have a voice speaking to you but I couldn't understand what it was saying.  Doesn't have a touch screen.,I'll be looking for another laptop PC.

I'm very happy with this laptop.  It's fast, battery life is great, screen is bright, and it's super light weight.  The only thing that sucked about my experience was the Amazon One Time Password.  I had to plan my day around trying to be home to receive my laptop or have my delivery delayed.  I totally recommend that people who are looking for a great laptop buy this one, but I recommend not buying it from Amazon if you can avoid it.

You can read about the new features of the 2020 MacBook Pro with Apple's new M1 chip online. It is living-up to my high expectations. Out of the box, the initial start-up was flawless, downloading all my Contacts and documents from the Cloud, linking to Internet, and upgrading to MacOS 11.1.
One day I spent over 6 hrs. on the phone with Apple. The next day I spent 5 Hrs on the phone with Apple. Don't buy Apple. NOT WORTH THE HI price!!!!!!!!!

I made the switch from HP to Mac and I’m not impressed. I’ve never had a computer freeze on me so often, it lags and locks up. It’s not even good for watching a show, constantly kinda freezing , the words play but the video doesn’t move ... I had to buy an external USB hub to plug in as it only has 2 C type ports. I would return it if I could , but instead I will have to pretend to love it.

Coming from one of the worst MacBook Pro generations (2017) this was a breath of fresh air. Very snappy, quiet, cool, long battery life, FANTASTIC KEYBOARD (Those butterfly switches were a mess) Oh and the touchbar, I love that thing, didn’t think I’d use it a lot but here I am using it a lot😂 It’s an amazing laptop, the only laptop I’d ever recommend anyone get (besides the MacBook Air)
I disliked the fact that I couldn’t reset and clear all my data! If it’s at all possible please perform a complete reset of the MacBook before reselling it PLEASE

   First, I love the color. I had another brand fitness watch that I really liked but this one is awesome and I love it. It has all the amenities and syncs to my iPhone perfectly. After my wife’s Apple series 3 watch started to show its age (no more updates and occasional crashes) I decided she needed a Hanukkah present before we left for a European vacation.,She was delighted.  The usable screen is bigger than my 44mm Apple Watch,  the display never goes dark, yet the battery life is better.,As we get older the health options of the new watch are a welcome addition.

I love everything about this watch! It charges quickly and the battery life is good. Like other rechargeable devices the more you do with it the faster it goes down. Since it charges so quickly that’s no big deal. I didn’t like the band because it’s too sweaty in in the summer. I think I should have gotten the one with cellular because this one has to be near my phone to do some things. Another piece of advice I have for others is to get an adapter when you get your watch so you can charge it. I couldn’t set mine up until the adapter came.

I had an SE which was just fine, didn’t need  the extra sensors. But, and here’s the big but as in bigger and brighter display. I use my watch often during exercise and its nice to take a quick look at my metrics without effort not to mention just regular use. Four stars because even though it was at a sale price, it’s still in my opinion over priced by $50-$75.

Rápido, intuitivo, tecnológico, ligero y a la vez robusto en su construcción aportando sensación de durabilidad. La integración con el iPhone 13 Pro Max y los Air Pods Pro es increíble, es como tener un solo dispositivo multifuncional. Es primera vez que tengo un AW y la verdad me encanta su funcionalidad, apps como las de monitoreo de salud en tiempo real son realmente increíbles como el hecho de tomarte en escasos 30 segundos un electrocardiograma, medir el nivel de oxigenación en la sangre y en general todo lo relacionado al tema de salud esta genial. Podes contestar llamadas con buena comunicación en doble vía y además te permite usar muchos shorcuts que te hacen tu día a día mas amigable.

First time Apple Watch user and still learning the ropes and abilities of the watch. I don’t know why it would take some people forever to set their watch up as it personally took me less than 30 minutes. As long as you have ios15, it shouldn’t take you that long. So just make sure your phone is running the latest software version before doing watch set up.,Keep in mind, you MUST order a separate charging block as they do not include one for you but this should not prevent you from setting up the watch. My watch came 70% charged so I was able to do everything I needed to set up.,I got the Starlight 41mm delivered yesterday and it is beautiful. I’m still playing around with the watch but it’s fun. I’ve used the ECG and Blood Oxygen apps and those were neat. I’ve never had an AW before so I can’t compre the battery life to previous modes but it’s definitely holding it’s charge very well.

I’ve purchased a number of iPhones and iPads and have always found a charging cable included. The packaging looked like it was directly from the factory and had not been tampered with. So why no charging cable?

Christmas present made wifes day, uses it constantly. Who knew ? I'm just getting around to relying on my cell for time instead of wristwatch and now I find out everyone is back to their wrist and talking into it. Next will be molar speaker implants and direct to retinal nerve video. Gotta love it.

The watch arrived with a. dead battery. After a three hour charge using a USB-C charger which I had also purchased, the watch remained charged for less than 15 minutes. It is charging now overnight but surely a brand new watch battery is supposed to be a little charged then recharge easily. After 4 days, It now recharges fine. The ECG app is extremely poor and Blood Oxgen is very slow compared to pulse oximeter. I bought for these features. Apple does say not for “medical “ purposes. I am not a fitness freak. I am learning to use features that require purchase of additional software that helps me. Pay attention to your purposes for buying this watch. I hated it but have learned to use certain additional software to my benefit and am having no more battery problems so I am now pleased.
For the magnet charger their was no plug into the ac outlet included so another day delay while having to order one.  Stupidly at its best

This is my very 1st apple watch and so I got the GPS version because I did not know if I would like it or not or really use it and now, I'm happy I ordered This!,I find myself using this for everything now and almost never take my phone out of my pocket when I am out on the go I can read all my Facebook messages and my text messages form the watch! although one thing I don't like is that when I get the message it pops up the message on the watch as soon as I get it so others can read it if you don't look right away and read or clear it from notifications think it may be a setting or something that could be fixed with an update but have not really looked at all the settings on the watch yet just used it as is after setting up.

After spending $800 for this thing, I had to spend another $20 to get a USB-C charger cube. I must have 20 USB-A cubes, but this is not compatible. Of all the zillion devices I have, none need a USB-C female charging outlet. I understand why USB-C is needed, but not to include a charger cube?,With the battery arriving DOA, I had to charge it from my laptop which was not very convenient since my laptop USB-C port is used for several other purposes.,They must have saved $2. Oh ... add it right to the bottom line.,There are also no instructions included whatsoever.,What a bad first impression.,Setup took over two hours with required updates, downloads, authorizations, pairings, log-ins, etc. I suppose a lengthy setup is understandable ... but did I mention no charger and no instructions? I'm not likely to get over that. Really ... how cheap can you get Apple?,It is interesting to note that I got a 31 page printed manual along with my Apple branded USB-C charger cube I had to order, but absolutely nothing along with my watch!!,How cheap can you get Apple? How cheap can you get?,It's an amazing device, but products that don't present themselves well when opening the box are doomed to failure in the market. I am both upset with and shocked at Apple for this.,3 stars is all you get. All the incredible engineering that went into this was lost on me immediately by the decisions made by some idiot product/marketing manager.,I am soooo done with Apple products.
Love it!

Upgraded to the Series 7 after my son, broke my series 5 and MAN! this is thing is a beauty, this is my first time buying a Stainless Steel one and the GOLD really pops!! it really does look like a dime piece..more elegant

I have had the other generation of apple watches, I only got this one because my gen 5 screen cracked all the heck now.,I do not feel much difference in the 7 from my 5 beyond the larger screen.,The 7 feels about the same weight isn't much different.

I love love love my apple iwatch ❤️ This is my first iwatch. You gotta have it. I love how big it is and the battery life to charge your iwatch is a bit faster.  I love how this iwatch has everything I like. Message, phone calling, GPS, bank, heart rate, and everything else. Although it doesn’t include the USB C  wall charger, you only get the usb c cable charger. But the iwatch is brand new new! And it was worth it ❤️😊
Quick delivery,Good product,Quiet Handy!
I like Apple products as they are easy to set up and use.

The screen was not at the required level, the quality of the screen is very weak,And the programs are very bad on the device because of the iPad's compatibility with the iPhone,I had heard before buying that there is no comparison between the ios tablet and the rest of the systems, but I discovered that the Android system is much better
I ordered all the way from the Philippines! I'm not sure if there's a jelly scroll or I just couldn't see it. Maybe there is but very minimal up to non existent! I'm very happy :)

Perfect replacement for older ipad
Excelente Producto lo Recomiendo

I love the mini, works great!
Good product. Easy to setup and use

Let me start by saying I'm not an audiophile. I mostly into pop rock and I got a Apple TV 4K this past Christmas for spatial audio enabled movies and shows like Dune, Matrix Resurrections, Foundation, etc.,Spatial audio was the primary reason I upgraded and was skeptical they would be better sounding than the Airpods 2. The first song sold me on the AirPods 3, the audio was just that good compared to AirPods 2 and even rivaled AirPods Max. They are well worth the money. The one down side is the fit. The AirPods 2 fit me perfect, I've had some instances of the AirPods 3 falling out of my ear. The plastic shell feels more slippery and doesn't have as secure fit for me. If I get animated like running or something with action body movement theres a good chance one or both are going to fall out. I'll knock 1 star for that, but it may fit you fine. I kept them as I'm mostly working from home now and their primary use will be watching movies on the Apple TV. When I'm out I use the AirPods 2. Maybe someone will come up with a thin silicone sleeve to increase the grip.

My second gen Airpods were giving me issues so I figured I’d get these while they were on sale. Yes they fit a little less secure than my old ones but they still stay in place. They only *feel* like they will come out. It’s the first thing you’ll have to adjust to. The sound is noticeably better with substantial bass and midrange. No question the drivers have been updated and they just sound richer than before. But you can take that better sound to the next level by turning on spatial audio. Best way to describe it is when you’re connected and listening from your macbook, it will seem like the sound is coming FROM the macbook but in full high fidelity. Turn your head and you’ll hear *where* your macbook is from the sound. When I first turned spatial audio on I thought the airpods weren’t working. You can also have spatial audio just locked in without the location effect.,With the additional battery life, and wireless Magsafe charging, this is a great upgrade from the last one. Really happy with these.

I've been putting off the AirPods because I have had plenty of classic Bluetooth headsets around the house (Plantronics, Jabra, BlueAnt, etc).  They've all worked pretty well, and they all lasted numerous years, and they've all been pretty inexpensive.,After more Zoom meetings and aging batteries, I finally went to the AirPods, and I sure am glad I did.,First, set up is stupidly easy.  I mean it is ridiculous.  The Bluetooth consortium can definitely learn from Apple.,Second, the charging case is fantastic.  None of my other headsets have had a charging case, and I'll let you that I had no idea what I was missing in terms.  Related, and third, the FindMy capability. My classic headsets were always somewhere dumb, but with FindMy I am 1000x more likely to find them and use them.,Finally, the sound quality is infinitely better than all the rest combined. I've had at least 6 bluetooth headsets over the past few years, and they are lousy garbage compared to the AirPods.

The first AirPods I’m keeping. The previous version is not that impressive and the Pros I don’t like. I have used Bose ear buds for many years and find them unmatched in sound quality, however, they are big, stick out (try wearing a headband or hat with that) and have connectivity and volume control issues. For earbuds that expensive, it’s not acceptable. And why I gave these a try.,Sound quality wise, I like these ones best of all the AirPods. Spatial audio is absolutely amazing. Their stem is smaller than the first gen, which is nice, and they have no noise cancelling. I consider that an advantage, but it really depends on individual use. I run and need to hear my surroundings. Turning off noise cancelling on the Pros turns on their mics and every sound gets amplified, including hair swishing back and forth or a hat covering them and moving ever so slightly, it drives me nuts. For people who do not need noise cancelling, this is much better. And cheaper too.,I also like the fit better, I’ve never liked and used ear buds with tips that need to be inserted in the ear canal. However, they don’t stay put and that’s their one major drawback. They need some kind of tips to secure them in the ear and Apple should provide those. But since they don’t, you should consider getting them yourself. The selection is currently not that great and reviews not that many, but I found some that work. I had a great run without losing any and they fit so lightly that I don’t feel them at all. Which is all around amazing and may make the my favorite ear buds yet.

Here are a few points that I think would help potential buyers.,1. The case sits slightly taller and feel a hair bulkier than previous gen,2. Battery is better. The airpods last noticeably longer without needing to go back to case. But I feel the number of charges the case hold also drops by maybe 1 or 2 counts. Combining the 2 factors, I believe the total battery life still lasts longer than last gen. The reason for the case charge count drop could be because the airpods can hold longer charge now.,3. spatial audio does feel great, and it's amazing that it could be implemented into this small device.,4. mic performance still great, it is better than the mic on my sony xm4.,5. This is the most important bullet point I want to mention. This generation has qc issue for sure, my first order went back due to connectivity issue on the left airpod. My second order was returned due to static noise on the right airpod. The third order is great so far. So if you're looking to buy this gen. I highly suggest buying from vendor like Amazon who has great return/exchange policy. By comparison, my 2nd gen airpods didn't have any of issues mentioned above. If you search online, it seems the static noise issue is quite common lately.

I’ll start with the pros and cons and then give an overall at the end, this review is just my opinion on these AirPods, if it helps you, great!,Pros:,- I did in fact receive legitimate AirPods, I confirmed it through the warranty under the settings, I know this was a concern for some people,- They sound a lot better than gen 2 with more bass and more clarity and they get just as loud if not louder, the spatial audio is cool but not life changing IMO,-The battery life gets me through a day at work where as my gen 2 did not, they also charge very fast,-These actually fit me a little bit better than gen 2, I guess I got lucky with my ear size, I know this is an issue for some people,- They stayed in my ear during my work out sessions,-I personally prefer the pinch controls over the tap/touch controls due it being more comfortable for my ears,Cons:,- Overtime as the inside of my hears get moist the left side tends to get loose for me,Overall:,I’d give this product a 4 out of 5 stars, If they used a different material that prevented them from being slippery in my ear during long use i would given these AirPods 5/5 stars

Even though the shape of these is very different, it feels very much like AirPods 2.  This is a good thing.  And Spacial Audio is cool but very few apps support it, and the auto spacial audio is kind of awkward.  The new "pinch" is honestly a downgrade over AirPods 2.  It's much less convenient to pinch than the tap especially if you're out running, wearing gloves, etc.,The "Find My" support is extremely basic.  It sort of finds the charging case using a system similar to AirTags, but not quite as good.  This only works if your AirPods are actually in the case.  If your AirPods are out of the case, you're SOL.  You're better off buying one of those leather cases and supergluing a Tile or AirTag to it.,Basically if you're happy with your AirPods 2, don't buy these.  Unless you subscribe to Apple Music and really love Spacial Audio.  The music quality otherwise is honestly about the same.

Faster connection when you put them on. (Feels more immediate compared to the first gen AirPods) Sound quality is about similar to the first gen. Earfit is also not much different at least for me. Imo, wired EarPods still yield superior sound quality due to, well, the nature of being wired. Regardless, I’d upgrade/buy only because of a better battery life for wireless earpiece experience for Apple devices.

Bought these and was very excited as these would be my first pair of airpods.  The classic earpods (with the wire) always fit great in my ear.  They were comfortable and never fell out, but I wanted a wireless pair.  I bought these, knowing the shape was slightly different, but figured it wouldn't make a huge difference...boy was I wrong.,The new shape is very uncomfortable.  As a result of the discomfort, I adjust them a lot to try to find a more comfortable position.  They fall out too (probably a result of adjusting them and the poor fit) - I haven't worn them for a workout yet, but I am not optimistic they would stay in place during a run or other intense workout.  Very disappointed.  Also slightly disappointed by the battery life.,Edit: 2 stars because the sound quality and battery life has been impressive thus far

These don’t fit as well as the 1st and 2nd gen AirPods. The bud is bigger and doesn’t stay in as well, they’re also slightly heavier feeling. My AirPods 2s disappear when I put them in, forget I’m wearing them. That’s great because I wear them all day at work.,On the positive side, the sound is better, can go much louder and slightly better depth. I’ve never had a problem with volume on previous models, just noticed these go very loud to the point you could hurt your ears maxing out the volume.,Comes down to what is more important to you, comfort and fit or sound quality. For me personally the comfort is most important so I’ll be keeping my 2nd gen AirPods.,PS- I tried my friends 3rd gen AirPods and cancelled my order. Don’t worry, I didn’t wear these and return. Not sharing ear wax :-)
My first computer was a Mac, I had a Newton, still have it. I had the Blue iMac and a eMac, I may not have the latest of everything. But, I do like my Macintosh products.
Nice
Will not charge, tried several different cables. This product should last for more than a week. Have to return it, a major inconvenience at holiday time.

My son had already ordered one. I loved his. He uses his for work so he got the full data and WiFi as well as the apple pen. I don’t use mine for work so was very pleased with mine with no data. Just WiFi and less data storage. Easy to set up. And have used it since opening the package. My old one is 9 years old and still doing great, however, it was not accepting updates on some of the apps I use.
Much faster than the Air 2, with a bigger and better screen. No complaints.

I have had an iPad Air for many years, but it was getting slower due to less storage space.  I ordered this one from Amazon because I could rely on them to ship it quickly.  I am very pleased with the battery life and the touchscreen and the screen quality is great.  Now when I travel I can be better in touch with my rental business.

I have had this iPad 11 inch pro for about a week and works great. Very quick on WiFi . The touch screen is great. Some apps are a little different on a iPad vs iPhone  but works fine. I would recommend this product.

The lack of a home button and Touch ID was unsustainably inconvenient. Face ID didn't work at all. The gesture that replaced the home button was buggy and worked less than half the time. So, for all the beauty of the display and the speed of the processor, if I can't easily navigate and must use my passcode instead of a biometric ID, it just isn't worth it.

Hookup was magic since I still had my old one.  It transferred everything from my old one to this new one.  I thought it was going to be a suicidal mission but I couldn’t believe how easy it was.  But I don’t know how to use the camera and other features and there is just a small sheet of paper with a couple of basic diagrams.

Was great in the beginning!! But after 2nd week the battery life was dying quickly. I am sure its a glitch.  reached out to customer service they wanted me to go through troubleshooting and I did 2 more weeks when by and I still have to jump through hoops to get my return approved when the return deadline is 01/31/2022.  NOW I HAVE TO PAY to SHIP it back.  NOT very good customer service
Nothing to add is an iPad, it is an excellent product.,At least I can say that my package arrived in perfect condition and without problems.
I’m not hard on my electronic gear. In fact, the opposite. So I was profoundly disappointed when this cracked after about six weeks. Otherwise a very good unit but do not buy it.

I really like the new iPad. It's my first one ever so I can't compare it to previous versions, but this one with M1 is so cool, fast with a fabulous display and perfect colors.,And Amazon is probably the best place to buy from. The price is really good and the offer is better than many other resellers and even better than Apple itself.
Early Christmas present. So far the iPad has been very user friendly and a great addition to our apple collection.
This has everything and meets all my expectations. I am so enjoying it. It is so capable for what I wanted and needed.
This overpriced tablet works very well & my guess is that it does more than most people need.
Love my new iPad Pro.  Very fast, long lasting battery, quick response...everything I wanted when I moved up from my old iPad.  A lot to learn to fully take advantage of it!
YES  this is ipad pro.,way faster then regular ipad.,screen 12inch, i can play game better picture, better view. i love it.  Thanks Apple.

The seller had nothing to do with this issue, but FedEx did a poor job with the shipping. They left the IPad unattended, out on the communal blacktop parking lot. The battery life seems to be on the short side.,Other than that, we love the iPad.
I would not recommend this. Battery drains very quickly and camera quality is poor. My 3 years old iPad works better than this one . My first Apple product which I think is waste of money.

This is beyond what I expected. After never owning an ipad in my life to getting this one as a first, I’m amazed! The reviews for this thing were off the charts. For it only being $329 you really get a powerhouse of a machine for the price tag. It can handle multi-tasking very very easily. The battery seems to never drain as well. The brightness of the screen is perfect for just chilling around the house which is what I’m using it for. Grabbed a nice tempered glass screen protector and a case with a prop-up on the back of it and it does the job. The only thing I wish they did differently was get rid of the notches at the top and bottom of the screen. For $329 I can’t complain too much! You’ll be happy with this device especially if it’s your first ever ipad.

I do agree with most of the reviews about this iPad. I wish the screen was a full screen tho.,Besides that I do see a definite improvement from the older generation iPads.,I purchased a keyboard to add more of a “laptop” feel.,If you  don’t use this iPad for a lot I  think the 64gb  will do just fine.,I do feel the speed is  faster with this 2021. I maybe a  little biased because I  only  purchase Apple products so I really have nothing to compare it to.,Overall if  you purchase you will not be disappointed in this one for the price.

For the price, I finally bought a tablet for drawing. I thought I might also be able to do some handwriting, and while the write-to-text scribble feature is pretty cool, it is not going to work for writing like, an essay or novel. Too much finicky reactiveness, perhaps with my specific handwriting.,I was worried maybe I'd find it too small for drawing, but again for the price and having put off a drawing tablet for some time I really really am enjoying it. Plus it came a whole month earlier than anticipated!,I can't actually speak to the camera quality. But for battery life it did come at 70% and I used it for five hours straight to 20% so not seeing any issue there.

This is certainly an upgrade from my old iPad Air (1st).  It works well. Responds rapidly. Screen sharpness is amazing. The reason I'm giving it only 4 stars is that it frequently hangs up on YouTube...I thought at first it was YouTube but my iPhone 11 works fine on that.  It also is a bit finicky in connecting/staying connected to my Bluetooth hearing aids.

I didn't notice it at first, but when I turned on dark mode, I immediately noticed that my iPad has a dead/stuck red pixel (see pictures). With the brightness turned up, it becomes even more noticeable. I tried the various videos on YouTube, that is supposed to fix the issue, but none of them worked. So make sure to check your iPad, to ensure that you don't have the same issue. I'm going to return this, because I don't want to do a warranty claim and get a refurbished iPad, when I just paid full retail for a new one!

When trying to set up the iPad we were unable to. We got in contact with Apple and was informed the product was actually refurbished and locked to a corporate company. Due to this the iPad could not be used at all. 10 out of 10 do NOT recommend…

I’m a bit disappointed because I couldn’t Bluetooth all the information from the old iPad to the new iPad. I would need current software, on the old iPad to make that happen.,Well duh! If my old iPad could update to the current software, then I wouldn’t have replaced it.,I guess I’ll try to use iTunes on my PC, to pull everything off the old iPad, and transfer to the new iPad.

Me ha gustado  mucho hasta ahora. Todo funciona como debe, muy fluida y bastante util practicamente para todo lo que necesito. Lo complemente con un teclado inalambrico Bluetooth y sin querer me doy cuenta que acabo de sustituir mu laptop que uso desde 2016.,Unico pequeño detalle es que aun no hay app de whatsapp (aunque uso la version web, pero no se puede apreciar la camara en videollamadas ni otras funciones de la app oficial). Ni app de calculadora oficiales pero...,Overall esta excelente. Ademas de que la adquiri en oferta y me ahorre uf casi un 25% o 30% de lo que costaria adquirirla en mi pais R.D

I have had this iPad for 2 days now. At first glance of the package it was completely full in contact and dno damage delt.,Pros: - extremely smooth for games,-great value and excellent video quality,-amazing battery life (up to 10 hours),-compatible with controller and keyboard,Cons: -Sometimes, the screen will freeze for about 1-2 seconds,-audio is not really good,-if you turn it to high brightness, it will drain batter 1.8x faster,In Conclusion, this is amazing for about anything you want to do such as Ebooks, Google search, games, or anything else. I am happy with my purchase.

I didn't want to buy an Amazon Fire tablet so the next cheapest thing was an Apple Ipad.  Several things I don't like about the Ipad.  It constantly askes for your fingerprint or passcode every time you attempt to download an app.  If you don't have other Apple products, you have to set up your Apple account, two more passwords, one for your tablet, one for your Apple account and since it's not powered by Android which uses Google to store passwords, you need to locate your saved passwords from Google and retype them.  I also don't like the interface.  I have to learn everything all over again.  It's a hassle.  I'll stick with Android next time.  Also I had to buy a separate charger that had a USB connection because I needed to reset the Ipad to factory settings when I forgot what my passcode was after not using the Ipad for a month.

I finally gave up my 10 yr old MacBook and bought this 2020 Mac Book. Sooooo much easier to carry- light, easy keyboard, EXCELLENT speaker, and fast as lightening for steaming, multiple windows open, attachments to emails, and storage for music and photos. LOVE IT! I do miss a USB port larger than the lightening port, but I’ll get over it.

I actually loved this except for the lack of a touch screen.  I ended up returning because of it.  The touch bar was ok but when it came to copy and pasting I had a very hard time with the mouse and there was no option to touch it.  Everything else was top of the line especially the battery life.  If they have a touch screen version I would buy it for sure.

The Macbook was defective since the day it arrived. Apple refused to give me a new laptop because it was bought on Amazon and Amazon charged us a 20% restocking fee????? for returning a product that never worked as expected!

So this review isn’t about the project. It’s about the sale whether intentional or unintentional of horrendously used MacBooks. Amazon shipped a cosmetic damaged, unwiped,  not sealed properly MacBook. I did a return/replace and the second MacBook was not as bad cosmetically but had programs installed in the file system that aren’t native. Also although cosmetic damage was minor compared to the first one it was still a used MacBook at a new MacBook price. I had zero interest in writing a review but I was prompted so I did.

The performance of this machine (CPU, memory, SSD, and GPU speed) is outstanding. The battery lasts over 10x longer than my previous laptop, a Lenovo Thinkpad T490. The display is bright (500 nits) and beautiful. The laptop is ultra-portable, weighing less than 3 lbs. Either the cooling fans on this laptop are so quiet that they're inaudible, or else they've never come on! macOS Big Sur is intuitive and feature-rich, and the fact that the OS is based on Unix makes software development a delight. The only criticism that I have with this machine is that it only has 2 Thunderbolt 3 USB-C ports; an external USB-C hub/adapter/dongle is required if one needs HDMI, USB-A, Ethernet, SDHC, DisplayPort, or VGA connectivity. The price / performance of the M1 MacBook Pro is hard to beat!

I really like my purchase of the MacBook Pro. It is super fast. The colors on the screen are bright & clear. I love the the 13 inch screen. It’s the perfect size for me. Since it didn’t have any usb plug ins I bought me a hub for it that has usb, hdmi, slot for memory card & it has 3.0. Love this Mac. Would recommend it.
Used to be a windows guy, now I know what the hoopla is with a MAC.. I also love my IPAD Pro 11… They are truly productivity tools
Slick, Touch Bar is very handy the screen is not touch screen btw, 4 hours of active use and it had been on for 5 days. No charge needed.

I love Apple when it comes to computing. Their software is efficient, error free and easy to use. Their computers perform efficiently and they virtually never freeze up. The only issue with my last Mac was that the mag safe power cord would consistently fray and the hard drive cable had to be replaced 3x over 8 years (should change every 2-3 yrs). This mac hasnt given me any problems in the first couple days. I did notice a lot of software and drivers dont seem to support the new Apple chips yet, but I have no doubt it will eventually happen.

I never make reviews but I have to make one for this. I’ve had this computer since March and it’s June now, and I have to say, I really, really, really love my computer. It’s super fast and the speakers are loud and it’s everything you could want. My only issue is that there is no USB port. When I’m editing I find it very difficult to use the mousepad because I can’t be precise with my work the way I do with a mouse. I just bought an adapter today, and I hope it makes my editing much more easier. But all I can say is that I spent a lot of money upgrading my 2011 MacBook Pro and I decided to just buy this computer with my stimulus check and it was the best decision I’ve ever made.

I really only used my Apple Watch for tracking activity and reading texts. I could never really respond to texts unless I wanted to use the canned responses. This one actually lets you type a response. Mind you the keyboard is SMALL but it's perfectly useable. I also love that the battery life is such that you can use it to track sleep and it charges really fast. I thought the 41mm would be so much bigger than my Series 1 but it's not and the new design allows the face to be used more efficiently. Glad I upgraded.

This is the first Apple Watch I’ve ever had and I absolutely love it. Sure it doesn’t come with a charging block like a lot of the one star reviews point out BUT they are sold literally everywhere and you can upgrade your charging game and get a fancy affordable charging doc for all your stuff anyways 🤌🏻,The app for the watch is super smooth and easy. Set up only took 15 min max. Comfortable to wear and fun to personalize. Messaging and phone calls work no problem. All of the apps are easy to use.

When I bought this, Apple Watch series 7 was out of stock almost everywhere. But Amazon had it in stock with free overnight delivery. And it was $30 off retail price.,It arrived well packed in its original unopened box and in perfect condition. I’ve been very happy with the watch and the graphite Milanese loop band.

I really like the series 7 apple watch. Many improvements over the series 3. That was a good watch too.,The watch face choices seem to go on and on!  The 41mm size seems to fit me better than the 38mm.,The extra features are really nice. You can read all about them when you go to Apple website. I got the blue watch, matches my new blue iphone12. Took 4 days to receive it.  Guess this is a very busy time of year.,If you are a fan of apple watches, then you will love the series 7.

I bought this watch for my husband for Christmas. He can’t carry his cell phone at work, so it allows him to get his messages as well as keep track of his physical activities, heart rate, pulse and blood pressure.,He has told me several times how glad he is that I purchased it for him.

I considered buying a used apple watch a couple years ago, because the current watch at the time didn't seem to do much more than the older watches. Then the 7 was going to come out with always on feature, and larger screen, which for me was the thing I wanted. I'm so far loving it. The ability to switch between always on faces means it can go from looking like an elegent watch (plain, artistic face) to utilitarian with a swipe. The added health features are a bonus. Although I don't really need them, I could see those features being very handy for an older user that's trying to monitor changes to heart rate, O2 saturation, etc.
I loved my series 3 Apple Watch and the upgrade to the 7 series is great. Same quality with extra features and I love the larger face. It’s easier to read with older eyes.

Another home run for Apple. Live getting phone calls on my wrist snd responding to texts quickly. The face is nice snd clear… great color too!  But really, they couldn’t throw in the wall plug for the charger ? Remember to get an extra one so you can charge from a wall plug .  But I do love my watch!

I love the watch. It’s so cool that the you can use your own photos as the face of it.,4 stars because apple doesn’t provide the USB-C adapter in order to plug in to charge.  I would’ve been fine if it was a regular usb but it requires a usb-c.  I ordered one for $10.

Charges easy, took ten seconds to sync it to my iPhone and like five minutes max to set up and pick a watch face, overall really convienient and helpful, my first Apple Watch and iPhone and I’m definitely an Apple customer for life now android sucks

Alright, I won’t say the Apple Watch is the best watch in the world because I know not everyone will agree with me but gosh is it really useful. Although this stainless steel version is on the pricier side, it sure is durable with the sapphire glass that’s resistant to scratches and the stainless steel chassis case, more durable than the aluminum version at least. If you’re like me and try to take advantage of all the Apple Watch features, it’s a great buy. If you’re someone who uses smart watches more casually such as for time, messages, notifications, etc. then I would reconsider and maybe think about getting a different smart watch unless you’re willing to learn all the features that are available on it.

Charger didn’t work. Apple needed to back erase the contents from the watch to be able to send me a new charger and it took several conversations with Amazon to get it resolved. Each time was a different answer. One told me they could do nothing unless I wanted to return the entire purchase for a replacement. I was finally offered a credit to be able to purchase a new charger. I would have been better of going to my mobile provider to get the watch and the support that took a week to resolve here.

The Apple Watch itself is great and as advertised. But I would order from another site. I tried using Amazon's 12 month equal pay option, but they ended up still charging the full amount without notifying me of any changes. Despite using an Amazon card, it took 2 emails, 10 minutes of online chat, and then 20 minutes on the phone to get the billing rectified. Customers shouldn't have to spend an hour of their time to resolve a billing issue on the seller's side, much less when it's the seller's credit card being used. Not the best look for such an established company. The month delay in shipping due to the supply chain issues is understandable, the effort on resolving issues that are in Amazon's control, is not.

I absolutely hated that this did not come with a charger. Now I am stuck home with Covid for Christmas and I have a useless Apple Watch that I cannot charge. To add insult to injury the correctApple chargers Cost a minimum of $30 and are not available on Amazon for over two weeks. So now I have a Watch that I cannot use and I cannot go out and get a charger. Apple sucks to package their watch in an unusable state. At the very least a small adapter should come in the original package. Gave battery life accuracy and mobile app all bad reviews because they cannot be used without a charge.

I upgraded from a Series 4 Apple Watch. I like the "always on" display and the added blood oxygen measurement. Other than that it doesn't do much of anything that the older watch doesn't do. But IMO it's enough to justify the upgrade.,FWIW, the slightly larger display isn't at all obvious. Is it a little bigger? Yes. But if I wasn't told beforehand I'd never have noticed!

So, the battery lasts about a day, but I take mine off at night and charge it. It definitely lasts a full day though. I really enjoy being able to see my updates and texts without having to take my phone out of my pocket, which is very helpful with the group family texts :) It also helps save time when the phone rings as you can see who is calling, again without taking the phone out of the pocket.  I'm still learning how to utilize it to its fullest extent, but I do really like it and I'm so very happy that I splurged for it for myself.

The watch is almost what I expected.  However, for the money, I expected to receive the ability to charge it.  Shame on Apple for their greed and lack of customer service.  I received this for Christmas and couldn’t use it until the stores were open and I could buy a charger.

Going from Android to iOS was a little strange, at first, but I’m so glad I did. This watch has been wonderful to wear. It’s stylish look and the health apps has been the most important reason for the switch. I hope to keep this for at least a couple years. That is until they release the much rumored blood glucose monitor in the near future

Received a defective Watch whose display won’t turn on even after 2hrs of charging it! First Amazon delivers it late. Second it doesn’t turn on. Third the Amazon app does not have a “replacement” option. Only return. How will I get this Watch back on thanksgiving deal that I purchased it on?! Very bad experience with Amazon!

I upgraded from a second-generation model to this one. I dislike that you have to pay so much more to get one with the Milanese loop band and have to get a cellular model to get the dark color. This basically does nothing more than the ones that are several hundred dollars but are about twice the price. That is the negative. On the positive side, I like the always-on display, the EKG function, and the larger display. I look forward to a time when these become thinner and have longer battery life. I would buy it again.
Quick delivery. Checked local Apple stores and nobody had purple. Apple had a month wait on this. The price is the same everywhere. They had mine in stock. Very happy.
Love my new mini!
Christmas present
Great product.
I got exactly what I ordered, packed well and it came one day early.
Great for travel and works perfectly. Functionally and cosmetically perfect
Best gift.
Using the Apple Migration Assistant, the transfer of data and applications from a previous iPad. to the new one was seamless.
Nice up grade. Really enjoying it.

If you need complete silence to concentrate on tasks for your job or school assignments, and you want earbuds that will cancel out unwanted noise, these are awful. You can literally hear everything else going on in the world alongside your music playlist, favorite podcast, or calming white noise.,But if you think you can just raise the volume higher on these AirPods to try and combat the unwanted noise, then you end up with a lot of sound bleed. This results in everyone being able to hear what YOU are listening to. It's like having mini speakers on the side of your head.,This is bad because I have some songs that I personally like, but my friends tease me for liking them. Why would I want others to hear what I'm listening to? It's for just me to enjoy. If I wanted a speaker, I'd buy a speaker.,I will say that the head track feature is kinda cool, but the other con vastly outweighs this pro.

Insert (properly) in ear - bad fit, crown is too bulbous / bulky to fit - uh oh ...,Search for directions / help forums - THIS IS A WELL KNOWN ISSUE!!!,Wear 1-2 minutes, it's in my lap while sitting still not talking not chewing.,Use (for intenede purpose) to make call - within 30 seconds, it's in my lap or on the floor.,Every attempt to manuver to catch or re-insert a falling pod while on a call results in an accidental press of poorly placed terminate call button - UNDESIRED CALL TERMINATION.,I'm sure they can do much better for those with incompatibly shaped ears (didn't they test before RTM?),Sound quality was quite good.,Bulky charging case was rediculous should be able to just drop onto mag charger,never challanged battery life because they would not stay in my ears - boing!!! under chair!!!,sheesh!,Final Rating: negative 2billion out of 10,Returned with predjudice and for cause.

Full disclosure, I used to have the airpod 1st gen but I ditched it due to minor inconveniences , and went back to wired headphone till the 3rd gen came out, here’s are my problem with the 1st: long stamps sticking out my ears, no button, wire charging and I always forget to charge.,The 3rd nearly fixed all the problem I faced, shorter in length, added button, wireless charging and longer battery life, however the bud itself are bigger in size (as shown on picture), so it did take me some time getting used to, once you adjusted to it you should be fine.,The surrounded sound is pretty cool that’s not on any other models.,No sound cancellation at all just to keep in mind, if that was what you are looking for then you should skip this model.

So I have the original, first generation, AirPods. Love them, worked great. Decided to upgrade with the Black Friday deal, mostly because the mic had stopped working in my original pair. First off taking them out of the case. What genius designed this? You literally have to rotate them 180 degrees in order to put them in your ears with the way they lay in the case. The fit for me ears wasn't great, they went it but not very well, at least not in my ears. Sound quality was great! Wow a big improvement. Then it comes to the controls. OK the 1st generation really got me hooked on the tap to forward, stop, etc. These you have to physically squeeze the post, which is even shorter than the other generations??? Ah that was a big no for me. Needless to say my sister is getting some AirPods for xmas. I immediately order the 2nd generation for myself.

Leí bien antes de comprar, y vi varios videos. Por eso se lo que compre y me gustaron.,Recomiendo lo mismo a muchos, ya que puede que no le sirvan porque son un poco grandes en la oreje comparados con la 2da version. Son muy similares a los Pro a cuando se tiene puesto a simple vista.,El sonido es muy bueno, uso la funcion de Spacial audio al ver videos o pelicular. Siri me escucha desde que la llamo y en breves segundo ejecuta el comando que le doy.,La bateria practicamente nunca se me ha descargado por completo, ya que desde que los dejo de usar lo guardo en su cajita, la cual dicho sea de paso tambien proteje.,Asi rapido no tengo quejas. Solo, reitero, leer bien antes de comprar y seguro gustaran tambien.,Aproveche descuento maximo en BF y una promo de mi Credit Card, Me salio mas de un 50% off de lo que cuesta normalmente.

i’ve had both the airpods gen 1 and 2 and tried the airpod pros for a few days that i borrowed from a friend. i like these the most out of all of them. they don’t fall out that easily, only if you shake your head a lot or fall asleep on your side (like the 1st and 2nd gen).,i like these a lot more compared to the pros. the rubber was uncomfortable and transparency mode amplified the outside noise but the only other option (to my knowledge) was noise cancelling. i wear only one airpod most of the day because i’m in class and the pros were awkward with only using one.,the sensor buttons on the stem are a lot more convenient than the gen 1 and 2 and since it supports spatial music, i’d recommend this over those.

Good for big ears, bad for small ears.,Unlike the gen 1, this doesn’t fit well into the ear. I cannot use the AirPods Pro because of the “suction cup” like ear pieces on it so the gen 1 was amazingly perfect for me.,I got really excited to see the gen 3 without the rubber ear pieces and purchased them right away!,BUT OH MY GOSH!! They do not fit well in the ear at all! I get the point is for noise cancellation but I seriously can’t keep them in for the life of me. All I have to do is smile and they fall out of my ear.,But if you have bigger ears, this is good! My boyfriend absolutely loved them. They fit him nice. But me, not so much.,Just a warning for the small eared people out there. Lol

I am quite happy with these. The sound is fantastic (great bass) crisp and clear. I use them for music and my phone. They pair up quickly with no problems.,My only issue is, on my Pro's, when I would open the case, a pop-up on my phone would show me the charge level of both the case and the pods. I haven't seen that with these. Is there something I need to activate or does that function simply not exist for these? Maybe just an included function of the higher prices Pro's?

AirPods 3 sound incredible. Seriously incredible, and a massive upgrade on AirPods 2 if you have a device capable of Apple’s Spatial Audio. Every bit as good as AirPods Pro, and I think they actually sound better then my wife’s Pros. More “full,”’whereas the Pros sound more focused in my ears. The spatial audio really does add immersive audio and battery life is great.,But there are two big downsides:,1. There is ALOT of sound leak.  A massive amount more than AirPods 2. Anyone within 10 feet will hear them, and anyone within five will clearly know exactly what you are listening to.,2. The earpiece is 50% larger than AirPods 2, and it is noticeable.  After 15 minutes, my ears began to ache, and after an hour they hurt. I can wear my AirPods 2 for 5 hours and forget they’re in, but not these.,I’m revising my initial review, as the audio quality surpasses the cons. Over time, my ears adapted to the fit, and it became less of a problem. I would like to see Apple address it and the sound leak, because the sound quality is equal or better than the Pros at less money.

These are very difficult to secure in the ears. It’s true what a ton of reviews say, that they fall out randomly, often. Can’t be talking or eating as the motion of the jaw will knock them loose. Another thing, the ‘clicking’ of the button on the stem, eehhhhh it’ll take some getting used to.

Spent a lot of time trying to decide if I should get an iPad Pro, and i made the right decision. There are no apps that take advantage of the M1 chips, and even if there was, the OS on the iPad is just not up to par for that power. The touch recognition works much better than the old style with the home button. And, the removal of the home 🏡 button really works. I was worried at first, but once you start using the top button, it works great. If you need a laptop, then get one. If Apple 🍏 ever unleashes the OS on the iPad I would definitely upgrade, but it’s just not there now. I’ll use my MacBook Pro when I need to get more done, and use my new iPad Air for relaxing 😎

I needed an iPad for note-taking and writing on PDF’s. Since classes are online now, it was so annoying to write down notes or do homework and have to take pictures of it and upload to my MacBook. This works GREAT for college students. I downloaded Notability immediately and it’s been working great so far. I bought the Apple Pencil and the case from amazon as well. You get it for $50 off here on Amazon from the original price so I think it’s a great price point. I just wouldn’t replace my MacBook with my iPad. Its very useful to have both. ONLY THING IS, make sure you’re home around the delivery time! You don’t want anyone stealing your package with $800+ worth of products in.

Bought this to replace my 7 yr old iPad Air 2, couldn’t be happier with the result. Never been one to need the newest, nicest Apple product but decided to get something I knew would last as long as my last one. Very fast processor. Able to handle all of my apps for work and leisure with ease. Highly recommend this iPad.

Pleasantly surprised with the condition! I purchased a green iPad Air in “good condition” and according to the description I was expecting some scratches and missing apple stickers. As far as I can tell there’s not a scratch on it, and both apple stickers were in the box.,I’ve been using it daily since it arrived for long drawing sessions (8-10 hours in procreate) and it’s run perfectly. On a full charge the battery is lasting about 9ish hours.,The screen size is more than enough to work on and the response with the apple pen (2nd gen) is smooth and flawless.,Very happy with my purchase!

I’ve been using an old IPad for years.  When I say old, I’m talking Generation 3, well before the IPad Air, Mini or Pro.  It was starting to run really slow and I thought it was time to upgrade.  I’m very pleased that I did.  This IPad is improved in so many ways.  It is lighter with a bigger screen (more actual screen and less “border”), much better camera, much fast processor and I was shocked to see that it charges via Type C versus the usual Lightning Cable!  This means it charges FAST!  Battery life is not as good as my old one, but it charges so fast I don’t even notice!

This was the first apple device I have owned since my iPod touch in like 2007. I have never really had a need for one and always thought they were unnecessarily expensive. Now I have a little bit of money so it wasn’t as much of an objection to me, plus I wanted to try out iOS and have an opinion of it myself. Instead of sticking with Android without knowing both sides.,I have to say, this was one of my best purchases recently. This is exactly what you would want in an tablet. I can’t compare it to other tablets or tell you if it’s an improvement from the previous generations. All I know is that I’m so very happy with this device.,Just before this I bought a surface so that I can increase my productivity. While I enjoyed it and it’s practical uses, I had to return it after using this iPad because it does everything I need it to, honestly, and the battery last much longer. There are a lot of things I can say but there’s not much I can go over that you can’t find on YouTube or other reviews.,I’m just another happy customer.

This review is for the digital artist experienced and non experienced, die hard WACOM users and other tablet brand users with varying user experiences and preferences.,My beloved mobile studio Pro 16 battery swole and died, so this iPad is a temporary substitute.,If you have never drawn on an iPad, but you've seen all the Procreate jazz on social media and wondering if it's just being hyped up, well it's being hyped up, but honestly. It's worth trying. And I will detail the pros and the cons to help you off standing on the fence of buying or not buying.,Pros- 1. Very Sharp Screen (no pixelated 1080 HD), 2. Light to carry and easy to hold in one hand than the bigger 12.9,3. Has finger print reader on power button (it works flawlessly, especially if you are in a situation you have to keep on your masks, it's great),4. Apple pen is new to me but surprisingly comfortable to use. I'm accustomed to the WACOM stylus, however don't let that deter you. The pen pressure is up there with sensitivity, tilt and smooth lines (no shaky lines or parallax) very accurate. You will get used to it. Currently using Clip Studio Paint on the iPad and I like how it feels over Procreate. Both good apps.,5. Speaker quality is nice and crisp, some likeable bass.,6. Battery life is decent when running everything.,7. The device is fast, you can tweak some settings to make it run more snappy.,8. 60htz refresh rate helps you save power, and you won't notice it unless it's next to the iPad with 120htz proMotion. You don't need proMotion to enjoy drawing and using the iPad air 4.,9. Apple pen charges fast in minutes.,10. iPad air 4 CHARGES FAST. Uses USB C.,Cons-,1. Pen loses charge quickly when left alone and I believe if you keep it docked to the device it runs the battery of the iPad down quicker to keep the pen juiced. So what I do is, if I'm not drawing I don't charge the pen on the iPad until I'm ready to draw. But it lasts a good while, nothing to worry about on a full charge.,2. Screensize can seem smaller when using the drawing apps especially if you are used to a larger screen. Therefore, icons are tiny, but not impossible to use tiny.,3. It's expensive.,4. Uses apps which you might have to pay subscription fees for certain features and may not have all the features like on your computer.,Overall, I don't think it's meant to be replacement for power user digital artists tools but it will definitely supplement your life as an artist on the go or home. It is a very capable device in my opinion. I am getting used to it positively.,If this is only for drawing, go for it! It can handle it very well!,If it's drawing, video editing, image editing, heavy graphic design, I'm not so sure because of app limitations Vs software.,@kingsonalli on IG. Hope I helped you!

I’ve had the very first iPad Air and while the 4th gen is much faster and smoother, the TouchID button is very fragile! Accidentally dropped my iPad with a case on it, everything was okay except the TouchID button. It look scratched, but I guess the scratch messes up the TouchID technology so it no longer works. It’s not something Apple can fix too. They charge you $410 to get it replace. Would not recommend such an expensive fragile tablet. Also read online that this is a common issue with iPad Air..

The iPad Air 4 is an amazing tablet! It's responsive and comparable to it's 2020 iPad Pro cousin in many ways except for storage; 64 gigs of storage is simply not enough.,After having the device for a little better than two weeks, I found myself deleting apps to conserve storage. Keep in mind that iOS will automatically use 10 gb of storage. If you're an EXTREMELY light user, who mainly use this device to browse the web, social media or stream, you'll probably fair well with the smaller storage. However, if you plan to use the device for any type of productivity (leave alone creativity), it's best to opt for the higher storage.,I returned my 64 gb device in exchange for the 128 gb iPad Pro, which would better serve my needs.

I bought this ipad as an upgrade to a previous 2018 base model. I wasn't sure about upgrading to the Air, but I'm glad I did. I like the design without the button, like the newer iPhones, and the screen is larger and nicer. It also supports charging the apple pen wirelessly, which is a great feature.,If you are on the fence between models, here are the differences that I think make it worth the extra money:,1) Charge apple pen wirelessly,2) Better (larger) screen,3) USB Type C connector,4) Faster processor,5) Overall nicer design

The 128gb version actually comes only with the 8GB ram. There are no apps which make use of it, and to properly use this item, you need so many additional purchases of warranty and applecare+ and pencil etc. The item gets really overpriced really fast and then is not worth it anymore.

What Can I say?,Everything in this tablet is perfect,Starting with the form factor (ideal size) and ending with performance and battery life.,Even the screen is amazing. Black look really black to me. I would rather save $100 and do not have mini led then pay +100$ for mini led. Brightness is more than enough for me and HDR videos also look amazing.,Just buy it. This tablet will last easily for next 5-6 years if you do not break it. :)

It was time. My wife's ten-year-old iPad was still an OK e-mail reader, but little more.  We got our money's worth out of it, but also had an unnecessary fear of the unknown slowing the upgrading decision...,Seamless transition... obviously faster, sharper graphics, transitional changes all intuitive.,Great price, quick delivery via Apple and Amazon.
It came in on time and it was exactly what it said. It also seemed to be cheaper than what I could find at local stores. It was brand new and in perfect condition.

I had gotten a Mac on the advice of others but found myself using my phone. So I bought the iPad Pro and love it. It integrates well with the Mac- it’s the perfect size for convenience and the picture quality is amazing as are the new integrative and intuitive features.
Let that apple pencil fly

The size is nice. Easy to draw on. Performance is mind blowing good. Nomad sculpt runs so smooth on this tablet. I also like using procreate, because I can make many layers with the extra ram. I wish it was lighter. Because holding it for a long time makes my hand hurt. Also I wish the screen was etched glass. So the pen would have better grip when drawing. But overall I love this tablet.

This iPad replaced a seventh generation iPad.  It was purchased because the wi-fi in the older iPad was not working well.  The iPad Pro Wes purchased because of the face recognition feature.  This feature alone makes the higher cost worth it.  The screen is much clearer and the speed is great.

Loads quick, screen quality is great, It comes with face recognition. It works fine but I tink I liked the finger print better. I generally use the password on this new unit. The speed is most  noticable When doing heavy work load. Thats when it shines. Very happy I upgraded.

I bought this iPad to save me some space for notes and to, virtually, have a mobile, all-knowing notebook. And it did just that. I can do almost anything I want to on it, including writing notes in the way I want to. I don’t need to use it for anything else, so if you’re simply looking for a huge, virtual, mobile notebook, this is definitely for you.
EXCLENTE CALIDAD, BUEN PRODUCTO, CUMPLE CON LA DESCRIPCION Y LA FUNCIONALIDAD

It heats without load, just while watching YouTube video of do some browsing. Battery drains fast. May software update resolve these issues.,Awesome sound, great screen. Overall I felt in love with Apple iPads :)
Just what my wife was after.  Larger screen and all the IPAD trimmings.
It transfers data so quicken it’s gorgeous. It came so fast.  Love everything about it !
Pantalla espectacular, llegó en perfecto estado.
Got this for school, note taking and drawing. Great split between my phone and desktop.

When Apple just announced their first iPad we bought one for my mom and since them I've been in love with all Apple products. This model it's not the exception, very intuitive, easy to use, great display and high quality of colors. Props to the logistic and delivery team I received sooner, thank you thank you thank you.

Depending on what you use your laptop for, this could be a nice replacement, if you pair it with the magic keyboard you’re looking at a more versatile mobile device. Only thing holding it back for now is the software which I think will be updated for the next version
Love everything about it including the speakers/sound. Their best iPad yet!!!
Apple pen is not charging.  Now i don't know if the issue is this the ipad or the pen because i would need another ipad pro or pen to diagnose.

What can I say? It’s exactly the same as the 8th gen but with minor upgrades. But it’s also the same price so no one can REALLY complain. These iPads are not processing powerhouses but they are durable, cheap, and replaceable. I’ve bought a half dozen of them from different suppliers to use as prompters and lyric sheets from my churches worship team.,They have great battery, a clear screen, great build quality, and low cost.,If you wanna edit 4k videos I doubt you want an iPad, if you do, get a Pro, if you don’t, get a 2020 MacBook Pro M1 (it’s flawless), if you are just getting started, test the waters with this before you drop $1000.

This was sold out in any of the chain stores and had an unknown delivery time on the Apple site.  Hard to get a deal on Apple iPads, but if you have AMEX points or gift cards, when applied, the price was the lowest of any other places.

Apple's choice to make an inexpensive iPad like this that doesn't cut corners really makes me happy. It's nice to be able to get something brand new instead of refurbished or second hand.,Great battery life, plenty of storage, excellent screen, and that premium iPad software. I just wish it were slightly smaller like the iPad Air, but that's just a preference rather than a complaint.

So I am comparing these to the standard 2nd gen which I really liked except they tended to fall out of my ears if I tilted my head in any particular direction. The Dolby Atmos and taunts of fitting better than the 2nd gen Airpods and being more similar to the pros prompted me to try these out as soon as they were available. My first impressions were that they are extremely slippery almost designed to be so that I bobbled them more often than not and the fit in the case was much much more awkward than the 2nd gen ones. All that aside I hoped that the sound quality would make up for any other qualms I had. I immediately subscribed to a free trial of Apple music as that seemed to be the best music test by all accords. With all the quality settings turned up I don't really notice a huge difference between 2nd gen and 3rd gen Airpods. Swapping the  two back and forth between songs what I concluded is the 3rd gen had a better dynamic range but not so much that it made the 2nd gen sound awful as far as ear pods go.

What a solid upgrade from 2nd Gen! I owned the 1st gen, 2nd gen, and the airpods pro, and I think this one (3rd gen) is the most balanced in terms of sound quality, comfort, and convenience. Comparing to 2nd gen, there is a noticeable upgrade in sound, especially in bass. The spatial audio and pinch control is also a big plus. Comparing to the pros, I think the sound quality is on par, but the wear comfort level is much much better than the all-sealed pros. If you are comfortable with 1st and 2nd gen, the 3rd gen will be a pleasure to use and wear (for hours!). But if you already have a pair of Pros and feel comfortable wearing them, then there is no need for moving to the 3rd gen. Also since they are not sealed over your ears, noise canceling is pretty much non-existent, so that is a big red flag if you care about noise canceling. For my use case, 3rd gen is awesome!

These were so disappointing! After borrowing my moms 2nd gen AirPods for a week I decided I liked them enough to get my own. I figured it made more sense to get the newest model but unfortunately that was a mistake. The 3rd gen are so much bigger, the part that goes in your ear anyways, and are unbearably painful. I do have small ears, but never have I had earbuds break the skin in my ear causing scabs, and bruising from trying to get them to stay in. They also shorted the stem on the 3’s which could have been fine had they not added the force touch controls. There’s just no way for me to grip the stem in the right place without accidentally pulling the whole AirPod out. That problem is probably amplified by my nails, which are only 1/4 inch long, but even without nails it still seems like such a bad design. I love Apple products, I wish I could get behind these, they’re just awful overall :(

Hardly fit in my ears, I’m a big guy! 6’2” 280lbs and they barely go in my average size ears! Very large and these do NOT have the interchangeable ear tips! Be ready to return them…….,Sound quality is a little above average but can’t get a proper evaluation because they don’t fit my ears too well, they aren’t noise canceling like their predecessors, I guess overall I’d give them a three, and definitely would NOT recommend them.

In case there’s anyone out there like me with ears that were practically made for the original airpod design, these do not fit the same. They fall out constantly making it a really difficult experience. I’m in meetings all day and need to wear headphones for confidentiality purposes. I had to adjust these constantly which provided feedback to the other people on the calls. The sound quality was good but the only notable difference was the spatial audio. Cool but not a necessary feature for me. For some reason my ears must have a very particular shape because I’ve also tried the AirPods Pro and they don’t work for me either, constantly unsealing and falling out.,If you are like me and struggle with finding earbuds that fit, and the original AirPods fit your ears, I warn you that these might prove to be too large!!

Absolutely hated it. I had the 2nd generation, lost it, and replaced with this one. It was a constant battle to keep them in my ears, a problem I did not have with my 2nd generation. The noice quality was also not too much louder or sound concealing, considering how much more you’re paying. Sent them back and reordered 2nd generation. Still waiting on a refund,Update. It is now officially 3 weeks later and I am STILL waiting on a refund
