I really enjoyed these overall. What really surprised me was the bass. I read it was pretty good but still hearing it surprised me. The bass was much deeper than I thought & it creates a very pleasing listening experience. The sound is clear, crisp and I don’t really have any issues on them on that part. Connection to my iPhone is seamless as expected, battery lasts as long as Apple said 6 hours. Actually it was a good bit longer when I tested it. My only issue is that your gonna have to wait for your ears to get used to them. I wore them & my ears weren’t completely comfortable with them for a time. But after some time I got used to them. So I recommend these overall.

The product itself is of quality. However, I’m not certain as to the reason why the PRICE of this particular item , the Apple iPod gen 3 kept on changing every day from same price as with the Apple stores nationwide to their price at $98 to $118 etc.. then the following day or two it will be higher than that if Apple store. It’s very frustrating!!! This is bit a bidding game. I’m familiar with supply and demand. But you took advantage of this situation because of the holidays. Now the iPod gen 3 is cheaper.

I am plagued with losing or damaging of several Apple pods so I decided tu use "Anti-lost"" straps. With the series 3 pods. I paid for additional warranty which covers at least 1 loss I think.,With Series 3 pods the stem is much shorter than the Series 2 pod so the setting in the ear of the series 3 pod with Anti lost straps is impacted and fall out of the ear more frequently.,So my rating is not based on the quality of the series 3 pods but the problem not being able to use straps.

I didn't care about sound cancellation bc I like to be aware of my surroundings so I found this to be a wonderful upgrade from first gen. Not the same shape, but still takes up as much space. They do hurt my ears after a while but any headphones do. They also do fall out a bit more than I'd like but that's just cause I don't like jamming them in my ears. I got them on sale so money well spent!

I had the 1st gen Airpods and loved them.  Especially for phone conversations.  I was never "wowed" by the music quality but they were "good not great".,These Gen 3 versions are a massive upgrade in sound quality.  Much more bass, full sound.  Actually pretty amazing for in-ear models like this.,I am extremely happy I got these.  If you are upgrading from Gen 1, you are really going to love them.

Case is the charger, so keep it charged and makes it easy.  Case charge lasts about 1.5-2 weeks for me!  I store the pods in the case, so it works well.  Controlled the pods with taps was a little confusing at first.  I do like that you just tap on the pod to answer calls.  I work in dog daycare and dinner feeding can be noisy.  These cancel out all the loud barking and howling that goes on!  Would highly recommend!

After losing my old pair of the 2nd generation Airpods- I thought it was time for an upgrade. The old ones had lasted me 2 1/2 years, and I would mind spending extra money, especially considering how I keep them in my ears 10 out of 24 hours. These are real airpods- not fake.,The sound quality was marginally better than on the 2nd gens, but unless you’re an aspiring audiophile there isn’t mush if a difference. Battery life is the one improvement of note- they do last longer. The only problem is they don’t stay in the ear very well- I found myself constantly having to readjust them. One even fell out of my ear at one point, scaring me to death.,Another difference I didn’t like was instead of tapping to control, you had a tiny button to push on the side. This made for skipping songs much more tedious, and you risk pulling it out all together.,I will be returning these and getting another pair of 2nd gens. I am a young adult female for ear size reference- I’m bot sure how they would fit and adult size. Overall I’m disappointed I couldn’t use the newer model.

So I've had the OG airpods, the airpod pros, and now these... THESE are amazing. Listen, everyone's ears are different, but if these suit your ears, and you want great quality, then these are the ones for you. The airpod pros hurt my ears after long periods of use and the silicon tips tended to fly out of my ears regardless of the size. These third generation airpods fit perfectly, and no, they do not have noise cancellation, so if that is important for you, do NOT go for these. Overall, I'm satisfied as hell. Great design, long lasting battery life, they fit perfectly.

This is a product with no flaws. All the wireless headphones that I had before - JBL and Samsung Buds Live had their own characteristics. We lost the network, stopped working at a certain position of the body (JBL when I leaned forward, and Samsung when I was lying))) it was terribly annoying. In addition, a stupid Samsung sensor that performs various actions when you try to simply correct the earpiece. And now all my problems and headaches for several years have been eliminated by purchasing AirPods (3rd Generation). This thing just works! Always and without any reservations! Everything is convenient here - a small flat case is convenient to carry in a bag and in a pocket, control buttons with a clear response instead of a stupid sensor. They don’t strain at all when wearing, and at the same time they don’t even try to fly out of the ear in any position of the body (this is important for me when working with my reptiles). Of course, there are probably better wireless headphones than these, but my search for headphones for myself is already over)

The new AirPods third generation in my opinion sounds better than the second generation AirPods I had previously and the third generation AirPods fits comfortably in my ear compared to the AirPods Pro's which hurts my ear a lot.

I’m downsizing from a 27in iMac to this 24in and I can hardly tell the difference. Every video I watch on the screen is smooth, vivid, and clear. Due to the new Apple M1 chip, 4K videos play without any lag and no matter how many apps I’m using, this computer doesn’t even stutter. It is amazing how they can fit such a quiet and powerful computer into a body that is as thin as a macbook. Speakers are so small yet they are stronger than previous models. The magic mouse, keyboard, power cable, and included lightning cable are color matched, even the sticker is color matched to your model! I highly recommend getting the 8 core/8 core gpu model as the base model doesn’t come with the touch ID on the keyboard - a very underrated feature. The upgrade from the base model also includes an ethernet jack on the power brick as well as 2 more usb-c jacks in the back. The power button and aux jack are located to the left of the screen on the back and side. This is not just a computer for casual home use, it will function perfectly for the majority of users - person and business. If you are looking for a new Mac, look no further.

Then the computer would not connect with my print which is was working just fine prior to the update, I talked to 2 different AppleTechs ( I bought a service contract) 1 tech conversation was about the download issue  another tech was about the printer issue.They could not fix my problem. Never had an Apple Mac before.  Used pc's for 30 plus years.  Decided to try an iMac and this seemed to be the latest with the M1 chip.  I also purchased the Microsoft for Mac conversion so that I could still use EXCEL, WORD and POWERPOINT.  I also set up the file transfer from my laptop pc to the iMac. While it took about an hour to transfer files, it was successful, although it did NOT transfer pictures nor favorite bookmarks, so I had to go to each web site and save on Safari.  This took a while but Safari is much faster than the other sites I have used in the past. For example, on pc it took 3 minutes to get to my bank's website, on the iMac it takes about 5 seconds. This is an incredible machine. I still have a lot to learn about all it can do.  By the way, I am 78 years old, so don't panic about learning something new if you have never used an Apple product before.  I also recommend that you purchase the extended warranty which allows you to contact Apple support 24/7.  These people are very, very nice and are extremely helpful in solving problems if you should have any. I highly recommend this Apple iMac!!!!!

I have favored using Apple products over the years. My work life has given me the opportunity to use Windows products when it comes to laptops and desktops. I have also owned Windows laptops and desktops for home use in the past and will never go back to them for my personal use.,I currently have a MacBook Air, iPhone, Apple Watch, iPad, Homepods, Apple TV and now this new iMac which has replaced my older iMac. Apple ties everything together using iCloud. When everything works together it just makes life easy. With this iMac I have now stepped up to a SSD and that along with the new M1 Processor it makes this machine fast. Really fast.,The migration assistance software that the iMac comes with allowed me to easily move everything over from my old iMac’s Time Machine backup. In no time at all I was up and running with my old desktop settings and all my Apps from my old iMac on this new machine. Rosetta 2 translates and runs a few Apps that are still Intel CPU coded.,The 24 inch display is another plus for me. Beautiful colors and resolution.,The fingerprint security on the keyboard is nice but my old iMac would unlock via my Apple Watch so it isn’t something that I would had to have.,One negative is the ports. You either buy a USB Hub or like me purchase a few USB-C to USB Adapters to allow older devices to connect to the newer ports.,I am pleased with it.

I ordered the iMac since the spring loaded event and it goes above my expectations. The screen is sharp, the colors are great (I got the blue one!) and the performance is blazing fast for my normal use as a college student. It’s simply that good.

I ordered this because I needed a mac to develop games for IOS (im not docking a star, but it's irritating that I have to click publish from a mac, not PC). I'm not a huge fan of macs, and don't expect to use it for much, so personally I love the minimalist design; however, if I were shopping for a computer to use a lot, I wouldn't be a huge fan. Its not bad on speed and power but the adorable mouse and keyboard are anything but ergonomic. They're both awkwardly sized and shaped.

I have used the iMac for years and enjoy working on them. This one however has quit while turned off twice now and it takes several minutes to mount the mouse after I have restarted it. It doesn't work very well without a mouse.

Let me begin by saying the obvious: There is nothing like the Mac Experience. If you're using a PC, I'm sorry. Perhaps one day you will see the light. The iMac I purchased is beautiful in every way, and I have no complaints at all. However, I do have one tip for new buyers. Once you set up your iMac, the very first thing you need to do is make sure you have the latest OS. To do this, click on System Preferences and then click Software Updates. Most likely you'll need an update, so do that before you do anything else. You'll need to reboot your iMac and that will take a few minutes (it took mine around 15 minutes), but then you'll be able to do everything else you need to do, such as setting up your App Store account. Other than that, the iMac is ready to go out the box, and what a beautiful box it is. Enjoy!
Updated to newest OS - Worked for a couple days then went to power on and nothing. BRICK doing literally nothing...Sending back to amazon

I usually hate writing reviews (doing Amazon's work without getting paid, after all) but it seems like there's a lot of reviews either praising these to the ends of the earth or pitching fits about one or two issues to give them 1 star.,I originally tried Sony's XM4s, since lots of reviews seemed to show they were a similar quality for a big price difference. Mine were plagued with connection issues, either unable to connect most of the time or dropping it constantly on Apple, Android, and Windows devices alike. When I saw these available for a rare discount, it made sense to pull the trigger, with a price point only $100 higher than XM4s for much higher quality. The sound is strikingly crisp for wireless headphones, the build quality is insane, the adjustable band works well on heads of all sizes, and it's so easy to swap devices, change noise cancellation, etc.,Transparency mode is unmatched, makes it mighty easy to hear what's going on around you without it drowning out your music. Noise cancelling is also great, but I'm not a big fan of how any headphones solve that. Battery life doesn't lead competitors at all, but is more than enough to last many days of active use.,Main drawbacks? The price without a discount is really too steep, go for these on sale. The inability to turn them off with a power button instead of the admittedly stupid case is weird, but they barely lose any power on standby mode, so folks are really making a mountain out of a molehill on that point. I haven't experienced condensation issues yet, but will update if that happens. Not including the audio jack at this price point is also absurd, especially when these are being presented as a middle ground between normal headphones and audiophile options.,Again, definitely worth picking up if you can score a discount, but I'm not sure I'd be as enthralled at the standard $550 price point.

Got mine today. I have spent quite some time with them and i will share the pros and cons. I will also compare them to my xm3s.,Pros,Great build quality.,Good sound ( a balanced sound , not bass heavy) , I still think xm3s and xm4s are better,Eco system,Cons,Not worth the price,Heavy,Can easily get scratches on the caps,Strong clamping force which makes them really uncomfortable,Cannot turn off,Cannot fold,Conclusion,For $500, I expected a mind blowing experience but nope. I am an apple fan, but this wasn’t it. I am returning them and will wait for better apple headphones

I have been an Apple customer from back in the mid-80s when I bought a Mac 512e computer. No hard drive...just internal and external floppy drives. Since then I've owned a large number of Mac computers, iPhones, iPads, iPods...you name it. When the headphones came out, I was a little shocked by the price but decided to give them a try anyway. I've been very impressed with them so far. The manufacturing quality is top-notch, as you would expect, and the sound is very, very nice. The noise cancellation is outstanding and I love the Using an oversized wristwatch-type crown to control the volume is genius! Are they heavy? I don't really notice it, but I take a break every couple of hours. Whether or not they're worth the price is subjective. I'm happy with my pair, but there are other headphones made by Sony and other companies that are very good and can be bought for hundreds of dollars less. I'm very satisfied with the AirPods Max, and if you're willing to pay the price, I'm pretty sure you'll be satisfied too.

I was skeptical because of the price tag but working from home my employee gave me a couple dollars to spend on some things that might make it a little bit easier. Because I was tired of uncomfortable headphones and in your ear buds that left my ears sore after hours of meetings every day I decided to try these. They are amazingly comfortable. I’m 604 with a larger head than most people and they fit very well. They do not press into my ears but lightly sit over them in the cushions are very well designed. The sound quality is like having a HomePod in your ear. I highly recommend for the price, as these are the last headphones you’ll ever buy!

you move the dang thing off your ear and somethjing happens...instructions are completely vague-tried to use it to watch movies on my ipad-battery doesn't last at all...so called 'case' the thing goes in is awkward and clumsy...but the sound just is no better than sony headphones that cost less than half of this...these things are just not worth the money...sorry Apple, I've been disappointed by you before, but this is the WORST of the disappointments

I'm an admitted "Apple fanboy" so this is coming to you from a purely objective place. These boys are heavy - and I have a giant head to support the weight. Once they're on, even at the appropriate size, which is generous, there isn't a lot of sound isolation even when noise cancellation is turned on. This is just the nature of having very cushy ear cups, I suppose. My 3 year old pair of Beats Studio3 do a better job (which is depressing). To keep it short, I did return these. I like the idea of a "premium audio experience" a lot, but my advice if you're on the fence at all is to buy the AirPods Pro instead. There's no volume control, but at least they're portable, versatile, and more than sufficient for everyday listening.

I was lucky to find these at Amazon when everywhere else is continually out of stock.  When I received them, I noticed the box was in a bag, but the box itself was not sealed.  When I took them out and charged them, then tried to connect to my phone, they wouldn’t because they were already paired with another device. I had to totally reset them to get them to connect.  Be careful ordering, they might be someone else’s return.  They are comfortable, and the noise cancelling was quite good, but the sound wasn’t.  I thought maybe Apple worked in some kind of voodoo to make music files sound better, but no, you’re still limited by a standard Bluetooth connection.  Tidal’s MQA files didn’t sound any better than Apple’s 256 kbit.  Ultimately, I chose to return these, which was a painful process in itself.  Bottom line, try these out before you spring for them.  They might be right for you, but they weren’t for me.

I grew up in the CD era and saw movies of people with big headphones sinking into their beds and disappearing into the music, and I never really understood it… until now. I have several electronics that “support” Dolby Atmos, but the combination of these headphones plus Apple remastering old albums – it is literally like I’m truly hearing the music for the first time. The quality is just unreal.,Four stars because there are still relatively few songs (and movies) that truly take advantage of what these headphones are capable of. They are heavy and hurt my head after a while, and maybe it’s just me but the hum from noise cancellation gives me an immediate headache. Also, if you’re used to rocking out with earbuds that go straight into your ear canal, these are going to seem much quieter in comparison.

Excellent wireless noise canceling headphones for a single wireless device.  Very comfortable.  Is it worth the price? Probably not… but as I’ve heard many places, neither is most of high end tech we purchase today.  So, I’ll probably wear them until the metal fatigues itself to pieces to justify my “splurge”,Serious lack of forethought for the the fact that most people have at least 2 devices (one touch based and one keyboard based). Every Bluetooth device I’ve owned for the past 7 years has been able to connect to and automatically switch between the different sources.  For a company that wants you to do it one way and seamlessly integrate that’s a major miss IMO. If you then factor in things like watching movies past other household members bedtimes, there’s the manual switch to the TV.,On a much less noticeable issue the fact that these cannot do losses even though you can spend $15 for lighting to head phone and another $35 for another headphone to lightning… JUST to be able to listen wired (apparently they still need battery as well when wired though I haven’t tested myself), it STILL isn’t lossless :).  On top of that they then released the head turning media campaign for their lossless platform, and they have no way to use these for that.

So much about AirPods max is great. The sound quality is vastly superior to the pros. Much more detail in in movies and music. Transparency mode is greatly improved. The noise cancellation is the best I’ve heard on any headphones or earbuds. I really like the sound dial mostly cause it’s the same as an Apple Watch but the location and design could have been improved. I really hate the price but luckily I got them on sale but at least Apple could have evaded included their $35 wired cord to make it a little more worth the price crazy of $550. I’m not really a fan of the overall shape of the ear cups, to me they look like the headphones you wear when you go shooting. The mesh on the top of the headphones are really comfortable I really can’t feel much on the top of my head. One massive flaw with these is that they don’t have a power button and you have to put them in the case to prevent the battery from draining. But whenever I extend the headphones it feels like I’m about to break them but it’s smoother than other headsets and other headphones just click instead of sliding in. I don’t know if it’s just me but when I plug in the it makes cord a bussing sound in the left ear. There are many nice headphones out there but these are the nicest headphones I’ve ever put over my beautiful ears. But really suggest getting a different carrying cause though.

I bought four pairs of these and all four users report consistent complaints from people on the other side. Sounds quality is bad.,The 1st gen worked great.,The 2nd gen were god awful and never connected.,This new 3rd gen connects but people say every fifth word is garbled.,Come on Apple!! Spend one billion of your four hundred billion in cash and make some AirPods that don’t suck!!!!

Good sound.  (Came partially charged.) BUT, can not charge using cord included with it, as it is USB C.  (Not the case with my other Apple AirPods that came with my I Phone 12Pro Max purchased in February 2021.) Cant charge these new AirPods on my Dell laptop either, purchased in 2019, or with any charging cubes I have.  SO, now I had to order adapters and wait until they arrive next week.  ANNOYING!

I have had the generation 2 airpods for two years and have loved them. I decided to upgrade to the newest version, I really wanted to love them but they kept falling out of my ear after a few minutes. The sound quality was great but they have changed the shape of the ear bud and now no longer stay in my ears. I even tried the twist method to insert them but it was no use. I used to go running in my generation 2's and they never fell out. But they made the bud larger and now they fall out after a couple minutes. So I guess if you have larger ears they might be great but I was really disappointed and will be returning.
it seems this is not authentic i couldn’t validate the serial number in apple website

The gen 2 fit perfectly. Wore them for very long hours. Never an issue being active with those. The gen 3 are bigger and fit weird and will pop out if I intentionally stretch my jaw multiple times. I’m keeping them because they sounds really good. Better drivers, spatial audio, and battery life make it worth it for casual use. Haven’t test the water resistant. If the gen 2’s fit without issue, these will be to big, but if you deal with the discomfort for a week you’ll get use to it. Music is good, but pair it to Apple TV 4K with a good Dolby Atmos movie and holy crap! Some scenes in Dune were something else. They really do sound better for Bluetooth buds.

I owned 1st gen and they were perfectly designed, always stayed in ears. I bought these, hoping for better sound quality and battery life, which they deliver. However, to my absolute disappointment, these headphones do not stay in my ears. I keep losing them while sitting down. I bought headphones for gym use, I can't take these to the gym now, or wear it without fear of losing them. Waste of money, poor product.

Pros: sound quality is amazing, battery life amazing too,CONS: Yhe double click  on earpiece to switch tracks and skip stinks!  I wish they would have left well enough alone.  Accessing that little button on the ear piece is a big hassle

I like the 3’s for some things and the 2’s for others.,The 2s have a warmer sound signature and stay in your ears way better - and are lighter.,The 3’s have better technolog, battery life and water resistance. I don’t have the same issues with the mic that I did with the 2’s on phone calls etc.,Both are good. If your primary use is phone calls get the 3s.

Waited years to spend the money on wireless Apple AirPods and was so excited to finally gift myself these for Xmas! I decided if I was finally going to purchase, I might as well get the newest version and I’m so disappointed that I did. I’m a ‘normal’ sized woman. 5’4 and 135 pounds and these AirPods literally just fall out of my ears. Just walking they fall out. They’ve fallen out as I walk in snow (trying to find the tiny white AirPod in the white snow is beyond annoying) They’ve fallen into the sink. How do they not stay in my ears??? The sound is fine, etc. But I have to wear a soft headband on my head to go to the gym so my headphones don’t fall out. Wish I’d purchased the AirPod Pros as I’ve been told those stay in place.

They sounded fine although I only listened for about 20 minutes for fear they were going to fall out of my ears at work. The old ones fit in my ears just fine. I never had an issue of them falling out on their own unless they got knocked out. These I constantly had to keep pushing them back in because they would come so far out of my ear. Another thing I didn’t like was the button to play or pause what you’re listening to. The old double tap is so much more convenient to do and so much faster. Bottom line: I’d you like the way the old ones fit and work I do not recommend these.
iPad Pro is the best tablet on the market. Everything is synced perfectly from my last one and the upgrades are noticeable from turning it on. So glad I upgraded!
I like the bigger size, iPad is awesome

It’s a cool product that basically extends your iPhone onto your wrist, but I just have trouble finding a reason why I need it. It doesn’t really do a whole lot that your iPhone already can’t do besides heart rate monitoring and the activity app

I really only used my Apple Watch for tracking activity and reading texts. I could never really respond to texts unless I wanted to use the canned responses. This one actually lets you type a response. Mind you the keyboard is SMALL but it's perfectly useable. I also love that the battery life is such that you can use it to track sleep and it charges really fast. I thought the 41mm would be so much bigger than my Series 1 but it's not and the new design allows the face to be used more efficiently. Glad I upgraded.

This is the first Apple Watch I’ve ever had and I absolutely love it. Sure it doesn’t come with a charging block like a lot of the one star reviews point out BUT they are sold literally everywhere and you can upgrade your charging game and get a fancy affordable charging doc for all your stuff anyways 🤌🏻,The app for the watch is super smooth and easy. Set up only took 15 min max. Comfortable to wear and fun to personalize. Messaging and phone calls work no problem. All of the apps are easy to use.

When I bought this, Apple Watch series 7 was out of stock almost everywhere. But Amazon had it in stock with free overnight delivery. And it was $30 off retail price.,It arrived well packed in its original unopened box and in perfect condition. I’ve been very happy with the watch and the graphite Milanese loop band.

I really like the series 7 apple watch. Many improvements over the series 3. That was a good watch too.,The watch face choices seem to go on and on!  The 41mm size seems to fit me better than the 38mm.,The extra features are really nice. You can read all about them when you go to Apple website. I got the blue watch, matches my new blue iphone12. Took 4 days to receive it.  Guess this is a very busy time of year.,If you are a fan of apple watches, then you will love the series 7.

I bought this watch for my husband for Christmas. He can’t carry his cell phone at work, so it allows him to get his messages as well as keep track of his physical activities, heart rate, pulse and blood pressure.,He has told me several times how glad he is that I purchased it for him.

I considered buying a used apple watch a couple years ago, because the current watch at the time didn't seem to do much more than the older watches. Then the 7 was going to come out with always on feature, and larger screen, which for me was the thing I wanted. I'm so far loving it. The ability to switch between always on faces means it can go from looking like an elegent watch (plain, artistic face) to utilitarian with a swipe. The added health features are a bonus. Although I don't really need them, I could see those features being very handy for an older user that's trying to monitor changes to heart rate, O2 saturation, etc.
I loved my series 3 Apple Watch and the upgrade to the 7 series is great. Same quality with extra features and I love the larger face. It’s easier to read with older eyes.

Another home run for Apple. Live getting phone calls on my wrist snd responding to texts quickly. The face is nice snd clear… great color too!  But really, they couldn’t throw in the wall plug for the charger ? Remember to get an extra one so you can charge from a wall plug .  But I do love my watch!

I love the watch. It’s so cool that the you can use your own photos as the face of it.,4 stars because apple doesn’t provide the USB-C adapter in order to plug in to charge.  I would’ve been fine if it was a regular usb but it requires a usb-c.  I ordered one for $10.

Charges easy, took ten seconds to sync it to my iPhone and like five minutes max to set up and pick a watch face, overall really convienient and helpful, my first Apple Watch and iPhone and I’m definitely an Apple customer for life now android sucks
I am very happy with my purchase. I didn't think I needed to go up from the cheap tablet I was using - I was wrong! This has been well worth it!
Tried finding this Model during Christmas for a reasonable price.  Just after Christmas it was back in stock and Amazon had it a great price.
Easy to set up and use. I was able to easily set up my iPhone data on my iPad. The iPad is extremely easy to use. Camera and apps function flawlessly.
This iPad was just what I expected and the online user manual is very good and descriptive. Memory and battery are fabulous. Love it!
This is so much better than I expected! The picture quality is astronomical and so is the response time. Very good buy, I’m  pleased
Upgraded from generation 6, this one is Gen 9 and is fantastic, all noted facts about this iPad are true. It’s simple, it is awesome!
This 9th Gen iPad does everything I need it to do.  It's fast and for the price, I consider it to be the perfect entry level iPad.
Bought it as a gift. People I bought it for were blown away that I got them this. May get the 256 gig one for my self later lol.
Maybe I should have bought a mini. Thumb Typing would be easier like on an iPhone. It’s a long reach for my thumbs in portrait.
I like everything about it. My old iPad need to be replaced wit something new and fast. It is perfect for me. Light perfect for travel.

                ,
   I have bought 4 imac and spent over a 1400$ for each. The imacs were shipped to me outside the US. I have just received the first Imac. And it's not functional. No signs of power. Nothing. The power supply is supplying power normally i had it checked. Yet the imac itself isn't working. I spoke to the support. Asking for help. And they wouldn't. Claiming that they don't have the option to do so or even to refund or partial refund me.,Waiting for the other 3 imacs.,Note : we don't even have Apple stores in here so i could have it fixed. This is a brand new computer. And to get it I took a big leap of faith by finally leaving Windows and adopting Apple. However after about 2 weeks I could not login. Both the mouse and keyboard stopped responding. Apple could not resolve the problem and are sending replacement items. I am very skeptical because I don’t think this will resolve the problem because I find it very unlikely that both the keyboard and mouse which are brand new stop working at the same time!,As I suspected there was nothing wrong with the mouse and keyboard, I just happened to interact with a Representative who did not know what to do. After I got the replacement items the problem persisted but when I called again I got the right person who helped me fix the problem.,However, one major complaint I have about this computer is that IT HAS TO BE PLUGGED  TO A POWER SOURCE TO WORK. IT DOES NOT SEEM TO HAVE A BATTERY. When I called Apple the person I spoke to confirmed that for the computer to turn on it must be plugged to a power source! That is my disappointment, a different kind of disappointment!.,I have changed my rating from 1 star to 3 stars. Could not give a higher rating because:,1. The computer does not have any autonomy and has to be plugged to a power source to work!,2. The mouse is not the best there is, not ergonomic,  needs to be moved around on a smooth surface for scrolling, the location of the charger at the bottom is awkward!

The one thing I forgot to check, "Will it work with the USB items I own or am I going to have to buy more g~d~n rechargeables?",I have to buy more g~d~n rechargeables. G~d~nit. All this Rot-tooth is driving me to the poor house.,Otherwise it works just fine.,EDIT: Scratch that. After 24 hours the screen flickered and died. I can't even tell if it is booting.

Both Apple amd Amazon strive to make it easy. The computer is great, functional and appealing. I chose to buy through Amazon bc I trust their shipping and ordering process more than anyone else. This is a very big purchase amd I was confident in putting hard earned money towards Apple and also Amazon where I feel extra effort and innovation is highlighted

I was very happy that Apple decided to issue colors on their new iMacs. I got the blue one and I can't be more happy with my purchase. I have always loved the apple designs and this new thinner iMac is amazing. Its quiet and very quick to start up. I would suggest getting the mid-tier model as I felt that the base model is too cheap. As a side note get the ram and storage options that you want because this all in one unit can not be modified one you get it out of the box. Also I would opt for the magic keyboard with the 10 key pad. I did not and I wished I did as all the accessories are colored matched and can not be purchased separately . but like I said go with the mid tier and you won't be disappointed.

This is/was a replacement for an older iMac.  Buying from Amazon got it here quicker, but with fewer choices of build,(1)  I thought I had bought the Apple Care add on service, but evidently did the order wrong on the Amazon website.  Get the Apple Care.  Amazon's "included" tech service is not comparable.  Pay the $ extra up front.,(2). There is no printed instruction manual for this machine.  All web based.,(3)  This machine has different connector cables than my old USB (and likely yours).  Talk to an Apple knowledgeable rep and get  the right adapters to connect your printer, etc. peripherals with the machine..

For my use case (die-hard windows fan, with a 32GB RAM machine), this MAC is going to be my second computer. Just to get into the mac world. Got the 8GB machine because I know it's enough for my use case (and amazon doesn't sell the 16GB version anyhow). Hook it up to an external NAS server and all of a sudden 256GB seems like a lot of storage.,I like this machine a lot already. the best? 1080p FaceTime Camera, the screen is simply awesome and it is my new go-to for teleconferencing and working from home machine.,Bear in mind, in their desktop world, this is an entry-level machine. Designed for 'home entertainment' more than professional work.

The new Apple chip on this computer is a problem for third party apps. Getting Parallels and Windows set up was a horrendous problem. Also, my Samsung external SSD hard drive will connect but data on the drive is unavailable. Apple support on this was well-intended but ineffective (turned over to the "engineers." Also the speakers are an annoyingly deep base and there is no treble/base adjustment option.  So the voice of invitees on Zoom meetings is unnatural and at times indistinct. Apple support recommendation:  (1) get a third party app to adjust the base treble or (2) take the computer to an Apple store and have them look at it  ( a "fools errand" if I ever heard one!)  So luckily I ordered the computer from Amazon and can return it. I will then purchase the 21.5 inch iMac from Amazon. So think carefully before you purchase this technological marvel.

I have only had this $1600 INac for a couple of weeks and for what ever reason it just locks up. I am now on a first name basis with Apple Tech. Support. Not happy considering to s  ex nd it back. The computer I had for 14 years which is not an Apple worked just fine in all the years I ownyit. Very disappointed.

I chose to purchase from Amazon instead of direct from Apple because of the shipment speed available on Amazon. And let me tell, it was a fast and simple process. I was able to take advantage of 5% cash back putting the purchase on my Amazon store card which was great!,This iMac is absolutely beautiful and I wouldn’t hesitate to make a large purchase like this on Amazon again in the future.
Brand new I pad doesn’t work. I’m very pleased that after contacting Amazon a new one will be here tomarrow. Was disappointed but appreciate the customer service

These are insane. I’ve had several AirPods and have a pair of AirPods Pro. My expectations were somewhat high with these Max. Right out of the box the sound cancellation wasn’t that great and I was disappointed. But then it updated itself and now it’s even way better than my Pros. I also love not having to shove them in my ears constantly. Very comfortable I don’t understand the weight complaints. Sound quality is insane. No complaints they’re exactly what I wanted and more! It’s so good and fast and got the 256 it’s a mini computer

While they pack a hefty price, the AirPods Max are worth it for their incredible sound and build quality. I highly recommend them for discerning listeners.,I’ve heard that a lot of people were disappointed with the sound quality, however with a small amount of effort you can EQ them for a much brighter sound than they have out of the box. The EQ controls are accessed on your iPhone or iPad settings under “Headphone Accommodations.”,Being constructed of metal and aluminum, AirPods Max initially felt pretty heavy on the head, but after a while, I got used to it.,The so-called “Smart Case” is incredibly stupid to be honest. I highly recommend buying a third party option. Many of them also have the magnets built in to put the headphones in low power mode. You can ditch the smart case all together.,While the always on quirk was kind of strange in the beginning, it has never really been an issue for me nor have the headphones discharged quickly because of it.,Overall I am very pleased with the headphones and highly recommend them!

Be careful if you order this product. When they arrive new and you sync them, they should not come with someone else’s name attached to them already. Product clearly says new, but I received a pre-owned product. Huge bummer.

I was enjoying this headset.  It fit in well with all my Apple items.  Noise cancellation was excellent... best I have experienced.,But, battery life was horrible.  Even when you put them in the case, which puts them to sleep... you can't turn them off otherwise.  I would put a fairly charged set in the case and sleep it went then took them out the next morning and the dreaded red light came on indicating the battery was in dire need of charging.  In doing some research I saw that many others were noting this issue on Apple talk boards.,One other issue, the controls on the top of the ear pads often got activated when trying to take off the headset... I found them to be awkwardly placed.  I found the Bose 700 controls much easier to use and less obtrusive, for instance.  Very awkward placement.,So, I returned them, sadly.  I really enjoyed them otherwise.

I love these headphones for work videoconferences.  Comfortable enough to wear all day, replaceable ear cups, great sound for calls, movies and music.  The spatial audio support is also great for an immersive experience.  At first I hesitated because of the cost, but these easily beat out my Sony noise-cancelling headphones as well as my Airpod Pro's for home use.  The only thing I don't like is that they don't fold well for travel - but I have the other headphones for that.

As an AirPods Pro user, one of the biggest downsides of the design is the reduced sound quality when using the mic due to power splitting. I was hoping with the price premium and size of the AirPods Max this would no longer be an issue. It was, however, with sound quality dropping when in a call.,Also, the top band is extremely tight no matter how I tighten or loosen it. This makes the headphones unbearable to wear after an hour, giving a serious headache.
Fast great screen not too heavy ok battery life
Hasta ahora me a funcionado muy bien me encanta todo de ella para lo que la necesitó muy bien.
Great machine as expected.

Pros:,- Easy to use (no weird touch gestures or weird controls),- Love that its always on and ready.,- easy integration with the apple eco system. no apps required.,- sounds very good,- comfortable, love the breathable ear cushions.,Cons:,- Started to have connectivity issues with my Mac after 3C39 update.,- Some times wouldn't charge beyond 75% (not tested after 3C39 update),- the flimsy case is required to get firmware updates.,- expensive,- charges with lightning cable.,- battery wouldn't last one week with light everyday use.,- little heavy,- smelled very bad out of the box.,There is a lot of room for improvement. Feel like paying the early adapter tax with the experience changing with every firmware update.,I was expecting a much better experience overall.

The sound reproduction is flat… in other words just as it was recorded.  Virtually no latency ( lip sink) issues.  They’re fairly heavy, but once on they are very comfortable and you rarely notice the weight. They seem to be designed to be ventilated so your ears don’t get as warm as other higher end Headphones.  The ANC is excellent and in the pass through mode the ambient sound is mildly amplified!  I actually hear better with them on.  Just note I’m an old guy so… may not be as noticeable to younger folks but the transparency mode is great, just like the ANC.  Listening to Spatial Audio and Sony 360 music with These is simply amazing. These are not inexpensive headphones but if it’s in your price range I can highly recommend these!  Apple did a great job with these.  I only wish I could pair them with my iPhone and another device like my Apple TV at the same time.  But… these are great headphones and again if it’s in you’re price range well worth the money!

Nearly everything is great about these. Build quality. Sound quality. Great Active noise cancellation. Great controls. Nearly. Because I can’t get over the weight. After an hour or so, I find myself fiddling with them. I’m trying to get used to it. I’m sure I can, but for now, still heavy. Not too sure I would want to wear them for a seven hours Intercontinental flight. Anyway, I’m still keeping them for now, because the rest is great.

I've previously used the original AirPods and the AirPods Pro. In particular, I really valued the noise cancellation on the Pro. However, I had issues with one of the Pro earbuds developing a crackling noise. I had it replaced, but after the warranty period expired, then the other earbud developed the same issue. I saw the AirPods Max go on sale and I had a gift card so I took the plunge. This is definitely more than I would normally pay for headphones but I figured that I had a good track record with Apple so far, all things considered, and I assumed the premium cost would be reflected in the quality of the product. Unfortunately, the Max fell short.,First, the good: the build quality seems good. The headband is comfortable, and I never get any pain on the top of my head from wearing it for long periods of time (which frequently happens to me with other headphones). The volume dial/button/crown thing is nifty, and I like that there's a dedicated button to toggle back and forth between Transparency Mode and noise cancellation. Similar to the AirPods Pro, it also does an auto-pause thing when you take them off which is much appreciated. The overall sound quality seems really good, though I'm not an audiophile so I can't say much more than that.,Some minor gripes: the volume dial/button/crown thing can be a little squirrely. I wish it required a little more resistance to push down or turn. As it is right now, I find myself often accidentally activating it. Also, the auto-pause feature sometimes doesn't work correctly. It definitely knows when it's completely off your head but often doesn't recognize if I've pulled them down around my neck; despite not being on my ears anymore, I can still hear the music or whatever playing. I'm guessing it uses proximity sensors or something to detect if it's "on" your head or not, and being on your neck confuses it? I dunno, seems like that's something they should've accounted for, as that's a pretty natural thing to do with headphones like these. Also, seems like half the time if I take them off then put them back on, it'll automatically unpause, but half the time it won't and I need to manually resume. Not a huge deal but irritating and inconsistent. Also, one last minor gripe: the tops of my ears sometimes gets sore in these, because when I put them on, they touch the inner wall of the ear cup (which is covered in rough material). I guess my ears are bigger than what they designed for?,Lastly, the problems. Or mostly just the one problem: the noise cancellation doesn't seem all that great. It seems like it *could* be great, or maybe is *supposed* to be, but maybe the shape of my head just doesn't conform to Apple's assumptions. When I wear the Max and have noise cancellation on, it's inconsistent in how it blocks out sound. For instance, if I turn my head to one side, the quality of the cancellation shifts wildly (either from good-to-nonexistent or vice-versa). I work with multiple monitors so this is something I'm doing a lot, and it's very distracting to have the noise cancellation shift so much every time I do this. Also, I've noticed that if I literally press down on the sides (i.e. pressing them more onto my ears) the cancellation gets dramatically better. It seems like the ear cups aren't getting a good seal against my head and thus are letting in too much outside noise. I've tried adjusting the headband in various ways but nothing seems to help.,This is a pretty major disappointment for me. Considering the price, I would expect the noise cancellation to be at least on par with the AirPods Pro, if not better. Perhaps they are if you have the right shape head and ears, but unfortunately that's not the case for me. Maybe it's not fair to compare the Max to the Pro, since the Pro are in-ear buds vs the Max's over-ear design. But STILL...look at the price! I'm not sure why these are so much more expensive. If you're looking at both of these, what's the advantage to getting the Max over the Pro? I really can't think of anything that's THAT much better on the Max. Like I said before, maybe the sound quality is much better on the Max, but I honestly can't tell the difference. The one thing that DOES stick out to me is the noise cancellation experience, and these are definitely not as good.

Very frustrating to pay this much for a product in such poor quality.

I'm generally a big fan of Apple products, but purchasing the airpod pro was a mistake. Unfortunately, return policy is very limited. Here are some limitations IMHO:,1) Even with a good seal, an airpod can fall out, everyone I know, who has one, has had this happen, and a few have lost one when this happened. Cheaper third party models sometimes have a thin cord connecting the two earpieces so something like this or an over the ear retainer would be an improvement.,2) Checking battery life is a hassle particularly if you left your case home. My Bose headphones announce the % charge when I turn them on and this would be an improvement for the airpod,3) Touching the stem to control some features is not reliable.,4) A big safety concern is that the airpod dampens external sounds (like approaching cars) even when turned off or in the transparency mode (noise suppression off). Of course, one can take it out of the ear and maybe lose it.,5) noise suppression is not that impressive.,6) if one is just going to use them at your desk, one can get a better microphone and headphones for less money.,7) battery life unimpressive and only lasts a few hours,I'm probably going to go back to my Bose headphones and either toss or give away the airpods

Disappointing experience - ordered from Amazon and one unit was Dead on Arrival and and tried to have the airpods replaced by Amazon. Instead they told me to go to an Apple store and tell them to fix it. This is the new Amazon.com experience,I returned these for a refund and intended to buy another pair but the black friday deal was only one per customer no exceptions.,Nice.,Got a working pair at Warlmart of all places.,The earpod pros are really good for one thing - phone calls. I have a lot of earphones and headphones and as far as musical playback they're simply average. Noise cancelling is a bit laughable. Transparency mode is useful in the right settings. And the battery life is poor as is the fit if you have large ear canals.,Don't get me wrong, I bought them for phone calls on my iphone and they're good at that - great. But I don't use them in the gym, car, planes, or basically anywhere else.

Los audífonos son geniales, se cargan al 100% en poco tiempo, se conectan rápidamente al iphone siempre y cuando se tenga activo el bluetooth. La cancelación de ruido es muy buena, aunque he visto reviews donde dicen que los audífonos de sony son mejores en eso y además tienen servicio de Alexa y Google. Pienso que si tienes iphone estos airpods son la mejor opción por la compatibilidad y uso de Siri.,Algo que no me gusta mucho, en mi caso, es que la parte que ingresa al oído es un poco más grandes que los airpods de segunda generación o audífonos con cable donde sentía que ni los llevaba puestos. Al ponerme los airpods pro, al inicio se siente bien pero ya después de una media hora empieza una ligera molestia que hace que no sea muy cómodo llevarlos puestos por mucho tiempo, si es tu caso como el mío analiza bien antes de comprarlos para que puedas disfrutarlos por mucho más tiempo.,Viene incluido 3 gomas intercambiables en talla S, M y L puedes probarlas, al configurarlos te hará una prueba para saber si está haciendo una correcta cancelación de ruido con la talla de gomas que estás usando.,Espero que en la siguiente generación de los airpods pro los hagan más ergonómicos para el oído.,Procura comprar un estuche para el cargador de los airpods pro ya que suele rayarse con facilidad.

I got these to help with my insomnia. I had the regular Apple Ear Buds for a couple years, but they are uncomfortable if you are a side sleeper (which most sleep docs tell you is the best way to sleep).,Unfortunately these are way worse. There is almost no way to sleep on your side comfortably as the plastic digs in to the side of your head all night.  (Tried the Music Cozy too and had issues with volume being too low). How hard is it to make a comfortable earbud you can use for sleep!,Regarding noise cancellation- it's decent but not great.  Two examples: 1) On a recent flight I could hear a baby crying several rows back.  it was a bit muffled, but I definitely still heard it.  2)Tried these at the beach and could still hear the ocean.  Seems like they work best cancelling out voices, but oddly not other sounds as much

These are the refreshed AirPods Pro which now come with a Magsafe + Wireless Charging case. Apple silently updated it without much fanfare, but there's still a belief that these aren't new. So, the truth is, they do indeed now have added Magsafe, but pretty much everything else is still the same.,What I Like,The AirPods as expected integrate seamlessly. I use a MacBook and an iPad and the AirPods switch between them like a charm. Additionally I use these with my OnePlus 6T Android phone and they work fine like a Bluetooth earphone. Of course, I lose out on all the magical Apple-ish features Auto-Pause etc, but they still sound great. Did not notice any Bluetooth jittering or lags or frozen playback. Tried out Spatial Audio and some may call it gimmicky, but it was fun experience to have nevertheless. Apple Music now has a lot of music remastered for Spatial Audio, but even without, my original songs seemed to deliver some directionality with Spatial Audio and Head Tracking turned on. The ANC is really good and makes these a good light-weight pair of earbuds which block out distractions around you. They were great on train and bus rides and with some light music, you can get quietly comfortable. However, they're not suitable for flights because of both the battery life and the form factor. Flying definitely needs either a BOSE QC35/45 or Sony XM4s to deliver a long lasting comfort.,What I Don't Like,The manufacturing quality has taken a real bad hit. It seems that they shifted or started additional manufacturing in Vietnam, and the AirPods I received, did not feel like a premium $150 product. I could see the plastic joints, they felt rough, there was glue oozing out, and it was nothing like the first pair of AirPods Pro I tried 2 years back. So this was frankly disappointing. I don't care where Apple makes them as long as they're just as good since these don't come cheap.,The fit of AirPods Pro is something which works for some, and just doesn't work for some others. I'm in the later. They fit me fine sometimes, but other times they just pop out. There's no way I can use them, unless I have oil-free skin (oil in the hairs makes them fall out a lot faster) and I always have to push them in every 5 minutes. So, do check out the fit before you commit to these. I want to try the Beats Fit Pro, since they offer a near similar feature set (minus the Wireless Charging) and should stay in better.,I didn't find much value in investing a MagSafe Charger ($29) for now, and so picked up the cheapest Anker Wireless Charging pad I could. It works like a charm. If not, you can always charge with the included Lighting to USB-C Cable.

Got these because they were on Christmas sale… normally $249, on sale for $180. No real need for them, because i had the older generation AirPods and they worked just fine, but the older ones hurt my ears after wearing them for a while (like 30-40 min) and the battery drained really fast on them. What i love about all AirPods is that it reads messages without my need for interfering… I’m a hygienist and my hands are preoccupied so i can’t check messages. I pop one AirPod in and can hear if my kid or someone messages me something important. Doesn’t interfere with my work… win win. Anywho… these new ones kept literally falling out of my ears. Not sure if i have weird ear shape, but never had issues before. Tried changing the sizes of the ear squish they come with, no dice. Also, i kept having an issue with them (right away) where it would say i left one of them somewhere i had been, recently, and was moving away from it. I had both ear pieces in hand. So, not sure why it kept thinking that but the concept of letting you know if you left them, is neat. All in all.. nice product, just not for me.

Battery life is getting bad (lasts about an hour on a Zoom call) so I needed an upgrade.,Was really excited to see Airpods 3 but read some mixed reviews so I went with Airpods Pro when they were on sale.,The pro is great but I just can’t get comfortable with the earplugs and I don’t really need NC (have a pair of Sony for that). So I decided to try out the AirPods 3 anyway (Apple store don’t let you try them on right now btw) and OMG I’m keeping the 3 for sure! They fit comfortably and stay on. Sound is awesome too and with Bass!,For those of you who’s deciding between Pro and 3, it really just comes down to Noise Cancelling and fit. If you don’t need NC and not sure about the fit, I have pretty standard girl size ears and they fit me completely without falling out!

Can’t tell you about battery life yet just received. It was a mistake gift. They are too large for my husbands ears but he won’t let me return them. It’s OK now for the winter because he wears a beanie cap on his head that holds them in but come spring and summer I expect him to loose them and I will not purchase again. He’s on his own.

The sound is great (google how to update the firmware on your AirPods!) - loved the sound - but they're bigger than the AirPods 2.  Just sitting - not moving - and they popped out of my ears.  Working them in deeper - they still pop out of my ears.  So I'm returning the 3s and I'm sticking with the AirPods 2 which fit my ears perfectly.

As expected from Apple products, the sound quality is awesome. The spatial sound feature is great and te battery life is a no worry.,The downside:,- The noise cancellation is not as good as the AirPods Pro,- They feel kinda loose in your ear and easily fall from it (already dropped one at the gym),- had to purchase those ear tips to secure when using them (solved the loose feeling),Apart from that, is a 4 out of 5. I’m pretty happy with them.

Compared to last generation (airpods 2), it seems like Apple has done a trade off between sound quality and wearing comfort ability. The sound quality has been improved (Bass), but for a long time use like 3 hrs, you might feel it pinch you eat a little bit which AirPods 2 does not have a issue. An the firmware for the 3rd generation is not perfect , you can hear some buzzing sound while not listen to anything. But I guess Apple is going to update the firmware in the future to eliminate this issue. Instead of upgrade form AirPods 2, I would say AirPods 3 is more like a intermediate version between 2 and pro.

Sound quality is definitely improved in these and the shorter stem makes these look great but I’m disappointed to see that the earpiece is larger than the previous model. One thing that did bother me though is that the pinch control on the left AirPod stops working I have to place it back in it’s charging case in order for it to work again maybe it’s defective because there was a time that it wouldn’t charge but overall they are good earbuds.

What was Apple thinking when they designed this product?  Impossible to pull out of the charge case, hard to hold onto when placing in the ear, WILL NOT STAY IN THE EAR????  DID they not do any testing on this?,I bought these instead of the PRO's because I did not want to have  my ear sealed off with the cuff.  But this is ridiculous...they fall out when I am talking , they fall out if I smile, they barely stay on the ear at all.,Then when I go to put them in the charge case... they are not easily placed.  I have dropped them already many times just trying to put them in the charge case.  SUPER DISSAPOINTED IN THIS PURCHASE

They are often for me a little hard to pinch out of the case compared to the 2nd gen but the amazing sound in your skull watching a movie is awesome!,I didn’t think the 2nd gen could get any better for watching movies or listening to music but here they are.,I bought a Mobosi case for it and love the brand for quality and protects my AirPods from loss.

They’re the best headphones I’ve ever owned, besides two things:,1.) discomfort,for whatever reason, only my left ear becomes incredibly uncomfortable after wearing these for a few hours. I’m assuming my ear is pressing against the harder plastic bit on the back side of the detachable earcups (which are an excellent design, besides that).,2.) there’s no power button.,you can’t turn these on or off. the headphones decide that for you. this is a stupid feat of over engineering in all honesty, that on top of the laughable case are just some incredibly bizarre design decisions.,overall, the build quality is excellent. the noise cancellation is the top of its class. as far as bluetooth headphones go, audio quality is great. the simple volume knob is perfect.,i would say the price tag reflects all of that..

I consider myself firmly rooted in Apple's walled garden, but am by no means a zealous fanboy. That said, I would not buy these headphones without an iPhone and without an Apple Music subscription. The only way to justify the price tag is to make full use of every feature it offers and without those two you'll be out of luck. The soundstage is absolutely brilliant, and coupled with Dolby Atmos it will change the way some of your favorite tracks sound for the better. The sound-cancelling is first in class. Build quality is amazing and although I have experienced condensation during extended listening periods, they're easy to clean and it doesn't happen often.,It's easy to gawk at the price tag if you compare them to other noise-cancelling headphones on the market, but none of them offer the seamlessness these do. Make sure to spend time learning how to get the most of this pair before buying!

It’s nice when you have unrealistic expectations and you aren’t let down. Transparency mode is a notch below science fiction. I have mild hearing loss, and Apple Health allows you to integrate an audiogram and use it to correct the sound heard through Transparency. The active noise cancellation is also extremely nice.,Some people have problems with the ergonomics, but I find these to be quite comfortable.,They’re expensive, but I think they’re totally worth it.

Noise cancelling is excellent. Best noise cancelling of any consumer wireless headphone. The rest is crap. They get really hot. I mean HOT. Also, moisture buildup in the ear cups definitely is a thing. They don’t get very loud either. Heavy. The heaviest. Don’t expect to listen for more than 30 minutes at a time because of the heat and heft. The case is garbage, but you probably already knew that. If your on the fence between headphones get the Sony XM4.

The product is heavy, hurts my ears and neck after a long time of use, I just can't seem to get used to it.,I've been trying to return the item for three days and they won't let me return or tell me why. Really just wasted $530.

First, this is and remains a wonderful product so I’ll spare excess commentary praising Apple. The first pair I received looked and sounded perfect. What I found odd is when I went to pair (which took more time than what I experienced with my Pro’s), the AirPods already had a name (in this case, Michael). Rather than risk it, I exchanged them for a new pair. Second round, packaging was more comprehensive (box was sealed, protective paper in place, etc) which candidly I did not notice was absent with the first. My advice - as exciting as the unboxing process is and as new looking as they may be, look for less obvious signs that you may have received somebody else’s gently used AirPods.

Love these new headphones. Some of the best audio I’ve ever heard. I had to buy because I buy everything Apple (yes I know these are expensive and I might have a problem).,Throughout using these the real advantage I’ve found is using these at my work place. I spend most of my day on the phone with clients. Unfortunately it can get loud with others doing the same and cause a distraction. These work great for calls and the ability to noise cancel helps me focus. Apple made my life easier and my production has gone up.

Punchy sub bass with no distortion or muddyness, clear mids and highs. The ANC and transparency modes are also excellent. You get what you pay for. They sounded toe to toe with my friend's audiophile grade headphones.,I tried the Sony XM4 1000 in the store, they felt like a plastic toy build quality wise after holding the Airpods Max.,Don't get me wrong, Sonys are still very good, but the Airpods Max blow them out of the water build quality wise, and are noticably better sound wise and ANC wise.,Pros:,- Incredible sound, ANC, transparency,Cons:,- Price, you'll probably want to buy another $20-40 worth of accessories like a legit stand and a real travel case

These headphones are amazing. Steep in price obviously, but nothing compares to the sound quality and noise cancellation these offer. The weight isn’t an issue when I wear them (I have a big head though).,Noise cancellation I have personally experienced and can compare these to are the Bose N25’s, AKG NC60’s, Beats Solo Pros (the ones with the Apple H1 chip I believe), and apples AirPod Pros.,The volume crown takes a little getting used to, but it’s definitely not a deal breaker. My ears stay pretty cool while wearing these too. Plus, I have an industrial piercing that most headphones irritate, but these are comfortable, even with the piercing.,I would definitely recommend.

Had high hopes when I decided to purchase. Seems stunning to admit they have exceeded my expectations.,Build quality is excellent. Sound quality/noise cancelling is great too. Seemed like it was coming from everywhere (best way I can explain it).,I did decide to get Apple Care for it, as some people seem to have issues with condensation and sound consistency.,No regrets

I picked these up on a black Friday deal because my first gen AirPods were starting to go bad after more than three years of hard use. I wear my headphones almost daily while at work or at home working out. The noise cancellation on these headphones are by far one of the best in the industry in my opinion. They also come with multiple sizes of the in-ear rubber tips to make sure you have a comfortable fit.,When using noise cancellation for the first time, you might notice that your ears hurt a little bit. This is a result of the noise cancellation sending negative sound waves to essentially silence all external noises. After a little while you get used to it and the feeling goes away because your ears have gotten used to that noise cancellation. Please note this is nothing to be afraid of, just merely a warning so you don’t feel that you’re going to have long-term issues.,They also work just fine in transparency mode which uses its external microphones to let noise come in so music and play in the background while you’re still aware of your surroundings. I highly recommend these over apples standard AirPods because these have a much more superior sound quality, including a better mid range and bass. My generation one airpod seem to lack bass entirely and resulted in more muffled mids.,In all, I think these are one of the best in ear truly wireless, noise canceling headphones especially if you use exclusively apple products.

First off: Bose QuietComfort over-the-ear phones are, to me, the gold standard for noise cancellation. I splurged on a pair of these several years ago and love, love, love them: their comfort is such that I can wear them all day and forget I've got them on, their battery life stands up to that all-day wear, and they're almost TOO good at the noise cancellation thing (I've had people walk up behind me (at home) and startle me because I did not hear them coming.,But they're awfully bulky - no getting around that! So I thought I'd look into a pair of noise-cancelling wireless earbuds. The AirPods Pro had decent reviews, but they're the sort that stick into your ear canals; I also tried the Samsung Galaxy Buds Live, which do not (but also, naturally, had poor ratings for their supposed Active Noise Cancellation).,The Galaxy buds are nice enough, in that they are comfortable, don't require jamming anything into my ear canal (ewwwww!) and come in fun colors. But they fall out if I do anything other than sit in my office chair, and there's really no way to tether them.  The ANC on them is, as expected, a joke, and I don't use that "feature".,The AirPods Pro come in any color you like as long as it's white. There ARE ways to make them a bit more secure (anti-loss straps, earhooks) and I've used both of those with mine. The ANC.... at first I thought it did absolutely nothing. Then I found that they DO reduce some kinds of background noise. For example, there's a small fridge in my office. Without them in, I can hear a slight humming. WIth them in, but ANC turned off, there's actually a LOUDER hissing sound. With them in, but ANC turned on, I cannot hear the fridge at all.  Similarly, when someone in the next room is listening to something on the TV, with a door closed between us, I can't hear the TV at all with ANC turned on, and with ANC turned off, I can hear the TV (if slightly muffled).,Long story short: They do reduce some kinds of background noise but will not do anything like the kind of job a good pair of over-the-ear phones will do.,I have not yet had a chance to try these on any kind of transit, due to COVID. The Bose worked quite well for that - I could hear my audiobooks on the train without blasting the volume to dangerous levels. I suspect the AirPods would not work all that well; when I have a chance to try them on a train, I'll come back and update.,Off-label use: my husband wanted a pair of these to use to improve his hearing (there are numerous articles out there about how this sort of earbud can be used as an inexpensive sound booster for those with mild hearing loss).  He tried them, then reported to me that his mouse and keyboard actually make clicking sounds - something he'd genuinely been missing.

I was iffy on ordering these due to some of the other comments. But I’m glad I did. They are just as described. Real, authentic Apple airpod pros. The sound quality is very good. But the best feature is the noise cancellation. It’s better than expected. Was delivered in two days (with prime) and the packaging was in perfect condition. Definitely recommend.

I have ordered these twice. First time the left one came defective, the pressure sensor for touch controls wouldn't work, but then would sporadically spam as if I clicked it at times when I hadn't touched it at all, skipping songs/videos, spamming enabling/disabling noise cancellation and transparency.,I requested a replacement for being defective, the delivery came in an empty box with only the bubble wrap packaging. The box had clearly been opened and resealed with non-Amazon tape, shipping label ripped off. My guess is the Amazon delivery driver stole them, but not certain on that. Contacted Amazon support and they approved a refund.,I will be ordering these from Apple now, not worth my time. When they did work sound quality was great, functions were great, etc.,5/5 for Amazon customer service, 0/5 for delivery and quality of product

Build quality is way below average Apple product:,- very obvious seam on both pods;,- adhesive remnants on different parts of both pods – had to scrub it off;,- charging case is a little flimsy;,- connection issues with the right pod – fixed after several reconnections.,Overall soud quality is nice.,Good buy during huge discounts, but never for the original price.,Apple has to improve its Quality Control processes.

I normally use bone conduction earphones, however, after an ear I jury from flying, I was unable to use them. I borrowed a pair of Airpods to listen to a couple of songs and liked all of the features; however, the Airpods were connected through their Apple phone, which I have an Android. So I ordered a pair; figured I'll return them if I really don't like them.,I tried on all three sizes of the ear tips and found the smalls were most comfortable. The sound quality compared to my bone conduction earphones is remarkable. With the Pods, the sound is richer, it was nice. The noise cancelation feature was something very odd to me. Everytime the feature was in use, my ears felt a lot of pressure and would make my head feel pressure, which is the main reason for returning.,The 2nd reason for returning was the lack of usability without the Apple app specific for these headphones. There are no Android Airpod apps with same functionality as the Apple Airpod app. There are tiny buttons on the Airpods that have some usable features, but if I'm going to pay for a product with features I find worthy, I want the same access to them.,Battery life is very poor. I listen to podcasts and music when I'm busy at home. The Airpods would last about 4 and 1/2 hours straight through.,I'm just going to stick with bone conduction--the technology is improving, and I'm a sucker for open-ear.

Apple made a bunch of missteps over the course of designing the more recent MacBook Pro computers, most notably the poor keyboards followed by the god-awful Touch Bar. (Props to Apple for trying to innovate and the Touch Bar was a cool idea, but it was a solution that created more problems than it solved.) Eliminating more of the ports on more recent MBPs was also problematic, limiting everything to USB-C/Thunderbolt only, even down to killing the very popular MagSafe power plug. After getting one of those more recent models from my employer for work, I was able to find out first hand just how bad they really are.,This new model reverses SO many of those poor design decisions. MagSafe has returned (while still retaining the ability to also charge over USB-C), the keyboard is far better, the Touch Bar has been eliminated and physical function keys have been brought back to replace it (YAY ESC), and a built-in HDMI port and SD card slot have also returned. As soon as I saw in the release announcement showing off what Apple had done with this machine, I ordered one immediately as I knew this was going to be a perfect replacement for my 2015 MBP - which I'd kept rather than upgrading to the subpar designs mentioned above. I don't regret the purchase at all. This is a fantastic machine.,The only downsides I've experienced are due to the transition to the M1 processor. For 99% of users this won't matter one bit as the performance of the M1 Pro is exceptional. My individual problem is the migration of architecture; moving from x86/x64 to ARM meant instantly losing the ability to run VirtualBox and VMWare. VirtualBox will likely never run on the M1 architecture, and while VMWare is working on a new ARM version and Parallels is also available, they only allow for virtualization of ARM guest systems. Good enough for ARM builds of Linux (and limited versions of Windows), but Intel virtualization is now dead on the Mac. Again, this is not something that most people will ever run into, but for me it's a bit of an inconvenience. The trade-offs, however, are worth it.

M1 Pro performance is mind-blowing! The laptop boots up out of sleep in a second, just as fast as you unlock your iPhone but it's a laptop. The display is absolutely gorgeous, the color is pretty accurate. The black is very deep and you can't discriminate a black produced by monitor and a natural black!!,The battery life is the highest I've ever seen!!! It can easily, EASILY endure for a day. I highly recommend this beast for pro users.

On day 3 of using this beast and wow. It’s insane.,I’m a videographer and am always editing and exporting videos. My Mac before this was the i9 and this thing completely blows it away.,I shoot on a Sony FX6 camera and most computers have trouble with the footage and editing it (just the codec). This computer has no problem at all. Kinda crazy.,4 stars because I had one problem with performance (it was not performing how it normally did) but restarting it fixed it.,Will update after months of use. But so far - best purchase I’ve made. If you use a computer everyday and performance matters. This is a no brainer.,Oh and thanks apple for bringing back old stuff (mag safe and ports) and calling it “new”.

Clarity of the screen and improved speed were offset, for me, with a lack of a USB port, no DVD port, and still no compatibility with some apps that I would use. For me, I ended up having to buy an adapter for other devices which revealed that with the adapter plugged in I could not attach the power cord.,I need to point out that I am NOT a power user and most interested in memory & storage capacity, screen size clarity, and speed. I recommend that one  really look at what you are going to use your computer for and see how the computer meets those needs versus cost. I bought the MacAir Pro Max with M1 chip. For my fit I rate it a B+/A-.

There’s nothing to dislike about this laptop. It’s fast, the graphics are INSANE, it runs so many applications at once flawlessly. It’s better than I had hoped for. Price was a bit scary at first but we use it for my wife’s photography business and Photoshop/Lightroom work perfectly without issue and the quality of the machine is well worth the price. Honestly considering a second one to replace my HP.

I have been a pc user my entire life and took the plunge into the apple platform with this 16 MacBook Pro and it is simple bliss. The speed is mind blowing, the screen beautiful, I can not find anything bad to say.  You should get a shell case to keep safe (as seen in photos) I got the base model and am happy as can be with it, I think if I had gotten the more spec out model my head may have exploded.  I am now convinced that on judgement day that when god looks for my name in the big book he will do it on a MacBook Pro.  :)
I'm coming from windows.,And boy, this M1 baby is so snappy, has no fan sound, and the screen is INCREDIBLE!

I've been a Mac user for many decades and have had many Apple laptops over the years and this is definitely the best to date.  Battery life is increadible, display is bright and high res, it's fast, and the keyboard is excellent.  Great design..

The macbook is really a fantastic machine. The only thing really holding the mac back, is the price. Its just way too expensive for a lot of people, not even a good gift consideration because of that. You could make one of the most powerful PCs with the money it cost to buy one of these. That being said, why bother buying it? Well if you really enjoy mac os, there is one reason. I can’t think of too many though. Its a good machine, just not worth the money it costs.
