I've returned these. If I wasn't an Android guy and was deep into the Apple ecosystem, I would absolutely love to keep them, but I'm not, so I won't. The build quality is next level, and the ear cups are the most comfortable and breathable of any headset I've used. It's lack of full functionality on Android and Windows gives the impression that Apple doesn't want non-Apple fans, which is very anti-consumer. Bundle that with the insane asking price, and I think, on principal, I shouldn't give them my money. I do wish other companies made products as nice as Apple, at least in terms of hardware.

Considering how things have changed with stores selling audio products, it's not possible to go into a store to buy headphones and 'compare' a variety of headphones to decide which you like best. So, I purchased the Bose NC 700 Headphones, Sony WH-1000XM4 Headphones, and Apple AirPod Max Headphones all in the span of three months. The clear winner in all categories.... Apple AirPod Max.,1. Superior, clear, crisp, sound with spatial separation of vocals and instrumentation.,2. Easily connects to all Apple products (computers, iPads, iPods, and also to LG TV;s, and Dell Computers.,3. Very comfortable in feel on the sides of the head, over the ears, and snug fit on top of head.,4. Noise cancellation is like BAMN!! No sound outside the headphones period. But also is adjustable.,5. Snug fit, cushy ear pads, with deep pockets to encase ears with space for audio to surround the listener.,6. Controls are few, creative & unique, and function well.,7. The headphones look and feel of top quality, and professional sturdy.,8. Uh... did I mention they sound Great!!!,If you love to hear, and feel, all the intricacies and nuances music you listen too, this is the best purchase.,UPDATE: 28 Dec. 2021,I have come to learn that this headset is also a complete extension of your iPhone. What does that mean? When you say "Hey Siri" you can ask anything that you would ask if you were talking directly into your phone. i.e. "Hey Siri" increase volume, decrease volume, next song, prior song, send email, send text, what time is it, and any questions you would ask Siri when researching something on the web. It can and will notify you of text messages you receive as well as emails if you have chosen the settings for it to do so. It gets no better than this.

These are some of the best wireless headphones I’ve every used, and the perform better than the Sony XM4, and Sennheiser PXC 550.  The noise cancelling is great, the transparency mode is the best I’ve ever used.  These pair and work seamlessly with multiple apple devices, as long as Windows isn’t involved.,BUT… moisture condenses inside the aluminum earcups and make the headphones stop working.  I’m on my second pair and pushed through August/September with daily resets.  Now that humidity levels are down, they have started working again.  But until apple addresses this issue, or you live in a very dry climate, stay away.

I’m not sure where to begin.  I have owned a number of excellent headphones, in the past, but this one is truly the gold standard.  The comfort and fit are second to none, tone quality is unbelievable, bass & treble are perfect, and intelligent noise cancellation is out of this world.  On top of all this, it is the perfect headset for those of us who wear hearing aids.  I had read reviews by a number of people wearing premium Beltone hearing aids, who did not have to remove them, to hear well with the AirPods Max, and were thrilled to death with the “partnership” … I am now one of those people, as well!  In a word … W O W!

I've been using my Bowers & Wilkins and V-Moda M100 Master's for a few years now, and these Apple Air Pod Max headphones are indeed much better. I bought them for only $430, which brings the price pretty close to B&W's. These headphones are very high quality, sound amazing (especially with Dolby Atmos tracks), and provide fantastic simulated surround sound with my Apple TV movies and shows. It is unfortunate that you still need to buy an actual case for these headphones, as the little rubber "case" Apple provides is pretty much useless.

So I seem to experiment with headphones.  Over ear, in ear, on ear, etc.  I must have bought more than 12 sets of different products over the last 3-4 years.  These sound fine.  Not blown away as I was hoping, but maybe I was hoping for something that doesn’t exist.  No issues with comfort at all.  I could keep these on my head for hours and would not be bothered.  I have had some sync issues, and I primarily only use Apple devices.  Though mostly with my Mac.  Each time I have used them, I have had to remove them from my Mac Bluetooth registry and add over again.  No problems with my iPads.  Ironically, my Acer Predator will automatically recognize them, even when they are on a different floor in the house.  Oh, and I’m surprised by how many headsets make it unnecessarily difficult to adjust volume on the headset itself.  Not so with this set.

Noise cancellation is by far the best out there in wireless headphones. Sound quality is nice too.,The only problem I have with these is their easy to scratch up. Already have a few scratches on the iodized aluminum surface. Ruins the look. Otherwise, they’re great if you can stomach half a brand.

This is an absolutely crucial purchase if you work in a shared space (crowded coffee shop), fly for longer than 30 minutes, or if you just appreciate hearing the nuances of a song.  I was hesitant to buy them after reading about the condensation issue but I’ve worn them now for several weeks and have only seen condensation once, which came during a marathon writing session.  The carrying case is a joke but if you’re spending this much for headphones, I suppose you know how to take care of nice things.,Buy the headphones, you won’t regret them.

I ordered the Bose top-of-the-line heaphones and found the sound was really good, but the controls were hard to work because there were no knobs. I have to swipe or rub the headphones to answer calls or work rthe volume. There were no marks or etching on the headphones to indicate where, just on the instruction booklet. I tried and tried to figure it out but got frustrated and returned them. The Soney took-of-the-line were easier to use, but they did not sync with all my apple products and when they did, I would have to reconnect them every time I used them, sdo I returned them. Then I went to the most expensive route - the Apple AirMax headphones and I must say these sound great, the volume knob works easily and is multi-function - and it switches seamlessly between all my Apple products. Best of all, I can watch TV in bed and my wife can't hear anything. I got tired of looking for my little Air pods in the morning. More importantly, when I travel I won't have to worry about dropping my airpods in the plane and having to search for them PLUS they never did fit right.  I love the Apple AirMax headphones.

The sound quality of these headphones is great. The noise cancelling feature is amazing. I love letting other people try it out just to see the look on their faces. There are however 2 things that bother me about these headphones. First, it feels like they are squeezing my ears and head too tight. Second, my ears get really hot after having them on for more than 30 minutes. The combination of my ears getting hot and my head being squeezed causes me to only use them for short periods of time. Otherwise, I'd use them a lot more often.

After years of headaches with Microsoft, I decided to switch the wife to the world of the Apple iMac. This computer has been a blessing to use, only cable to deal with is a power cable. The 4.5K resolution is just amazing and the speed of the M1 processor is fantastic. Well worth the money.

The 12-month installment payment will NEVER happen. And it could be even worse than you think. A quick fact is that I got deducted for the WHOLE amount in August (I adjusted the autopayment immediately in July at Synchrony bank to the promised installment payment after I decided to keep the iMac). The reason? The bank said that if you make changes in July for the auto payment amount it will come into effect in September. So, no matter what you do, you would be charged the whole amount in August if you previously chose to autopay the statement balance. A huge bug here. After 2 hours phone call, the bank agents said the only way they could do was to send this $1500 by REGULAR MAIL WITHOUT TRACKING number. Wish me good luck. By the way, don't call the customer service at Synchrony bank unless you have at least 2 hours to get angry and are willing to give them the opportunity to ruin your rest of the day. If I can give stars for the payment method, I would give Synchrony bank a 0.

this iMac  fits nicely in between the old 21 and 27.  the new chip made in-house  is a nice feature.  I have an older I Mac that I love.  I am not a gamer at all, but speed is still important.  could have bought the  intel 7 gen. and been happy just the same. Bought these as a Christmas gift for my daughter who wanted an upgrade from her gen 1 AirPods, and all I can really say is…WOW, just WOW… the noise canceling factor is obviously a game changer in and of itself, however, in my opinion, the sound quality is the single most impressive quality of these gen 3’s. Good bass depth, crisp and really well balanced treble and tone. Battery life could be better, but the MagSafe charging capability makes charging anywhere, anytime a breeze! Well worth the money!

I had the first gen Airpods and decided to buy 3rd gen, never had a problem with the 1st gen falling out of my ear. The 3rd gen both ear buds fall out of my ear when I talk and work out other then that quality and sound is on point. Returned the the 3rd gen and bought the Pros and they do not fall out of my ear and the noise cancelation is a plus. Hope this helps!

I bougth this airpods to upgrade my Airpods Gen 2.  My first feeling was "Is big for my ears" but after a couple of weeks i got used to it.  I also had the feeling the Airpods were going to fall down but they stay even when i run.  Great sound and battery life.  The reason i don't give it 5 star is because i still feel some discomfort when i used for long periods of time.  However, i haven't found any other better.

I had the airpod 2nd generation before these. Used to wear them all day non-stop and would actually forget I was wearing them. These 3rd gens hurt my ears after about an hour and fall out easy.,Side note: they fall out of the case easily if you have the lid open. The 2nd gens had to be physically pulled out. These just come out if your opening the lid and hold them any other way than perpendicular to Earth.

As others have mentioned, this new shape doesn't stay in like the older models. I've never had an issue with the Airbud shape and have loved my Airpods gen 1 since they released. Looks like I'll be sticking with those.,If you're lucky and they do fit your ears, the sound quality is definitely a boost from gen 1. Bummed they aren't for me.

I was debating between these and the 2nd Gen; decided on this 3rd Gen. It has great sound quality and instantly connects to my phone and iPad; however it’s really uncomfortable. It falls out of my ear really quickly and when it does stay in (forcibly), it hurts after a short time. The ear piece is bigger than the other generations which is the cause of the problem. The 1st and 2nd Gen fits more snuggly and comfortably in my ear. This one is just big. Sounds great overall tho, only downfall is size of ear piece.

Out of the box they paired up to my iPhone very easily and worked fine for 3 days. First use on day 4, the left earbud had no sound at all, right one worked as normal.,I went onto the Apple website to troubleshoot. During this process I had to have my phone "Forget the Device / Airpods" and try to pair again. Then the AirPods would not pair to any phone at all.,Ended up chatting with a tech and after an hour with them they gave up and told me to return / exchange for new ones.,Aside from the obvious issue, when they were working they were good. The battery life isn't all that great but they charge quickly in the case. Hopefully the replacement pair lasts longer than this one.

I debated between these headphones and the Sony WF-1000XM4's.  Both are well reviewed.  The Airpod Pro's are priced lower and looked less intrusive.  I am VERY satisfied with the Airpod Pro's.  They are so comfortable to wear, they sit very securely in my ears but don't become uncomfortable even with hours of use. The noise canceling is incredible, including the Transparency mode which allows for conversation.  The spatial sound feature makes the music sound like it's in front of you and is very natural sounding - not gimmicky.  The Apple engineers and designers really nailed this one.,I use them mostly with my iPhone but they paired up with my Surface Book computer just fine and sound awesome with it as well.,Only negative, and it's minor, is there are no volume controls on the earphones. This turns out to not be less of problem than I thought it might because once you set the volume, with the noise canceling, you don't need to adjust them, and you can leave the volume at an ear saving level. The AirPod Pro's don't need to be turned up loud to sound good.  Love these things and can't believe I put up with less for so long.

These sound great and are very comfortable.  I can wear them for hours and not know they are in my ears. Eventhough they don't lock in, they feel very secure and have not popped out, even when jogging.  They were easy to pair, including with my apple watch 7.  I like being able to control the volume, seeing song titles and skipping songs from my watch. I testing the noise reduction in my home office blasting Jet Engine white noise, they are not quite as good as my wired Bose QuietComfort 20, but close enough.  But have not tried them on an actual plane yet.  The passthough works well.  I thought the spacial audio sounded a little better on than off for music.  It sounded a little fuller, but did not try it on movies formated for it, and probably will not.  Hey Siri works great.  My one complaint is that I cannot control the volume when paired to my FireTV Cube.  I was hoping to use these in bed when my spouce is sleeping next to me.  I could not adjust the volume with my iphone, apple watch, or using Siri.  I ended up buying a $20 pair of Tozo A1s with built in audio controls.

I have little issue with the headphones as they are. I wish the battery lasted longer, but they work as advertised. I realize it’s not uncommon for headphones to not come with a charger adapter (although every pair I’ve ever bought did), these come with a charging cord that has Apple plug on one end and USB-Type C on the other. These adapters are not common, meaning if I want to use that cord I have to big a new adapter, approx $20. Or have a useless cord.

I’ve been meaning to replace my old AirPods for a year now. The battery life was ending… I kept shopping for all different Earbuds, reading reviews, and asking friends and finally broke down and decided to try the most expensive, but best reviewed earbuds, AirPods Pro.,You bet 100% that I made the absolute right decision!!! These are amazing!!! First is the fit! You barely notice them in your ears, which I areas other earbuds can get uncomfortable after a while. Second is the sound!!! The Spacial Audio of the Pros is incredible and 3x the quality of my old AirPod 2s!!! Third is ease of use. I used to have adaptors that I’d put on and take off the old AirPods because they would fall out of my ears without. They also sync so easily with my iPhone and I’ve yet to have any Bluetooth interference which my old AirPods would often cut out and skip for who knows why.,I got the Pros at $179 off Amazon during the Christmas sale season. They are now back to $199, but I would pay it if I had to!!!,AirPods Pro’s are absolutely the best earbuds ever!!! Especially a must if you have an iPhone.

Took a full 10 minutes before my Galaxy even recognized it.,Finally connected.,Only to realize It doesn't stay connected.,Had to go through the process each time.,Obviously defective or a cheap Asian knock off.

Easy to lose, one lost in three days, only the charger shell left in five days,Years of using the TOZO Bluetooth headset,The experience is better than Apple, and the price is cheaper. TOZO is second only to Apple in the sales of Bluetooth headsets on Amazon, and the price is much different.,Under all kinds of advertisements on Thanksgiving Day, I finally paid my stupid tax to Apple.,Good luck and thanks for watching.

I bought these Air Pods Pro earbuds because they were being sold on Amazon for just a few dollars more than the Air Pods 3rd gen, but I really did not need the noise cancellation feature (which I have not even tested, as I use them in very low noise environments). Compared to other earbuds I owned before, including a pair of Beats, the sound quality of the Air Pods Pro is just amazing to me (but I am not a fanatical audiophile). They are also extremely easy to pair with my iPhone and they fit my ears perfectly, especially after experimenting with different sizes of ear tips, using the testing feature provided with the iPhone. I ended up with medium size tip in the left ear and large size in the right ear (I guess I am not perfect after all :-). Battery life is not spectacular, but more than adequate for me, especially with the recharging case they come with. Just like with most Apple products I have ever owned, I recommend these Air Pods Pro.

The Apple AirPods Pro are a definite step up from the regular AirPods, stay in your ears well (the Beats Fit Pro does slightly better here, but the microphone is not as good as on the AirPods Pro), have good noise cancellation (Bose and Sony might be a tad better, but these are very good), and excellent microphone pickup.  If you are going to be in a loot of phone calls, eMeetings (Zoom, Webex, Facetime, etc.) these are very much the ones to get.  About the only thing these are not good for would be high head movement activities (athletics), there the Beats Fit Pro does better, but these are on a par or better than the competitive Sony or Bose variants (which are larger, so easier to dislodge).  Also, once paired with Apple devices, you can just move them around to be used with whatever you happen to be doing, iPad or iPhone or MacBook, they autoswitch, don't have to be re-paired, and also handle Siri commands.

It’s a rip off. Calendar Notification is a known issue as it doesn’t sync with your phone. I hope I recover my cost with apple stocks.

The Apple Watch is different from my old Fitbit. I’m getting used to the larger size. I like the customizable face and what you can access from it. I like that I can answer calls and texts messages from it if I’m away from my phone.,Wish the battery lasted more than a day. Oh well.

I went from a very old apple watch to this one so there was like fireworks and stuff going off in my head !!  It's a great watch for the price !!  All new fabulous features, much longer battery life and it even does an EKG !!!  No heart problems here according to my watch, thank goodness !

I got this for my husband and he loves the watch, however the band will come undone at times and he has almost lost it a few time because of this. Overall he likes that almost everything he can do on his phone he can also do on the watch. I like that it measures vitals and steps it has great user interface and so far has been a hit.

I thought watches were outdated until I bought a fit bit for fitness tracking in less than a year my desire grew for more fitness data and I added swimming to my routine. I bought an Apple Watch  series 3 exactly 3 years ago. Loved it, passed it onto my daughter and upgraded to the 7 series. I absolutely love these watches. The 7 is easier to use, if that’s even possible and the battery life is much much better than my 3. If you’re a first time buyer or looking to upgrade I highly suggest this one!

This is a considerable upgrade from my previous Apple Watch (Series 3). I decided to get the 41 mm instead of the 45 mm, and I am delighted with the watch's size. The display is vibrant, and it does a great job of logging my workouts. I would recommend this watch.

I’ve had my eye on an Apple Watch for the past couple of years but this time I finally decided to get one. I love it so much and I am so happy I went with the 7 over the SE. I got the new starlight color which I really like because the champagne color can go with yellow gold, rose gold, and silver bands.

I have been wanting one of these for a while. I decided to take the plunge. For the price you pay for these things I would expect a way to charge the watch. I get the charge craddle but not the wall charger. Apple uses a very small usb port so it does not work with "Normal" USB ports. So now I guess I have to spend yet more money to get the wall charger! or I just may return it.
This watch is sleek and beautiful! I love the technology and the versatility of being to wear it all the time! Apple makes great products!
Love my new watch. I ordered the extra wristbands and change them to match what I’m wearing or just to match my mood💜
Everything it’s good but the charger it’s bad , now I need to use the charger of my iwarch3 for my new I watch 7 , I’m disappointed

I’ve had a series 3 for years and upgraded to this one. Love the color it goes with everything and matches gold and silver which is so hard to find. Works amazingly, very responsive and accurate. Charge lasts for 2 days. If you love apple products then it’s a must buy. I love it for tracking activity for workouts as well.
I love my watch! Works great. Had series 1 and 3 so I’m familiar with the way they work. Christmas present from my husband

Was super excited to receive this for Christmas gifting but now I am not sure. It seems to have been opened and is not a new item!! Looks like I am going to return and purchase from Apple directly to make sure it is not fake.
The Apple Watch series 7 is great. The screen is bigger and more bright than the series 5. It’s faster and very fictional
I was in need of an updated watch my old one was a series 2, and just wasn’t working well anymore. So happy I got the 7! I absolutely LOVE it! 100% recommend getting.
Go to a store! It came broken, dirty and the band didn’t even work! Please please don’t buy off Amazon they are amazing in other areas but not apple.
I am like a kid in a candy store discovering my first Apple Watch. I love that you can change the face of the Watch.

We are an all Apple family, so after our 10-year old Apple Laptop gave up on us, time to get a new one. So far, not disappointing.  Has the new Apple H1 chip, which works much faster than we ever expected.  Bright screen. Best of all, wonderful Apple customer service.

I am a photographer and I run Lightroom and photoshop and this laptop holds the crown. It is super fast! No problems at all. My internet is super slow but this thing picks up quickly. No problem with running multiple programs. LOVE this laptop. Highly recommend

I've been working so far one month with this laptop and by far is the best one I've used. It does not make any sound (using the same kind of edition and programming apps with an intel 2019 version, which is quite noisy). It does not heat neither. The only pitfall so far I've seen is that still after 1 year of having ARM based processors, some apps still are not natively compatible and it requires Rosetta 2. It definitely worth it.
Needed to update my old computer. It is working well so far.

I am in grad school and needed a laptop for zooms classes, writing papers, and low-key for playing games like the sims. This laptop was easy to set up. I was able to transfer all the data from my old mac to this new one. I also got the 16 inch screen and I don't think I could ever go back to a 13 inch screen! It so big and very easy to see the powerpoint on zoom while also taking notes on the same screen.
I’m an apple fan and this laptop did not disappoint!

Absolutely outstanding computer, battery life is amazing, performance is way better than my old MacBook Pro 15” 2018. I recommend this laptop for every day use. I have installed parallels desktop for windows 11 virtual machine and it has been working perfect so far.
I also had the same problem! the computer won't start up! Right now is on apple support! Let's see, otherwise I'm returning this computer.
wow

Some product on my iPhone were not accessible on the computer which were important to me. I thought all items on my iPhone would be allowed to download on this computer. This was a hard computer to get to know.

I would not recommend purchasing these AirPod Max headphones.. These are not New but used.. First indication was the packaging which was missing.. Nothing like how Apple ships the product.  When I connected them a few moments ago the person's name who previously owned them showed up in my settings on iPhone so they were not even reset..

They're expensive. That said, there can be a connection issue in which my desktop repeatedly drops and reconnects then drops the connection again. This is irritating and since the max cannot be turned off, it is necessary to reset by depressing the crown and that other button. This can be hit or miss, I solved the problem, strangely, by turning on an iphone, which seemed to connect the max to the desktop. Circular wizardry. Got the latest firmware update. But, they are tremendously cool. Volume is crisp, build is sturdy and clean, except for the connectivity, 5+ stars.

Excessive price, heavy, ridiculous case. But currently my favorite headphones. They are the most comfortable headphones I have (and I have quite few), they sound really good. The noise cancellation isn't as good as Bose or the top end Sony's, but they are good enough and the comfort of wearing them makes up for most of that.

Love them!  Pulled them out of the box, they auto synced to my iPhone and I was jamming.  Like the sound quality in fact I have heard details in songs I did not hear with earbuds.  The fit is a bit more relaxed than other over ear headphones I’ve used in the past, so they don’t pinch  when wearing them, but that means my gyration have to be scaled back a bit as I dance around cord free.  I’ve left my phone on my desk and gotten at least 100 feet away before starting to lose signal/breakup. 👍
Too heavy and tight around the head. AirPods Pro is a better experience.

Don’t waste your money...these are my 2nd pair,you countless times have to reset the headphones phones,after charging and you put them in the smart case they still drain the Battery...MIGHT OF AS WELL OF TOOK $500 dollars and just THROW IT OUT THE WINDOW...this will be my 3rd appointment at the APPLE STORE this month...BUYER BEWARE

The headphones are good, noise cancellation works as supposed, with a bit of pressure so you do feel it as a bit of extra pressure. I liked new clarity mode. The headset jumps between devices as it should. One caveat is that you can only switch NC or Clarity on Android devices.,Sound qualuty is great, resolution, surround, volume, it' s all good.,The cons.,The headphones are heavy, but they do last for a 20+hour trip with NC.,I was not able to make my lightning connector work with a 3,5mm jack - so no on flight entertaiment (tried two cords with endless devices. No luck),Case looks good on a desk, terrible in everyday use,Ergonomics - super comfortable on your head, but terrible if you try to carty the on yohr neck.,Overall - a mixed feeling, it's a great headphones, but I'm not completely giving up my other geadphones due to their light weight and ergonomics.

The noise cancelling is very good and pairing to an iPhone is simple.,Problem is that the fidelity is not very good. The fidelity of my first generation air pod ear buds is really excellent, MUCH better than the AirPod Max. The AirPod Max has a muffled quality and an overactive bass. Sounds like I'm listening through a pillow.

I love apple products and jumped on the opportunity to have these.,First impression..looks amazing and sharp. The audio quality is great as well.,My dislikes…they are rather heavy and expected when the outer shell is made of the same metal that the back of iPhones. The noise cancelling is not as expected when compared to my air pods pro and my other Sennheiser PXC 550 headphones.,The case it came with is not what I consider a travel case and apple could do better with that.,Initially they felt great but noticed the pressure it started placing on the rear jaw area within 5 min of wearing these headphone and as previously stated, I didn’t like the weight.

I’m a little bit crazy when it comes to headphones. I currently have 26 sets, adding and trading constantly. The air pod max punch WAY higher than their price would suggest. While $500 for a set is quite expensive for a lot of people, I own headphones that cost $800, $950 and $1100 that don’t compare as favorably. By far the best noise canceling I’ve experienced as well.
Very nice iPad!
N/a
Yeah

Not a fan. I bought this to grade papers and write a book. What I found was an overly expensive iPad that lacks the functionality of my old iPad, 10inch-ish, that's heavy with a deficient screen.,My old iPad was lighter, more comfortable to hold, and easier to pack away in my backpack.,This 12.9 iPad is huge and heavy, making it inconvenient to use, which is exactly what the iPad was designed NOT to be.,And why is their no 1/8th inch jack? This thing is the size and weight of a house. You'd think they could put a measly 1/8 inch jack for those of us who record, podcast, etc.,Additionally, I bought the keyboard. Again, too expensive, cumbersome, and lackluster. For a keyboard as large as the MacBook Air, the iPad12.9 is strange. Basic functionality is lost.  Example it lacks the top keyboard of the Air: volume, escape, search, microphone, etc. Also, it's too heavy and big.,To me, it seems the better choice is a MacBook Air or an “iPad Air at 12.9” inches--if it should ever be made. Grading papers is a slavish thing. You want some thing that's easy to hold, look at, and interact with. The iPad 12.9 shows Apple getting out of touch with what made them great, great design. The 12.9" iPad pro's weight, lackluster keyboard, cumbersome handling, and cost make it a deal breaker.,Apple, do better.

Apple do not joke that the next computer is not a computer,,now with the M1 chip, this tablet is a beast that can run all your creative suites and more.,The only downside is the battery life,,not that 10 hours isn't good, but it could have been better as the MacBook M1 features a 16 hours battery life.

This is my first iPad and I love it so far. I am upgrading from a galaxy tab s4 and the difference is staggering. Everything is so snappy and gaming runs great. I have tried a lot of apps and content on it with absolutely no problems. I’m sure this thing is a bit overkill for me right now but I wanted something with a good future. Honestly I am not sure that the screen is that amazing considering the hype but it does look great. It is a bit difficult adjusting from Android to IOS but no big issues. I live in an area with pretty much no internet so I bought the 5G model. There is no 5G around here so I can’t comment on it, but the 4g runs good. The brightness is a nice selling point, it is much easier to see out in the sun than my last tablet. My only issue with the 12.9 iPad is a lack of good cases right now but I’m sure more will come soon. I am not exactly a power user but after years of suffering from the sluggish performance on android, especially in regards to gaming, I wanted a big upgrade. Apple Arcade seems quite nice so far for people who like gaming too.

Upgraded from an IPad Pro 2 and this thing is a BOAT ANCHOR compared to the 2, particularly with a magic keyboard. Seriously, it is just a few ounces less than a Mac Book. Battery power is terrible also. Went from 100% to 60% during a two hour meeting using just Evernote and email with 25% brightness. Agree with other reviewers on screen bloom (very pronounced in darkness) and the fact that you can’t use all that power with the current IOS. Lotta swiping still.,Would not have bought it if I knew all this.

I don’t know how anyone could possibly rate this less than 5 stars.  I have the 2020 iPad Pro 11inch and just upgraded to the 12.9 inch with XDR display.  This thing is a total beast like one buyer commented.  The screen is absolutely beautiful and the speed is crazy fast.  Waiting for more accessible apps and better folder management so I can ditch my MacBook Pro!  Either way I LOVE this device and will keep it for years to come!

$1,000 tablet with a blooming display. I dont care if this is a "side effect", this is the top of the top, and its not cheap. Even the menus have blooming. There is all this talk about HDR being 1600 Nits and how bright it gets, I literally can barely tell the difference between this and my tab s7+ when it comes to brightness (600 nits). The worst offender is how swuare this thing is. Being this weird aspect ration means you will have huge black bars. Youtube videos literally look the same size on my tab s7+ which is almost half an inch smaller in width.

Having had iPads since gen 1 this is the worst of the bunch from a general use standpoint.,No button to press so every time you try to do something you either try 3 or 4 or more times or wait and sometimes it will timeout and give you the prompt for pin.,After having it for about 6 months I’ve gone to a Samsung tablet and happy now.,It shouldn’t be frustration trying to deal with the device when you just want to get things done, play a game, or listen to music.,Then there’s the price!,Apple, you’re a joke compared to 10 years ago.,New M1 hardware will eventually stop shining and you’ll be back to being judged on the actual product and service.,Oh, wait, it’s Apple. Never mind, the fan bois will support you.,Selling mine to a friend who has nothing right now.

This is my first mac and I love it. It is super fast with a very smooth operation. Has not been challenging to adapt to a mac. Pairs well with an iPhone.  I found set up very easy considering this was my first mac. Not a technical computer person so not able to help out in that area. I just use the program and leave the technical details to others.

I bought the best computer I could afford and it arrived with one side of the box ripped open and one piece of craft paper in a box double the size the computer should have been shipped in. No padding at all!!,Miraculously Apple took that into consideration and created the most amazing well packed computer ever. It works! He loves it!

This is my first Mac, and so far so good.,I’ve always had an iPhone since iPhone 3 (I think), and also have an iPad. Therefore I’m very familiar with iOS, so setting up the Mac was a breeze. However, I’ve only ever used Microsoft PC’s in the past, so switching from Windows to the Mac interface is a lil tricky at first. I’m slowly getting it, but liking it all so far.,If you’re already an iOS person, you’ll love a Mac. I do so far, and will probably never go back to PC (but one should never say never).,Cheers!

Shipping was prompt and easy set up. It's fast to turn on for sure. Needs to have more USB and C ports. Keyboard and mouse are wireless  but wish there was a way to know when to charge them and also when they have been fully charged notification for the most part its a decent computer

Probably would be good if the computer could update the OS, as it is, will be a brick by the end of this year, too sad....,Update - Boxed up and waiting on UPS to come pick up this expensive brick.  It's completely worthless but it is pretty, gotta give them that, shame it doesn't work, won't play movies or music and i keep getting errors saying I'm missing WINDOWS DLL'S!
Mine arrived crooked, mounting leans to one side. Otherwise the machine is wonderful performance-wise

Received my computer in 7 days. Ive been using it for 2 moths now. Great computer, awesome look but its expensive considering what you're getting. Cant upgrade cant fix.  I wonder how long this computer will last.,Have in mind that the computer only comes with 2 thunderbolt ports. If you use usb 3.0 goood luck finding a cheap port since good ones cost $300. I love the keyboard and mouse. Overall great computer but I just wished it was cheaper.
So far my new Mac has performed very well. I am still getting used to it. Very happy with the looks and ease of use.
Can't  get  it to pair with my old  computer.

Really a very nice computer but expensive compared to windows desktops.  Wonderful large display--a pleasure to watch. Also very fast. On the negative side, I wish it had more inputs instead of the two type c ports. You will need to buy various "dongle" extensions; but that's Apple machines these days -- form over function.

So the sound quality of these are really good! The noise cancellation feature is pretty impressive - there’s a wall unit ac at work where I tested it. I sat next to the unit with the fan humming and blowing quite loudly and turned on noise cancellation and *nothing*. During this same time, someone was standing next to me inches away and saying my name and it sounded faintly, like it was 20 feet away.,The reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is, even with the small tips in use, I had to keep adjusting both AirPods when I had them in while grocery shopping.

Of course there's going to be some limitations with a battery so small, especially when using intense functions like noise cancelling.  However, the battery life of the ear pods are nowhere near as long as half the battery life of the phone.  You will need to be near a charger, and it's too bad you cannot use your phone's built-in wireless charger to charge up the AirPods in a pinch.  I love the sound quality and noise cancellation.  HOWEVER, noise is ONLY being cancelled for you, and your caller on the other end will very loudly hear every single little background noise on your end even when you can't.  This is quite an aggravating mode of operation.  Since that noise is being cancelled for you and you cannot hear it, you're oblivious and make even more background noise.  If you're outside, you won't be annoyed by wind noise, but your caller will hear it amplified.

EDIT: After contacting Amazon for this issue, they offered me a replacement or refund, I went with refund. Bad part of the story is I canI have go thru all that jazz for to risk another used item. I will go for new version when it comes out from Apple Store.,ORIGINAL REVIEW:,I ordered a new AirPods Pro alongside with 3d printer related products and some finehair brushes.. All came in good shape except the Airpods Pro..,FIRST: Package had no stretch film on it to peel off. it was an open box with some dents, scratches and some stains on them ( as seen on pictures),SECOND: When I took the AirPod Pro's out surface had scratch marks and eartips had some dirt on them as well as the charging case. Also hinge had some dents too,THIRD: the earphones made from two parts in production.. there are seams/connection points of those parts on the device which should be barely visible.. In this device it looks like the earphones were disassembled before cause I can clearly see the parts are not well aligned on each earphone. You can clearly see those misaligned assembly surface error on the images.,AND LASTLY: when I try to connect the device to my iPhone. it showed it as "Theresa's AirPod Pros" on my device list.,This is a used item, sold by amazon as brand new, it can be even stolen item so far I can not know what the heck Amazon do here.,Horrible service so far.

I tried to not order these. Went through several pairs of cheaper ear buds. Finally went ahead and ordered these. Extremely impressed. First, noise cancellation is astounding. I have an air purifier running at all times and I put these on and thought I had kicked the cord with my foot and turned the air purifier off—nope! Just completely silent. I can still hear people speaking and my dog bark but it is at a reduced volume. But things like that air purifier hum are completely erased. Second, sound quality is out of this world. Crystal clear and perfect strong bass. Also listening to people talk on zoom sounds like they are in the room with you. I just purchased them so I have no input on battery life etc. But so happy with the product, wish I would have ordered them first and not went through frustrations with cheaper ones.

Best headset for having conversations on your phone. I’ve tried many brands of the same price range. These do not rank the highest in terms of comfort X or sound quality, but if you’re trying to have a conversation on your iPhone without annoying wind and background noise for the person you’re on the phone with, these are far superior to any other brand. They keep popping out of my ears, which is annoying. The good news is that the sound stops if you’re listening to music so that you know that you’ve lost one of the earpieces. It would be nice if you could adjust volume with the earpieces like other brands  Volume has to be controlled on the phone not the earpiece. It’s very easy to answer the phone for an incoming call without having to touch the earpiece or the phone. Just tell it to “answer”, and you are connected!

Rarely in today’s world of over inflated claims of product performance have I purchased a product that actually overachieved its hype.,I’ve been an avid audiophile for over 40yrs. and have purchased and used a huge variety of higher end speakers, sound systems, head phones and ear pods over that period of time.,The iPod pro ear pods produce a quality as sophistication of sound equal to over-ear headphones costing double the price or more. They easily compare to it surpass the performance of Stienhour, Sony, and Bose, wired, over the ear headphones that I’ve used in the past.,They are adjustable for fit and comfort. Very unobtrusive and intuitive to use. The battery life and charging time appear to be more than adequate for the 3-4 hour listening sessions that I use them for as I work.,These were a solid value at the $249 list price. I purchased mine on sale for $199 and now I’ve seen them advertised for as low as $159.,This really is a “must buy” for anyone looking for a high quality portable headphone solution.

You have to have had a few wireless ear-buds to appreciate how many orders of magnitude better this product is compared to others.,The Siri integration is fantastic.  The touch/force button works great. The receiving sound is perfectly clear, and enhanced by the noise cancellation. And the mic quality appears to be good, have had many conversations without issue.,The normal AirPods were good too, but they fell out of my ear too much.  These sit better in my ear, and stay in longer without issue.,There is still concern that something so expensive can be lost.  But for a few months it has been safe.,Obviously don’t get this product if you only use Android.,Also, some irritation with my other apple devices automatically connecting to these.

I ordered with Prime on November 25 and was supposed to receive delivery by November 27. After Amazon lost track of the delivery, some back and forth with Amazon customer service, posting a negative review on November 29 and canceling and re-ordering through customer service, my original order mysteriously arrived December 1. That required me to contact customer service again to cancel the replacement order. For all of the rigamaroll with Amazon, I deducted a point. While the Black Friday price made some hassle worthwhile, it shouldn’t be required. Amazon should just do what they say they will do. If you need a week for delivery, tell me you need a week. Don’t promise me 2 day delivery.,That said, the airbuds seem excellent so far. Good for calls, podcasts and comfy. They arrived already charged so I was able to start using them right away. Like other Apple products, they pretty much set themselves up.
When I connected to my phone for the first time, they were named “Stephanie’s air pods” and my name is not stephanie. Are these used air pods??

Having read all the negative reviews I wanted to let people know what my out of the box experience was. So no bubble wrap. The AirPods box just flipped and tossed around on it’s trip to my porch. Maybe some padding next time Amazon please. I purchased these from amazon bc the price was better. People were saying other peoples names popped up when they went to connect implying they are refurbished. This DID NOT happen to me, and it simply said “connect AirPods Pro”. Next people were claiming these are knock offs because it says made in Vietnam and not China. So this is actually the first year (2021) that apple started making products (AirPods/AirPods pro) in Vietnam, so as to not rely so heavily on Chinese firms. These are not a knock off. As for quality and sound. I will get back to you on that. Hope this helps!

The spatial audio feature sounds great but you have to re enable it all the time , for me the deal braker was that they don’t . These were supposed to be an upgrade from my first gen, which they are audio-wise when they actually work properly. Sound and features are good. Disappointed that they cut out frequently. Every so often only one airpod will connect. Sometimes one will drain battery much faster. The fit seemed to be fine and after some use my left ear became very sore and I realized that my left airpod was not streamlined where two pieces of the plastic connect and it was cutting my skin.

I would like to start off saying they sound a whole lot better then the first generation AirPods. The bass is a lot more prominent than pervious generations. Although I give it a four star because they do not fit in my ear because of their larger size. So with that being said people with smaller ears like me beware. Es primera vez que conecto estos audífonos con mi iPhone 13 pro nuevo se escucha excelente es una buena experiencia vere después el rendimiento de la batería,  si se que tienen muy buen alcance,  se sienten muy cómodos,  no puedo usar los Airpods pro sufro de vértigos estos son perfectos 👌  muy buena compra por ahora

They get uncomfortable and somewhat hurt after a few minutes. I will most likely return and get the airpod pros for more comfort

Love these!!! I wear them all the time. I still haven't learned how to tap them for whatever im trying to do, but it stops and starts the music just like I need em too! 😂 I've had them for a few months now and they still work great. Good battery life, great sound quality, noise canceling, and comfortable in my ear.

I guess these things only fit a certain type of ear? If not, these other reviews saying they work great haven’t had a lot of earbud experience, I would definitely compare them to something you’d buy at Walmart for like 20 bucks but the first and second gen airpods sound worlds better than these do also the noise cancellation just isn’t a thing i guess?

I was excited to use the 3rd gen AirPods after owning the 2nd gen AirPods for 2+ years. These were initially impressive, with spatial audio especially. However, the more I used and listened to music, the more I could notice their flaws. High frequency notes have a clipping/choppy sound at low/decent volume. Spatial stereo makes tracks sound tiny. However, battery life is great. Water resistance is an added bonus. If you're in the Apple ecosystem, these will switch flawlessly with modern Apple devices. In the end, for me, it comes down to audio. How music sounds is very important to me. These were just not the upgraded AirPods I had hoped for. Will be switching to the Sony WF-1000XM4 noise cancelling earbuds as my 2nd gen AirPods replacement.

great functions but i don't like that i have to keep charging his battery

At $477, these are still very expensive but enough for me to give it a try. Have been using these for two weeks and so far I like them a lot. I'm not an audiophile. To my average ears, sounds are crystal clear, immersive with great instruments separation. Bass can be heavy at time but very tight and no distortion. NC works quite well. Transparency mode is the best out of all the ones I've used before. They sound so natural just like you didn't have the headset on your head.,Downsides, these are heavy and the clamp force was a bit much for me at the beginning. I reduced the clamping force by bending it backward a few times and now they are quite comfortable.,Build quality is on another level compare to Bose and Sony.

I really enjoy these headphones and the quality sound they produce! The only thing I wish was a bit different, would be the ability to physically turn the headphones on or off. Currently, you have to put the headphones back in the case to retain charge. Also, for the price, it would be nice if they included a charging block, but this isn’t the biggest deal breaker. Overall, I am very satisfied with my purchase and would definitely purchase again.,One last thing, I would definitely recommend the apple care because if something goes wrong you will get a replacement pair for free. Worth it for such a hefty price tag.

Great product, but buyers be warned that they have a flaw, condensation builds up in the ear up after about an hour of use. I wasn’t doing anything intense that cause sweat just sitting down at my desk.

These are simply the best Bluetooth headphones you can buy. I love these headphones. The sound quality is magnificent. I use these daily at the gym without any issues. I listen to lots of music so I believe I know of what I speak. Expensive but worth it. You get what you pay for.

These headphone are beautiful, fit great, are very comfortable and do not hurt the top of my head or my ears. The sound quality is amazing and the noise cancellation is the best I have ever experienced. Easy to connect to all my apple devices and the battery life is an unreal 20 hours! I highly recommend these headphones.

I've always known this could be an issue - but it's been 20 years since I used over-the-ear headphones and I figured that technology had gotten to the point where I shouldn't be concerned - and it's Apple, c'mon - they design everything to be as user friendly as possible.,I was wrong - I am so disappointed that my ears get too warm to use this comfortably.,Also - if you wear readers and you take them on/off - having over-the-ear headphones is a chore.  Stick with ear buds.

There's only one thing wrong with these headphones that I've found...they press tight to your head and until you get used to them it can feel quite compressing.,That being said I'm sure that tight fit is WHY the noise cancellation and sound quality are so good. Seriously... these are outstanding headphones and although I didn't want to pay $550 for them... I was more than ok to pay nearer $400 now that the price came down for the holidays.

The sound was truly amazing but after wearing for a few days it became apparent it was not for me. I am working from home and so need a versatile headphone set. The music and sound quality plus noise reduction was beyond my other IPods. The issue was talking on calls, no one could hear me. I tried support and al was ok.,This and the fact after a while my ears hurt from having them on for hours.,Loved the sound but too much for just that.

Comfortable and convenient but after 16 days audio starts dropping randomly from right ear followed by overwhelming static and complete disconnect then restart. 28th day, they connect to devices but have no audio or anc.,Apples response because I didn't buy Apple care.  "Please ship them in for evaluation and repairs".,Thank goodness Amazon still cares about customer experience and gave me a full refund after the 30 days.

the build quality is insane.  These are hefty in a good way, they feel solid and well made.  The sound is great.  Noise cancellation works really well too.  Yeah, they are expensive as hell.  But the integration with my phone, iPad and computer is so seemless that it makes me not regret getting comparable (soundwise) but less expensive models.

I love this new iPad Pro, but it takes forever and an eternity for Apple to get these new pieces of beautiful tech in stock anywhere. Some complain about the blooming problem, but I don't do HDR and cannot afford a $10,000 Hasselblad to do that kind of content, so the brightness problem just does not affect me. This is a very nice 2 TB option, which Amazon only sells up to half a TB, unfortunately. I did buy a case and screen protector from here on Amazon, but have not reviewed them yet. Camera on the new iPad Pro is the one from the 2017 iPhone X, which is actually decent. Not in good light, still kind of blotchy. The native Camera App does not work with the 'tracking' that is new to the front-facing camera, but that is because you need certain third-party Apps that can utilize it. Not much else to say, I love iPads. Oh, the speakers on this thing almost as good and loud as my 27" iMac! Five stars, very little to complain about as far as the product goes. Being hard to find is a Samsung issue and is irrelevant to rating this item. Thank you.

This is my 5th ipad since the original, but this is my first iPad Pro. I finally bit the bullet and I am very happy with my purchase, sure it is expensive, but keep in mind this  is the type of device you have to use for awhile to see why they charge what they do. If you already have a recent iPad pro, it may not be worth the cost of an upgrade, but if you are on the fence on whether to spend iPad pro money, I would say to give it a shot if you like to watch media and do anything that you may do on your phone, just much bigger and better scale. What convinced me to make this purchase and go for top of the line was I wanted a tablet to use to properly stream xbox and playstation games remotely and it does not disappoint doing that a bit. I am very happy with my new iPad, so far it is one of my best Apple product experiences.

Why would you sell a year old iPad Pro 11? The answer is you wouldn’t unless you had an opportunity to own the incredible 12.9 inch iPad Pro with Apple’s M1 chip. I’m used to fast iPads but this tablet uses the same chip that powers its fastest desk and laptops.,I have used my iPads over many years in my law practice for everything “except heavy lifting.” By that I mean major written work like briefs and extensively memoranda.  For these i use my 13 inch MacBook Pro.,However, I can’t say that anymore. Here’s why. I’ve added a keyboard to my new iPad Pro and I ended up with a hybrid laptop which is only slightly smaller than the MBP, It is however more powerful and faster than either the MPB or the iPad Pro 11.  Both are on the market.

Hardware,No hiccups yet. The m1 chip might be a beast.,Screen,Probably the best part of the tablet. It’s a 1440p 120hz display. Very fluid and clear. Bright and colorful. I only wish it was 4K.,Battery,On max brightness the battery drains quite fast. Charges fast at least.,Design,The best looking apple device in my opinion.,Sound,Stereo speakers are nice.,Value,A great device, but you’re gonna pay the apple tax. You’re most likely gonna buy a keyboard and pencil as well. Consider the iPad Air or MacBook Air.

Nice, well made tablet. Large display looks good. Overpriced. Was excited about the high end display and the M1 chip, but I don't really notice anything of this with daily use. Maybe there are apps that I haven't found that would make the display and M1 chip stand out. So far, it's JUST a tablet for me. Procreate is great, but it's a $10 app that's similar to so many other apps. Pay over $1000 for the tablet and then asked to subscribe to news, arcade games, online storage...  Don't regret my purchase. Wish it didn't cost so much. Guess I expected more after all the promos.

I purchased this to replace my 1st gen 12.9 iPad Pro. I also purchased the Apple Keyboard.  Yes that is a $1500 purchase, but the two together are wonderful.  After learning a few trackpad gestures I hardly ever need to use the touch screen - although it its there if you need it.  The display, battery life and speed are over-the-top great.  I have not noticed the “blooming” that is critiqued here.

Okay I’ve had this iPad for a little over 3 weeks now  and yes you can notice bloom around things.,But let’s be honest this thing is amazing. I personally can care less about the blooming. Although I think it probably shouldn’t be there for the price we pay for these things but like I said I can honestly care less about it. I don’t think people should be giving this 1 star because of it but just my opinion. I’m coming from a regular iPad so this is a huge upgrade for me

The Ipad appears to be functional and adequate but with a less than optimal battery life.  My wife purchased an ipad pro for me in August for a birthday.  At the time, Apple was offering free air pods with the purchase of an ipad pro.  However, when I contacted Apple technical support a few minutes ago, they reported that you only got the air pods if you ordered directly through Apple.

I love it, absolutely love it! The only thing is, the M1 chip is too powerful for a tablet. I did a 2018 vs 2021 iPad Pro comparison video on my YouTube channel under my name Nic Studio if you guys are interested.

I do not find this M1 processor to be any faster than on my 2020 version, nor is this “super beautiful screen” any different. I do photo manipulation and expected a faster, more brilliant iPad. WRONG. keep what you have. It is not worth the big bucks!

3 Weeks In…It’s official, the New 2021 iPad Pro 12.9 Is currently the Best Tablet In The World. But please do not get this confused! This is much more than a Tablet. This is a full blown laptop replacement. It took a while, but they did it. The M1 Apple (in house) Processor, the 1000 nits of brightness with a 1,000,000 to 1 contrast ratio screen. This is the NEW, the amazing, 2021 iPad Pro LED screen with that huge size! A newly made learning experience all for the best… My previous iPad (Sold for $200) was a 6th Gen standard iPad that was used primarily for surfing the web and streaming high res music from Tidal. I am a true music lover. I collect high end DAC’s, Amps and Headphones, mostly wired. When I first pre-ordered the New iPad, for some reason I went with the 11 in. Why? Probably because it was $300 less expensive for one reason! Secondly, I convinced myself that a 12.9 screen size was just too big! Too big for everyday tasks and just too huge to lug around. I admit it now, I was dead wrong. The 11 in. had to go back. It was a sad day. I thought I had thought this one out. I was wrong. After 1 week with that 2021 iPad Pro 11 I felt almost cheated. I knew I was spending a lot of cash, but was it spent on the wrong device? I had hunger pains for the 12.9. It was meant to be! Then I did it, after tons of YouTube videos and 100’s of articles… I packaged up that pre-orderd 11 in and proceeded to right then and there order the Brand New 2021 12.9 in, right here on Amazon. It was a painless transaction. When it arrived, I knew I was all in. Yes sir, this was, is the Tablet of all Tablets to beat. Now hear this, I love Samsung as a company and have a Galaxy S20+ 5G phone made by  them. Only 1 year old. I just love that SAMOLED display. I love the speed. I did not just love, well, anything else. Google dropped a very large, heavy ball when they neglected to focus on Tablet Apps. Mostly, at about 85% the Android apps are written with no regard or monitoring, for a 7 inch screen. The New iPad Pro has a 12.9 in screen, so no, that just wont work. Samsung battles on, producing some of the very first finest tablets and smartphones to come to market. Most of the other vendors have given up. Asus and LG were the last two standing next to Samsung. They just could not compete. That ended within the last few years but like I mentioned earlier, Samsung pushed on! I am the proud owner of a very nice Samsung Galaxy Tab S4 11in. in ALL of its beauty and speed. Photos look great, movies have deep blacks and general content is certainly better than just fine. The problem is, its a phone. It’s a 7in. by 2.5in. phone, and its still using phone apps. You should understand that when your the last in line holding that Tablet, you NEED to rely on what’s right in front of you. That great display just cannot provide the much needed app content to match the iPad. Myself, I am a convert. I was dead set against Apple for many years. Then came my 2019 MacBook Pro 15. I want to stress this point please… I was and still am so enamored by the amazing (non-touch) beautiful LED display, the raw power of Intels Quad Core  i7, the 512gb SSD and of course the 16GB of 4th gen. onboard RAM. To this day, I STILL very much love that Apple laptop. It rarely fails me, its always updated and “oh my” that screen is just gorgeous! No Windows based laptop could compete. Not my Microsoft Surface Pro 7, not my Dell Inspiron 4K UHD monster touch screen laptop. None of them could compete. I was transformed into a Mac lover. For sure I did not set out to be one, but I can proudly say today, I am. As technology advances at a blistering fast pace, one needs to keep up or, be left in the dust. That is exactly when and where the iPad Pro comes in. An amazingly fast laptop M1 processor, 256GB SSD, 8GB Dual Channel 5th Gen RAM. A touch screen that begs to be touched. Accessories albeit overpriced designed for a specific Tablet. There is no shortage OR doubt that Apple is making more money than ever hand over fist. The benefit to that is that so much of that money goes in to R & D (Research & Development). Picture this, if you will, a boardroom with 22 fine Corinthian leather chairs seated around a huge Mahogany board room table. Fast forward and Apple CEO’s and CFO’s tell the lucky 20 others at the end of that meeting this. “We think we have a true winner here. We want you to take these home and live with them, for 2 weeks minimum to a month maximum.” The meeting closes and the lucky 20 walk out with what will eventually become the 12.9 2021 iPad Pro. After a month, they are all brought back in to that meeting room. They discuss all the (mainly Pros) and Cons. Small improvements here, a few deletions there and then we have it. That laptop replacement I spoke about in the start of this review. Yes, you can have your cake AND eat it too. The attention to build quality detail is practically flawless. The utter speed of that Apple designed and implemented M1 Processor. The mind blowing mini LED screen that rivals that from LG OLED HDTVs.  This tablet will take your breath away. You will be transformed in to a lover of everything iPad. There is far too much to much too list in one Amazon review. It would not be fair for me to try to cram EVERYTHING into one hand written, typed review. These are Amazon Reviews and should not be the length of a book or you will pass the review by for a few shorter ones. To all of you that made it this far in my review, I applaud you. Thank you for hanging in there! That is exactly Apples philosophy. Make darn sure every 20 members in that room are unanimous. A very resounding YES, we hit the ball right on the screws and it has left the ballpark. More balls come and they too get smashed out of the park. Is it unfair for Apple to have this much leverage and without a doubt over-charge the consumer in return for pure, unbridled greatness? Probably. Let me finish with this please…Most of us work very hard for a paycheck, salary, fee or whatever. It is all Green in the end. Picture this… Two tablets are sitting in front of you and you are practically drooling over those displays. Your feel like you’ve seen this movie before. The software opens up. You look down, then back up as you contemplate all those pros and cons surrounding a 12.9 in iPad Pro and a 12 in Samsung Galaxy S7 Pro. Same price! The decision may not be so easy, but I will add one more piece to this puzzle that was missing. The operating System and the 1 Million or so apps made SPECIFICALLY for an Apple Tablet screen.  IPad is on the right, Samsung Galaxy Tab S7 on the left. Same price. Which one are you going to be confident of that your hard earned green is placed in the proper pocket? They both boot up and the screens are stunning and just blow you away. Then the dust settles and you are all alone (*in your head). Be honest here, when and if you have that choice between 2 of the best Tablets. Not Laptop PCs doing double duty as a tablet and PC. No. This is a contest between 2 of the very best Tablets in the world! Which one would you pull the trigger on. The Android Version convoluted with unknown device software that varies SO MUCH from device to device, A somewhat confusing Windows 10 Pro that may or may be not “up to date” with proper antivirus software, a necessity! Or do you look at the iPad in the middle with the Magic Keyboard or Logitech keyboard case. You look left, you look right, then you look back again to front and center at that very New 2021 very large 12.9 in screen that cries out to just be touched. Which device will you choose>? Are you going to remain an uninspired Apple hater, or are you all wrapped up in Windows? At this point, Android has left the building. Windows 10 Pro hangs in there against iPad OS 14.5. Two tablets left. I look to the left, then to the right. I am sweating now and my heart is racing. Which one is begging me to “future proof” and buy into the whole operating system experience? Yes, this actually happened to me. A very long time Microsoft PC and laoptop owner. A lover of Samsung Galaxy Pro PHONES. And then I cave. To realize all that money could bestow my love but too needing to choose one device in the now, and  one in the end. That device is the 2021 iPad Pro 12.9. Exploring all it can do every day learning something new I feel invigorated. My inspiration for a Tablet (and a keyboard) cries out to be touched and learned. I am excited, frustrated, a long deep breath as I work through this NEW “learning experience” second to none. Yes, the 2021 iPad Pro LED 12.9 inch display takes my breath away. Be it pure geek/beast mode now. Then, at that very moment when I hand over my credit card I know…I know in my gut I made the right decision. That decision, again, is that 12.9 2021 iPad Pro. I have arrived and there is no looking back. One and done. My confidence returns and I am practically begging to learn more. This is my true story. I hope I helped someone, anyone! To understand just how difficult that One Grand gets spent. Apple gets richer and its back to the boardroom because there is talk of a new M1X chip. The tablet has not even arrived at your front door and Apple is already back in that boardroom discussing the near and far future of Apple Devices. The line blurs. Is it a Tablet or a Laptop? I will leave it up to YOU to make that decision! Remember this please, enjoy your purchase and learn all about it. Get the very most out of that big purchase. Your future you will thank you.

Highly recommend.

My 16'" Macbook M1 pro, 16gb ram, 512ssd 10 cpu/16 gpu,  Space Grey was purchased from a big box retailer. I wanted to review here because I feel the one star reviews are not well thought out.,DOA's happen - I actually prefer that up front while Applecare and the retailer returns are all in full force. The more interesting detail I'd like to hear is how well did Apple/Retailer handle replacement?,As for the USB/Thunderbolt oval ports upgrade, inexpensive dongles are here and can be shipped Prime just like the computer itself. That is fully detailed in the specs and connectivity pictures - heck the MacAir prior to M1 was already using this oval port. The new ports (3) are high speed / power and versatile for displays and storage. Also we are not losing one to power - we are back to magsafe, which I really like. Ports are also there for HDMI and SD cards - again very useful. One negative is the two USB3 ovals on the left side are close - too close for two adaptors. And a sound port. Overall a real win port wise,Sound. The same way they are improving thin TVs inboard sound this laptop has killer sound compared to past models. Really full with nice bass and well defined.,Retina display. 16.2 inch and awesome sharp, fantastic color, contrast, and wide angle.,Weight - 16 inch has one draw back, almost 5 pounds.  Not a problem for me but it's no Air.,Battery - as advertised plays movies, browses, games all day long and is barely warm on the lap - very nice.,Security/Keyboard - Fingerprint reader has been very reliable and keyboard lighting and feel is great. Trackpad is accurate and very large.,Compatibility - So far decent but I'm just beginning to explore.  VLC does a lovely job playing video/audio, Steam is supposedly poor but I've had some initial luck with my favorites - Wingspan, Tabletop Simulator, Pinball Arcade (warned it not might run in 32bit mode and then proceeded to run flawlessly after a few dozen keychain authorizations), Scythe all run under Steam. So far LibreOffice hasn't worked - I may need a reinstall or it may be problematic. For now My Chrome is working alongside Safari so browser choices are solid.  Notes, Numbers and Apple's apps are solid so I can wait on LibreOffice.,Value - What can you say here Apple gear is always salty, but I tend to find the quality hard to resist.,A new ARM processer that is this solid out of the gate with unreal efficiency and cool operation is promising. I'm sure there will be more old software with issues but I am encouraged by how much old and third party software runs.  So - don't let a few problems out there hold you back - this is the future of Apple.,Five Stars.

Bought this from the Apple store, since Amazon was taking forever on the 1TB model.,Pros: It does exactly what Apple advertises: quiet.  The laptop is power efficient, does not heat up much (if any at all), has good battery life, powerful CPU, and GPU for work loads such as video editing, and the speakers are good (for a laptop that is). The CPU is not the best when compared to the Ryzen 9 5900HS, or 11th Gen i9; however, the fact that the M1 Pro CPU can deliver great performance (which rivals the competition) and be highly power efficient, is a Big Plus.  Unlike other laptops, whether I plugin the laptop, or not, I’m certain to get the max performance.,Cons: Price is a bit steep for many, but then again, there are Dell Precision laptops which are at the same price point.  Some parts (edges, and heat vents) of the laptop feels a bit sharp, and there’s zero upgradability.,Overall, for what I’m planning to use it for, it’s a great laptop.  But for the average user, unless you have money to burn, $2700 is quite a bit to spend on a laptop.

I'm not a video content user, or do any heavy video editing that may tax the processor or GPU. I'm more a casual user, so the full power and potential features of this laptop will never be used by me. So why would I spend a whopping $2,500 on a 16-inch laptop? Two reasons, my old 2012 MacBook Pro has reached obsolesce and after December 2021 Apple will no longer support it (no more security updates). Secondly, I am heavily into the Apple ecosystem. iPad, iPhone, iMac and I really like how all my devices work together seamlessly. Also, I'm an older guy (euphemism for senior citizen) and I really like and prefer a larger screen size on my laptop as opposed to portability. Having got all that out of the way, let me share this, this laptop is AMAZING. The screen display is incredibly sharp with vivid colors. It has a comfortable keyboard with good backlighting. The very large glass track pad is very responsive, and Apple's software is excellent at palm rejection, so your resting hands do not interfere when your typing. The sound output through the speakers is very, very impressive, almost unbelievable for laptop. The laptop's aluminum frame is solid. It is a big, bulky laptop, so if you're on the go and looking for a laptop to lug around everyday, I recommend you look at the 13-inch Mac laptops. Buying a laptop at this price range is a huge investment and I recommend that potential buyers do their due diligence and compare features and costs of both Macs and Windows PCs, especially if you're not in the Apple ecosystem. But, If, however you want a larger 16-inch screen and a Mac laptop then your choices will be the 2020 (Intel) or 2021 MacBook Pro (M1 Pro) and of the two, I recommend the M1 Pro version. Once I got over the sticker shock, I really am very happy with my 2021 MacBook. My recommendation? Two thumbs up!

Last Macbook Pro I had was from 2015, so this 2021 one is definitely an upgrade. I got 64GB RAM and 2TB storage, so the price was an upgrade. Overall: faster, smoother, and SILENT. There's no fan concern anymore as compared to the old models. That alone is the best aspect.,Dumb drawbacks:,- The Paintbrush program, arguably the most simple and unsophisticated program on the Macbook, has a bug/flaw where I cannot add text to a new project without the program closing. This never happened once on the old computer. Repeatedly, if you try to add text, the program just closes. Considering I paid a fortune for this computer, this was utterly mindblowing. I couldn't remove + re-add the program either, since it's a fixed Mac program in the hardware. So I downloaded some other random paint-type program from the app store. Just dumb.,- The lack of USB-A ports is incredibly stupid and an inconvenience. It's so obvious that Mac just wants to make money off of selling their adapters. One might argue this isn't a big deal, but I never had to deal with adapters on the Macbook Pro 2015. So the fact that I've paid a fortune for this new computer and I don't have a functional Paintbrush program + need to use adapters now is just inconvenient and dumb, considering how much time and technology goes into these computers. It's like, why inconvenience people?,- I needed to purchase new subscriptions to various programs in order to use them on my new computer. For example, I had a Microsoft Word license on the 2015 Macbook. But it wouldn't carry over to the 2021 computer. If you had purchased a one-off license for use on one device instead of an online yearly subscription, you'll find you have to re-purchase Microsoft 365. A couple other programs also didn't work and I had to re-purchase and download.,I give the computer 4 stars because of these inconveniences in comparison to the price. If the price is a lot lower, there's less to complain about. But I paid a lot of money and expect a flawless device, not a bugged paint program and the annoyance of needing to use adapters now.

Been using my new Macbook Pro for only a week now but it hasn't skipped a beat and I wanted to get in this early review.  I edit videos in DaVinci Resolve and am a full time music engineer and work in Logic Pro.  For these tasks this computer is an absolute beast.  I own a Mac Pro tower decked out with every option I could throw at it a few years ago for much more money than this new laptop costs and it can't even hold a candle to it.  I am very impressed with the ease it completes all my tasks.,Besides performance I am thrilled that things like Magsafe and a host of ports were reintroduced to the body.  I actually am really enjoying the screen and the physical shape, weight and the speakers are nice and full.  The quick charge has already saved me a couple times and the battery lasts so long, even on my CPU/GPU heavy tasks.  If you work with heavy programs like I do and time is money, then this thing is a no brainer.

I’m a computer technician for over 25 years now and I can build myself the best PCs. Yet I own the latest MacBook Pro 16 inch and I love it. These machines are amazing in every way. Keep in mind no product is perfect but these come close. I can’t stand to use windows 10 or 11 anymore. Once you go Mac, it’s very hard to go back to PC. The only use case I can think of where someone would want a PC laptop is gaming. Everything else Mac wins. There isn’t a windows laptop that even comes close to these machines. The funniest thing for me is how Windows laptops need to be plugged in for the best performance and they still lose to M1. It’s a laptop! Having to plug it in for it to perform well is ridiculous. Mac performs the same, plugged in or not.

This is an amazing machine; however, my unit appears to have a flaw. It does not charge when shut down and the case is closed.  Many people on forums have the same problem. Fortunately, Apple has been very good about addressing this problem with me.

Overall the machine is nice, even revolutionary.  However, the notch is there, I still cannot believe it's apple's design. How can apple make that?,Let's just admit having a notch on top of a laptop screen is a terrible idea, no matter what excuse you use.

Will update as I use it but so far this thing is honestly a bigger bump from my 2013 15 inch MBP to my 2019 I9 MBP. ONLY USED A couple days will update later but so far the battery life is so good, the screen is godly, and the keyboard is so much better than the 2019 version. Basically anything you want in a laptop. I got the cheapest (cheapest lol) model, but basically that's saying a low end Ferrari since the cheapest is what most people would need (even more than most honestly). I do not game but use for work and need the larger monitor.,Just waiting on the case to come in not many options at this time but its just insane how much BETTER it is than an i9 version from 2019 (which itself was excellent minus battery life).,Biggest pluses,Screen is iPad quality, similar to my 2021 iPad Pro M1, speakers good, battery life great, and keyboard is MUCH better than that stupid dumb board they had in previous models.,Thusfar well worth the money esp with college faculty discount.

Positives:,--All aluminum chassis,--Apple Silicon,--Apple Security,--Regular Keyboard,--Speakers/Sound,--Track-pad.,--Battery Life,--SD Card Slot,--Ventilation and No loud fans,--HDMI Port,Negatives:,--Top Notch. It invades screen space. Can't enjoy the screen real estate if it is being invaded.,--MagSafe Port may not charge batteries if laptop completely powered off or so the rumor goes.,--No Anodized Black Metal Chassis option (Macs have been a shady grey color for way too long. Either that or the default tuna tin can color).,--No USB-A ports. Lack of utility.,--No color matching of the cords and power brick to the laptop color. So vanilla.,Premium priced laptops are all about design design design. This year's design doesn't work for me. Maybe next year when Apple comes up with something more palatable, it can take my money.
