I need a MacBook for programming and the hobby of making music. Think between past 2020 and this one. Is the curtain so critical, and is there a big difference with the previous model, without loud hype?

This year's MacBook Pro with M1 Pro/Max merges the display technology and battery life that makes iPad Pro beautiful with the form factor and keyboard of a true professional laptop, plus the outstanding Apple Silicon architecture that blows Intel PCs out of the water.,Before I switched to the Mac in 2019, I was a devoted fan on the ThinkPad line of business-grade notebooks. I still love their outstanding durability and their substantial, boxy design that means business. I was thrilled to see some of that design language--plus more useful ports and a return to Apple's own MagSafe.,The hardest part for me was deciding between the 14" and the 16". I ultimately settled on the 16" (middle priced model with 10core/16core, 16GB, 1TB model) and I'm happy with the choice. I did briefly look at the 14" while I was picking up my order from the Apple Store, and I was really impressed with its portability. Once shipping times return to normal and there's no rush to order, I would suggest taking a look at them in-person. I think the 14" this year offers far more value than the 13", even the M1 13" from last year. But I had already gotten used to the weight of a 16" machine and I enjoy being able to multitask several windows without needing an external display. I really would have liked 32GB RAM, but $400 plus waiting weeks for custom build shipping was just ridiculous.,Macs have long set the standard for display quality in a notebook. They feature calibrated, high quality displays with the P3 color gamut and now, these displays are even better. With this year's MacBook Pro, the ProMotion feature (a variable refresh rate of up to 120Hz--double the standard 60Hz, but also allowing even lower refresh rates when nothing is moving on the screen) that has long distinguished the iPad Pro line and this year the iPhone Pro finally comes to the MacBook Pro. The display can do HDR content with sustained 1000 nits and peak 1600 nits brightness. Supposedly, regular SDR content shows at the same 500 nits max as prior models, but subjectively the display does seem brighter and bolder than the 2019.,Apple says that the speakers and keyboard have been improved vs the Intel 2019 model, while the touchpad remains the same. The keyboard is visibly different--black instead of unpainted metal in between the keys--but structurally is still part of the unibody. Apple overstated the improvements in the keynote, but its certainly no worse than the Magic Keyboards used on the 2019 Intel model, and I do think there is more key travel and a bit more key noise than the 2019 MBP 16. The speakers are likewise just as good as before, and I do think they have a bit more power to them. They can easily rival my HomePod mini stereo pair for listening to music at my desk.,If you are on the Internet at all, you already know that this years models removed the Touch Bar and added a display notch. The thing is, it makes more sense to say they added rabbit ears because the notch area was always non-display, it just used to be part of the bezel. It only takes a small amount of menu bar space (if you are worried about that, I recommend Bartender 4 which can restore the old menu bar spacing and hide unneeded items). As for Touch Bar, I feel kind of bad for the few developers who really put a lot of time into it, but it clearly didn't take off and didn't make sense to keep investing in it. There were a few things I really liked such as the emoji picker (though it often froze while scrolling),On another note, the FaceTime camera is drastically improved (now 1080p) and among the best in a laptop. but still weak compared to an iPhone or iPad. Now that there is a dedicated notch area for camera space, I wish Apple would but the best-in-class cameras it already knows how to make on the Mac. Even the massive 12.9" iPad Pro has the cameras from the iPhone now, so the Mac could too. I haven't tested the mics, but the marketing language is exactly the same as in 2019 so I doubt there are any substantive changes to the design.,Oh, and did I mention this laptop is SILENT. Like seriously, I have not heard the fans turn on yet. My Intel Mac was constantly running them and was too hot for bare legs during everyday web browsing, let alone anything "pro.",I am definitely satisfied with the purchase, and I will come back to upload some photos when I get home.

First ever review on Amazon. I came from Bose QC15's I bought about 8-9 years ago and decided it was time to get a new pair of over ear headphones. I'm a huge Apple fan and when Apple released the AirPods Max, I was very interested. Sure the price tag was expensive, but when I got these out of the box and put them on....the range, soundstage, and feel was incredible. Worth every penny.

The AirPods Max are quality headphones. Amazing ANC, Spatial Audio, build quality, and connectivity. If you buy used like I did, the previous owner could have enabled lost mode, and will transmit location data to their Apple ID; be careful when buying used vs. new. Other than that, they have clean sound in the high and mid-range, but bass could be increased a moderate bit. Overall, not worth the $550 price tag, but if you can find it for less than $450, they aren't too bad. Found mine for $426 after taxes and discounts.

Sound quality is on par with the Pros though slightly airy-er due to not being as sealed tight. Overall great upgrade from the prior generations if you have slightly bigger ears, only if you can get it for a largely discounted price (140USD). At the regular price, even if silicon tips aren't your thing, the Pros are a much bang for your buck at that price point.

I love this watch better than I even expected. I come from owning Android watches used on both Android and iPhone. I will list some pros and cons.,Pros:,Very comfortable,I like the OS on the watch,Software on the phone is good,Implementation of complications is good,Heath app good enough when compared to my Android watches,sensitive touch screen.,Charging speed.,Neutral:,Battery life. About average for a true smartwatch.,Cons:,1. No USB-C charger included. This is a star removal on its own. This is total garbage for something this expensive. They can use the excuse of minimizing electronic waste, but it is to save/make money.,2. None of my third party USB-C chargers (all output 15w or more) work for charging. However, my MacBook charger and MacBook itself charges the watch fine via its USB-C. So guess what, I have to buy an Apple branded charger.,3. Compared to my Android watches the amount of included watch faces is sparce, and the ones that are there are subpar in comparison. There are some good ones, but not as many good quality ones on Android.,4. No keyboard on the SE version. I have a keyboard on every Android watch I have owned, and that includes my cheapest one. Ones to download seem to cost, and want you to buy before you even try it out (unless I am doing something wrong here),5. Scribble is terrible. Get to a one, zero, etc, and good luck. For some apps you can't use voice, so scribble is a must. Can work fine with just using text if no characters, and if a number doesn't look similar to a number.,I love this watch, and it may not look seem that I like it due to the negative, but I really like this best out of every watch I have owned. It is missing basic features that my wife's less expensive, and very nice, Galaxy Watch 4 has at a much cheaper price, but with Apple it is what it is. No power brick or better 3rd party charging support is nothing new for Apple, but it does hamper the experience and satisfaction a bit.

We have been buying gifts for everyone this year, so I bought this for myself and discovered I have great taste when giving gifts. Battery life could be better, but isn’t that true of everything?  It’s also a stealth way to appear disconnected, while still being in the loop. In short, an amazing device that you didn’t know you needed.

Un smartwatch con calidad desde su caja, hermoso, calidad de imagen excelente, se puede contestar mensjaes de WhatsApp, solo con la voz o escribiendo en el mismo reloj, se puede hacer llamadas directamente desde el reloj con Siri.. Se puede hablar y escuchar a través del reloj, se escucha nítido y ellos nos escuchan muy bien también, ideal para cuando estés manejando y no puedas usar el teléfono. Eso si, la batería dura 1 día, es como nuestros celulares que al final del día deben ser cargados, pero para las funciones que ofrecen vale la pena. Deberás tener un cubito de algún iPhone previamente para cargarlo ya que viene solo con el cable de carga, pero si ya tienes un iPhone podrás usar ese cubito. Adicional viene con 2 correas una M y una L para muñecas grandes si así lo requieren. Feliz con la compra

I was definitely one of those people that was completely against getting an Apple Watch. I just felt like it was a huge waste of money. Although, after fiddling around with my mom’s Apple Watch SE (40mm) I knew I had to have one.,It’s so much more convenient being able to take phone calls without having to sprint like a track star to a separate room in order to be able to answer before the person calling hangs up. It’s also quite handy being able to stream music directly from my watch without having to carry around my massive Iphone.,I haven’t tried out the Sleep Tracker just yet because I haven’t been able to bring myself to sleep with it on as that’s just not my norm but I am working on getting used to having it on my arm at all times.,The build quality is glorious and the graphics on the screen are so crisp and clear. I will admit that the 44mm, in which I chose, can be a bit heavy on the wrist. I have kind of a bony wrist and it tends to shift directly onto my Pisiform Bone and that can be a bit of a bother at times but it’s more of a nit pick than a real problem.,The band I chose was the Nylon Sport Loop in Mazie/White. The color is immaculate and so whimsical but is a bit itchy to my sensitive skin, even when it’s not pulled too tight. I’d also recommend not getting any Nylon bands in light colors if you tend to get them dirty easily because this band will most definitely get filthy quick.,After all was said and done I paid a grand total of $336.00 for the Gold, 44mm, SE. I actually purchased it directly from the Apple Online Store and will preface that if you decide to do that, be prepared to wait at least two weeks, sometimes three depending on demand.,Mine shipped directly from the warehouses in China and took a week and a half to arrive. Whereas, my mother ordered hers from Amazon and received it within 2 business days.,I was told by an Apple representative though that ordering from elsewhere doesn’t guarantee you an up to date watch. My watch came with the new USB Type-C charging cable while my mother’s watch came with a regular USB cable. Also, my watch has the True Tone Technology while my mother’s just stays at either dim or bright at all times.,If you’re in the fence about this watch, just take the leap and get it while it’s still a bargain.

Although I didn’t buy it from Amazon, I don’t think that matters. Apple does not provide the proper charging equipment to use this device. I bought this for my wife’s birthday and she asked me how do I charge it and there was no hardware to do this with outbbuying more hardware/accessories. For that reason alone this product gets a one star for ruining my wife’s birthday. Sleep tracking blah blah blah Amazon wants me to mention this. Very disappointing.

I ordered an Apple Watch SE directly from the Apple Store because they offered a trade in program.  Got notice today, they weren’t going to give me my trade in because the watch wasn’t wiped clean the way they wanted and did I want them to keep it.  There was no mention of this issue when they sent me instructions with the return box.  Now I am out $70, but the watch is coming back to me.  I will NEVER  place an order with this deceptive and corrupt place of business ever again!  I am shocked as I have always liked their products but their watches haven’t had the longevity of their other products and the Apple Store is awful!

No idea if I like it because it arrives low on battery with no means to charge it. Very surprised this was not mentioned in the reviews. You must purchase a C block adapter for $20 to plug into the wall to charge the device. Writing in hopes of saving you a similar disappointing experience.

Now I know Apple watches are not cheap but in my opinion it is worth every penny.

I love this watch better than I even expected. I come from owning Android watches used on both Android and iPhone. I will list some pros and cons.,Pros:,Very comfortable,I like the OS on the watch,Software on the phone is good,Implementation of complications is good,Heath app good enough when compared to my Android watches,sensitive touch screen.,Charging speed.,Neutral:,Battery life. About average for a true smartwatch.,Cons:,1. No USB-C charger included. This is a star removal on its own. This is total garbage for something this expensive. They can use the excuse of minimizing electronic waste, but it is to save/make money.,2. None of my third party USB-C chargers (all output 15w or more) work for charging. However, my MacBook charger and MacBook itself charges the watch fine via its USB-C. So guess what, I have to buy an Apple branded charger.,3. Compared to my Android watches the amount of included watch faces is sparce, and the ones that are there are subpar in comparison. There are some good ones, but not as many good quality ones on Android.,4. No keyboard on the SE version. I have a keyboard on every Android watch I have owned, and that includes my cheapest one. Ones to download seem to cost, and want you to buy before you even try it out (unless I am doing something wrong here),5. Scribble is terrible. Get to a one, zero, etc, and good luck. For some apps you can't use voice, so scribble is a must. Can work fine with just using text if no characters, and if a number doesn't look similar to a number.,I love this watch, and it may not look seem that I like it due to the negative, but I really like this best out of every watch I have owned. It is missing basic features that my wife's less expensive, and very nice, Galaxy Watch 4 has at a much cheaper price, but with Apple it is what it is. No power brick or better 3rd party charging support is nothing new for Apple, but it does hamper the experience and satisfaction a bit.

It’s also a stealth way to appear disconnected, while still being in the loop. In short, an amazing device that you didn’t know you needed.

Adicional viene con 2 correas una M y una L para muñecas grandes si así lo requieren. Feliz con la compra

I was definitely one of those people that was completely against getting an Apple Watch. I just felt like it was a huge waste of money. Although, after fiddling around with my mom’s Apple Watch SE (40mm) I knew I had to have one.,It’s so much more convenient being able to take phone calls without having to sprint like a track star to a separate room in order to be able to answer before the person calling hangs up. It’s also quite handy being able to stream music directly from my watch without having to carry around my massive Iphone.,I haven’t tried out the Sleep Tracker just yet because I haven’t been able to bring myself to sleep with it on as that’s just not my norm but I am working on getting used to having it on my arm at all times.,The build quality is glorious and the graphics on the screen are so crisp and clear. I will admit that the 44mm, in which I chose, can be a bit heavy on the wrist. I have kind of a bony wrist and it tends to shift directly onto my Pisiform Bone and that can be a bit of a bother at times but it’s more of a nit pick than a real problem.,The band I chose was the Nylon Sport Loop in Mazie/White. The color is immaculate and so whimsical but is a bit itchy to my sensitive skin, even when it’s not pulled too tight. I’d also recommend not getting any Nylon bands in light colors if you tend to get them dirty easily because this band will most definitely get filthy quick.,After all was said and done I paid a grand total of $336.00 for the Gold, 44mm, SE. I actually purchased it directly from the Apple Online Store and will preface that if you decide to do that, be prepared to wait at least two weeks, sometimes three depending on demand.,Mine shipped directly from the warehouses in China and took a week and a half to arrive. Whereas, my mother ordered hers from Amazon and received it within 2 business days.,I was told by an Apple representative though that ordering from elsewhere doesn’t guarantee you an up to date watch. My watch came with the new USB Type-C charging cable while my mother’s watch came with a regular USB cable. Also, my watch has the True Tone Technology while my mother’s just stays at either dim or bright at all times.,If you’re in the fence about this watch, just take the leap and get it while it’s still a bargain.

Although I didn’t buy it from Amazon, I don’t think that matters. Apple does not provide the proper charging equipment to use this device. I bought this for my wife’s birthday and she asked me how do I charge it and there was no hardware to do this with outbbuying more hardware/accessories. For that reason alone this product gets a one star for ruining my wife’s birthday. Sleep tracking blah blah blah Amazon wants me to mention this. Very disappointing.

There was no mention of this issue when they sent me instructions with the return box.  Now I am out $70, but the watch is coming back to me.  I will NEVER  place an order with this deceptive and corrupt place of business ever again!  I am shocked as I have always liked their products but their watches haven’t had the longevity of their other products and the Apple Store is awful!

I'm writing this review here because I can't get through to Apple. Do NOT buy this iPad. I purchased 2 of these, and the USB-C port on BOTH of them broke within a year. Apple wants $550 to fix each one of them, but I can't even send them in for repair because Apple requires you to erase the device before sending it for repair. With the broken USB-C port, I can no longer charge the iPad to power it on, let alone erase it- even through my account on Apple's website. I don't live near an Apple store, so unless I drive 2 hours to the nearest one, I now basically have two ~$1,000 paper-weights. Never. Buying. Another. Apple. Product. EVER!!!!

I was upgrading from a Pro with home button. The new Pro does NOT support split keyboard which I have used since iOS 5, nearly 10 years. I find the new keyboard layout unusable. It is natural to hold the iPad in landscape position with thumbs on the sides but now the bezel is so small that your thumbs interact with the screen also rendering the device unusable. They expect you to use this with an iPhone style one-hand keyboard but after 10 years of using thumbs in split keyboard, this phone-style "floating" keyboard (if you can even call it that) is impossible. I bought from Apple store and returned it after 5 days of frustration. This is not the same class of device as ones with home button, this new kind is for quasi-desktop replacement, not for kicking back in your comfy chair and surfing, watching vids, playing chess, etc. I wanted Pro for the audio upgrade 4 speaker stereo. What a shame this new Pro kills the use-case I have been accustomed to.,In addition, there is no cable that supports the regular USB-A connector to your computer, I couldn't even restore so I could keep going where I left off. The supplied cable is USB-C to USB-C, completely useless on a Windows machine. I refuse to buy even more stuff just to use this, it's their flagship product, it should come ready to use.

I have to laugh at the people who upgrade from a 2020 Pro to the 2021 and complain.  What?  You didn't  notice a difference from last year's to this years?  Duh!!  However, if you didn't already have a Pro and bought one now you'll be impressed with the speed of this thing.  I came from the 2018 and only bought this because my 2018 Pro screen was cracked, no longer on Apple Care and starting to not respond properly to the touch screen.  And I noticed the speed bump.  No - IOS 15 won't turn this thing into a laptop, but that's why Apple sells MacBooks and no amount of hoping will change that fact.  Is the M1 overkill for an iPad?  For 99% of people it is for sure and the Air will suit most peoples needs.,  Also if you're considering the iPad mini don't be put off by the idiots complaining about "Jelly scrolling".  As the owner of the new Mini 6 as well (I work in IT) it's complete idiocy.  Yes, it has a 60Hz display and if you really want to look for it you can see it, but in daily use will you actually notice it?  Not really, unless you actually can read articles while scrolling at high speed.  LOL. Some people are just boobs.

I had been eyeing a new iPad to replace my aging Air 2. Originally I was going to go with the Air 4, but the cost of the base-level Pro (11-inch, 128 GB) is only slightly more expensive than the 256 GB Air model. I felt like it was worth getting more powerful and future-proof hardware than extra storage (especially with cloud storage and USB options).,I’ve only been using the Pro for about a month and I can definitely confirm it’s powerful. I thought the Air 2 was a fast tablet, but the speed of the Pro is unbelievable. Apps open almost instantly, 3D scanning takes seconds, and even editing massive RAW photos in Lightroom was seamless. I haven’t tried to push the iPad to its limits, but so far nothing in my regular graphic design workflow has caused any kind of slowdown.,The battery life is also a major upgrade from my earlier iPad. I’m used to having to plug in my devices at the end of the day (or several times throughout the day in the case of my Windows laptop), but at the end of the day my Pro still has anywhere from 30-60 percent battery left. That’s with web browsing, drawing with Procreate, answering emails, etc. The battery does take a bigger hit with 3D and AR applications, but that’s nothing unusual.,I also love the screen of the iPad Pro. The 11-inch model doesn’t have the brand new HDR display that Apple advertises, but it’s still vibrant and bright. More importantly, the 120 HZ refresh rate really does make for a smoother experience. Drawing on the screen with the Apple Pencil is an absolute joy, and even just navigating around iPadOS with the faster refresh rate feels better. It’s hard to go back to the regular screen on the Air 2.,The downside to the latest hardware is that, while it’s incredible, the iPad feels limited by the current state of iPadOS. While I’ve fallen in love with using the iPad for graphic design projects, it still doesn’t have the pro-level apps that are on PC. Designers expecting a complete laptop replacement will probably be disappointed. Even so, iOS has plenty of unique apps that make the iPad a perfect companion to PCs and Macs. Procreate is my new favorite drawing app, and I’m discovering all sorts of unique apps that take advantage of the Pencil and AR capabilities. The iPad is really in a class of its own, it can do things that no PC (including the Surface) is capable of.,Overall, the new Pro hardware is probably a bit overkill in most situations right now. In terms of being future-proof, however, I can see it being well worth the money. This is the kind of hardware that will presumably last for years, and I’d expect that the app situation and iPadOS limitations will improve significantly once developers begin to take advantage of the M1 chip. The other iPad models are more than adequate right now (especially the Air 4), but anyone looking for the best iPad experience should definitely consider the Pro. I’m absolutely in love with using mine.

I have been a iPad Pro 10.5 inch user for many years. This year I decided to upgrade to the 12.9 inch iPad Pro M1. I bought it and used it for a couple of weeks. I found the 12.9 inch to be overwhelming. It was too big, too heavy, too bright, too unwieldy and too expensive. I eventually sold it and bought the 11 inch iPad Pro M1.,Wow!,I absolutely love this 11" iPad Pro!,It's just the right weight and size. It's very comfortable to use. The screen quality is off the hook. Super beautiful. I bought this one with the smart folio keyboard instead of the Magic Keyboard. I prefer the smart folio keyboard. It's more solid when you use the device. It's quieter and it has the ability to fold behind the screen if you want to use it that way. Much better than the Magic Keyboard. The Magic Keyboard is as heavy as the iPad itself (which is a bit silly if you ask me.) Makes the whole combination as heavy as a MacBook Pro.,Of course, functionality-wise the iPad is a dream to use. Super intelligent. Super elegant. Super fast! (M1),Love the abilities of the Apple Pencil. (Scribble is fantastic.) Because the screen now goes out to the bezel equally all around, it makes the screen feel significantly more useful than the 10.5 inch. I also like the fact of the 11 inch iPad is closer to 16:9 ratio. The iPad 12.9 inch is closer to 4:3. It just felt overly deep when I used it. The 11 inch screen feels better. Less like it's taking over your whole field of vision. Also the fact that the smart folio keyboard does not have a trackpad, is a plus in my opinion. The trackpad on the Magic keyboard makes the keys further away from you and makes the the whole iPad too large for the space in front of you. The smart folio keyboard does what you need it to do without getting in the way.,I cannot say enough good things about this device. It's one of my favorite Apple machines, and I have owned them all.,Highly highly recommended!

Bought this 256gb version to replace my 128gb 2017 Air. Noticeably more responsive and much smoother operation with no stuttering while surfing or scrolling.,I am however sending it back and have asked for a replacement due to a bright spot on the display around the size of a eraser head. Most noticeable on a light background but can be seen with other background colors as well. This is a known issue in the Pro model and also on the 3rd generation Air models and it seems like it has still not been corrected.,It’s one of those “I can’t unsee it” things that is hard to ignore. A rep was excellent and after a 15 minute “let’s try this” authorized a return and replacement with Amazon.,You cannot replace without calling and getting authorization for this item.

This iPad used to be one of the best tablet out there but not anymore now.  Galaxy Tab S7 and S7+ beat this model by far.  Here is why:,1.  Better value for your money.,2.  Lighter and more portable with the keyboard case.,3.  Faster processing CPU and OS system (Tab S7 now with the newest chipset),4.  Tab S7 and S7+ is more laptop and PC-like experience.,If you are looking for an all-around tablet then Tab S7 and S7+ is the one.

Procrastinating an iPad upgrade for 1.5 years and they weren’t quite what I wanted with each generational change.  FINALLY an iPad that can ALMOST replace my laptop/MacBookPRO!,Upgraded to 11’Pro 2021 256g from a 9.7’ 2015 Air2 (obviously a massive upgrade).  I was going to get the 12.9’ however I still wanted a “grab and go” tablet with the power of a laptop.  The 12.9’ doesn’t feel like a tablet.  I used my brothers 12.9’  for a week whilst he was on holiday.  It was a little awkward in size; now don’t get me twisted, the 12.9’ is as brilliant as the 11’ however for “ME” it didn’t have the feel of a tablet, felt like I was carrying around my MacBook Pro,It won’t replace my laptop just yet, but it’s soooooo close.  I’m VERY happy with the performance thus far.  The screen is amazing, 5G connectivity is brilliant, the battery life is incredible! I can’t pinpoint any disappointments, it’s truly an amazing iPad, no one will be unhappy with this purchase,Acquiring a magic keyboard in the upcoming week, that may be the game changer for me….

I had a 2nd gen iPad Pro 12.9” version which I liked, but it was too bulky and the display was starting to fail.  I went to the Apple Store to compare the 11” display with the new 12.9”  XDR display.  Sadly, the 12.9” display was very nice and did in fact exhibit deeper colors and more contrast, but size was my main criterion so got the 11”.,The 11” display shows images as somewhat washed out.  Also, while I was expecting a significant increase in speed, that isn’t at all obvious with most apps, though it does process 360-degree images and video faster.  The 11” battery life seems worse than my old 12.9” (even after five years of use), and I find myself charging at mid-day which was never necessary before, though it can quickly recharge at 30 some Watts.  Overall, I’m basically happy with this 11”, but miss the display space of the 12.9” display.  I’d have to rate this “upgrade” as a solid “meh”.  Need an 11” XDR version.

I bought this from Amazon Warehouse for $411 in “acceptable” condition. It was actually in perfect condition. The box was a little scuffed and had been open but other than that it was brand new. There were zero scratches and the battery is great!,I considered the iPad Pro for awhile but I’m glad I didn’t spend the extra money. I mostly use it for artwork with the Apple Pencil in Procreate software. Other than that, I just browse and watch movies. 10/10 I would absolutely buy it again.

This is a beautiful iPad. The biggest drawback which overshadowed his great it is? The battery life. Horrendous. Disconnected from wifi, all apps closed and the screen locked = 40% battery gone in 7-8 hours. I’ve woken up twice with a dead iPad when I’ve set it down at 40%-45% battery left. Apple support has been no help, all they can say thru diagnostics is the battery itself is good, it’s a “software problem”. I’ve followed all steps to potentially fix it and nothing has worked. Hugely disappointing on an iPad that’s brand new and costs $700.,Desperately needs an iOS update to address this.

Super clear & clean images. Easy to navigate as if using iPhone (have iPhone 12 Pro Max). Connected quickly to my internet. Transferred seamlessly from iCloud. I got the green one. I wear hearing aids and they connected quickly to the iPad and the sound is great. Downloaded my iTunes library and navigation is smooth finding my fave tunes. Battery life is very good. Looking next to get the Apple Pencil and ProCreate app for doodling and creating images. I’ve been skeptical of Apple because of the expense. But I had to get new hearing aids and they have Apple software to connect to Apple products. I am impressed with the ease of use and sound quality. I am now able to chat and hear what is being said with FaceTime. The iPad Air gets an A++ from me.

The ipad air 4 is IMO the best bang for buck for something that is both a great tablet, and even laptop. I use the apple pencil and logitech combo touch case, so together the whole system came in at under 1000 dollars and it has the same form factor as my work’s Microsoft Surface without all the bugs! 10 hours+ of heavy use battery life, and it works seamlessly to tether off of my iphone. I’m not sure why anyone would buy the LTE version… I use the trackpad with the combo touch and most apps integrate its function well. I probably use the trackpad for 80% of what i use this tablet for, everything else is done with the pencil or touch. The gestures and keyboard hotkeys work great on the iOS platform.,Multitasking capabilities on the ipad allow me to use this almost like I would a laptop. I can video chat, text, email, browse the internet, etc. all at the same time with at least 2 apps/windows up at a time. The only limit I’ve found (at least with FB messenger video) is that if I’m multi-tasking, the video feed cuts out to my friends, but I can still see their videos.

I got this just recently, and it's taken me a few days to warm up to it.  I miss the old Home button on my old iPad Air (circa 2015). But, it was time to upgrade because my old one was running very slowly.  This beautiful iPad works amazingly fast, has all the features and apps I want, and a large screen that I can read my eBooks on comfortably.,It's taken me a bit to figure out how to close apps, but you just swipe up from the the bar on the bottom, then hold the app to "hide" it.  It seems like there should be a better, faster way to close all the apps, but I haven't found it, yet.  I'm not worried, though and you shouldn't be either.  This is a great value for the money, and a fantastic machine.  I'm very happy with it.  Highly recommend.

Save your money and get last year’s model! I’m the type that gets a new iPad each year. This is the first time I feel like pumping the brakes. The hardware is now complete overkill and the only real selling point from Apple. Software needs at least 3 years to start catching up. Even iOS 15 isn’t ready for this new iPad.

In my opinion, for many users the iPad Pro 11 is the ultimate and perfect iPad.  The screen is stunning, and the CPU is blazing fast.  With 2TB of memory, this is a very powerful computing device.  I really like the 11 inch size.  It is large enough for my demanding uses but still leaves the unit small enough to be handy to pack up and take anywhere.  With the Magic Keyboard unit, which also functions as a case, this iPad is a powerful notebook computer that does it all.  Yes, I am enamored with this iPad!  Highly recommended.  RJB.

No complaints about the product per se, but the advertising here is deceptive and you may think you're getting a separate keyboard/stand. You're not. Do your research. There are ones you can buy to use with this for an extra cost. The apple "Magic" keyboard is outrageously expensive. There are cheaper compatible ones that should meet most anyone's needs. Again, do your research/search. Just sayin' ...  Otherwise, this is a five star computer device.

Bought an iPad Pro on the Apple website a little more than a year ago. Spent well over a $1,000 with accessories included. After very light use, the iPad stopped charging. The store staff (on Michigan Ave in Chicago) said the charging socket broke down because "the device is not meant to be used while charging" and demanded $500 for a fix. No excuses, zero willingness to find a reasonable solution, obscene level of indifference. With all respect to the legacy of Steve Jobs, Apple has become an extortion machine with not even a hint of innovation. I was planning to buy two new iPhones and a next-gen large iMac, but I am taking my business elsewhere.

Just upgraded from a 6th generation iPad 9.7.  Here are some observations after a few minutes of use.,+ Speed is off th charts.  Much better than my 2015 and 2017 Mac Book Pros and previous IPad.,+ Better audio,+ Face ID,+ Slightly better graphics,+ Extra screen area,+ No home button.  Don’t miss it.,- A slight loss in portability.  It is dimensionally slightly larger than the iPad 9.7.  However I think the trade off is worth it.,Tried using it as a computer with a keyboard and trackpad but much prefer it as an IPad.  It will never replace a desktop computer since the software I need are either not available on IOS or are defeatured versions of the desktop apps.  I love IPad for what it is.  Really loving the upgrade.  Still can’t believe how fast it is.

This is a nice tablet.  I have had Android phones and tablets in the past - this is my first Apple product - figured I'd give it a try.  It works well and has a nice screen.  I didn't know that Apple products with no data plan won't allow you to receive or send text messages from or to folks that don't have an Apple device.

It’s a great iPad if you don’t want to do things like transfer music stored on your iPhone, or back up documents to any cloud service other than iCloud, or even just simply back up to your iCloud account (the file sizes are absurdly large so you will need to pay the monthly fee for more storage). It’s marketed as a replacement for a laptop which is absolute false advertisement. I’m stuck with what basically amounts to a fancy kindle+drawing pad with minimal ability to do much else. Would not recommend for anything beyond the traditional uses of an iPad before they got more sophisticated.

I have an older ipad air. I use it every day as a Kindle and general internet access point. So I thought to buy this as a spare. Very vexing that it uses the USB-C connector cable and the old one the lightning connector cable. Great. I now need 2 different cables. And, of course, the old ipencil doesn't work with the new model. Great. I now need 2 ipencils.,Apart from this, it seems to work as well as the old one.

I had been lusting for a Pro for years, and when my Air 3g failed, I bit the bullet.,What a freekin disappointment!,First up is the insanely clumsy 2-button power-down. Next comes the VERY stiff sleep & volume buttons. Not at all easy to use. You have to press quite hard to get a response.,Getting see the apps loaded in memory is also a huge PITA. I usually have to try 4 or 5 times to get to show. The “flick” operation is not very clear.,Battery life is nothing to shout about- very similar to my (now discontinued) Air 3g.,I guess since I’m not an artist doing graphics the whole Pro-thing is a waste.  Wish I had gone for a refurbished Air (4g)…. Would have saved a bunch!,At least the sound is good. That’s something… not sure if worth the big price tag.
Working out and running
Absolutely love it! Definitely recommend getting one😁

My main reason for purchasing the Apple Watch SE was the fall detection.  But I soon discovered other features, heart rate, tracking daily steps, Walkie talkie.  I sleep with my watch on for the fall detection. I had a warning when I woke saying my heart rate dropped below 40 for 10 minutes during sleep.  I am so happy I own  this watch!
Great product. Apple comes thru again and it didn't break the bank.

I feels a bit ridiculous to review this $300+ piece of technology without having used it, but when it arrived today, it didn't come with a way to charge it -- nothing to plug into either a wall outlet or USB port. I've had tech gadgets arrive requiring batteries, but never something that required a specialized plug / adapter that wasn't included. I live in a rural location, which means the part isn't even available here. I'd either have to order the charger and wait for it to arrive or send the thing back. I'm opting for the latter. It's a bad sign when a company has clearly put so little thought into its users/buyers.
I love Apple watch. So useful
Product works perfectly, packaging intact and overall good buy
Excellent product, design, price and in the box include charger type C.
So far loved it .
Don’t count on getting your Order.

We looked hard for the "jelly scrolling" issue that others are mentioning and while we can see it, we don't find it to be a deal-breaker in any way.  Maybe it's because we're old-school and accustomed to waiting for tech to catch up with us.  That little instantaneous flicker doesn't have an adverse effect on our experiences, though we can see where others could be.  After discussion, my spouse and I are guessing that those who are sensitive to the flickering of fluorescent lighting are likely to be effected, among others who have heightened visual sensitivities.,This is a lovely little machine.  We purchased it someplace in person and immediately found that we made a mistake and needed to order the cellular model instead, so while I am waiting for Amazon to send it, we've,  been playing with the WIFI version as we have a two week window to return it open box.,Personally, I love that it easily fits in my mini backpack and does so much more than any other portable device I've ever owned, I almost feel overwhelmed.  As Star Trek devotees, we think the handheld profile it boasts is a fantasy come true.  My first computer cost $1,700 and came in two huge and heavy cardboard boxes with cow paint all over them.  This little beauty is like alien technology compared to that computer.,It's small and sleek and very elegant looking.  It's a comfortable fit in my hands for viewing and typing.  It’s laid out like my phone and gives me see much more space to do the things I want to do, without torching the battery in my phone.

Don't spend your hard earned money on this. The jelly scrolling display is unacceptable for this price point.  My $190 Samsung LCD screen tablet doesn't jelly scroll whatsoever. Apple is full of it to say this is "normal" for LCD screens. It's poor engineering and a real shame coming from a company like Apple that usually makes spectacular tablets.

This tablet is my dream tablet. I have been waiting years to have a mini form factor with the best that Apple can do. The price was just right for something that will last for years and never slow down to the amazing A15 chipset. The screen is fantastic and the battery life is surprisingly amazing. Even beats out the iPad Pro 12.9 and iPad Air with screen on time according to YouTube battery tests. UI is snappy and the Apple Pencil Gen 2 support is such a fantastic tool to use. I love this tablet and would recommend this to anyone. I did get the 64GB model because this tablet is for document editing and watching YouTube and Anime. However, if you are a heavy user I would recommend the 256GB model. The colors could be a lot better, but besides from that I have no complaints. As well, ignore the jelly scrolling bad reviews. Majority of those reviews have no idea what they are talking about just bandwagoning a problem that is not an issue.

This mini ipad 6 is perfect. It has the A15 chip, full screen display, usb-c and a new design. I’ve always thought the other iPads were too large for what I needed. I can hold this with one hand. The performance is outstanding. The speakers are on each side and had much better sound than the mini 5.

Wonderful upgrade for myself and my students.  Ordered five 256gb and these are indeed the newer batches as described by various vloggers on YouTube.,Impressive battery life and Apple Pencil two precision is flawless with every app we have tried.  Takes a little get used to the volume buttons on the top left - but no reason to deduct any stars.  Could not be any happier.,Five stars.,Make sure your iPad mini 6 ends with serial number VQ5 or newer.  The difference in screen scrolling speeds and reduced jello effect is dramatic.,Happy holidays Amazon family.

I don't know about the jelly scroll problem, my vision apparently isn't that good (?). That aside, this is one the best tablet updates I've seen in a while from anyone. Granted I'm not brave enough to venture into Samsung land with its 18,000 varieties of tablet, but if they did have the greatest tablet ever made, who would know? The speed is good, the battery life is good, the pen is awesome, the bezels are great (as opposed to the coke-bottle-glasses design of previous versions). Overall, the redesign is really good. I was kind of afraid it wouldn't be after seeing the new M1 iMac (blech).,My only real issue, besides the price (holy smokes), is the power button and fingerprint reader. I have so many questions about this choice. When are we getting Face ID on all tablets, especially at these prices? Why is the new button slower to unlock than the old fingerprint scanner? 3. For a company that seems to hate buttons, why don't they just add a haptic feedback mechanism similar to the one in the iPhone? Why not combine the weirdly placed volume buttons with the fingerprint scanner and allow us to drag our finger across to change the volume (psss, Android devices have had a feature like this for years). Finally, given how often they keep reminding us that they are the industry leader--nigh, the intergalactic leader in secure personal devices, why do they continue to limit how we choose to secure our devices? Why not offer Face ID ***and*** a fingerprint scanner? On a phone, I get that there is limited space. But on a tablet or laptop, what's the holdup?,Yes, I'm secretly hoping Apple will read the previous messy idea and add it in a later iteration. As of now, it's a great tablet, and I'm just glad that they are designing their products again rather than just changing the chip and calling it "Mission Accomplished" year after year. Now, about that over 10-year-old Mac mini chassis...

I actually own this device and am reviewing it based on my use case; reading, navigation, photography and gaming. I've owned every mini other than the 5. I've owned near every iPad, now an 11” iPad Pro. My Mac is an M1 Macbook Air.,Pros: Its a little monster. In Lightroom, can load, import or export pages of thumbs and it just gets in done quicker than my M1 Macbook and as quick as my iPad Pro. Never runs short on ram no matter how many browser pages of images I open.,Cons: The sharp edges get old fast, they are not comfortable. Fingerprint reader/ power button is large and easy to push. If you're a landscape user, expect to repeatedly sleep your mini during use. If you game, expect you'll sleep it (second time I've done it writing this review) a lot. This is the sort of poor execution, or arrogance, I see more and more at Apple. Did anyone actually use this product when it was in its design stages? The new display aspect ratio cuts off the bottom edge of some web page layouts. Annoying to have to scroll just to respond to a cookie request. Aspect ratio also cuts off all but the first line of sub-titles. Again, what's going on at Apple? Due to a poor grip (sharp edges and button placement) it feels a lot heavier than it is. Older mini's are heavier yet feel lighter. My 11” iPP feels heavier but nicer in hand.,I see zero jelly scroll. I'm a landscape user and no matter how fast or slow I scroll, both sides scroll totally linear.,While not the mini itself, don't buy the Apple Smart cover. The magnet is weak and the iPad slips out at times. But the magnet is strong enough to make separating the cover from the back a royal pain of fiddling until you can close it. Hint for the guys: grow long fingernails. The edges are sharp and uncomfortable.,I returned the mini 6 after 2 weeks of trying to come to terms with it. Fortunately found a new mini 5, 256 that’s in the mail.

This thing just feels right in the hand. You can use it one handed and two handed really freely. Portrait and landscape both feel great. This is the best device for note taking or reading manga without a doubt. I also love it for content consumption and video calls. I carry a portable folding keyboard and trackpad from iclever and I can easily use it as a work device. Jump desktop turns it into a full on computer as well capable of streaming gaming or work. The Apple Pencil works flawlessly with this device and the pocketablility is incredible. This is the best iPad hands down. It’s no laptop, but it’s a great iPad.
Love them. Fantastic! Couldn’t be happier!
The headphones are the quality we’ve come to expect
They are way to big and heavy. They are not worth what they cost.
I love these but i can’t wear them because while mowing my yard they burnt the back of my ears. It has taken me weeks for them to heal. Everyone please beware of this.
As usual Apple does not disappoint. The sound quality is great,. The controls are easy to use. If I had one complaint it would be the price. Other than that “rock on”.
Very light and very comfortable. Fabulous quality. A+ Really amazing noise cancellation; ordering a 2nd set for my other son.
Good from apple
Great audio and noise canceling. Very balanced sound
Best noise canceling headphones on the market
The noise canceling is almost too quiet almost freaky. The sound is fantastic and the battery lasts. They are really warm on my head.

Right earbud constantly makes rattling/cracking sounds immediately after put out of the case. No matter if airpods are connected or not, is something playing or not, it just always makes this strange noice (idk like a fridge, but not that loud ofc). Upgrading firmware does not help. Disappointed as it will require to take it to the customer center by warranty or ship back which means additional time spent. And what if I gifted it to someone? It would be kinda frustrating.

Got these as a Christmas present and have been enjoying for the most part. The earbuds deliver very good quality sound - bass comes through as well as midrange and higher ranges..,My problem is that the left one doesn't fit great and comes out of my ear just walking around the house doing the day to day things...has fallen out a few times. The right one fits fine. I ordered some Daemonlight earpod covers to see if that helps with the fit issue.
Este producto no tiene cancelación de sonido. Sólo los PRO.  Pero para mi esta perfecta esta opción. Busco duración de la batería y este tiene el desempeño perfecto

If you enjoyed the first generation AirPods and are looking for something without noise cancellation then these will be perfect for you. Base isn’t exaggerated and the sound quality is really good. Battery life could be better when you compare them to even the first generation. Overall happy with them.
I Like the product but Apple customer service is horrible, they are very hard to deal with,  not customer friendly and everything they do benefits Apple not the customer

I bought these for my young daughter for Christmas. When she went to pair them, we discovered the pods were named "hoe number 3's". I don't know if these were returned and resold to me, but I'm not happy.
Que no trabajon como dicen
Leafy earbud rattles when there is low bass and is very distracting when watching movies. Podcasts and other things with less necessary audio quality are okay.
I absolutely loved the quality and sound of these headphones, but as far as staying securely in your ear is a negative 4 for me! They don’t stay in at all. Very disappointing

I’ve had air pods before, these are the worst. They fall out when I’m just walking down the street, forget about if I want to run for the light-they north fell out then! I think I’ll go back to the headphones with the neck band. The older AirPods  were better even though I lost one of those when it fell out my ear and into the train tracks off NYC.

Warning, do not buy any Apple products that have been listed by Amazon as used without being aware that you may have no warranty.  The warranty starts from the original sale date of the device, not when you buy it.  If you have a problem with the device and it sat on the shelf for a while, you may have little or no warranty left.  There is no way to know this until you call Apple with the serial number.  Amazon is not able to to extend the warranty and you are stuck with a defective device with no recourse.  I bought 4 of these.  I really wish I had just bought new, but on other products I have not run into this issue.

After saving up for months, I was fortunate to purchase this product. I found the deal on Amazon, with a discount due to Father’s Day and I believe a Memorial Day sale. Purchasing this iPad has been a great thing. As a college student, I take this everywhere I go. It is very light weight, and a very smart device. Once I turned it on, it connected with my apple account and set up my apple wallet. I use this device for taking notes, watching videos, and listening to music. The speakers on this thing are great. The color is fine, a little light. I recommend purchasing the Apple Pencil right off as it goes extremely well, and along with a screen protector. Overall, I am so content with being able to have purchased this device. Happy customer here!

Had this for about a week and it is AMAZING! I've always hated IOS but the iPad with the Apple Pencil 2 is truly creative and exceptional.,There are a few issues with the features, such as no Face ID so I have to manually enter my passcode, or use my fingerprint. It's not a big issue but depending on how you're sitting or laying adjusting your finger to the right position can be uncomfortable and inconvient.,The positive is that even drawing or writing on the glass top with the pencil is easier than it was on previous models and gives some friction so you can write or draw the way you want to. Battery life is good but I always charge it at night so I'm not sure what the overall battery life is. The magnetic side for the pencil is Great! But can only be set to 1 side of the iPad. Sound quality is excellent.,Overall I give the iPad Air 5-stars! And a must for anyone!

I’ve wanted to get off the google tablet teet for some time now for reasons that are best discussed in other venues. But my first apple experience is within the newest iPhone 11, so that experience helped me adjust to the iPad platform. Yes there’s a learning curve between the iPhone 11 and this tablet, but it’s not really steep at all. What you can’t figure out is easily answered by hitting the net and searching. Trust me the answered show right up for questions of basic operations. Screen and image quality.....well if you compare it to my 8yr old Samsung galaxy tab, well there is nothing to compare really.This ipad outshines it. My cousin who is an apple nut says that its super impressive. My issue now is moving things such as photos from the Galaxy tab. Its definitely doable but its also not as simple as one would think if you don’t have a pc with the itunes installed (which I do not). I have no need for a pc. ....yet.

This is a review of Apple iPad Air (4th generation),This is a holiday present; however, I had to take it out, make sure it worked, and load some software on it.,I have similar one that is about a year old. This one has a bigger, clearer screen, and is about twice as fast at loading and running applications, it is light weight, and the battery lasts up to 10 hours. It comes with Touch ID, and a USB connector for charging and accessories.,One amazing machine.
Todas las funcionalidades de una computadora, con ayuda de un adaptador le agregue un mouse y una funda con teclado y trabaja excelente

I use this almost exclusively for school and it’s a total game changer. Using the noteability app i have any document i could ever want where i can take notes directly on the pdf, export hw assignments, etc. The ipad itself is fast, good battery life, good responsiveness and i havent run into any glitches yet. Cant speak towards the camera or any beefy app use like drawing or editing videos or whatever, but i love it. And this is coming from someone who thought he would never own a tablet.

I was torn on this iPad or the pro but I didn’t want to pay ‘pro price’ haha. I love this iPad! I also purchased the apple keyboard as well and the pencil, highly recommend all of them! The new charging cable not being ‘lightning’ and are USB-C now did throw me off at first, but it’s obviously not really an issue. The keyboard is also USB-C so it works perfect together! The iPad does not have face recognition (unlock) so that was kind of a bummer but it really doesn’t cause a big issue. It does have fingerprint on the power button, which works great, I find myself most times just typing my password in though. Overall I love it!

It is light weight and a very comfortable size.  That said, Apple holds a tight grip on everything.  That means there is no real way to adjust the color settings or whiteness of the screen.  You can with the Galaxy S7 and S7+.  The picture on the Galaxy, especially the S7+ is far superior with crisp colors and white whites.  You can also adjust it warmer or cooler, but not with the iPad.  The sound from the iPad Air 4 is a real problem.  It is bright with a high amount of sibilance (hissing Ss) when people speak.  The problem is, unlike the Galaxy, there is no available EQ app that works across the board from everything from movies to Pandora.  They all try to direct you to Spotify and Apple Music.  There are many other services.  With the Galaxy, the EQ works for all.  The iPad speed Air 4 speed is very good, but for me, that is where it ends.

This is my first iPad since maybe the first gen iPad?? It is great! But I have one caveat: I wish I got the 11” Pro simply for the face recognition. My phone is an XR and has face recognition, and after you get used to that it is kind-of hard to go back to fingerprint. To be honest I think I really liked the idea of the pretty colors!! Also I felt if I got the Pro I should get the larger screen, and that was just too expensive. Turns out this screen size is fine for me - I haven’t been unhappy with the size at all, maybe because it is so crisp and bright.,I also got the 2nd generation pencil and the magic keyboard, because I wanted to replace my aging MacBook. It took me a while to get used the different ways you interact with an iPad, but now that I’m used to it I love it and use it pretty exclusively.,Anyway, very happy with my purchase!

This iPad is better and faster than iPad Pro 2020, but it's a useless upgrade and waste of money. There's no apps to take advantage of the Apple M1 processor, it would be good if Apple make Final Cut Pro or upgrade iMovie with new Pro features.

Tremendous machine. I am upgrading from a 9.7 iPad from a few years ago, so this is a huge bump up. Much faster, thinner, better display, battery life, etc. The M1 is really something and the WiFi connection is much zippier too. Ignore 1 star reviews saying this is a needless upgrade.

I returned a Mac Book Pro and got this! A super purchase which has basically replaced all my other computers and tablets. So easy to use and beautifully built. It is like my right arm now...don't know what I would do without it. Well worth the investment as it will give you years and years of enjoyment and utility. Though a bit on the expensive side, quality is quality, and it it well worth the price. I would recommend it to any of my friends!

Screen starting to go out on my 2018 iPad Pro, and I didn’t want to pay the price they are charging for 2020/2021 models. So I opted for the iPad Air 4.,Pros:,Feels just as fast and productive as my iPad Pro,TouchID works even better than FaceID in this form factor IMO. Don’t have to make sure I’m staring at my iPad when I want to unlock it, nor do I have to worry about blocking the camera.,Just as loud as the 2018 iPad Pro. This was my biggest worry, as it only has 2 speakers instead of 4, but I, happy to report I don’t notice any difference in the audio quality/loudness.,Cons:,Lack of ProMotion is noticeable.,Doesn’t seem as bright when using outside.

What can I say, it's the iPad pro lite.,Surprised that this can handle 4k video editing. I mostly use it to take it on the go and draw with my apple pencil. The touch ID and definitely a missed feature and don't mind it on the power button. USB type C is a game changer. Originally I was going to buy the Samsung galaxy tab s7 since it was cheaper but then I remembered that with Apple you pay for literally what you get. Apple is solid when it comes to their chipset. Their build is definitely designed better. Also it's Apple, they have it priced that way for a reason. I use this mostly as a drawing tablet on the go. Got procreate, but clip studio is definitely much worth it. Excuse me while I go back to drawing

Bigger, lighter, faster, and nicer than the regular iPad. Also more expensive than a regular iPad. Why get this one? It’s easier to find! It’s also future proof by at least 2 years over the regular cheaper iPad. The processor is the exact same Bionic A14 that you find in an iPhone 12. The regular iPads come in with an A12, 2 generations back. I imagine the next iPad release will have an A13...while the Air, without even getting a refresh for a year would still be faster than the latest and greatest regular iPad.,For me, I don’t like upgrading every year. At the current pace of refresh, the regular iPad has at least 2 more releases before it even matches the speed of the Air, so basically 2 years ahead. Be lazy, be future proof, buy the Air

There’s a few things I love about this iPad Air over the iPad Pro. First being the weight, it’s very light and can be held with one hand easily. Secondly the bezels are a little larger than the iPad Pro which to me is a step in the right direction. The reason being is that it gives your palm space to grip the side without covering the edge of the display. Third of all it’s got some decent sounding speakers for what they are. And last but not least the display is very sharp and has great color accuracy. I hope that Apple considers this bezel design for the iPad Pro because it’s definitely much better for holding in the hand. This iPad Air was a great buy and I definitely will be holding onto it for years to come!

Shame connector is not standardised with the Iphone meaning its easy to get cables mixed up.,Faster and better battery life than previous models but a little tricky to use.

With Android camp abandoned tablet market and Samsung producing narrow, suitable for video only tablets with 16:9 or 16:10 tall ratio there is a huge glaring hole for people who are in need of small handheld portrait orientation tablet with squarish ratio of 4:3 or let's say for comparison sake 16:12 screens. Galaxy tab S2 8" (mini clone) was not updated since 2015 leaving Apple Ipad Mini as only choice. Reluctantly i ordered one. Ahhh... two issues personally for me: 1) Old Mini 5 and Galaxy Tab S2 had 16:12 screens while new one has 16:10.5 which is much less comfortable for me for Ebook reading and Internet browsing while in bed. Pity. 2) That infamous jelly scroll defect. Let me put it straight. Some people pay more attention to it while some less but ! To whatever degree of discomfort it causing it is simply unacceptable to have neither in portrait nor in landscape orientation. I only paid attention to it on my 3d day of use but now i can see it every time and it is simply disturbing and infuriating to have on the new 500$ device. Huge letdown from Apple who with their usual arrogance will not acknowledge it neither will issue recall or even care to redesign it. They already said that it is normal behavior !!! Ha! Simply bad engineering decision by putting screen controller on the wrong side of the screen making it good for landscape use only! Looks like Cupertino have some serious brain drain there. Worst of all no alternative. Returned. Take a look at pic attached so you can see screen proportions of GalaxyS2 vs Mini6

I've used several ipads before deciding to buy one myself. When the iPad Air 4 released it was perfect for me, no front home button, fingerprint sensor, type-c connection (like all my other devices) and colour options. I bought it with the Apple Pencil 2 and I use it for artwork in Procreate, the lack of bluetooth transferring capability is probably the most disappointing thing but it's not a dealbreaker. The screen is amazing and palm rejection works very well. The handwriting tool is very accurate and I love writing on the screen (as slippery as it is sometimes). I use iMessage on it to talk to my sister on her iPhone and I can use Facetime which I wasn't sure about prior to purchase. It really is a great device and the size is perfect for drawing and watching shows.

Looking for the hardest way to do anything? I love my iphone 11, so I assumed ipad air would be as easy and fun to use. Boy was I wrong! There are distracting pop up tips that don’t apply to what you’re doing, claims it can do things it can’t, and no common sense with the AI. I regret this purchase.

I had a 2 year old slightly above base level iPad and got this a year after MBP…,Positives:,-It’s snappy,-Pixel density is nice,Negs:,-Contrast ratio for $800 is utter garbage… this is all screen and the screen is as bad as the cheap old iPad I had, no one is sitting with two iPads 24/7 comparing a 10% improvement, I got the other one because it was cheap and it fit the bill… this is MacBook priced and gets beat by budget tablets,-it’s nice that the CPU is decent but iPadOS is trash, like a decade ago, it’s an iPhone with big screen but what’s it for then? I can’t take it anywhere that the MBP won’t go… there are no “real” apps in the store so outside of pencil apps the iPhone and MBP win in portability or function… I’m writing this on the iPad and it’s a chore… half the screen is covered up by the keys and I constantly have to balance the thing since it skids and topples at uneven pressure…,-Face ID is as dumb as on the iPhone, there it’s masks here you have to constantly move covers and cups so that the sensor is in your face and half the time you have to lift the thing to aim it…,-camera bump… whose this for? Whose going around with an 11” device and taking photos… I only see 2-3 weirdos a year in YT videos that are being laughed at in the video… now how many people put their device flat on the table?,-browser, this is meant as a consumption device… doesn’t work, ads ads everywhere, pay $800 to not be able to Adblock anything because you’re using phone browsers from 2005

Originally I thought these were fake, but no THEY ARE REAL. Now, don't get these confused with the pros. These are the 3rd Gen. Meaning, there IS NOT NOISE CANCELLATION. In my personal opinion, They are the exact same just that these do not have noise cancellation which is still fine by me. All in all, great quality product. Pros are just a little bit better, but if you want to save some money then go with these. Everything is pretty much the exact same.
Wow! The sound is way better than the previous 2s. But these fit my ears really weird, they tend to fall out if I don’t really jam them in and twist them.

They sound great and the features are a step up from the Gen 2 AirPods except for comfort. I found myself having to readjust them often and if I’m gonna do that I might as well use the Pros because they have ANC.
Best value was Amazon for the latest and greatest AirPods.  Spatial audio is a super neat feature.  Fit is better than prior versions.

Purchased a few weeks before Christmas. There's a reason the second gen airpods are sold out everywhere right now and these 3rd gen are still in stock. Terrible fit, always falling out, only advantage is wireless charging.

I was excited for this new release. These have great sound quality but they continuously fell out of my ear even while doing the simplest tasks. The 2nd generation worked great for me over the last year; when generation 3 was made they changed the style of the ear piece. Recommend anyone to try because all of our ears are shaped different.!,I ended up purchasing the pros which have adjustable tips.

Great device with a terrible screen issue (possibly, just for now). The left portion (in portrait) of the screen refreshes at a slower rate than the right, causing content to distort when animating, or most notably, when scrolling. This is currently present on all units (I confirmed by going to the Apple store and all 5 units I inspected had the issue as well) - Once you see it your can't unsee it. I find the iTunes store app to give a great demonstration of how bad it can be, with all of the small square content pieces distorting into obvious skewed angles and trapezoids. Hopefully Apple can fix the issue with a graphics driver update, but theres still a chance it's caused by a hardware configuration issue. I've been waiting for this form factor for a long time, so this is a major disappointment. The device is great otherwise, as advertised, but this screen distortion gives me a headache and I'll likely return the tablet if Apple doesn't find a fix. It ruins it.
Entrega muito rápida, antes do prazo!!,Produto original, conforme descrição. Estou satisfeito com a compra.,O ipad mini 6 é maravilhoso.
O produto chegou bem antes do prazo e ainda com cartinha! Produto original! Ótimo vendedor

Apaixonada por esse iPad. Lindo, leve, super ágil. Ótimo para estudo e trabalho e também para o Netflix de todo dias. O pedido foi entregue dentro do prazo, veio bem embalado e caprichado. Precisei consultar o vendedor e ele foi atencioso e rápido na resposta. Super recomendo!

Produto original, lacrado, chegou antes do prazo, bem embalado e sem avarias. O produto é super leve, fácil de carregar na bolsa, a bateria dura o dia todo no uso contínuo, mas se vc usar pouco dura mais. A câmera é bem básica, mas não era meu objetivo na compra
Tablet de verdade!
O iPad é incrível, prático e me surpreendeu nos mais diversos sentidos! O vendedor também foi excelente, o produto veio super bem embalado e a entrega ocorreu até antes do previsto!
Para quem precisa de um tablet portátil, atual , eficaz e com recursos atuais essa é uma boa escolha.
Perfeito em todos os sentidos. Processador, tamanho, sensibilidade do touchscreen. Um ótimo custo-benefício.
Produto excelente!,Entra rápida e eficiente!,Recomendo!
Apple’s one it again! Great product!
I like it very much.
Love them , they sound great and no cons so far
These headphones are magical, it feels like I’m in a concert and the comfort of these on my head is perfect! 10/10 product.
Great headphones, definitely not worth that type of money though. Also the noise coming out leaks and can be heard by others in the same room as you. Sent mine back shortly after having them.
Sent it back it cost too much
Too expensive for the features it has
The headphones don’t have an off button/switch, so they die quickly if you don’t put them back in their case.
the noise cancellation experience is undoubtedly the most exceptional.
I love them.  Expensive, but glad I bought them.

My first apple product and the build quality is top notch, very premium feel. I couldn’t justify paying the extra money for a iPad Pro when the air 4 has everything most people need. I use my ipad for drawing and typical web surfacing, Netflix, etc and its very snappy with a great screen. The speakers could be better like the pro but it’s definitely acceptable. The thin bezels are a perfect size. The fingerprint scanner location is not the best but again not a deal breaker. No regrets going with the air 4 over the pro. I used the extra money for the magic kB and pencil.

I have owned two other IPADs in the past.  This is nice with a larger screen however there are some differences in this model from the previous models in where things are located and how it operates.  The one problem I had initially was how to turn the thing off.  I don't like the way it turns off.  You can go into setting and shutdown or hold the power with volume button to get the power off screen.  I don't really like that.

I have been using for almost a month. I received it within two weeks of my order, which is earlier than expected. At first I was skeptical because they were cheaper than Apple website itself. When it arrived, I could defend that it came from apple because of its packaging.,There were some rough edges, that looked like it was dropped, which worried me. When I opened it, it worked fine and as I mention I have been using it for a month. Overall would give it a 5/5.

Great product for great price. Screen quality and design is really good. It’s really refreshing and new to use iPad Air and I love that experience. Battery life is pretty good for my use. Picture quality is outstanding. The only downsides for this price point is not having a 120 Hz refresh rate screen. That’s the major downside. Apart from that, I really like using the product on a daily basis.

Wanted to watch Netflix while husband watches golf. This suited my needs and was insanely easy to set up and sync to my phone. Just turn it on next to your iPhone and everything loads. I also like to cook and recipes are so much easier to read on the big screen. Didn’t know what I was missing trying to read recipes off my tiny phone! Very happy with this for my simple recreational needs.

It’s everything they said it is. I moved up from my iPad Air 2 64GB and haven’t looked back.,The improvements over the Air2  are subtle but substantial. Touch ID makes you realize how often you had to manually key in your ID.,The price point is a bit steep vs  what I paid for the Air2 but you do get what you paid for. The build quality is what you would expect from Apple.,Everything is responsive; I don’t detect any lag. It’s as if I added bandwidth to our WiFi.,Now I need to decide if this is worthy of a keyboard as a simple laptop replacement for quick getaways.

Upgraded from my 2017 iPad pro to this ipad air, the pro was still getting the job done but coming close to the end of updates I and wanting the newer design I pulled the trigger sold my pro for 500 so had to do it , editing is awesome on this ipad, media consumption even with only two speakers vs the 4 on the pro still nice and loud the second gen apple pencil is a must I purchased the 256gb model wish there was a higher storage one but this will do been editing travel videos and pictures on this ipad and works amazing super fast and smooth just enjoying it very much

I had the iPad gen 2 but we never really used it at home. It languished and was never replaced just because it was much easier to use our phones while on the couch vs the ipad. With the addition of the apple pencil support, I decided to purchase this for my husband and I, as we're both artists and could use it. My husband uses it constantly and has already completed multiple drawings on it.,We don't use it for much anything else but to draw on but that's exactly why we bought it. We didn't really need another multi-purpose device but as a drawing tablet that can double for other things in a pinch this was a great buy for us.

I am glad I decided on this ipad. Using it is like the iPad pro I don't mind the inch difference and since I use a headset speakers are not an issue for me. It is exactly what fills my need. And paired with the apple keyboard it allows me freedom to type anywhere I need too. The apple pencil this time around is way better than the first apple pencil. I love scribble and I find myself using it a lot.

This is my second IPad Air. The first one still works great; but, it is getting a little long in the tooth. So I decided to get the IPad 4 just in case. The IPad Air 4 is just a little faster then my IPaid Air 2.  I have had nothing but great luck with all my Apple products. Even my refurbished ITouch works great. Yes the Apple products are more expensive; but, I don’t mind paying for excellent performance and durability. That is one thing that my HP’s and Dell’s that I have had in the past can claim.
I brought this as a Christmas gift so I do not have all of the answers but my daughter says she is enjoying it.
Tablet that I have been waiting for as my replacement.  Apple is the mold that every other Vendor aspires too!
Bought this for my wife and she just loves it screen is super sensitive cameras beautiful and as always iPads are super fast.
Use it every day and with that much storage capacity I expect to have it a few years longer than my old one.
Last iPad last us 6 years and we hope this one will do the same.  Kids love it.  Battery lasts a long time.
My granddaughter loved her birthday gift iPad the best. She only has parental access to games and to face time family but she is happy with it.
Screen quality is clear and amazing, battery life lasts a very long time…. Camera quality excellent
There is a big difference between this model and the one I had before so learning the way that this one works is taking me a while to get used to.
Arrived on time with no issues.,Exactly as advertised if you are in the market for an iPad.
Great ipad, and easy replacing my old one. Just set one beside the other and follow directions
Leve, rápido, completo!!,Adorei 😉

Ótimo produto, ótimo preço. Recomendo!
