I have wanted a new iPad for years as I usually buy the standard iPad models because I am cheap.  But this time I decided to get the better model and for whatever reason but Amazon was selling them considerably cheaper than Apple, so I decided to buy it.  I was not disappointed and could instantly see the higher quality screen, faster processor and extra features with USB-C.  Gotta love that!!  This unit charges super fast with my high wattage USB-C chargers.  Now my folks and siblings have all ordered them too.  I am sure the Air 5 will be better but I will have no reason to upgrade further for quite a few generations.  If you can find a goo deal on it, then buy it.

I've had *two* now I've had to go to the apple store to bring in for a fix - they both have had screens flickering. At this point I'd rather I never bought it then having to keep driving a broken one to an apple store.

My wife loved it. I got it for her as an anniversary present and she was not expecting it at all. I had her set it up herself, because she is a little intimidated by technology so I went to the store and said “see what you can do”, and by the time I got back she was on Facebook and all her apps were up and running. Amazing product. Amazing set up. Amazing presentation.
I had the air 2 so I needed to upgrade. I love it except I wish it had Face ID. Had 64 gig and would have gone to 128 but it wasn’t offered. Choices are 64 or 256.

I used to have iPad Air 3rd gen but because I do digital arts and use the apple pencil a lot, I decided to upgrade my iPad just to use the second gen of Apple pencil.,Some people would think that would be a stupid reason to upgrade an iPad but it's worth it!,When you use the apple pencil 1st generation, the battery runs out so quickly and you have to charge it in that stupid way if you know what I'm talking about. Also as someone who draws a lot on the iPad, the tapping feature is just a very useful and luxurious thing to have.,Now iPad itself, it's just amazing. Literally no cons. I got 256 GB and the storage is more than enough for me so far, and the responsiveness of this tablet is just spectacular. Especially if you use Goodnotes hyperlinks, you can definitely tell how responsive the new biochip is.

It is amazing!!! My granddaughter uses it for school and drawing. It is very nice, but my only complaint is that when she sunk it with her phone, it didn’t install any of her apps. But overall worth the money because at other places, the same IPad is $800. We spent $550-600 including the iPad, case, a cheap pen that works great and screensavers. Very nice.

Bought this solely for the purpose of being able to do digital art on the go. I only have an at-home station and kept catching myself out of the house a lot more lately and doing a lot less art. Now I pull this out in waiting rooms, at friend's houses while hanging out and vibing, and now with a new job on top of my schedule, I've got drawing time during my lunch breaks lol. It's also come in handy for writing more, which I didn't expect. Buying a keyboard along with your iPad pays off a lot if you like to do some writing!,Basically, I love it a lot. :D

Very poor battery life. Did I get a refurbished pad vs the new one I paid for? The charging cord is so short one can’t use the ipad while it is charging. Couldn’t Apple spring for a longer cord and design one that is easy to plug in and lasts for more than a couple of months on a $700 machine? Location of fingerprint recognition pad is awkward.

I love this ipad it has been coming in handy and doing its job. That price tho🤩yes I am in love I highly recommend. The IPad Air includes lovely new features throughout the IOS, youTube put me onto a lot of them. Came perfectly, no cracks, bumps or bruises, The only concern with mine is that I’m having a hard time syncing the iCloud together and my messages going through. <that might be operator error, but that has been my only thorn.
Great quality sound, fits comfortably. The only negative thing about these headphones, is the volume level can be just a little bit louder.
Perfect for wanting to ignore everyone and still make a statement. :)

Great sound quality, especially with spatial audio. They feel great in my ear and don’t fall out. Best AirPods yet! Highly recommend!

I have had two sets of the Gen 2 and they fit the ear perfectly. These Gen 3 earbuds fall out all the time and are not secure in the ear. I imagine that's why with the Pro version the added the rubber parts to them so they hold in the ear better. I would stick with Gen 2 or try the Pro before getting the Gen 3.
Didn’t like it and don’t recommend it. Just stick with the previous model they stick in ears better!

Sound quality is great and even the noise cancellation works well. However, they don’t fit well in my ears and fall out for the slightest reason. Unfortunately you cannot adjust them to fit. I would recommend trying them on before you buy, if you can.
Has been working great. One earbud survied a trip through the washer. But the fit is not great. One fits better than the other. Past generation was better fit.

These AirPods were still attached to previous owner’s iCloud account which allows them to track me, see my home location, as well as disable them or restrict access. Completely useless and Amazon just wants me to return them so they can sell them to someone else! Super sketchy and major safety breach. Beware when purchasing these refurbished headphones
In comparison with the first generation. This one feels big on the ears and doesn’t stay out as the first ones. Still! Sound is great, easy to manage calls. I like them!!

Does not fit every ear size. I bought these for my girlfriend for Christmas and they are WAY too big for her ears. They don’t fit at all. She has very average size ears so I didn’t think this would happen and she had the old ones and those worked great, fit perfect and everything. A huge bummer, the old ones are better except for the battery life anyway, so save yourself some money and the risk of them not fitting and don’t buy these please.

I have all the apple pods. Gen 1&2 we’re great. I couldn’t get with the pros because they hurt so bad and returned them the same week. These gen 3s are perfect. They don’t hurt at all, they sound good and they’re very nice looking. Worth the buy for sure!!!

I like Apple earphones. The sound quality of these earphones has been greatly improved compared to the previous generation, but be careful, you have to pay attention to where your earphones are made. There will be noises made in Vietnam.
I bought this as a gift for my sister and she’s really loving it. I tried it myself for a couple days and was surprised on how long the battery lasted.

Me gusta la calidad del sonido, lo que no me agrada es que no se sujeta bien al oído, luego de unos 15 minutos de uso siento que se desajusta. Además si eres de los que escucha música y en el transporte preferible elegir los AirPods Pro porque los AirPods 3 no tienen cancelación de ruido y se opaca mucho la música con el ruido exterior y es molesto.
I’m returning this product because it fits very awkwardly in my ears and doesn’t seem to be as comfortable as the older model. I’m going to stick with the older model.

Ear pods were a bargain but had not been cleaned.  Contained ear wax. Disturbing. Additionally product was not factory reset.
The fit is great they stay in my ears even while running on the treadmill. The sound is top notch and battery stays charged for a good amount of time.

I have been using these for a while and honestly I love them. I can find them anywhere they are when I lose them, most nights I fall asleep listening to these things and in the morning they are still alive (battery still has juice) and not like 10% or anything, they had like 40% this morning when I woke up. I really love these, they last for hours and they’re just so awesome.
My old one was getting a low battery. Received this one, set it up in no time and used within minutes. This one has a larger screen than my old one. Clarity of images better than expected.

My grandson was told not to expect it for Christmas , but when he heard it had wi-fi he was content.  When all the presents were opened and one remained, it made everyone’s Christmas just to see the look on his face.  Many thanks to this dealer. Ruth
This iPad was purchased as a Christmas gift for my husband. He loves it! It charges rapidly and holds a charge well.
It’s a good back up for my 12 inch iPad. I like it. Smaller than expected but still good.
Yeap jus love it there is no reason to buy an other tablet brand or even think about it

Just got an Apple Watch, still getting use to it. The 41 size is perfect for me, got the GPS only style and so far no issues. I put my watch on the charger each morning while in the shower and it charges just fine during that time - not sure why so many complaints about battery life. No issues with sync up to phone, very easy and quick. Miss a few features that my fitbit watch had but still hopeful the Apple Watch will work in those areas.

I  was suspecious becuase this came in a Amazon box, then when I opened the box it came in the apple watch box but without the clear plastic packing over it.  But it did have the green pull tabs on it and it as not tampered with. This is the real thing! I love it so much!!!
I was notified that apple watch package had arrived a short while ago.  After opening package I realized the watch itself was not in package, only the watch band and cord were in box.
Love the gold finish. It’s not too overwhelming. The size is amazing, loop is durable and high quality. Worth it!

I paid a lot of money for this watch. It was packaged very nicely but it does not come with a charging cube to insert into the outlet. I have an Apple watch and cubes and none would work. So, I figured I must need a special cube just for an Apple watch.  Bought one for $24 on Amazon and it doesn't work either. So now I have spent additional money. My son-in-law came over and thought it could be charged on my computer but it could not. So, he has now ordered me another type of cube from Best Buy and hope this works. Have had this watch for almost 1 month and have yet to be able to charge it. Not happy

All I can say it's really disappointing to buy and item like this and you can't use it because there is no way to charge it. Now imagine getting it as a gift and having to wait to use it until you buy another item (the power block) to charge it. That's like buying a TV without a power cord, or a new car that doesn't come with the FOB or key. I never liked Apple products because of the hassle, this just solidifies my belief that APPLE SUCKS.

I needed 2 watches for Christmas gifts. The one from Amazon came in a day, the Apple order took over a week and just made it for Christmas. Amazon has the same trade in as Apple, I’ll send in my series 3 watch tomorrow. Great watch great buying experience.

This Watch does it all. Use it to keep track of my daily schedule with out me having to constantly pay attention to setting up alarms. It’s long battery life keeps it on my arm and not charging. Once again you get what you pay for ,in this case the best.

The sound quality and battery life is great. However the fit of the earbuds while in are not. Not only do they not fit in your ear they constantly slip out causing the sound level to go down. They spatial audio is nothing crazy, to me the sound better while fixed, not adjusting based on your head. Personally, will be returning because for me the cons outweigh the pros. Overall could be better.

I bought this item for Black Friday and I’m honestly pretty disappointed. The earbud that goes in the left ear fits okay, but the one for my right ear does not fit nicely and feels very loose. I’m nervous it is going to fall out. I have to readjust it every minute, but still can’t figure out how to make it fit comfortably. The regular apple earphones with the wire fits better than these. Returning this product.
Does any one else have a static/ringing noise in the left bud when there is no music playing? Not sure if that a malfunction on my AirPods or on the entire 3rd Generation line.

Bought these as a Christmas gift, person went to connect, and they were already registered to someone else's account. Pretty embarrassing, like I bought someone used headphones. Pretty nasty thing to buy used.

I bought these on sale for $139.99 and got the AppleCare+ “Just in case” the sound quality is very good and fits nicely in ear. Battery life is great and charges fast. Hopefully these last me for many years. If noise cancelation is a must or preferred get the pros. I’m content with these so far.
I love the sound through these but the sizing doesn’t work with my ears. One of them fits in pretty decently but the other ear keeps falling out I think my ears are different sizes.
Don’t buy, stick to 2nd gen.

Great sound, but I don't like the design as well as my 2nd generation airpods, which would no longer hold a charge after about 4 years of use.  Compared to 2nd generation, the 3rd generation does not fit into the ear as well (easily falls out of my ears), does not fit into the case as well, and has a larger case.  It's unfortunate to have a worse design for a supposed product upgrade.
Holds a change a long time, great sound, however, I’m getting vibration from one of the headsets which is annoying
If I could give 0 stars I would. I was sent used or refurbished AirPods 2 in a 3 boxed.

This ipad is light and fast.  But I am frustrated by the fact that it is missing a few key functions that I enjoyed on the ipad that I purchased in 2012.,The USB-C connector is only useful for charging.  It doesn't allow me to connect a flash drive with USB-C to look at movies, photos, documents.  I could do that on my older ipad.  Now I can't download movies onto my flash drive and watch them on an airplane anymore.,  There is no standard headphone connection.  I assume that Apple did this so that they can sell their expensive airbuds.  However,  I was able to purchase a $7 adapter on Amazon so that I can use cheap airbuds with this ipad.

It was glitchy from the get-go, freezing occasionally, but was always able to restart.  Six months after purchase, the screen froze and was unable to turn off or log on. Have to mail it back with a one week repair turn around. Apple won’t let me swap it out at a nearby Best Buy, but expects in-person swap at nearest Apple store - over an hour away. Buy an android instead.

I’ve had this iPad for over 7 months now. I haven’t had any issues except that it came with what I suspect is water damage on the upper right corner. It was the first thing I saw when I unboxed it! It is not very noticeable though, it only shows on certain angles or background colors like white, most of the times I forget about it. Still, makes me scared that someday it will spread or maybe make internal damages on the iPad ….

I use this when I go to bed and want to catch up on stuff that is not covered by the news. I am not into games. I love that I got free Apple Tv for a year. I have watched several programs already.,I buy iPad because I can get data on it through a phone company so when I go on vacations, I can still read my emails without using "free" wi-fi. It costs more, but I feel more confident using my own data than signing up to a motel wi-fi. To me, that is extremely important.

I use the iPads almost entirely for reading - books, articles, etc.  Because of major damage to both shoulders, I find the iPad Pro inconvenient and sometimes painful to hold, lift and move around. This Air version is significantly more comfortable, not to mention cheaper than a new Pro, and the somewhat smaller screen is a somewhat small price to pay (I'll admit to continuing to depend on the Pro for jigsaw puzzles, where every little bit of space counts).,Main downside is the faintness of the "upper case" numerals & characters on the keyboard.  Makes the concept practically useless.
The overall purchase was great. I am a fan of Amazon. The IPad itself is even better. I use it for college and it has proven to be very very helpful.

I haven't used apple products in a long time but I kept seeing other artists using the iPad air 4 and procreate so I decided to go ahead and get one. When I turned it on it was already at 95% and it took about two days to get down to 20% after on and off working/downloading stuff. Overall I do not regret it, the camera quality is pretty good, the screen size is great for what I plan to use it for, and I can use my type c 10ft charger for my phone instead of the extremely short one that came with it.

Can only be set up for a single user and it effectively augments the screen on your phone.  Larger display than a phone.  Beautiful photos (Just like the phone).  The larger display and optional external keyboard are the only two things this provides over your iPhone that I can see.

Its a great device sure. There is not much to say about the product as it is already well known. Just 2 points;,(1) Finger print scanner mounted on the sides is a pain,(2) Battery performance is very very poor compared with other apple devices (including my earlier i-pad) that I have used before,Late Note: Amazon is fast becoming a platform for sellers pushing "fakeware/defective / refreshed and sold as new".,Off late, I have stopped buying Branded stuff from Amazon no matter how tempting the offer/price,additional note: shutting down all apps and functions that might drain battery resulting in tiny, hardly noticeable difference. Downgrading the review to 1

The power button does not turn off the iPad Air, instead you have to press it along with the volume down or volume up button for the slider to show up. And it doesn't turn back on right after you turn it off. You have to wait for it to be off for at least 30 second to press the power button for the device to turn on.,This is a new behavior I've seldom seen in previous iPads and iPhones I've had. But other than that it works as it should. I don't like the face id so I taped over the cameras.

You would think with pay ing $200 for a pair of earbuds you would have amazing sound quality. Upon using them for the first time there was crackling only in the right earbud almost like the earbud was already blown and used. I do not think that that was the case because it was still sealed in the packaging unless they resealed it and saw them as being used which I would not put past Apple doing. Amazon was amazing with the return even though it was extremely frustrating trying to get it all figured out.

Got one from BB before this, i returned it and bought this from amazon because of the price difference. I loved the spatial music and superb noise cancellation. Perfect fit with the right rubber tips. It updates itself to the latest firmware. Checked the serial number from apple and it is legit NOT FAKE.,Only complain is it easily catches dirt. It has a gap makes this airpod catch dirts, its not proper aligned or glued smoothly, found some extra rubber silicone between gaps.

They fall out of my ears. The sound is meh. Sure, Apple owns the ecosystem and the custom chip helps with pairing. But they keep trying to connect to another of my Apple devices, so this 'feature' is also often an annoyance. Battery life is not great. Mic quality is also meh. There are no mics in the stem ends, so I don't understand why the stems exist here. My ear canals block the actual mic hole, so people can't hear me well. You can't let your ears near anything or the stems will catch and they'll jump out to the ground.,The case is good, and they are easy to remove and replace relative to some other brands. But that hardly makes up for their desire to commit suicide by jumping out of your ears.,I'm returning them.

Make sure you get the right fit and seal with eartips otherwise they will be either uncomfortable and/or lack seal and loose sound quality in particular bass response.,I was on fence between newer airpods 3 and airpods pro gen1, leaning more toward former for a better low-frequency response until I switched from medium to large tips and started to sound almost similar.

Just as expected! Great sound quality! Fits snuggly in the ear and doesn’t fall out like other ear buds. I don’t know why people said there is no power cable. Maybe they didn’t take the top piece out of the box, but there is a power cable included in the box. There is no need to buy an additional cable. Included a picture to show where the cable is.

Mine are from Vietnam. I read all the new ones are from there now. I checked the serial number on the box, MagSafe case, and in my settings. It’s the same for all three. No issues so far. Sound quality is great. I didn’t know the noise cancellation is was this great. I have to really yell load to hear myself. The transparency mode is awesome as well. Great buy for Black Friday. Can’t beat that price, was cheaper than the AirPod 3. Package was sealed and not damaged at all. No scam over here. I felt weird having an IPhone 13 Pro Max and still using wired ear buds. I cut the cord baby.,Oh yeah for those saying no adaptor box with it. Well I got an IPhone 13 Pro max and it didn’t come with an adaptor box neither. The adaptor wouldn’t fit inside this box with the AirPods anyway. T tells you what’s included in the box prior to purchase if you read.,Great Buy.

I wear these on the plane when I travel (weekly). They don’t fit my ear all that well, they fall out of my ear easily, they have a horrible battery life and you can barely hear music in them over the roar of a plane engine. I’m yet to find an ear bud that works 1/100th as well as a pair of Bose over-the-ear unit. Overall, don’t buy into the hype on this Apple product. They do phones amazingly well, but their other ‘support’ products aren’t worth their price!

I needed buds that were noise cancelling and Bose earbuds are seriously not it. I don't get why people like those.,These are great! I can barely hear any snoring, and can definitely not hear the sounds of transportation. It's good for my sensory overload issue.,Only complaint is that when I play a video or music or anything, one of the earbuds is a bit delayed in playing the audio. It fixes itself after a second and you kinda get used to it, but what the heck? lol. Also the battery life is BAD. It definitely doesn't last a full night of sleep, even with full charge. If you can get past both of those things, you're all set.,...The noise cancellation seriously trumps those issues though.

Apple Air Pods Pro claim to have better sound quality and noise canceling ability, but as a middle aged man I couldn’t tell much difference in sound from regular Air Pods. The real downer for me was fit in my tiny ears was poor. You have to jam the padding into your ear canal to enable noise cancelation and that can be uncomfortable or Ill-fitting for small ear sizes. They are good headphones but I wouldn’t buy them again based on value for the price.

These are great earbuds. I contemplated buying another non-Apple brand based on a friend’s review, but I’m glad that I decided on the pricier AirPod pros. Once you connect them through the Bluetooth you never have to turn them on again they just automatically come on when you put them in your ears and the directional sound feature is very cool and doesn’t distract you. It’s sort of invisible but makes a big difference in sound quality. Oh, and the other day I just discovered their noise canceling benefits… It was so subtle I didn’t realize it at first but I was on a noisy street and as soon as I took them one out to talk to someone it was like a blast of noise. These are the best Apple product I’ve had for a long time.

I really really want to love these airpods. The spatial audio is awesome and the sound quality is superb. The shape and fit is so weird, though. They kind of sit on the outside of your ears but they are so loose that they always feel like they are about to fall out. Whenever I smile or move my face at all, I have to re-adjust them. If you can get over the fit than I say go for it, but unfortunately I have to return them.
they do not fit like the 1 & 2 air pods they are to bulky , fall out easy should not be called the air  pods 3s

A die hard Apple fan will love these as the sound quality is a big improvement over previous generations. They are noise cancelling but to a mild degree. To make them noise cancelling they must now use silicon tips that come in three sizes so you really need to try them all to get a good fit and best noise canceling. I was not completely satisfied as these tend to fall out of my ears where the last generation never did.  I purchased some memory foam tips and they work better but still not like the old generation pods. The shafts are also shorter and they are harder to remove from the charging case than the old ones, especially if you have big fingers. I think Apple let us down on this upgrade.

They work as they are supposed to. There are plenty of reviews on this model of Apple AirPods Pro. Many were done by professional or serious music listeners. I would recommend people to do the online research and read the reviews before deciding if to buy them. For my purpose, the pairs work very well, easy to sync with my iPhone, easy to operate. The feeling of it canceling the noice was so amazing to me. The audio is also fantastic and syncing was very easy to do. I dropped one pretty hard the other day as it slipped off of my ear and it didn’t break which was a huge relief. For clarification: I purchased these on Apple.com. I am just posting my review here.,When you take these headphones out of the box you immediately notice the weight. Seeing as they are made of mostly metal, besides the replaceable ear cups and headband, this is not too surprising. The metal gives these headphones a very premium feel. The removable ear cups are very soft and comfortable and also easily replaceable (connected via magnets).,The comfort of these headphones rivals most of the other headphones that I own or have owned. I have been comparing these to my Pioneer DJ HDJ-X10s and my Sennheiser PXC 550-IIs. The pioneer headphones are made for long listening sessions and DJ sets and the new Apple headphones tend to be more comfortable than those. When I initially got them I had them on for over 5 hours without any discomfort. Also, a common problem with some over ear headphones is that your ear my start to get hot or sweat over time. That has not been a problem with these headphones. The ear cups are not made out of a non-breathable leather which I am assuming is the reason why my ears do not heat up or sweat over time. The mesh at the top of the headband aids in the comfort. The other thing that makes these comfortable is the various adjustment points. From the telescoping arms to the ball point hinges, you can get an almost perfect fit for your head shape.,Now let's talk about the sound quality. I will fist start off by stating that the noise cancelation, compared to the PXC 550-II is significantly better. It does not completely cancel out all noise however, it does a better job. I think. this is due to the metal design and the mass amount of microphones that they have located in various location on the headphones. When you use the transparency mode these microphones really shine! When this mode is active, and no music is playing, I can clearly hear myself as if I did not have the headphones on at all! Very impressive hardware and software magic from Apple. When actually playing music, in my opinion, the quality rivals a large selection of over ear headphones expect the high end audiophile range. The lows are not muddy and the mids and highs come through very crisp. The clarity is most likely due to the fact that the headphone boasts a 40mm driver which is large enough to reproduce a wide range of frequencies at high volumes without distortion or clipping.,I am a big fan of the tactile buttons and Digital Crown that they have on the headphones for control. This control interface is simple and easy to learn and use daily. The noise cancelation button allows you to cycle between the various noise cancelation modes and in the software you can choose which of the three modes it cycles between (see image). Te Digital Crown is exactly like what you will find on the Apple Watch, only bigger. Scrolling on the watch allows for volume control, and clicking allows for play/pause.,Using these headphones with Apple devices is pretty much as expected, seamless. I will say that you will need to ensure that you devices are updated to the latest operating system in order to fully enjoy all of the features.,Battery life so far is very good! The smart case helps maintain battery life when not in use. From regular use I can go about three days before I need to charge them again. Now that is not travel days. If you travel a lot you may have to charge them more often. Everyones use case is different.,Let me talk about the things that I don't like about these headphones. FYI these may be just personal gripes and might not bother you nor do they take away from the function of the headphones. The first issue that I have is that Apple is still trying to hold onto the lighting charging port. I really wish the would have put a USB C charging port on these headphones bringing them into the rapidly forming universal charging world that is here. The second gripe I have is with the case. If you look at the images I provided you can see how there are gaps in the case. This bothers me slightly because if I were to put these in my backpack on my daily commute there is a chance that something could slip in and scratch the ear cups. Now, I will see if this happens over time but it was not something that I had to deal with with my PXC 550-II because the case for those was completely covering of the headphones.,I will add to this review overtime as use these headphones more...

Sadly, the availability is limited and the order/waiting period is annoying. I received a set of Apple AirPods MAX headphones today and they were freezing cold from the delivery truck. It took an hour or two to warm up and charge the depleted battery. The connection to the Apple iPhone XS was simple. I found myself listening to some clean & pristine music within minutes of connecting.,My first piece, as a sample was Allegri's MISERERE by the Tallis Scholars. It's an a cappella piece from the 1630s. I like to use this track that's over 12 minutes because it is a perfect example of the headphones ability to handle silence. As there are no instruments and no backing vocals, MISERERE is a great way to test new headphones. I have to say, these new APPLE headphones are stunning, very expensive at almost $600 but might be justifiable.,The noise cancellation feature is the best I have ever encountered. I cannot make any commentary about planes, airports or trains since I don't travel. I can say this: my Whirlpool dishwasher was running and I could not hear it.,To anybody, thinking about buying these cans, go ahead...pull the trigger.

I have both - In similar color schemes! Hopefully the pictures do them justice! From an aesthetics perspective the AirPods Max are on an entirely different level. The ear muffs are super soft aluminum with just the right amount of shine. For the most part the NC700s are plastic construction, which isn’t quite as remarkable but does make possible the much lighter overall weight. Confessions from an audiophile - the AirPods Max deliver on every metric i care about. These are high quality headphones that will have you rediscovering the music you thought you knew inside and out. Not to say that the NC700s aren’t excellent as well but they don’t produce the same depth of bass or clarity in songs. Cost aside, I would choose the AirPods Max over the NC700s.

I bought the Max online from Apple directly and picked it up at the local Apple store. I returned it the following week to the local Apple store. Apple hasn't asked me for any comments but someone on Amazon may find what I experienced helpful.,My impressions of the Apple Max headphones are not comprehensive. They apply to the one feature that to me is the most important for headphones: sound reproduction and its fidelity to the original. That doesn't mean that comfort and ease of use don't matter, but once those are acceptable, then where do we go?,There's good coordination with Airplay and Apple watch and an easy set up - all as you would expect from Apple. I didn't use the active noise canceling feature but passive noise canceling is excellent: I put on the Max, turned on my noisy space heater, and had to test the heat with my fingers to see that it was on.,You place the cans on your head and they're up and running. The bass is rich and the highs are decent but, unless they are singled out in the music, they are obscured by the wall of mid: high mid, low mid, and the vast, rich, middle range. There's nice spatial separation and presence but the music never experiences silence. When music stops, at the end of a note or a measure, for example, even for an instant, there is a pause but it is at the same level of energy as the music which preceded and follows it. With good reproduction you will hear, where it is appropriate, silence - you will hear it, and it will be satisfying. Here you are never satisfied. With a good system the music speaks, there is a crispness of expression, there are overtones, there is nuance; with these headphones the music slurs. The Apple headphones don't breathe, the air just flows, on and on - this is elevator music, pleasant elevator music, true, and, perhaps, if you just want something to while away the time, sufficient. Despite the supreme comfort of these cans the listening experience for me is unfulfilling and tedious - and it makes me sad to see such potential (and these are quite special devices) wasted.,I have high-end high impedance open-back headphones and a good (trans)portable amp which I use most of the time. It isn't noise canceling (it's open-back) and it's wired. I would have liked the Max as an alternative choice for cafe and travel. I love the idea of wireless but I'm partial to good reproduction and to have my music (mostly classical) sound as close as possible to the original thing. I did alternate the Max with this system but there was no intention of comparing - especially after I listened to what the Max had to say.,I tried another tack. I have a decent midrange closed back headphone, low impedance and plugged directly into the 3.5 mm headphone jack on my 6s; not noise canceling but it's got a close ear fit and I've enjoyed listening to it on airplanes - price: $150. I feel like I've stepped off the elevator and into a concert hall. There are instruments being played not far away and I'm thrilled by what I'm hearing. When I listen to the same music with the Max, I hear sound - finely processed sound on a large stage - but I don't hear an instrument playing; I hear a technician's take on what that instrument might sound like: it's close but it's not in the same ballpark.

I purchased a pair of Space Grey Airpod Max at the Apple Store on launch date. I'm an owner of original Airpods since inception (which I absolutely love and still consider one of Apple's most impressive products from a value to quality standpoint), and a one-time owner of Airpod Pros which I ultimately returned (I did not find them comfortable with the in-canal component of it).,I owned the Airpod Max for a few weeks. Here are my pros and cons:,Pros:,-Very easy setup, excellent connection to Apple devices. This works seamlessly between each device you use.,-Spatial audio is a very cool feature,-The aluminum material is second to none in making the product appear high-end. Very cool looking in person.,-Noise cancelling is excellent on this device.,-EQ is balanced and neutral tones. The sound is very clean.,-They are surprisingly comfortable on the head with the material used on the cups.,-Nice airy sound stage and notable instrument separation,-Battery holds up strong,Cons:,-These are HEAVY. As in, you can't do anything except sit down and listen to them heavy. Now over time you do get used to it, but there is some fatigue. Definitely not for walking outside of the home and definitely not for any kind of physical workout.,-There is no way to turn off the device without placing back into the case. There is no button to turn them off manually.,-The case is just terrible. Easy to take in and out, but you literally use the most delicate part of the headset to carry them. The case does not protect anything.,-These clamp hard. So if you aren't used to heavy clamping, you may get headaches from wearing these.,-One of my biggest gripes: the sound is nowhere as crisp as I was anticipating based on reviews. I found the mids and vocals to be receded which was very surprising. I expected the sound quality to be above and beyond any headset I've owned. That was just not the case. This is something that can be tweaked in a firmware push.,-The customization level of the EQ is a fraction if its competition (Sony XM4 gives excellent EQ customization for half the price as an example).,-I have the same issue with the airpod pros in that the pressure on the ears from noise cancellation gives me headaches. This one depends on the user, but despite the earphones themselves being comfortable, the pressure from the cups cause headaches.,When all is said and done, I am a person that focuses entirely on value. These simply don't sound like they are 550 dollar + tax headphones to me. The sound quality just isn't there. They don't sound bad per say, just not at that price range. I would say a more fair price for them would be around $400. Now the material is excellent and the noise cancellation is also excellent. So if that is very important to you, these may be exactly what you want. But nonetheless I would anticipate some refinements for the 2nd generation, or a price drop in the future to something more competitive in the mid $400 dollar range. I ended up returning these because bottom line is I did not find the price to match the sound quality, and they were not comfortable for long term use.

The price gauging is scraping my forehead. Are you serious? Apple fans will buy anything with an Apple logo on it, no matter the cost .hey do make some great products. As an audiophile however, the buck stops here. Audiophiles pay for the sound quality and innovation. Apple fans buy Apple wearables to "show off" like, look at me, I am awesome because I spent. you know it, $600 on bluetooth headphones. What a total crock. I would take that same $600 and buy a beautiful DAC/AMP or some great Sennheisers or Beyerdynamic. Not this wireless Bluetooth crap. Score again for Apple. I am not a hater, I use a MacBook Pro daily. I am very much against price gauging for the sake of owning the latest Apple product. And by the way, what ever happened to Beats by Dre? You see, its the perfect opportunity for Apple to strike, and they do, in a very ferocious way. Fanboy and girls sit down. I have a bridge with an Apple logo on it for sale.

I should have known this would happen. When these went on sale I was like, "Nope. Not interested Especially at the price gouging price". But Apple always wins in the end. So yesterday I bought these on the spur of the moment. (Maybe they should actually stop sending me stimulus checks).,NOISE CANCELLING: Amazing. Better than the Sony XM4's. Goodbye annoying rumbling bass through my wall when my apartment neighbor has his TV on. Best ANC I've ever experienced.,COMFORT: Surprisingly great. And I wear glasses. With the weight, I worried about the comfort, but these feel great. Possibly also better than the XM4's. Those are lighter but the drivers stick out and youu can feel them against your ear. Gets annoying after wearing them for a while. These feel much lighter than they are and the earpads are like pillows from heaven.,LOOKS: Also great. Better than in pictures. They look beautiful and shiny. Understated. I think I like the surprising decision to not put the Apple logo on them.,SOUND: Okay......here's where I'm struggling. I'm having trouble warming up to their sound. Yes, they sound clearer and have more realistic bass than the XM4's, but I think I might prefer the Sony's anyway. Their sound is just warmer and more enjoyable for music. Remember when it comes to music, "accuracy" isn't the only thing. CD's are more accurate than vinyl, yet many vastly prefer the sound of vinyl anyway. These to me sound just a bit cold and sterile. I hope I change my mind. And there just might be something to headphone burn-in so maybe their sound will slightly change after more hours of use.,Basically Apple nails it in many ways, but I'm underwhelmed by the sound and therefore I would say don't be foolish like me and blow $550 especially if you already have a nice pair of noise cancelling headphones. Spend your stimulus check buying beer and pizza like any good American.

AirPods Pro are no longer a goto pair of ANC earbuds. The latest firmware upgrade from 4A400 to from 4A402 by Apple has practically remove ANC, and downgraded the audio quality due to the drastic ANC removal. Back to my Sony earbuds; these AirPods Pros are now shelved.,Update - With the firmware release from Apple of 4C165; ANC has made a return to AirPods Pro; thank you Apple for correcting one of your mistakes.

Warning: if the previous version fit your ears well, these won’t. I lost my original AirPods and ordered the AirPods 3 to replace them, and they were way too big for my ears. There’s no way they would stay in while running and my ears hurt after like 1 min of wearing them. The sound was good and everything, but I’m so glad I was able to return these and get the older AirPods 2 which fit my ears!

These AirPods Pro are the most amazing piece of technology I own. I am totally blown away by the Incredibly efficient noise cancellation. It beats my over the ear Bose AirComfort 2. The malleable ear pieces insure a snug comfortable fit and effectively block out outside noise.,I cannot understand conversations in noisy background environments. One of the primary reasons I bought these AirPods was the conversation boost feature. I was not disappointed, this feature makes a world of difference. I can actually understand people talking!,If you are considering  purchase of ear buds, these are the best you can buy in my opinion.

This is my first pair of Apple AirPods, and I can't say I'm impressed.  Apple products, back in the day, were supposed to be simple, logical and easy to use, but the functionality of these is not good.  My biggest grip is the controls.  The AirPods have a small sensor strip on each bud that can be used to turn the noise cancellation on or off, to pause music, or to go move to the next track or prior track.  That's it, and the controls cannot be changed in the AirPods Pro.  On my other earbuds (the Jabra elite), I can customize the controls, and I can also use the buds to change the volume.  I can't believe that the AirPods can't be customized.  Crazy.  More seriously, the sensor strip is EXTREMELY difficult to use.  My Jabras have a button on each bud that is incredibly easy to press, even 9 miles into a run.  The AirPods?  There is this small metal sensor strip that has to be pressed just right.  The only way to do it is to sort of pinch the earbud, pressing the strip with one finger while holding the back of the AirPod stalk so that it doesn't fall out.  This is not easy, and I find it a nightmare in running.  I end up pulling the stupid AirPods out by accident just trying to move forward a track.  I can't believe Apple thought this was a good control scheme.  On the positive size, the fit for me is perfect, and the AirPods are light.  The sounds quality is good too ---- the Jabras sound noticeably better with music, but the call quality on the AirPods seems a bit better than the Jabras.  At any rate, all in all, I'm not happy with these.  If I'd realized how tricky these are to use in real life, I never would have bought them, even on sale.

Solid sound. I feel like the Soundcore Liberty Air 2s I was using had more oomph — and the Beats Fit Pro I bought to replace these sound way better. ANC is cool, kills the hell out of the battery though. Four hours with it on seems kinda… pushing it.,My biggest issue was the fit. Not only do they come loose constantly, it’s also almost impossible to move them without hitting the force sensor. Maybe it’s because of my hands (they’re huge) but I was constantly pulling up Apple Music while using my Mac, which was incredibly frustrating.,Actually, I was going to rate these a three, but because Apple Music automatically came up any time I touched the force sensor, I’m dropping it to a one. It was that frustrating.

Gen 3 were purchased and daughter initially liked. However after wearing a few times she felt they were too large and uncomfortable.  She gifted the Gen 3s to me and we purchased the Pros. The Pros fit much better in her ears. I also tried the Pros on when they arrived and they fit much better. The Gen 3s fall out easier and do cause some discomfort. I suppose it’s all about the size of your ear canals.

I have the original AirPods and two pairs of the Pros. Wife has set of Pros along with my daughter. My wife just recently got hers and cannot stand anything in her ears so she was using an old Motorola earpiece to talk handsfree on her phone. I talked her into trying the Pros when they were on sale for Thanksgiving and when they arrived I put the smallest ear tip and she actually uses them. Sound quality is great and they are comfortable. Had all of mine since they were launched and they work great and automatically connect to whatever device I am using. Quality product and recommend highly!
Its a yet another great apple product, we all wished it had noise cancellation but :( still a great upgrade after first gen of airpods
For me this airpods are very uncomfortable I may return it. It hurts my ear I’ll stay with my airpods pro sounds the same as this and it doesn’t hurt my ears
I like everything about it

These airpods fit perfectly in my ears.  I was worried after so many reviews mentioned this version did not fit.  (The 2nd generation also fit my ears).  These sound fantastic and I love how they automatically switch between my devices.  I prefer these over silicone tips any day.

I had to return the first pair I received. Was a little upset at the fact it says they’re new and when I took them to Apple to try and figure out why the left one wouldn’t work it told them they were serviced. Which means they were not new. However Amazon fixed the problem sent me new ones and they work fine

Used, not new.  Look carefully for the Apple seals on 2 sides.  Return immediately if it’s not.  I bought them as a gift and the new owner realized it when there was only a couple of months left to claim the 6mos Apple Music.  Rating is for my experience.  I’d give a genuine AirPods Gen 3 a 5 star rating.

Very disappointed.  My AirPod Pros were very temperamental. The noise cancelling feature did not work consistently and I constantly had trouble with my iPhone and iPad not recognizing that both pods were in my ears.  I tried every tip size and none seemed to correct the problem. Maybe it’s my specific ears and the poor fit, but I give up and these will be returned. My Bose earbuds don’t have this problem so I’ll probably try the new Bose or the new Sony’s  next.  When they did work, the sound quality was pretty good and on par with my other high quality earbuds but not significantly better or significantly worse.

New Apple AirPods Pro,Works perfectly with my iPhone. Syncs quickly, good interface, battery life is pretty good considering how small they are.,Sound is great, noise cancellation is amazing.,I dropped one and used 'FindMy' on the iPhone which located them to about 2 inches.,What more could you ask for?,I'm quite happy with these.

My AirPod pros are the best! I’ve used them traveling, at home & while driving. The best ones available in my opinion! On a plane with noise canceling I couldn’t even hear the engines of the plane & same with in the car or noisy environments! The transparency mode is great! If you listening to something but also want to stay alert around you, it’s fantastic & the way I mainly use them. Battery life is good but not great. If your on a longer trip I’d recommend bringing a power bank. They last about 4 to 5 hours on a single full charge but I’d say the case itself charges the both the AirPods 2 to 3 times fully. I would recommend buying AirPod pros without a doubt!

I bought what I thought was an Apple Product from this sender only to find, after my spouse opened the gift on Christmas day, various differences in quality! For one, the charger does not fit into the Air Pod case; and its suppose to fit fully, snuggly& securely. Second, the back of the Air Pods has a button that when clicked actually doesn't make much of a clicking sound/noise at all, its suppose to be "muted"; however, with this product when you click the button it makes a loud, tacky clicking sound, revealing that it is not made with the same quality products as Apple. Lastly, and most importantly, after this product connected with my spouses iPhone 12Mini, it did not recognize the iPhone and thus, did not work or play music from the Air Pods! DO NOT BUY APPLE FROM THIS SENDER AND RECOMMEND BUYING APPLE ONLY FROM APPLE OR BEST BUY.  Amazon needs to vet this sender! I am in the process of returning now to sender.

It's an excellent product, the sound sounds great. The connection with the products of the apple ecosystem is fast, for those who have more products it is something to take into account. If you don't mind overpaying for headphones, these are for you.
my airpods 2 It's been used for too long. The battery really doesn't work It's not like air pods pro. Ear pain after wearing it for a long time, It's very good. I like it very much

The surround sound feature is amazon first of all. That in and of itself made me want to keep these. And they will fit everyone differently but I found them a bit uncomfortable and they fell out regularly.
It is very annoying that Apple removed the headphone jack. I am tired of engineers making bad recommendations that do not reflect everyday use.

I've been using it since its been released, and I am very happy with my purchase, not only is it good for school, its good for movies and games. This has saved my life during school, I use the notes almost everyday, but I do recommend picking up the apple pencil with it, overall really good iPad, best part is that it has a touch id, and unlocks instantly.

Purchased my new 4Gen iPad yesterday and it was delivered around noon today.  Setup was complete within 5 minutes, including download from iCloud.  The display is beautiful, it's fast, and the battery is extraordinary.  My old iPad was rendered pretty much unusable due to updates, so the difference between the two versions is glaring.  I also purchased a Magic Keyboard, and it's fabulous as well.
Decent, but don’t think it should be si exspensive.. The pen is separate as it is way too expensive and should come with iPad with the price we have to pay for this thing

EDIT: ok so I went to my Apple store and they replaced it hassle free. I was actually dumbfounded by how easy it was. I’m sorry I doubted you Apple,5/5 quality product and customer service,Old review:,Very nice product but my iPad came with a dead pixel. The product works fine and the pixel is very small, but since I know it’s there it is the first thing my eyes dart to when I look at my iPad. I don’t see it worth it to return the product because what if my replacement has a worse flaw.,Still, so far a very good product, just disappointed to have that flawed pixel.
