A new upgrade for mom to attend her zoom classes. New iPad is fast and the picture quality is great. Sound is fantastic too. I think amazon did offered the best price compared to other stores. Very happy with this purchase, mon loves it too.

My little girl is 6 and I got her this in the 256gig with the magic keyboard from Apple. The only thing I regret is I ordered sky blue and they sent me silver? I can’t take it back because she loves it to much and with school at home the keyboard and mouse are really handy. But if you don’t have prime and have to have it like for Christmas like me. I would order from Apple and get it engraved for free? Js

Apple loves to keep making different charging systems. That I don't like. This iPad is like using an iPhone. don't see much difference. I do like the speed, pretty fast really. Most of all I like reading my Kindle books on it.

Purchased this a few months ago and haven’t put it down. I knew I needed a iPad that could be used with an Apple Pencil for Procreate and this iPad is perfect. I got mine in green and the color is just like the photos. I’m happy I didn’t purchase from the Apple app because it was a little cheaper on here. Overall really happy with this purchase.

Ive never been much of an Apple fan, but I will say I love their tablets. I finally decided to spend the money and buy this iPad air, and so far I love it! The battery life is great, operating system works well for an iPad. No complaints other than I should be able to hold the power button down to power the device off...

I got these for my wife for Christmas to replace her Sony noise cancellation headphones which although have great noise cancellation features, are bulky and take up lots of space when traveling.  So, I'm not sure if we got a "dud" or not, but these Apple AirPods Pro have absolutely no noise cancellation whatsoever.  We've tried all of the different sized ear plugs and there is no difference between OFF, TRANSPARENCY or NOISE CANCELLATION modes.  When we put her Sony headphones on, we can barely hear a tv while standing next to it.  Put these AirPods in and we hear every word on the TV.  Glad Amazon has returns as these are going back.

As a user of most apple headsets through my life, I have found the Pros are the best out there. With slick features such as noise cancelation, transparent, or regular setting. Having the ability to change how you listen while listening give you maximum enjoyment. With a good charging time and well rounded information on when to charge them gives customers the power to have the best headsets at all times. As a person who enjoys going to the gym I was very skeptical if they would stay in my ears or fall out and get damaged. Luckily with he new adjustable ear piece. I have had no problems with this and trust in them to stay in my ears through all workouts. Overall with this product I have felt it was worth the extra money and has been the best pair of headsets I have owned. I would strongly recommend this product for active music listener, people who enjoy working out, or business people needed to listen without distractions.

I have ALWAYS used the corded ear pods for price AND I knew I would not lose them...and they did the job. I have used cordless off brand ear pods and they were okay, but always went back to my corded ones. The Apple AirPod Pros were on sale during the Black Friday week sales so I purchased and have used several times on multiple flights, and it blocks out all the plane noise and annoying passengers that cannot keep their mouths closed. It pairs almost instantly and charges quickly and stays charged for a long time...at least for the duration of my flights so far. No complaints!

As soon as I connected these to my phone my phone started glitching and I could not do anything with my phone. I cannot hear any sound from the headphones. I do not think that these are legit headphones

With any wireless device including headphones, I never had a problem with connecting once they were paired. With this one, I open the case near my phone, get the pop up thing, put them in my ear and.....no sound. Whatever I am listening to does not come through, it goes to the phone speaker. I have checked the bluetooth manager in Settings, and they registered as connected (not just paired, but actively connected). So I end up taking them out of my ears, putting them back in the case, closing it, opening it again, taking them out to see if it will take. I have had to do this at least 3 times, every single time. They are nice headphones, but I don't understand why the simple act of connecting (actually connecting) is like this. I don't understand why I have to put them back in the case instead of just managing it from the Bluetooth menu like every other bluetooth device I have ever used.,Advice is welcome.

I had been researching the AirPods 3 and these AirPods Pro for quite some time. After looking at a comparison video on “Unbox Therapy” I made the decision to go pro lol.,So glad I did. Equally happy that I purchased these babies here and not at the apple store for $249 (plus tax). Got them at $179. Talk about a steal.,The quality of sound that you’re greeted with is just amazing. The spatial audio is an entire experience and that noise canceling feature just places you in a world by yourself. Man, just get them.,Very happy with this purchase.

I purchased these to use with my Apple TV and I am not sure I like them; however, I am only using them to watch non-musical programs mostly. They do block external sound to a small degree. As far as using them with the Music app, I am spoiled by the Bose noise-cancelling head phones with the larger soft, flexible rubber inserts - but those are not wireless.  No matter the size I try, these Apple buds  will not stay in my ears and eventually edge out after a while.  Perhaps I have weird ears. They are easy to use, however, and are recognized easily by all Apple devices and have controls on the buds themselves, although I have not mastered the tap maneuvers yet.

Buyer be aware and read fine print!!!! No way to charge them. I have to buy a plug as well which is about 20 bucks Soooo that being said that’s why they are so cheap!!! No Apple products are ever on sale I am learning!!! Oh Amazon you fooled me on this one!!!!!😠

You buy these for the convenience and not the sound. Having said this, these buds are super convenient to use and sound pretty good too. The noise cancellation is very efficient. I even like Spatial Audio even though it’s gimmicky. They connect to my Apple devices effortlessly. Battery life is good and better with a fully charged case. Would buy it again.

Apple AirPods Pro sound pretty good though not great by audiophile standards. They’re comfortable, at least in my ears for long listening sessions (three + hours) and the noise canceling is as good as can be expected for ear pods of this price/class. I have not tried any other brand’s noise canceling ear pods so I cannot say how good they are compared to any of the competition. Considering all factors overall, these are great. Very convenient to carry around and use and they sound good enough for daily listening if your not after the absolute sound.

I just got them, and tried them as soon as they were delivered. The sound quality is great. Love how my music sounds. The tap controls are very convenient. Only negative thing I would say it the earpiece is larger than the earlier generations, but other than that I love them. Definitely would recommend.
Luv these headphones; I use them for music, and also for meetings.  Perfect for my needs.
My son and husband loved it !!!! great sound, noise cancellation, size and portability.
So disappointed… they did not fit my ears.. I actually had my 23 yr son & 18 yr daughter try them.. & they just did not fit..
All the tech reviewers went on and on how great the sound was,It’s mildly better than wired Apple earbuds

The sound quality is amazing and is definitely an upgrade from the AirPods 1. Spatial audio is very nice for me personally. The AirPods fit in my ear nicely and they passed the shake head test and definitely didn’t fall out. And plus they are just adorable.
Get these and you won’t be disappointed, these have on the options of the Pros, but cheaper and better connectivity.
I just received it today. I opened the package and found that this one was produced in Vietnam, not China, as shown in the shop. The packaging box has a circle of stains.
I really dislike when a greedy company (Like Apple) sells product before they figure out the bugs.
I love These so much. I dont Like how expensive they are but honestly i like them

I like these headphones a lot overall but here is the breakdown (I got it from the local Apple Store):,GOOD:,- APPLE ECOSYSTEM INTEGRATION: You will definitely like these more the greater your integration with the Apple ecosystem.  That is, if you have an iPhone, iPad, MacBook/iMac, Apple TV, etc. you will find these headphones to work seamlessly and flawlessly overall.  I love that it automatically pairs with my iPhone when it's next to it even if it was last connected to my Apple TV or iMac/MBA.  I love how I can check the battery life on my iPhone or Mac notification bar or widgets.  Pairing, connecting, etc. is a breeze with other Apple products.  Never have a problem connecting to any of my Apple devices, which is unlike every other wireless/bluetooth headphone/earphone I've ever used (from Sony, Bose, Beats).  I love using this with my Apple TVs, Macs (MacBook Airs, iMacs), iPad, and iPhone.,- GOOD AESTHETIC & FUNCTIONAL DESIGN: I don't love it, but I think they look nice overall.  I love the cool, smooth metal used on the cans, even if it does add some weight.  I like how all the controls are on the R can and not split between the two.  I like the digital crown for volume and pause/start.  I like the button for toggling noise cancellation modes.,- SOUND QUALITY: They sound good, but not noticeably better than my older Beats Studio Wireless cans.  Bass response is good if you like your bass.  But they also don't have problems connecting via bluetooth every other time I use them like the Beats so that more than makes up for it.,THE BAD:,- COST: Yeah, it's the "Apple tax."  Love it or hate it, all Apple products come with them.,- NO WALL ADAPTER: I really hate how Apple has stopped including AC wall adapters with their recent products.  This only comes with a lightning to USB-C cable.,THE NEITHER GOOD NOR BAD:,- BATTERY LIFE: It may not be the best in class but it is decent (but not great).  I think 10 hours per charge (using noise cancellation or "transparency" mode) is a stretch though.  More like 6 hours or so.,- COMFORT: It is neither super comfortable nor uncomfortable.  The cans are taller than wide so depending on your ear shape you may find it more or less comfortable for extended periods of time.  I find them to be too narrow and get tiring on my ears after using them for a while, but it gets better with some adjustment.  I also find the design of the arch over the head part to be not terribly comfortable, with the flexible mesh between the parallel bars being not that comfortable (can't press them down as the mesh doesn't keep the bars from pressing on your head).,- CASE: I think the "bra/handbag" case gets a lot of undeserved hate.  It is obviously not intended to be a travel case, simply a case to keep the headphones in battery conservation mode (if you have AirPods you know how fast those suckers lose their battery if left outside their charging case).  A case that could charge the phone inside it is not feasible, nor is a wireless charging design.  It just wouldn't work.  But for what it is designed to do -- keep it clean and in battery saving mode -- it does the job and is totally fine.  What I don't like is how the cutout for the lightning cable is a quarter inch off from where the port would be, which is annoying as I can't easily plug in the cord without causing some tension on the port due to the case getting in the way.,- LIGHTNING PORT: I don't mind this that much since I have so many lightning cables, but USB-C probably would have made more sense.,OVERALL:  These really only make sense for people who have numerous Apple devices as it doesn't really justify the price otherwise.  But if you are fully invested in the Apple ecosystem, then it is well worth the price.  I have AirPod Pros and find them to be complementary to each other, and I love having them both.

Purchased from the Apple Store.  Initial assessment is truly outstanding, especially for anyone using Apple devices (iPhone, Macs, Apple TV).  The sound quality is superb within their class, far more natural sounding than Beats, Bose, Sony.  I've got 30 years as a professional musician, and I really have to use my pro grade reference headphones to get better sound, but those are all wired and most cost more than these do.  The noise cancellation is where these things really shine.  I've used Bose QC and Sony's best NC headphones, and the APM noise cancellation is faster and better than those, and the transparency mode sounds truly natural - as if you aren't wearing headphones at all - and switching back and forth is easy to do.  If you use Apple devices, you'll be very pleased with the quick seamless control over your devices, and how easily it switches between devices (a real pain with some of the top competition's headphones).,Now for the bad... and it's really bad.  These things were clearly put out before they were ready for release.  I'm currently waiting on my SECOND repair/replace in less than six months.  My first pair worked well for about six weeks, then started getting really finicky about connecting, then starting switching noise cancelation modes all by itself, then completely lost the ability to connect or reboot/reset.  So I called Apple.  I don't live near an Apple Store, so they sent me a return box that took two weeks to arrive.  I sent them in, and it took a week for them to even start the repair, and a couple more couple days for them to decide the repair was impossible and send me a new pair.  Great!  Until two weeks later when the brand new pair suddenly refused to wake up (come out of sleep mode) and could not be rebooted or reset.  So now I'm waiting on another return box to arrive.  Researching the discussion boards, I can tell you I am far from alone in this experience.,And notice, I haven't even gotten around to the lack of a power on/off option.  These headphones "sleep" in ultra-low power mode, but NEVER actually turn off.  AND then there's the included "case" which is not a case, but a slip cover that leaves all the corner edges exposed, which are the most likely to be scratched or hit.  All the slip cover does is put the headphones to sleep and give partial scratch protection (but NO impact protection).  If you buy these, or already have a pair, invest in a 3rd party smart case.,Bottom line, buying the first generation of this product is a crapshoot.  You may get a lemon, but the warranty should give you time to figure that out and get a working model, even if it takes a few tries, and when these things work as intended, they are, in my opinion, the best consumer Bluetooth over-ear noise cancelling headphones on the market, especially for apple device users.  Sincerely, they kick butt, right up until they don't.,I sincerely hope they get the bugs worked out for v 2.0.  And I'm sure they're motivated - based on the discussion boards they must be losing a ton on replacing all the duds.

First thing first, I received mine as birthday gift so can’t say it’s worth paying $550..that’s up to you to decide. would I pay $550 out of my own pocket? Probably not..they’re probably worth $450 in my book. I also own Sony XM 3, Bose 700, Audio Techica M40 X and Cowin E70.,Second: the sound, which is the main object of any headphones..Max, I will just called Max for short. They absolutely sound amazing..very crisp, clean and nice punchy bass..not super bass heavy like Beats or Skullycandy. The transparency mode and spatial sound are truly game-changer..without the doubt it’s Max’s biggest pluses. Watching movie with HD sound also very impressive. It’s Apple ecosystem only. If you own Android it’s NOT for you.,3rd: comfort, which should be 2nd most important factor..it weights a bit heavy at first but after few days of using it it feels fine. When turning head you will definitely feel the weight..surprisingly  it fits my head perfectly not falling or moving when I am jogging or jumping up and down during doing exercise. After 3 + hours of test run, it feels very comfortable and not hurting my ears..that’s the biggest surprise.,4th: build quality, it’s absolutely great material with metal and aluminum, where most of the weight are made of. However the ear cups bang into each other when you’re taking off the smart case, which might scratch or damage the ear cups long term. You can buy earscups protector, which extra $15 at Amazon.,Now the negative..there are few of them..1. No on or off bottom, which mean your Max will slowly drain in battery. Even you put in the smart case..there are rumors some Max are draining faster than other. Mine is draining very slowly..so I lucked out. 2. Condensation issue. Some Max users reported that their Max have condensation issue when water or sweat get into inside the ear cups causing damage to the drivers. Once the drivers are damage it’s unfixable therefore Max shouldn’t be used for exercise. Yes, I did use for my exercise but I didn’t sweat much. No Apple logo on the Max, which I find that to be insulting and infuriating..$550 and other people can’t tell which brand i am wearing. Bad advertisement from Apple. Last but least the smart case, which is without the doubt the worst case of any kind in human civilization history. You can buy $20 to 100 ( Waterfield ) cases. No power charger, that’s another $20. Wish the battery is bit longer. 20 hours is barely acceptable. With constant battery drainage I’ve to charge Max every 3 day.,For the first generation of Apple overhead headphones it has pluses and minuses..all and I all I lucked on all the negatives  and get all the positive..I give Max’s very impressive 9.8 out of 10 because it’s very comfortable, overall impressive sound and top notch build quality, even its few minus faults.,I recommend to anyone who appreciate great sound quality and have enough money to buy them.

I have gone through thousands of dollars worth of headphones (including Sennhesier HD800S, HD700, HD650, HD600, Beyerdynamic T1 g2, DT770, V-moda M100, focal elear, monoprice M1060, Bose QC35, apple AirPods Pro’s, beats pro, beats studio, Aiaiai, etc, etc) and these AirPods Max might be an end game headphone for me.,As an audiophile and a guy who runs high quality sound systems for events (Funktion-One), these headphones have seriously good audio quality. The presentation of the mids is super clean and smooth without sounding harsh and fatiguing. This leads to very good instrument separation, clarity, and texture. A lot of boomy bass headphones have a lot of bass which may be fun at first, but it ends up muddying everything up so you can hear the bass, but you can’t feel the quality of the bass (the harmonic distortion that gives bass it’s character) and all songs end up sounding the same. With these, you can fully hear the bass to very low frequencies, but it’s not muddied at all so you can really get a sense for the texture and quality of the bass. This is very noticeable in hip hop songs where 808 bass lines all have a certain quality on them or a Tool song where the bassist has raw analog distortion on the bass track, something that is harder to hear on lesser quality headphones/speakers.,One great feature is that they sound great at low volumes too. A lot of headphones you have to turn up to a “fun” level before you can really hear the detail or get interested in the sound, but by that point you’re damaging your hearing. These stay balanced and engaging throughout the volume range.,When I have these on and go about my work, I don’t think about what the headphones sound like, I just hear the music. And it’s a huge relief and breath of fresh air to hear past the headphones and get straight to the music if that makes sense at all.,I could talk a lot longer about the quality of the sound and give examples but would probably bore the average reader. In sum, these headphones have fantastic non-fatiguing sound. The fact that they also have Bluetooth, noise cancelling, comfort, transparent mode are all a bonus.,Big buy recommendation if you want great sound that’s also usable on the go or in the office.

Can’t take mine off. Got them earlier today and am in love. Seamlessly switch between my MacBook, iphone, iPad, even Apple TV. Watched a show on Apple TV with dinner and the sound is just incredible. Did a test phone call to my brother while driving and he said I sounded clear, then I rolled down the window and he said it was still very clear. One thing I am liking also is that in transparency mode I can sing along with a song and hear myself through the headphones like I’m part of the recording. It’s kinda really awesome. Super comfortable too. Zero complaints.

If you have extra money, get them. If not, not worth it. They are good headphones  for sound quality. Obviously, status, if you’re into that. But really no one cares unless it’s a 16 year old kid dreaming about them. I love the noise cancellation feature, It’s a top tier feature. I think that’s what’s your paying for. There is no button to turn them off. You have to put them in the case. The size is inconvenient. You’d have to keep these at a desk or use them for one thing only just to keep up with the case. They’re are easy to lay around and you think they’d be turned off but no, they have to be in that case! Ugg. These are small inconveniences that will annoy you once you had them a while. I own every pair of Apple headphones. I lost one ear piece to each and I’ve been relaying on these bad boys and let me tell you it kinda sucks. That’s what brings me to this review section. I been spending a lot of quality time with these things so i think my opinion is valid. I like them but if you don’t have the money don’t buy them. You won’t use them that much to validate the purpose unless there is a really good reason you want these. I use them on the plane too. I hate putting them in my book bag because they don’t fold so i just feel like they are so exposed. That case does nothing but protect the aluminum and make sure the headphones are off. I use the Sony headphones too. they have a hard protective case. I like that a lot better. I will be honest and say i use these way more because i have everything Apple but they piss me off because i always come back to the thought. These aren’t worth the price even though they’re good headphones. I just shouldn’t have these worries if i paid $600 for headphones. That’s just me though! But y’all have a good day! Hope you enjoyed my real view, i mean review! :D

These are the best headphones i have used hands down. I have been looking for noise canceling headphones for a while yet every set ive tried have the vacuum feel to my ears. These Airpod ProMax are handsdown the best Noise Cancellation Headphones you will find! I have tried everything from sony to bose and there is no competition with these they are the best. The build quality is great and very durable. I would say the price is a lil high i mean just a hundred less would be better but either way these have blown my expectations out the water.,Pros,On of a kind Noise Cancellation (Tested On iPhone),Beautiful Build Quality,Fits your head amazing,Removable Ear cups (Easy cleaning and switching),Great battery life,Cons,Good sound but for the price better is available,No 3.5 Jack (Without purchasing extra dongle),The Cradle “Bra” exposes too much to get damaged,Doesnt have a on/off button (it stays in sleep mode until removed from the cradle or connects),Not designed for Android (Will work but wont have all features),Final thoughts?,If you want some nice headphones these are definitely that but i cannot condone spending this much on a set of headphones just cause they have great noise cancellation or style. Its really hard to say why not to buy these cause I really like them but in most cases i think most people would be better off getting airpod pros.

I’ve read hundreds of reviews. Let’s face it, time well invested at this price point! I was prepared for all the bad. I purchased silicone covers for the ear pieces and the headband before the headphones even arrived (less than $20 for 5 pieces). I expected monumental disappointment with the included case. But I waited to purchase something different.,The headphones arrived (I purchased from a big box store brand new - better deal for me). First, the charging. I’m deep in the Apple ecosystem so I just plugged them into my iPhone charging cord. Simple. After charging I thoroughly enjoyed a good hour of music. Sound wise, I’m in love with the experience. These are comfortable and perform as I would expect. I placed them in the goofy included case. It too performed as intended. Absolutely zero battery drain. But I decided that my shiny new purchase required a better case. I purchased mine from Amazon.,My headphones were instantly recognized by my all my devices so I had zero connectivity issues. Devices include: phone, laptop and tablet. I easily switched between all three.,These are loud. I don’t understand why anyone would complain about them not being loud enough. You’ve got undiagnosed hearing problems if you can’t hear properly even at 50% volume. I haven’t mastered everything these have to offer but now that I’ve spent the money and enjoyed the listening experience, I regret nothing! And that’s coming from someone who has never ever spent that kind of money on headphones.,Bottom line: these headphones are expensive but amazing! They’re user friendly and everything you need to know is available on several platforms for you to make an informed decision (ie: what comes in the box and weather you need an adapter). Save your pennies and purchase them new from an authorized Apple retailer. If you’re going to drop over $500 on headphones, you should not squeal about the extra expense of maintaining their care.,I’ve spent years purchasing Apple products and out of the dozen or more products, I had one bad experience a la my wireless carrier, not Apple.
This thing sucks

I am deeply entrenched in the Apple ecosystem, so it made sense to try these.  I am replacing Sony XM-4s which had good sound reproduction but awful (for me) touch controls.  As expected, out-of-the-box setup was easy with them being recognized instantly by my iPhone.  Construction quality is evident with top-notch materials, tolerances, look/feel, etc.  Although some reviews are negative regarding comfort, I found them to be fine.  Make no mistake, they are heavier than headphones constructed primarily of plastics.  But I don't believe they were designed to be worn when exercising.,Sound quality and noise canceling are first rate.  These are not "Beats-style" bass boomers.  If you want loud, thumping bass, look elsewhere.  If you want to hear amazing clarity and nuances that you can't hear with XM-4s, give these a shot.,Multiple reviewers express displeasure with the supplied case.  My take is that the primary function of this case is to provide minimal protection while serving to put the headphones into low power mode.  Since I don't plan on taking the headphones out of the house, it's fine for me.  If I were to travel with these, or throw them in a backpack, I would put them in a lined zipper bag, or something similar.  So, again, the case is fine for in-home use, but not more than that.,If these were priced at $399, I'd give them 5 stars.  I don't mind paying a premium for Apple's typically high quality construction, ease of integration with other Apple devices, attention to detail, packaging, etc., but $549 is pushing it.  Perhaps the market will agree and these will be discounted at some point.  For now, they're definitely worth a look, but only if the price doesn't bother you.

The battery life on these is horrible. 2 to 2 1/2 hours max on one ear bud. While on meetings. If they are in constant use the don’t last long. I also have issues with them falling out of my ear. I’ve tried multiple ear bud sizes. With no luck. I do like the option of pairing them with other apple ear buds. That way two people can listen to the same thing. I wish apple would come out with something more secure to the head or neck.

As with most apple Pro products, these are made nice. Sound quality is great, and does a great job at reproducing the sound. Wish they did a little better job at noise cancellation…but that could be me not using the correct ear plug pieces seeing how this comes with 3 sizes to use. All-in-all, love these and would get them again if anything happens to the ones I have.

I've never been a fan on Apple ear buds in the past as they never seem to stay in my ears.,This all changed with the new Air Pod Pro (3rd gen) wireless head phones.,The rubber ear pieces allow them to stay in my ears and the noise cancellation feature is great!,I can now tune out bad music played at my gym as well as conversations by other patrons.,I've had MANY issues with other wireless headphones not charging effectively but thus far the Apple Air Pod Pro have not exhibited this issue at all. I highly recommend this product!

these are not active noise cancelling headphone in a same sense as Sony 1000 series are, these just mute very easy sounds but don't actually work very well at that they add some kind of tone to everything, for me its only usable for video calls and that is all I bought it for, don' think this is premium device at all, for example case is not waterproof, and its not sold separately, a big downside.,PS: I have only used it with 3rd party memory foam tips and I think they are a must for these for maximum comfort, regular ones are a bit too slippery.

I bought a pair of AirPod Pros in early 2021. Loved them from day 1. Super to connect and use, and I've never had one problem. Bought a brand new pair two weeks ago and they never worked correctly. Left ear would drop out, or "blink" on and off. I read every forum post, every *fix* available. Reset the AirPods. Click "Forget Device" in the BT settings and repair. Take them out of your ears and put them in the charger, reset and resync. Couldn't select "Noise Cancellation" because "Both pods have to be in your ears." Conducted the ear tip fit" test. Never fixed. I would think it was working, then the left pod would blink on and off, almost like when you're walking out of range from your phone.,Lots of people online have this issue and many more have potential fixes. None worked for me. Apple dropped the ball big time on this one, either because the new Pods have an issue or the iOs does, or maybe both. Would not recommend these pods if you're running iOS 15.2

The best earbuds I've ever used. I didn't believe people when they said how good these were until I got my hands on some for myself. They were paired almost instantly as soon as I took them out of the box. The noise cancellation is incredible!!!! And the transparency mode makes it possible to keep your AirPods in while checking out at the grocery store or any situation like that. These are awesome and WELL worth the $200 price point I paid for them. i just wish the battery life of the case was better, but even so I HIGHLY recommend these.

I have had these a little over a week and the left ear bud won’t charge. Even though it says it’s 100% it dies within 15 minutes. I upgraded from the regular AirPods and they are supremely better in sound quality but for something so expensive I would expect better. They also have a hard time staying in my ears at the gym, it tiring constantly adjusting them and pushing them back into my head. The music controls don’t work that great, it will pause music but I can’t get them to skip tracks, unpause or reverse without using my watch or phone. Things to consider…

I use these constantly. One of my favorite uses is with yard work. I would say that they eliminate 90% of the sound of my lawn mower. I can listen to music at a lower volume than with the cheaper pair that I used to use. They charge quickly. The fit was a little bit suspect for me, but I have had similar issues in the past. I purchased the "COMPLY Foam Apple AirPods Pro 2.0 Earbud Tips for Comfortable, Noise-Canceling Earphones That Click On, and Stay Put (Small, 3 Pairs)" and they made the fit much better and more comfortable.

It took me a while to decide buying this because of the price ticket. So I waited and I got them on the BF sale. I am amazed at the quality of the sound and the level of noise cancellation, when I have them on noise cancellation mode and I'm doing dishes I can barely hear the garbage disposer when I run it. And believe me it makes a racket. The same goes for when my husband is using his awfully noisy tools inside the house.,They are definitely worth the price....... as, IMHO, is everything with the Apple label on it 😉

Before them I always had Jaybird earphones and can tell you that Jaybird has a way superior sound quality for any type of music I tried. The bass and sound quality is superior to the iPods, but the Jaybird Vista 2 (latest and best Jaybird yet) doesn’t have the Noice Cancelation quality that the AirPods Pro have.,If you are looking for a good Noice Cancelation, awesome pairing with you apple devices, then YOU NEED THIS. But if you are looking for the best sound quality, then there are several other brands that can offer you more quality at the same or lower price. L
airpod were better fit for ear and these don't fit as firmly.  Still a good buy...
The sound is beautiful! Crisp, loud, actually has bass unlike previous generations..

I had the product for a few days only. Even when I was just sitting at a table, it fell out of my ears! When they actually stay in, they are very uncomfortable. I cannot comment on battery life as I did not charge it, before returning it.
Item Description says new but received used product. Don't buy this product !!!!
Like every other Apple product this is a great addition to my Apple family of p.

Get em ladies and gentlemen, these do sound a little bit better than the airpod pros. At least to me, when using Spotify equalizer. I think you are getting the exact same features as the pro models. Minus noise cancellation, but again. These are totally worth it
These were a gift for Christmas to my Grandson and he absolutely loves them.

Buyer beware —- they made the buds way too big and they fall out of your ears every few seconds. The second gen fit perfectly, the pros have that rubber piece that goes into the ear canal so it stays snug, these are the middle airpod that need to be forgotten - the last straw for me was smiling while on the phone and both buds fell out.
got this for a present for my wife.  She loves it.  Happy wife = happy life.
Can’t say enough how awesome the new AirPods are. Spatial audio is mesmerizing the first time you hear it. Definitely an upgrade over the first and second gen AirPods

Take that bra case and trash it or throw it on ebay for 20$. Get yourself an actual case here on Amazon. I got one for like 15$... With that, it's great. I agree the normal case is impressively pointless. Just replace it. There's a reason companies make 3rd party cases. It sucks that you have to buy a case for 550$, but I without any doubt say the quality of these makes them worth it.,The sound? God tier. It won't beat your equally priced audiophile grade studio monitors. It just won't. But go ahead and go outside of your custom made quiet home with these and your monitors, and you'll understand that the AirPhones (yes) Max 100% have a place with you.,My point is, studio headphones sound better in a completely noiseless room. But anyone who owns open back monitors knows exactly how they sound with other noise like traffic or people talking. It makes it not worth it. These address that, and I personally would prefer using the AirPhones in a environment that isn't completely quiet,Not to mention they're bluetooth. Good luck finding bluetooth headphones in this price range that sound this good.,And one more thing. They're actually very serviceable and repairable. I'm sure you know the earpads come right off about as satisfyingly as an iPad magnetic folio cover. But did you also know that soft fragile looking headband is replaceable? I haven't had any issues with durability with it but If I did, I could replace the headband. The earcups come right off the headband stem by putting a sim card tool in the little hole that's directly below the stem. See the iFixit teardown for details about that, I highly urge you to not just start jamming a sim tool in random holes in your 550$ headphones. I recommend you not to do it or to figure out how to do it right with help from something like iFixit.

The sound quality of airpods was amazing when they came out. I bought these expecting a bigger sound experience than what I got with my airpod pros but was disappointed. They are designed well and the comments about sweating are not a big concern - that will happen with other devices be it in in-ear or over-ear. It just happens. For me I was bummed that it sounded like the airpod pro sound funneled into larger space that made it less robust. I was surprised by this but it actually sounds more echo-ish as if it's in a bare room.,I'm not trying to slam Apple but to compare I did buy a competitor (top shelf, less expensive) product and I got what I was expecting. The sweating thing happened there too btw...maybe you folks need to wash your ears more often? I dunno. It's not an AC unit so check your environment lol.

I know that the cost of these headphones are more than some other brands. On the surface the other brands may seem offer a similar experience for less money. But “similar” is not the “same”.,I truly believe those in the Apple “walled garden” will love these Apple headphones. I know I do. Comfort is very good, even though they weigh more than the usual competitors. But that is a tribute to their design.,After a week with these headphones I tuned myself in on the controls and the connection to Apple devices. The fact is these headphones are so well designed to work with Apple products, I initially made things harder on myself than I needed to. I guess I didn’t expect them to mesh this well with my Apple iPad Pro, iPhone and MacMini.,BlueTooth range, and sound quality is far superior to any other big brand wireless headphones I have ever owned or auditioned. I use the headphones with Apple Music and Tidal. Yes,,I know, these BT headphones cannot support “lossless” audio streaming, like my wired headphones. But see below:,I’m enjoying these almost as much as my cabled Sennheiser HD-650 and Audeze LCD-2 headphones driven by a DAC/amplifier.  Note I said “almost”. I don’t want to be thrown out of the “headphone audiophile club” ;),But wireless has its compensations. I can do projects around the house, and lounge on my deck. Not to mention enjoying great sound during travel. BTW ANC and transparency modes are fabulous!,My only concern is whether the headphone band will wear well. My initial dislike of the case is something that I got over. I did order a third party case for travel.,I think the aluminum ear cups could certainly get scratched or dinged up. So I added a ear cup cover accessory. There are multiple options on Amazon.,Do yourself a favor and consider how deep you want to dive into the Apple “walled garden”. I’m glad I did!

Regardless of the fact that these are limited to AAC resolution and Apple has said they will not be able to play their new high resolution files at full resolution, the sound quality on these is fantastic. Better than several other 'audiophile' headphones in the same price range that I have tried (with a separate DAC AND Amp). The noise cancellation is the best I have heard. They work great with my iphone, as they should. And they are very nicely finished and comfortable.,Irritations and quirks- they don't interface flawlessly with my macbook pro. Had to go into system settings and force the sound to go through the headphones instead of the portable's speakers.  and had to do it again when I wanted to watch another show the next day.  And while watching a movie in another room, the headphones would sometimes switch to whatever I had last played on my phone, not good. they seem designed to look for the phone over anything else. the lack of a charger is irritating at the price (come on Apple, not even a dinky 5 w charger like you used to include with iphones?) and I wish it was a usb c port instead of the lightning port, that way I could use my laptop's charger on both without changing cables. And the 'case' is a joke. But again, sound is terrific, very comfortable, nice looking. And if you do want one, wait for one of the flash sales, price dropped 30 bucks over the weekend a few weeks back, just for that weekend.

Upfront its obvious that these are expensive, especially when there's the Sony XM4's, Bose 700's, and many other quality options on the market for a third less than the Airpods Max or less than that.  However, as soon as you pick these up, you can feel the quality of the build of materials Apple put into these.  They're heavy to hold but theyre no problem to wear because of the mesh canopy.  I've sat with these on my head every day for 6-10 hours since December (ordered from Apple) and the top of my head never feels any pain or pressure whatsoever.  This is different than my experience with my prior headphones, the Sony XM4's, that would start to hurt and get sweaty around the top band and earcups after a couple hours.,Another comparison that is night and day is the noise cancelling.  They handily beat the Airpods Pro in noise cancelling and definitely also edge out the XM4's as well.  You don't have the option to tune how heavy the NC is like with the Sony or Bose mobile apps, but I prefer max NC anyway so it's not a problem for me.  Transparency mode on the Airpods Max is also bar none the best implementation over any other headphone.  The audio piped in from your environment feels like you're not even wearing giant earcups over your ears because it sounds identical to what you'd hear in the real world.,The sound is extremely good as well.  I am not an audiophile by any means and these obviously aren't trying to compete with Sennheiser's Orpheus headphones or anything, but turning on NC, blasting your favorite song and closing your eyes gives you quite a fun experience you get lost in.,Controls on the Airpods Max, the digital crown and NC toggle button are also nice and vastly superior to the touch controls or multiple button on the side of the earcup setup most headphone companies use.  It's dead simple to use, quick to access, and you can get precise volume increment changes if needed.,The extra features you're familiar with from Airpods or Beats like quick paring, auto switching, icloud pairing, etc, is all there and works just fine as you'd expect if you have used them before.,The only downside I can think of is the case.  It's not super protective (although not as bad as I feel like the media hounded it for), its weird looking, and its annoying to fold the headphones into and out of each time.  Most of the time I just set my headphones down on my computer desk and walk away.  They go into a semi-low power mode so it doesnt drain much battery anyway.  I usually need to charge these every 2 days or so anyway so it doesnt make a difference if I were to use the case.  I will need to pick up a third party case for traveling though, as I'd be too afraid to have these getting smushed around in my backpack.,Overall though, if you are on the fence for these because of the high price, get them.  They are super high quality, have lots of features, and I believe the build will hold up for many years, especially compared to the plastic headphones most people buy.

I've been using the Bose 700s for a while now, and I finally decided to give these a try. They are definitely worth the price difference. These sound wayyyy better than the Bose, especially when I'm watching 4K with Dolby vision. I love watching my TV with these. Also, the noise canceling is just on another level from any pair of headphones I've tried. These really block out everything, including the air conditioner units running in my house. The controls are also really easy to use, granted you take the time to read how to use them.,I don't really have any complaints. A lot of people will gripe about the price, but that's Apple for you. You get what you pay for. If you already own a number of Apple products, you'll really benefit from how easy these will integrate into your life. They are exceptionally easy to use with Apple TV. I can switch between listening to my Apple TV, my iPhone, and my MB Pro all in a matter of seconds. I've also had no problem syncing these to third party devices.,Are these large? Yes. They're heavier than the Bose definitely, but I have not had issues with neck pain. I don't find them uncomfortable at all. That's been the most impressive part of the package for me. I figured they'd be intrusive and uncomfortable. But they really aren't. So far, I've had no issue wearing them for 7-8 hours at a time. Years ago, I had the Sennheiser Momentum 2.0s, which caused me neck pain. I was apprehensive that I'd face the same scenario here. Fortunately, I have not had that issue.

Update 8/21: Eight months later, and I'm still very happy with these.  I use them almost every day.  I think Apple must have improved power management, because I've noticed I don't have to charge them as often as I originally did.,Original review:,These were in very high demand for the first couple of months, but I managed to snag a pair from my local Apple store on launch day.  Honestly, I fully anticipated that I would end up returning these after 30 days, since I didn't expect them to live up to the somewhat high price tag.  When I first played a brief bit of music through them when sitting in the parking lot, that feeling was reinforced, as my initial impression was not great.,However, after getting back home and acclimating my ears to the sound signature, my Bose 700 headphones went up for sale on Ebay the next day.  I'm not an audiophile, so I won't attempt to describe the sound in flowery, embellished terms, but to my ears they sound just about as perfect as you could expect headphones to be.  I listen almost exclusively to classical music, and what I love most about these headphones is that the bass is solid and soothing, but is not obnoxiously overpowering.  The bass is definitely there, but at the same time it doesn't feel like the headphones are "exerting themselves" to produce that sound.,Comfort is fine... they do not clamp overly hard on my head, and I prefer the feel of the cloth material rather than sticky vinyl or leather.  I wish Apple had included a way to manually power them off, but in practice this hasn't been a significant issue... I plug them in every 3 days or so.

Cons:,-The device switching (for apple devices) is not as flawless as I thought it would be and sometimes the headphones get hung up on one device. This is probably fixable by a future software update.,-the headphone ear pieces clack together when they are turned flat, which probably isn’t a big deal, but makes me worry about dings.,Pros:,-7 hours straight listening while wearing glasses, way less ear fatigue than any other over ear headphone I’ve ever used.,-transparency mode is deep magic.,-the spatial audio is so cool.,-it is satisfyingly hardy and I have zero buyer’s remorse.,-noise cancelling is pretty good! Music playing from a speaker nearby can get through it at almost imperceptible levels. For machine hum, fan noise, and constant drones it does incredibly well, it’s a little unreal.,-headband: very comfortable, adjustments are easy and stay put,Neutrals:,-Audio quality is really quite good, but it didn’t blow me away. I still like it a lot, and I prefer the sound of these to the Sony’s-xm4-whatever’s, which a friend let me try .,-weight: they are a little heavy, but I’ve gotten used to it pretty quickly.,-button to switch the noise cancelling mode sometimes requires me to hit it a second time, it has a deeper press which I’m still getting used to.,Overall I love them. Would recommend if you’ve been holding out on other models, use the Apple ecosystem, and plan to own these for a long time like me.

I laughed at these when I first heard about them but ended up grabbing a pair after seeing there was a 3 month wait (mine shipped early). These are EXPENSIVE but in my opinion worth it. Most top of the line wireless over the ear headphones cost around $399-$499 so there are a tad more. My only complaint is the weird case for them that looks like a lady's bag.,These headphones are beautiful, sleek and pack phenomenal sound. I will still use my air pods more but will use these when I travel or just want to lay on my couch and listen to music.

I was so excited to get this pair of headset and I have been using it as the only headset (I have multiple) for about a months now. Yes, the sounds is great, but it is not superior to what I have on my Bose QC35. The main charm was that it has Spatial Audio - but wait - there Spatial Audio content is hardly available anywhere. So what does this mean? This means that I paid almost twice the price of an excellent Bose QC 35 noise cancelling headset, with following added DIS-advantages:,1) It is almost twice as heavy, if not more, making it inconvenient to use for longer use.,2) I cannot just turn it off to conserve power; I need to every time place it in the (ugly) case,3) The battery running time is only 20 hours (compared to QC35's 30+ hours) - implying need for frequent charging,4) The primary selling point - Spatial Audio - is worthless since there is hardly any content available for it.,Save yourself a bundle, inconvenience and buyer's remorse. Do more research and get yourself something else.

Coming from the second gen airpod, these souded a bit better, but not as much as people say. However, one problem I have with mine is that there's a ringing sound in the right airpod everytime there's no music.
Purchased as Christmas gift for granddaughter. Is exactly what she wanted.
Very satisfied with my new AirPods and the price.  Fast delivery.  Love it
None of the features you get with the pros,And they fall out of your ears easily. Epic fail
My grandson is very happy with these AirPods. He wears them all the time.
I have had every AirPod model. This pair is by far my favorite. The design is very good. The sound is awesome. Easy to pair with my iPhone and overall I am very pleased with this purchase.

Love when they work but usually break in a few months.  One ear will cut out and sometimes they just stop on a run and won’t pair again quickly.  If Zvi don’t lose one, they usually stop working after 3-4 months anyway.
Not the best quality or noise cancellation. But works ok for my young granddaughter.
the gen 3 sounds a lot better than the gen 2, i was surprised! worth the higher cost in my opinion.
I’ve used all versions of the AirPods but these fall right out of my ears….returned

I need a headset of some kind for work. I have to go between sound from a mac, my iPhone and a Dell laptop. I was worried they wouldn’t be compatible and easy to switch. They are! The sound is fantastic. Being able to cancel the noise around me is amazing. I can concentrate on work without looking around to see what’s making a noise. And when just enjoying music or a podcast they can’t be beat. You can get all the Apple guarantees with these as you would if you bought them from an Apple store. They are worth the price.

I have tried so many different wireless earbuds. All had one issue or another.  Here is why I give the Apple Airpod Pro's 5 starts. Sound quality is great. Smooth connection to phone mid call (I don't always have them in when a call comes in). Battery life is great. Earbuds fit comfortably both inside and outside of ear (this has been a huge issue with other wireless buds). The touch element of these earbuds is well placed for answering calls or music on/off (After wearing for a while, I want to adjust them and with other earbuds this would cause me to drop calls or turn on/off music).  Siri reads incoming texts and allows for dictation of outgoing texts.,Love these earbuds!

I love these AirPods, sound quality is superior, Active noise canceling works great for a small in ear headphones. Spatial audio future works great, sometimes I forget I have AirPods on, it feels like sound coming directly from my phone, another future I love is automatic on/off, once you put them in your ear AirPods turn on when you take them out turns off automatically., It can also be used as single AirPod, they work independently, It is also very easy to pair and connect, battery lasts as it is advertised and lasts longer if active noice canceling is off. One down side for me is, it doesn’t stays in ears while moving as I was expecting other than that it works and looks great.

Best ear buds I have purchased. I finally got tired of buying all the cheap ones and decided to bite the bullet and buy the real deal apple air pods pro and I do not regret it at all. After what I’ve spent on the cheap ones I could have bought these years ago and had 2 more pair with what I invested in the cheap ones. The sound quality is amazing! My husband gets pissed about the noise cancelling technology because he will be trying to talk to me and I don’t hear him 😂😂. Awesome product. I highly recommend!

I ran out of patience while trying to learn how to use the stem controls, and never did get them to work (and I know from reading online comments that I'm far from the only one). Also, I only got a little over five hours of battery life (from a full charge) while listening to music from my iPhone 13 (which was nearby the whole time, in my pocket).,I REALLY like the noise cancellation and passthrough features of the Pro, but otherwise prefer my old Gen 2 AirPods. So, I won't be keeping these.

First, I would buy this product again but am frustrated with the design of the earpieces that dont allow for a very secure fit. If I am moving around I need to push the pods back into my ears often. I bought after-market retaining pieces and foam ear pieces that fit into the ear which make the pods work for more intense workouts. That being said, they have great sound and decent noise cancellation. I have used them on a couple flights with the stock silicone ear pieces and have been able to listen to music, podcasts, and movies without having the crank the volume past 3/4. Battery life is fine as long as you put them back in the case when done using them. I charge them about every other day.

I've always preferred the usability of in-ear earbuds. However, my ear canals are smaller than most people and so any in-canal earbuds hurt after an hour or so of use.,These are the only in-canal earbuds I've ever used that don't leave me in pain afterwards. Something about the plastic is extremely comfortable. I can't really explain it.,I thought spatial audio was going to be a gimmick that would be cool but wouldn't really add anything different to my listening experience. I like to watch football on my computer while I work. Yesterday, I had to restart and decided to watch it on my phone while my computer went through the update cycle.,The spatial audio totally fooled my brain. I actually had to take one of my AirPods out to confirm the sound was coming from them and not my phone. It's like magic.,I've owned 20+ headsets, from Bose to HyperX and everything in between. These are the best I've ever had. I prefer the sound of these over my Razer Nari Ultimate, and I LOVE my Razer Nari Ultimate.,I had planned to return these within a week if they weren't absolutely top-notch. I'm keeping them.

**UPDATE** Second pair was also defective. Same rattling in the left earbud. I'm guessing it came from the same batch since it was ordered so closely together time wise. Sent both pairs back and will be purchasing directly from Apple. The discounted price is nice, but only if the product works as it's supposed to.,Delivered in a timely manner, packaging wasn't damaged and sound quality overall was great. The only issue I have with the product is there is a rattling coming from the left airpod. Happens regardless of the type of music, volume, etc.,In the process of returning the item and getting a replacement. Will update the review depending on if the new ones fix the issue.,I've read in a couple reviews to beware of airpods assembled in Vietnam and those reviews are not lying. My pair was from Vietnam and it had issues. So buyer beware, I'd suggest purchasing straight from Apple if possible.

UPDATING REVIEW.  YOU can call Apple after the fact and they will add purchase date so Apple Care can be bought over the phone.  No problem.  I bought AirPods new and can't add apple care after purchase without taking the AirPods to an apple store for assessment which is very inconvenient.  Waited to purchase Apple Care until I received them to see if I would like them.  Well within 30 days of purchase.  Suggest you buy Apple CAre at time of purchase through Amazon, rather than waiting.

I would have loved to keep these but they would not fit in my ear canals. I had to return them. The large tips were to small making the noise canceling ineffective. I had to go with Sony XM4 earbuds because I could get aftermarket SpinFit tips. This combination works great. No one makes a good XL tip for the Apple earbuds. If Apple is going to have a proprietary tip attachment design, they should at least offer an XL and an XS size tip, even if they are an expensive added accessory.

Pros: Great construction, color choices, material build, sound quality, ANC, seamless connection to the Apple devices,Cons: Heavy so will be difficult to carry on the head for a long time; specially if traveling a lot. No connection to the airplane systems (additional money spent); the mesh is great looking but will break with travel.  Price is too high to justify. Approx range could have been $300; for the additional 249 you get the Apple Brand, Logo. No case to carry; that case is useless.,Recommendation:  Wait for the AirPods Max version 2. They will reduce the price and provide a better value and case.

Do NOT buy these if you want to use them on your Apple TV or iPhone to watch streaming movies or shows. They do not get loud enough.,Any audio source with multi-channel audio, on max volume, is barely loud enough to hear even in a dead silent room. Have to focus more than natural to hear anything.,I had hopped Apples own headphone product  would do better with volume than my other full sized headphones, Skull Candy Crusher Evo, when it comes to streaming apps, but nope, these are less volume.,They do get loud for Apple music, and 2.0 audio no problem. But overall, they are lower volume than most other headphones i have used. Same results when using my iPhone 12 PM with the same streaming apps.,Sound:,Very disappointing.  I am baffled as to all the glorious reviews, even audiophiles generally surprised and praise these. They all must be tone deaf or brainwashed by Apple or being paid by Apple to give them such a good review. I have used $20 Walmart no name random endcap headphones that sound about where these are, just average, certainly not $500+ quality.,Not exactly flat sound, it is a U shaped sound with the highs raised and the low sub bass raised.,But everything in the center sounds just cheap and tad tiny, lacking any vibrance or sound stage.,Narrow sound stage.,Sure sound is extremally subjective, I prefer lots of deep bass clear mids and highs, with a wide soundstage. These are nothing like that. They have very little bass. There are tiny hints of some very low volume low sub bass, but only appears when the song is bass heavy. They are nothing compared to the bass that the SkullCandy Crusher Evo has when using its Haptic Bass, or the Vmoda Crossfade Wireless (when u use a EQ since they are tuned to be mostly flat stock). There is no way to natively EQ these Apple headphones.,"Spatial Audio" is a super gimmick.,Take a metal can of Jimmy's  Baked Beans, cut the 2 ends out of the can, and stick one end over your ear, the other stick the headphone on it, that is how it sounds. Like listening to something in a tin can. Super tiny, echoey and just awful.,Design/Build Quality:,SUPER!  This is what you are buying. A super high quality metal product that is more work of fine art than a  product that gives you good audio experience.  So much a work of art and fashion, there is no power button.,Comfort:,This is where I have to give these 6 stars.  They are surprisingly comfortable. They are the heaviest weight headphones in my collection, yet they feel the lightest on my head.,My SkullCandy Crusher Evo, have stronger clamp force, the headband aggravates the top of my head, and my ears get very hot and sting after 15 min or so of use. But they have amazing sound, head rattling bass and sound like a full Home Theater system with 2 large subs.,But, I wanted something more comfortable so that i can watch long movies or shows late night when i don't so much care about having the Home Theater experience.,It is truly too bad these Apple headphones do not get loud enough to be useable for such, cause they are so comfortable, i would be able to wear them for hours and barely feel them.,Noise Cancel:,I do not nor ever cared for Nosie Cancel tech in full sized headphones, as i use them at home in a quite room. (The only use case I have for Nosie Cancel is at work, but i use earbuds there, for pocket abilty and convenience. The AirPods Pro earbuds do a good job of canceling out the noise of a warehouse when i want them too, and transparency is good for when I am around the office area and need to hear my co-workers, but still want to listen to my pods casts. I do not listen to music at work, so i do not care that the AirPods Pro sound like crap for music.),The AirPods Max ANC is very good far as I can tell. It will eliminate the noise of a fan on in the room, even a AC unit. Many say it is the best ANC they have used, even compared to Bose and Sony...i can not really comment on that, since i have needed ANC and thus, have very little experience with it.,When neighbor is mowing the lawn, or when crying babies or kids are out playing and there is noise i want to mute, I guess I can throw these on and make my world quite again.,The case:,It sure is....unique. It is fine for me, since they will just sit on a bookshelf, but for sure, useless as a real case and even more useless if you intend to travel. For sure, go buy a aftermarket hard case online.,Other:,Uses lightening cable. But that's Apple for ya.,Have to buy a $35  3.5mm jack to Lightening cable  to use wired, and has to be that or special designed cable meant for these, since it needs to be bi-directional. Or the inverse of most cables. U need one that converts and sends the signal from analog jack to digital Lightening, 99% of "Lightning to 3.5mm" cables /adapters work the standard way (digital Lightning to 3.5mm analog). And I tried a Apple lightning to lightning cable, and that does not trigger wired mode.,Overall, overpriced, typical Apple product. Yes, I use Apple products, but not just Apple. I use daily Apple and Google and Windows products and ecosystems.,If you are wanting good sounding headphones, look elsewhere.,Are you wanting a set of Apple built full sized headphones that put out sound, then you will be happy with them.,At least, since they are nice metal cans on your head, if you are out for a walk, and get mugged, u can use them as a defensive weapon and bean your attacker over they head with them. Bonk! They would hurt.

I appreciate good sound.  I have a pair of $5K Bowers & Wilkins speakers.  I subscribe to Tidal and Qobuz High Def music steaming services.  My other headphones are Sonys that are always rated number 1,  Bowers & Wilkins PX and of course Bose QC35II.  At first when I listened to Apple Max at Apple store I did not like what I was hearing, but after I’ve watched some professional reviews on YouTube from people who know what they are talking about, I picked up a pair.  I went through the pain of ordering the Apple cable since that’s the only one that works actually works with DAC.  Once I plugged it into my  Dragonfly Audioquest Red, and started listening to high def masters on Tidal, I was quickly wowed by the sound quality.  The soundstage is great, the sound is very balanced, bass is tight and punchy.  If I could describe the sound with one word, it would be ‘luxurious”.  If you just use these via Bluetooth,  you are denying yourself the reason for buying these.  Via Bluetooth, the sound difference between these and the other headphones is not that pronounced, because, it is Bluetooth protocol that kills all the goodness in sound transferring.  You need to use these plugged in and use a good quality DAC if you are coming from Iphone to unlock higher definition.  When plugged in,  I will rank my headphones:  Apple - 1st,  Sony - 2d,  B&W - 3d and Bose QC35II - last.  However Bose is the most confortable to wear for hours.  Sony is the second most comfortable, Apple is third and B&W are least comfortable.  B&W has incredible soundstage (it is like you are there) and some instruments sound incredible, but it is so uncomfortable it is like torture for my ears.,So the bottom line if you just want to go Bluetooth and don’t care about high def music - Sony is the best bet (2021 1000XM4 model but 2019 1000XM3 model is very close too and 2019 model had APTX chip and the 2001 model does not),  but if you are willing to go an extra step to appreciate fine sound, these Apple AirPods Max are the best.

I received these as a gift, in other words, price cannot be taken into account. I received these in Salmon color. I use them everyday on an android device and on a mac based OS device. I own the Sony 1000XM4,Based on my experience in ears solution like the Shure, some over ears AKG experience and some brief encounter with ribbon speakers on 10K+ amp, I would say the first limit of these headphones are the Bluetooth protocol itself. In that regard, the only way to extract the acoustic quality of these is to use the $40 cable.,Ergonomics, the headphones distribute their weight evenly across a stretch mesh fabric. Clever design. The friction required to extend the arms of the headphones is high enough that you will not have to recalibrate the length across time. The buttons have a great feedbacks, and I bought translucent protectors to protect the anodized finish of the shells. The ear cushions are comfortable, even for glass wearer. However, its design forces you to put them back correctly straightforward other wise the head detection system will not work (you can see that the hole does not align when cushion is upside down L-R down instead of up).,What a great segway to bring this important point. This is a not perfect product in its design and integration, from the unacceptable case form and functions, to the headphones poor battery autonomy, to the threat of having the humidity of the head getes into the speakers (read the forum, I think this is true), I got to say, you may have to shell another $50 for the apple care.,Having said all that, from a person being on android, I would go for these. The overall experience and acoustic, reminds me a bit of the third gen ipad, imperfect, but who cares.,Between these and the Sony 1000XM4, even on an Android and the 2/3 the battery life, I would go for Apple one. Better built, better sound, better ergonomics. If you have holes in your pocket go for it and go for the apple care, you won't regret it.

I love music!  Saying that, when the percussionist in the symphony taps the triangle, I want to hear it.  I have tried cheap and expensive headphones and finally, I have a pair and I can hear all the sounds.  These are just amazing.  Long battery life and the highest quality I have found.  Now what I don't like:  #1:  The cost, these are expensive but I finally have what I need, #2:  The weight, I think these are a little heavy.  They are made with quality material but are not light.,All in all, the best I have used.  I bought blue and the cushions on the headphones can be changed.  They are magnetic and you can purchase separate colors.  With the return policy, what do you have to lose?  You will be amazed at Amazon Music HD or Tidal since they have the best streaming rate.  Enjoy!!!

After listening to my husband ask repeatedly “What do you want for Christmas?” I finally gave in and confessed I had my eye on these AirPods Max. (I bought them at the big box store). I am Blown Away, let me tell you. They are by far THE BEST headphones I’ve ever owned. YES, they are expensive. I rarely buy anything for myself preferring to spend my money on the kids/grandkids. I guess that is how I justify buying them for myself.,The sound is so rich and clear. I hear parts of a song I never heard before. Wow. They are a bit heavy but I like them that way. I don’t see myself wearing them for more than an hour or two at a time. I love the way that they fit. They perfectly fit over my head.,They paired perfectly with my iPhone. Just a few taps and even a Grandma like me is up and running. The case is even a lot more substantial than I thought and gets the job of protecting the Headphones done nicely. These are my “at home” headphones. When I want to relax and kick back. I ended up getting the Space Grey color. I’d recommend going to a local store just to try them out and see for yourself whether they are worth the price tag. For me they are worth it.

Pros- These headphones sound amazing, I've tried Bose 700's Sony wh100xm3's and xm4's and still, these headphones had better sound quality than both. the bass response is incredible, its prominent yet not muddy. the mids and highs are crisp yet not overpowering. when you first get the headphones they don't really sound that good but then you go to headphone accommodations and do the custom audio setup then they sound amazing. also the transparency mode is better than i ever thought, people in youtube videos raved about it but when i tried it, it was mind blowing i could actually sustain a conversation with it, and the noise canceling was also amazing.,Cons- doesn't come with a case, the included bra is useless, I also wish it came with an audio cable and and a charging brick. its also a bit heavy and the clamping force is off, it squeezes more at the top a considerable amount.,Summary- if you have a decent amount of money to spend, have an iPhone, and really care about audio quality then buy these headphones, if you plan to use these with a pc then don't bother, I had issues with Bluetooth that made these un-usable.

Very good build quality. Sound is great but not better than what you'd find elsewhere for $100 - 150 cheaper.,Everyone compares these to Bose or Sony (which they don't compare to) when at this price we should be comparing to Master & Dynamic MW65 or one of the Sennheiser PXC 550 or Momentum 3's to which - Apple falls severely short in every single area.,So with these you're paying about $250 for a name and "Cool factor" but not for quality.,For $500 I expect the best out and they aren't even in the top 5!

I purchased these directly from Apple.  It took months to deliver, and during the interim I thought many times about canceling the order.  Why? Well, the first thing is it worth the astronomical cost, and especially when compared to a benchmark set such as the Sony WH-XB900N/B ($248 on good ole Amazon)?  The answer is a definitive "No!"  The Apple AirPods Max are grossly over priced.  Any intelligent buyer would want to compare the "specs."  For instance, what are the frequency response, THD, etc. that virtually every high-end pair of headphones provide.  Apple supplies no specs and when I asked Customer Service for them for comparative reasons, I was told that they weren't available. The only comparison is therefore subjective. The AirPods Max came well packaged - an Apple hallmark.  Instructions were not only scant, but written in a faint gray color and in a font size that even an eagle would have challenges discerning. The controls for adjusting the tonal qualities are absent too.  The ear cushions are very comfortable, but after about 30 minutes become very warm.  The headphone are also among the heaviest due to their metal construction, which give a solid feel. The mesh headband is also innovative and very comfortable.  Coupled with the right and left adjustments, they are a pleasure to wear for extended periods.  A variety of colors are offered too, but I went with the space gray and later ordered the red cushions ($69), and yes the price includes both right and left cushions as the Apple ad is vague on that matter.  Overall sound reproduction is above average, but not stellar. The Sennheiser Momentum 3 headphones, in my opinion, are far better as are the Sony XB900, and they are significantly less expensive.  The battery life is very good thus far and has approached 17 hours before needing to be re-charged.  Apple advertises 20 hours. Part of Apple's promo is free engraving on the AirPods Max, which I requested.  They arrived sans engraving.  Customer Service informed me that it was apparently a common error, and offered to provide a full refund or replacement.  I asked about the replacement's delivery. It would be another couple of months. Ridiculous, and shame on Apple for its inferior quality control, but it's par for the course as previous engravings have also been neglected rendering the whole promo a joke - on me unfortunately. So, do I recommend the AirPods Max?  If comfort is your primary consideration, then yes.  If sound quality is your primary consideration, then no. If you need headphones quickly, then it is even more of a headache, and don't even bother with the free engraving.,Update After Three Weeks,The headphones have performed well and reproduce virtually all of my music with great fidelity.  The battery still doesn't last as long as claimed by Apple, but the condensation issues that others have reported have not been experienced even after several hours of wear.  They do, unfortunately, make your ears very warm.  The major problem, and successfully resolved by a very capable Apple Support Member, was a failure to re-connect after charging. The reason(s) is still unclear, but after charging the headphones were totally "dead." The factory re-set was attempted three times unsuccessfully.  After re-starting all (Mac) devices with current OS systems, verifying Bluetooth connections, etc. the AirPods Max seemed doomed to a factory repair while still under warranty.  I then re-connected them to the Apple charger and the green indicator light appeared - a good sign! I then paired the headphones again with all devices and they regained functionality at 100% charged.  The Apple Support Member and I were both surprised and relived.  At least, I established a logged case and reported malfunction should it happen again.  Bottom line - for the exorbitant cost one would expect better quality control.  My opinion is that the AirPods Max were rushed to production in efforts to meet a high demand and quality suffered.,And a rumor among others that strong magnetic fields can effect a shutdown will be followed up on later, and after mine pass through airport luggage scanners, loose connection near microwaves, etc.

But it’s worth it!  I got it at the Apple Store but it’s actually cheaper here.  I got the green ones but really want it in purple but doesn’t exist!  I listen back and forth between these and Beats Powerbeats Pro and the latter sound like mini mono speakers compare to these.  Firstly, $500 is nothing because I paid $5000 for audiophile headphones but you don’t really need such headphones.  Not practical.  They are wired and open cased so you can’t use them in a plane and you’ll disturb other ppl.  They don’t leak sound but actually acting like speakers! I've never been one for apple products other than the iPhone. However these are a game changed. Finally the last touch that I love is the "transparency mode" which allows you to have normal conversation and hear everything as if you have no headphones in at all.

I like to take walks, and I often workout at a very loud gym, the voice canceling software is great, it mutes out the noice at the gym, I have not yet tried running in them, and I’m not sure if they will stay in place in my ear while running, but when it comes to lifting weights they are perfect.,They can respond to text messages and that has voided some issues because it will try and send a message to someone while I am having a conversation with someone else, but I just try and be cautious about it.
