My guess is most of the reviewers had them not long before they gave them 5 stars. I hate them. They are constantly a struggle to connect to my iPhone 12. They are always waving flags on my screen telling me where they are. They are always asking me to use Siri and to use Apple music. Yet they won't connect. I hate them. They are more of a malware than a listening device. When you can get them to work, the sound is great. I have to turn my desktop off when using them or they start playing iMusic from my PC when I am 2 floors away trying to use the phone playlist, I hate them.

Another winner from Apple. Are these headphones expensive, yes. Are they worth it, yes! These are the best sounding bluetooth headphones I have ever heard. First off, the noise cancelling is amazing! It doesn't shut out every noise, but close to it. Then press the button on the headphones and you can hear everything around you. Like your not even wearing them. This is great if someone is talking to you while wearing them. The sound quality is really very good. Listening to music (depending on the recording) I can hear instruments I have never heard before in a song. Everything is clear and the boosted bass is a welcome addition. The bass is not too heavy, it seems just right. I really enjoy listening to them. The battery last for days/weeks if you keep them in the case. The one downside (the case) it's ugly. I bought a case on Amazon that works just as well and looks a lot better. Long and short of it, the Airpod Max's don't do anything perfect. However, they do everything really well! Disclaimer: I bought mine through Apple, not Amazon.

I've seen reviews online saying it's similar in sound quality to the Bose QC35 II, but damn, It's not even close.,After daily driving the QC35 for 3 years, I could tell immediately that the sound is clearer and less distorted. The AirPods Max complimented many genres of music, from rock and pop by AC DC, Coldplay, Maroon 5 and modern house music by David Guetta and Oliver Heldens. Bass punches harder while vocals stay as sharp as a razor. The sound is deeper with more vibrance and contrast.,Noise cancelling is way better than the QC35 and even better than the new XM4 by Sony. Transparency mode is incredible and way ahead of the competition - even better than the AirPods Pro.,My only 2 complaints - the stupid Smart case and the weight. They are less comfortable than the Bose. If you're looking for something to wear on a long flight go for the Bose or AirPods Pro. I'm very sensitive to clamping pressure and it's quite strong. The case - built from nice "fake" leather but absolutely no protection. Throw it away and buy a replacement from Amazon.,P.S. I haven't tried the THX panda, but they miss too much features in my opinion.

There are pro's and con's.  on the pro side, the sound is ok.  it's not $1000 nice but it's better than the cheapy airpods.,On the con side, bluetooth is still terrible.  The microphone in meetings is terrible.  it's either off - you cannot hear yourself at all or all the noise in the back ground is amplified significantly and you can hear everything!  there is no between - it sucks.  You either feel you are under water and yelling (hoping others can hear you) or you turn off noise cancellation and you hear EVERYTHING amplified.,How about noise cancellation and hearing your own voice?!

As everyone has stated, battery life isn’t the best but if you are reasonable with your usage and charge frequent it’s not an issue. For me, these will hardly leave the house unless I’m flying. I like to enjoy, primarily, music (often after a few drinks) or to watch YouTube videos in bed.,The audio is very clean and adds a lot of depth and separation to the mix. Unlike other headphones, it doesn’t feel like it is leaning bass heavy or boosted in vocal range (2,000-4,000hz) and I would not at all say these are “tinny” in fact the upper frequencies feel great and the overall sound is balanced.,I had did have to return my first pair to repurchase at a lower price (it went on sale $50 less than a week after I bought them!) and my first pair maybe fit a little better? Not sure if that’s placebo or what- but had I not had that pair I wouldn’t notice or say that they don’t fit great, because they do. My new pair just feels a little more loose.,If you enjoy listening to music regularly, and I mean really enjoy it, then these are for you. I wouldn’t sell my kidney for these, but a couple days worth of hard-work? These are definitely worth that imo. I plan to get the cable to hardline them for even better sound in the future. Maybe around Black Friday or cyber Monday?

I have had headphones since cassette walkman age. And by no means i am some ‘audiophile’. However I have owned plenty of noise cancelling headphones over the years. These by far are the best if you need exceptional sound quality and sound stage. I use Spotify to stream all my music, and I just enjoy every time I put them on. When you open the box, you would instantly recognize the built quality is top notch and attention to detail is second to none. Noise cancelling is very effective, along with Spatial audio which makes movies and music more entertaining and engaging. Gone is the ‘swipe gesture’ stuff on ear cups. The digital crown works effortlessly.,Also about the case: I totally love it. Its elegant, and functional. And very easy to slide the pods once listening is over. No need to buy a third party ‘Bose’ style suitcase.,Ignore those often funny ‘expert’ YouTube reviews. Most of them are pretentious folks attempting to appear ‘audiophiles’

If you are already in the Apple ecosystem this is a no brainier. The set up, noise cancellation, acoustic fidelity, & note with spatial audio support - honestly nothing compares to them under $700. I’m a bit of a audio headphone collector, it’s a bad and costly habit seeking sonic clarity and fidelity all the time. Such as it is … I’m very impressed with these I compare them favorably with those units costing 2x their price. The controls are like all things Apple intuitive and easy to access. Just smart design throughout. As I said at the outset, if you are using an Apple device already and in the market for a top of the line over the ear headphone under $500 which performs like studio units more than twice their cost - look no further.

Im honestly not sure what to think about these. The sound is good for wireless headphones, although I really wasn’t blown away by it. I think I’ve realized that I just don’t care for the sound wireless headphones produce. I much prefer my AT-M50s (wired) to these, and they’re only $150. The sound level is awful. These are pretty quiet. Granted, I have damaged my ears from years of concert going and loud music, but I don’t like having Apple decide what my max volume should be. The construction on the AirPods Max is stellar, but the fact that the only way to turn these off and save battery is to use the strange little case is a bizarre design move im not a fan of. I don’t use the ANC cancelling much because it makes my head feel weird but it’s good. These sound better than the AirPods Pro, but if I need to listen to something on the go im grabbing them over these. I don’t quite know what Apple was going for but I wish they would have just gone full on and made these wired and made these sound like $500 audiophile headphones.

The noise cancelling function is better than BOSE but can’t say that is justifiable to pay over 100 over the BOSE but if you’re practical and care more about integrating then is ok.,If anything negative will be the overall size they take even when putting on backpack they take a lot of space.

They use acrylate as a gluing product and the ear cups are very itchy when wearing them. They took a while to break in and still feel itchy when i grow a beard.,3. No case. If you use these headphones for long sessions then condensation will build up and destroy them.,I have had these headphones replaced by apple 3 times now all of them died because of condensation. They won’t refund them but they will continue to send you replacements to the end of time.,If you only use headphones for short sessions then they might work for you but they will die on you if you use them for longer sessions daily.,Don’t buy them if you want to use them for more than an hour or two a day.,Worst apple product I have ever owned.

I bought these mainly because my previous pair (Beoplay H9) was difficult to connect (it sometimes required several attempts) and could not connect to more than one device at the same time. I expected the famous Apple system integration and hoped for better noise cancellation and sound quality. It is only with noise cancellation that I am truly satisfied. The Beoplays were not exceptional in that department but while I have no direct comparison to the Bose or Sony competitors, I can easily believe AirPods Max are up there with the very best. Also, the transparency mode really is excellent. I understand that someone switching from the Sonys or Boses can appreciate the higher quality of the materials, etc., but the Beoplays were certainly not cheaply made, the ear cushions were leather and the whole headphone (despite using metal!) much lighter.  I expected more from the sound. Again, maybe this is because people underestimate the Beoplays (and compared to Sony MX4 or Bose 700 there may be a significant difference), but when compared to my almost 4-year old H9s I could not see any drastic improvement. The sound is a bit more spacious (the soundstage wider), but that's about it. I definitely did not have the experience of hearing my favourite tracks anew (something I felt when switching from Bose Q35 to the Beoplays). What is most surprising is how poor the vaunted Apple integration is. Yes, they are easy to pair for the first time, but let’s be honest. You only do it once. Then it gets worse.  The Airpods may be laying on my desk (ostensibly not in use). Someone calls me on my iPhone. Even though they are not on my head, the call gets redirected to the Airpods. I have to manually override this and return it to the iPhone. The same happens when I am the one making the call. The automatic pairing could be disabled, but then what would be the difference to a third-party product? When I am using my MacBook Pro and putting the headphones on, they rarely connect automatically. I have to click to connect. Not only, then, is the “integration” and automatic switching moderately useful. At times it is simply infuriating (a few minutes before writing this  was trying to answer a call in the kitchen, the phones were on my desk in another room and the call went to the Airpods!).  I can only hope software updates are coming.

Truly incredible sound, if you want to be an audiophile,  it you’re too lazy to research and set up gear this is a nice compromise for amazing sound with minimal effort. They’re best for when you really want to enjoy the music or audio. Best for when it really matters. I still use my regular AirPod pros for working out and phone calls as they’re much much more comfortable, but the audio is incomparable.,I don’t think it’s the best sound ever. There’s probably other headphones that are better but it’s the best I’ve ever heard and the Apple experience is as easy and seamless as always.,Luxury? Yup. Worth it if you care about sound? Yes.

No lightning cable (yes these us lightning) or aux cord included but whatever. These are easily some of the best sounding and feeling headphones I've ever worn. While they are comfortable, they are made out of metal so they are heavier than most headphones so if you wear them for too long you can really start to feel the wight, additionally since the ear cups are attached magnetically you can remove and replace them quite easily. They sound really nice and are awesome for spacial audio and both noise cancellation and transparency mode are incredible. They have nice controls (I just LOVE spinning the digital crown) which consist of a digital crown for volume that you press and hold for siri and a separate button similar to the volume buttons on your phone which is used to switch between noise cancellation and transparency mode as well as skipping and reversing songs. My only real bone to pick with these is the stupid carrying case. It is ugly and annoying, as it is the only way to get the headphones to turn off without manually turning them off in settings. in addition it does not protect the headphones at all and the magnet that holds it shut is kind of loose, furthermore, when you take the headphones out, the ear cups clack together which can cause light damage to them down the road. However, an easy fix is to just buy a different third party case that can turn them off and is just better in basically every way. Thank you for reading, and I hope that this was at least somewhat helpful.

I bought these to replace my Sennheiser Momentum headphones which do not have a mute button and was really disappointed to find out the apple ones do not have a mute button and you can't configure the buttons to perform mute function.,Music quality is worse than the Sennheiser Momentum and skype/zoom calls are bettter on the Sennheiser Momentum - the apples headphones almost sound like they are not full duplex in a call - similar to bose quite comfort and most lower quality headphones on the market.

The audio is great, but falls behind my other pair of headphones, the Sony XM4’s, once you use the equalizer feature that only sony offers. If you are going to be using your headphones for a long time in a noisy environment, these are probably your best bet. Is it worth the hundreds of extra dollars for the improvements over the competition? Thats up to you, and I’m not even sure of that myself.

The sound quality is amazing and the noise cancellation is in a league of its own. The weight paired with the earpad's material makes them very uncomfortable. The ear pads kept rubbing the skin around my ears and my skin was irritated.,If they were much lighter in weight and the ear pads were softer then I would have kept them. I had to return them.

This iMac is a cheaper alternative to the more meaningful likes of the original iMac and iMac Pro, but there are drawbacks. Most of the ports are available on the back, and the speakers are about as good as iPhone 12 Pro Max, which are quite good for an iMac this compact. However, the M1 chip is focused on VR and AR, not performance. Intel is an industry standard, M1 is new and still relatively unknown to the industry. Mac OS is too hoggy on resources, and doing any kind of simple task is as good as you can do. Photoshop, video editing, gaming, etc. You need 32 GB or more of memory (RAM) to do such work reliably, as just running the system alone uses half the memory. You can hardly run Mac OS at all on 8 GB. The system is showing a few hundred MB available just after booting the system. Yes, the display looks great, but the webcam is average, about the quality from the fourth generation iPod Touch or second generation iPad from late 2010. Just go back to the Intel processor and offer up to 128 GB of memory so that this can do something productive. This new M1 iMac just looks like eye candy only slightly better than a Chromebook. I don't recommend this product unless you do the most basic of tasks or do light productivity on 16 GB of memory, which is no longer enough for any Apple computer running Mac OS in 2021. Too bad, you cannot use Boot Camp on M1, but if you could, and installed Windows 10 through Rosetta 2, you would only be using about half a GB of memory, because the Windows file system requires very little memory, but instead utilizes enormous virtual memory (paging file space). Mac OS is not much of a paging file or virtual memory accolade. Two different animals there. Just beware, these new Apple products with M1 are not as good as many say they are. Even the availability of the new iPad Pro models are very few in production because of this 'radical' change that may require a complete rewrite of Mac OS, or forego unified memory, which is a different way of wording integrated components. Like the different ways of wording corn syrup in food products to 'con' the buyer into something 'healthier.' Three stars in that you will probably have difficulty doing much with this new chip and unified memory setup (you want to get at least 512 GB of storage, or maybe 256 GB is sufficient if you do not have many photos and videos to download).

The headline says it all. Yes, the M1 chip is powerful, but few real software programs utilize it's awesome power. The list is growing however. In the meantime, I've spent a little time with the 24" model, and I believe I walked away soon after I realized how poor the refresh rate is of the screen. Even the true accurate color wasn't enough to keep me from losing interest. Refresh rate is crucial.,Look, I've used a Mac mini M1 for months and I can honestly say, it's really GOOD! It also supports my 4K display with no issues and just as well as my 2020 Intel mini (in fact, better!). The new iMac has such power, and there's going to be an explosion in raves once software developers can eliminate the need for Rosetta2, the Intel translator that comes with the new iMac. Again, the display loses me.,All that said, Apple is doing exactly what they planned and it's going to be an amazing and thrilling ride. WATCH as they begin to show the rest of the PC community what real CPU/GPU power can be got for well designed hardware, in a thin case, and low-heat.,Pros: M1, slim shape, colors, and style. Even price is not so bad, if you think about it. just don't go for the extra storage. You'll be fine with fast USB-hubbed storage, or cloud storage where you need it. Plus, external or cloud storage will lower in price faster than this iMac will lose its value.,Cons: Display refresh and lack of ports. The display refresh rate seems awful to my eyes compared to other displays, and with only two (2!!) Thunderbolt/USB-C ports. Here's the reason you'll see people dumping these models shortly. They'll want more ports and Apple knows exactly how to tease.

Okay. So I work in the media production realm. Live video, post production etc… my organization is Apple crazy. We have iMacs, Mac Pros, MacBooks, iPads, iPhones, Apple Watches, we even keep an urn with ashes and because we don’t know who they belong to, we pretend they are Steve Jobs’.,Personally I was a PC guy before I started my work in the production world, but quickly fell in love with the simplicity and cleanliness of Apple machines. As we moved on from High Sierra through Mojave, Catalina and now Big Sur, I’ve learned that Apple removes support for the most random crap on the planet. And it just happens to affect so many things that we use in the production world. I could make a list here but that’s not what the review is about. This review is about the M1 iMac.,I had really high hopes for this thing. As a desktop, it’s great. If you want something you can run a business from and do some decent editing on, this thing is great. But it has a fatal flaw. If you want to use extended desktops, or send content to a video wall, projector, or stream content, you need to make sure that all of your equipment is from the last 18 months or so also.,Firstly, it only supports 1 (that’s right, one) external display. Though it has 2 (that’s right, two) thunderbolt ports. Secondly, I could not get the computer to consistently recognize external converters (HDMI to SDI, scalers etc…), these are important for those of us in the production industry. Thirdly, the issue is with the drivers (or Kexts for you Mac nerds) in Big Sur. It’s been an issue since 11.2 and persists through 11.6. There are forums and articles all over the web addressing the issue, but here we are.,THE FIX: Rollback to MacOS Catalina! Yup, just download it from the Apple website and away you goooo……. WAIT!!!!…..,It’s an M1 Mac. Catalina only runs on Intel based Macs. Bye.,Also… they gave up support for interlaced resolutions. That’s right, no more 1080i support. Which we use for some environments where older projectors or video switchers are being used.,I get it, it’s an older standard…. But so is 480p which is still supported lolz. I wonder what the gain for the end user was to remove interlaced resolution support. So weird.

I don't have an iPhone, but Apple is pushing other people's text conversations with me from my non-iPhone to my Apple email account when they reply on their iPhones. This means that when they reply to text messages with me, it is not texting but sending through iMessage. That means I don't get their replies on my phone -- they only arrive on my Mac via iMessage.,So if you don't have an iPhone, be careful about getting a Mac, because it just might screw up your ability to text with people using your entirely different device with no associated Apple account. This is truly shady and monopolistic behavior by Apple to try to force someone who buys one of their products into their other products.,Apparently, just like all the other companies, I'm the product to Apple -- they just want to bilk me for more money and force me into their full ecosystem. And I don't even know how this can be fixed.

Apple is overpriced and non-functional based on today's standards.  Was good at last Mona Lisa in the 80's, but now is just bloatware and crappy OS,  Do NOT buy.  If you are married to the interface, just load one onto Android or Windows and you get same experience but at  fraction of the cost and twice the horseepower.

Coming from a 2013 i5 iMac the upgrade has been epic.,Everything runs at lightning speed. Installations of new apps is almost instantaneous. I click approve for install (using the awesomely convenient Touch ID button) and it races thru the steps and ready to open in a literal blink.,So glad I got 16g RAM. It’s wonderful to have everything open at once: a movie playing, 10 tabs in the browser, 7 other apps and downloading library to my SSD.. oh and all while e-mail history is loading. The monitor stayed fairly consistent at 10g RAM so 8g would have limited my fun.  Everything ran incredibly.,I wasn’t really fond of the style when in the Apple store, but now that it’s on my desk,  I simply can’t believe how gorgeous it fits in my home. The white bezels are perfect for the ‘home’ use and I’m glad they chose.,Overall I can tell this iMac will last even longer than my previous and stay future proof for years to come.,It looks, feels and performs exactly as a high end purchase should.,I insist you purchase one so you too can revel in the joy of an excellent decision you will appreciate for years to come

I will start off by saying that I didn't buy this from Amazon, but I did buy it, whether I show up as a "verified purchase" or not.,This is a great upgrade to Apples desktop line IN EVERY WAY.,* Thinner,* Lighter,* Quieter,* Brighter,* Sharper Screen,* Faster,* Better Camera (important for today's video calls,Important things to know:,* you don't need to buy the upgrade one to get the features.  You can get the Touch ID keyboard for $50 more.,* You can get the ethernet for $30 more,* The 8 core GPU is not worth the additional $200.,* * Gigs of RAM is plenty for the average user.  The M1 chip makes it even more powerful,I love the look and feel of the computer, mouse, and keyboard.  Very premium.,It is expensive, but you won't be in the market for a new computer for a while and this one will age well.  You get what you pay for.,PS. I went with Blue. Looks cool.

I'd been using a 24" Dell monitor and desktop since 2013, and was looking forward to getting at least a 27" screen this time round. Only problem was that I needed a computer right away as my Dell had it's HDDs stolen together with its USB backup drive.,Thank goodness I had a separate backup on iCloud from my MacBook Pro !,Anyway, I've got the 8-core 256GB Silver model with 8GB ram. The screen somehow feels bigger than its 24 inches. Text is crisp and images are sharp. I don't notice the white bezels at all. It's the best screen I've ever used.,Speakers are excellent. There are complaints that they're not loud enough; frankly speaking, if you need it any louder than it is, there's something wrong with you. The speakers are plenty loud.,I bought the iMac from Apple as I wanted the trackpad and keyboard with numeric keypad. I love the trackpad's Force Touch, and the keyboard's great to type on; the keys are tactile enough while being quiet: much better than obnoxious mechanical ones.,Finally, I'd to say something about the "Hide My Email" feature. While browsing, I came across a website that requested my email address. When I clicked on the Email field, macOS Monterey automatically offered to generate a proxy address instead of using my real one.,That's awesome !,Just one of the many ways Apple and MacOS are superior to the rest.
100000% better than the AirPods Pro! Fits right in my ear and the spatial sound feature is the bomb.com,10/10 WOULD RECOMMEND!
Its great. Had 1st gen, airpod pro…this is better then both. Enjoy!!
They sound good But the don’t stay secure in my ears.
The only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is because sometimes they can be loose but other than that they’re pretty cool.

Battery life was great in a single use. Worked 12 hours. On a phone call with 4-5 people almost the entire shift. But… I can’t stand the new design and how it fits in my ear. I can’t tell you how many times it fell out. My opinion…. Gen 2 is best. I’ve tried them all.

These are amazing headphones I’m no audio file type of guy but these are by far my favorite over the earbuds I must have if your in the apple equal system just great addition to my completion don’t be afraid of the price tag is kinda of steep but worth all 549.00 just a great pair of headphones

I dont own a pair of this but I work in a store where we sell this, my opinion they are ok but way over priced it for what it offers, save your money and get a pair of Bose headphones or Sony wh1000xm4 for a couple hundreds less they are way better sound quality and better looking headphones also.

Battery life, noise cancellation and sound clarity is amazing.  Sounds like I am right in the studio!  I also hear deeper bass - this is why I got Pro Max's as well as Air Pod Pro's.  I could not hear much bass in the Pro's (ear buds) and they kept falling out of my ears...I needed the MAX's.

These are a truly phenomenal pair of headphones with the best noise cancellation and transparency modes i’ve ever experienced before. Speaking of volume, the precise control of volume thanks to the button/knob on top is genius and allows me to have full control over my music and transparency modes without even touching my phone. They sound amazing. But I hate to say I need to send them back. They’re not comfortable for me and the mesh for some reason makes my head itch. Can’t justify this kind of expense for something that is unpleasant to wear. Sticking with my AirPod pros

I have the Blue AirPods and my wife has the Green AirPods. We both use them to help with the symptoms of our tinnitus. They really work. Sound quality is awesome. Build is great but we both got silicone ear cup covers, I didn’t like the metal cups banging into each other.

If you’re indecisive about buying it, here’s a tip/something you should know about the AirPods Max. The AirPods are strong in sound and you could feel an orchestra in your ears. If you have an iPhone, you can put it in off mode and you’ll get the real experience of what the headphones were made for! Of course, with Apple Music.

I just got these in the mail today and I know I'm already going to love them. Coming from the 2nd Gen AirPods that I bought in 2020, these earphones are on a league of their own and the difference is night and day. They're in credibly comfortable (fit was perfect right out the box), have pretty good noise cancellation, compared to other earbuds I've used and I feel like I can whip my hair back and forth without fear of them falling out like my AirPods. I really like them so far!

These sound amazing, something you would expect at this price range and the long standing reputation of the brand. Taking a star off for the quality of the charging case. The lid feels pretty flimsy and I am able to move it side to side as well as forward and backward when it is in the closed position, it also doesn’t close as snugly as my wife’s, who got a pair when they just came out. Due to these issues I actually checked the serial number with apple to make sure they are legit, and they are. The only difference between mine and my wife’s is that hers were made in China and these were made in Vietnam, this could explain the dip in quality I guess.

I tried to switch out the silicon cover for a different size but that didn't work. The sound quality and noise cancellation feature were great but I don't want to risk losing these expensive ear pods on the street one day, so unfortunately I'll be returning them.

For something that cost a lot of money, I was expecting a power adapter to come with it.  Much to my surprise, it didn't. I was so looking forward to using it, but had to spend more money just to get the adapter. Haven't had a chance to give it any rating yet because I had to order the adapter to charge it.  Am hoping that in the future, it will save someone else the headache of discovering it is NOT included.

***There’s no charging box for the cord!!! I was very irritated with that.  ***,Noise Cancellation is ON POINT! I love my AirPods!! I am so glad I got these!! I love the “hey Siri” feature being accessible without being extremely close to your phone. Music just sounds so, so good. I've gone through lots of headphones, buds and cans. Set up a basic home studio. Went through a vinyl/audiophile phase. No issues so far. Easy to set up. Came with damage to the power cord. Don't get the base model. The middle and top-end models come with fingerprint sensor, one more fan, Ethernet port on the power adapter, one more GPU core. Machine is well designed and very easy to use. It has sufficient capacity both in memory and storage to handle hundreds if not thousands of photos. If you are considering switching from a PC based system, this is the way to go.

The airpod pro's are awesome.  I got them for a great price during the black Friday sale and the only regret I have is not getting them sooner. These have had no battery lifr issue this far using them for as long as four hours. I find them a bit uncomfortable for long use. However, if you by them from COSTCO, they ARE compatible with the normal Apple cable charger (of which I already have several - one for travel, for home and for work all of which work with my iPad, phone, old AirPods, and now my new AirPod Pros).  If you don't want to order additional cables just for your AirPod pros, I recommend ordering from COSTCO versus Amazon. They are about $20 more expensive but the normal cables work for charging.,ALSO, some of the reviews refer to the pods being made in Vietnam and therefore being poor quality.  The ones I ordered from COSTCO (I returned my Amazon ones due to the cable situation) also were made in Vietnam so that is a mute point. I believe those of poor quality probably ordered from a bad reseller on Amazon, just a guess.

I've owned around 7 ear buds, and these are by far the best experience I've had. First, the fit is solid and you're not constantly concerned they'll fall out, in addition, they're remarkably comfortable. My kid wanted them for his birthday so I ponied up the coin. It seemed high for a pair of headphones but since he’s got them, it’s been silent in my house. You can’t put a price on that kind of peace in a house with teenagers. I feel like I sold Tim Cook my soul but the beautiful silence is worth it.

Very happy with my purchase. Got a 200$ gift card from Amazon and bought this pair the moment I saw it was on special for $179 ($192 with taxes). I’d perused them for a long time and was a little skeptical (I’m not a typical online shopper and I’m always afraid stuff will not be what I expect). Absolutely will NOT stay in my ears more than 4 or 5 seconds before popping out, usually into the dishwater, food, etc...you get the picture, go with the BEATS, I hear they are intelligently designed to actually fit your ears, what a concept!  lol  If you've already wasted your money on these, they DO sound great but you will definitely want to invest about $10 for add on wingtips or over the ear clips to ensure that you don't loose these the first time you stand up, speak or do anything that moves your head, jaw or body in the slightest.

I had the 2nd gen AirPods and decided to upgrade to the pro’s since they were on sale. They’re great. The transparency mode is really cool and you almost can’t tell they’re in your ear. My 2nd gen pods almost seem to amplify background noise and these pro’s aren’t  much better in that area. I was outside one night when I used my 2nd generation pods and my buddy asked me if I was surrounded by crickets. CRICKETS ! that’s how bad the noise cancellation is on those. I ordered some Samsung noise cancelation pods and the noise cancelation seemed non existent. I almost settled but then I remembered trying my friend’s airpod pros and how good they were. I decided to return the Samsung ones and bite the bullet to get the AP Pros. The noise cancelation is AMAZING. Seriously can’t believe how well they work. I love going to the gym and then turning on the cancelation and having everything go almost totally silent. So cool. The different settings are fun and work perfectly. Highly recommend if noise cancelation is important to you.

I did a ton of research and was very torn about what kind of wireless earbuds to purchase. I ended up getting these for a good price and am so happy I did. They work so well and they work flawlessly with my other apple products. Yes, I definitely recommend the AirPod Pros! Perfect fit in my ears right out of the box (and they have 2 more ear cushion sizes included) The noise cancelling is so good that at first I had to get used to just how much sound it cut out... without that "white noise" of the other noise cancelling head phones. And, they have "transparency mode"(had to look up what they call it)  so that I can hear the surroundings while driving (I use one for phone calls). Battery charges up quickly.

Got exactly what I wanted and shipping only took 2 days. My AirPods arrived with some sort of defection with the right pod where it would make a ticking sound whenever transparency mode or noise cancellation was on but all I did was take it straight to my local Best Buy and I was easily able to exchange them for a brand new pair which work perfectly fine. Great product and service

I love mine. These reviews about cords and such not arriving in the box had me EXTREMELY anxious as I waited for the package's arrival, but it came in perfect condition...I'll admit I felt a little bougie unwrapping and opening the box. Early Christmas present...wasn't disappointed at all.,Battery life is still pretty good, though I know the next gen of these is going to make it matter much more to me in the future.,Authentic, really good sound quality, and worth the money, considering this is a steal ANYWAY with this type of discount.

Not a product for me. I tried using them and had to return them because they just wouldn't sit in my ears. They sound good, but because of the suction not being good they never sounded any better than my gen 1 AirPods. I am disappointed in them because normally everything that Apple makes I love, but these were a miss. I am happy for anyone else who is able to enjoy them though.

These cancel noise from equipment in a loud machine room very effectively. Don't drop the case; a 2-foot drop onto my desk caused the lid to pop open and both airpods flew across the desk and onto the floor. No damage, but I am now looking for a case for the case of the airpods pro.

Ill be honest, I'm an android person. I had the pleasure of putting in some air pods from a friend. They weren't the newest but they still sounded good. I listen to music constantly and talk on the phone for my job quite often. I consider myself a little bit of an audiophile. I have audio engines in my kitchen to give an example. These are quite incredible. I'm hearing stuff that even my 500 dollar kitchen speakers can't produce (not knocking audio engine... they are incredible). Regardless, they are awesome. Deserves credit... the noise cancelation and transparency is crazy. Noise canceling had me looking back like someone was behind me the first time I turned it on. 10 out or 10..... would recommend to a friend.

Very good all around product that integrates very well with iPad and iPhone with automatic connectivity and switching between devices seamlessly. Rubber tips offer comfort and flexibility for a variety of different shaped ear holes . Swift delivery. Experiencing some intermittent Bluetooth issues when playing Amazon music. Very pleased that it will read text messages aloud.

Went from my old beat up regular AirPods that were like 4 years old or more to these.... and oh boy there's a big difference! the sound quality is up there with my Beats Studios.... extremely comfortable, noise cancellation is CRAZY! and got it on Black Friday for $160..... can't complain.... by the way THEY CHARGE WIRELESSLY..... no one seems to know this :) (turns out all pros do)
Gave these to my daughter and she said she likes the sound quality of these ear pods! Great product!

Positives: I love how you can adjust the transparency mode on your iphone and can enhance conversations or amplify surroundings!  Spatial audio sounds really, really good, including with movies!,Negatives: I like that Apple tries to give you different size ear tips, but I ended up going with some memory foam based ear tips that get an even better seal, comfort, and provide more bass.  Last very slight negative is noise cancellation is not as good as Airpods Max, but you can't expect them to do as good as Airpods Max due to their size, but compared to my old Track+ ear tips these are def better at noise cancelling.,Delivery: Amazon delivered next morning, even though tried to get it out for the evening, but hey, next morning very early is still extremely great service!  Top notch!!

My AirPods were 100% authentic but one of them had glue on outside of airpod and wasn’t aligned properly. Ordered a replacement and will update!,UPDATE: Was super easy and I got new AirPods very fast. 10/10 and still 100% authentic (you can look up serial # in apple warranty checker). The ones that were made in Vietnam did come defective as someone mentioned previously but they were awesome about exchanging and I already have my new ones. The packaging is even different (no little tab on Vietnam ones just plastic). Either way I’d buy again!

The pairing is very clunky, sometimes it works great often times you must fiddle with it to pair and then maybe you don't get both of them. Just save your self the effort. I wanted the transparency mode which is pretty sweet, but the hassle just isn't worth it. It's a bitter apple if you're not all in on Apple. I put my toe in and eh nope sorry Apple too much BS for that amount of $$$.

Originally my wife and I bought a different brand. I could not get mine to stay in the one ear. Being how I had an iPhone, I bought these. They stay in my ears great. Overall great sound in all genres. Bass lacks a little, but sound quality is still excellent. Noise cancelling is okay. Transparency mode is good if volume is middle to lower. Taking phone calls on them is superb. Overall well worth the money.

Si están dudando en comprarlos, dejen de dudarlo y simplemente comprenlos. Jamás había tenido una experiencia con audífonos como la tuve al usar esta maravilla. You get what you pay for.  These are expensive, but so far I think they are worth it. I ordered these yesterday in a panic when I could not track down a pair at Target. After reading several reviews, I decided to take a chance on them. Upon opening the package, everything felt legit and looked legit. I called Apple to verify the serial number and they approved the serial number and told me that they were a legitimate product. They ensured me that they even have a one year warranty based on my purchase date. Interesting case you are in a situation like me, just order them! They’re authentic! (At least what I received was.)

Was expecting these to be very underwhelming but they were actually pretty good, and with the big Amazon markdown, these were a steal. This is the best thing to touch my ears since... ever. I cannot express how impressed I am with every feature. First, the noise cancellation is absolutely exquisite for a headphone this small. Second, The Transparency mode helps me hear better than if these were not even in my ears. Finally, the specialized stereo is absolutely heavenly (I recommend listening to Hurricane by Kanye).,My only complaint is that the battery life could be a little but longer, but if you don't mind taking  5 minute break to let them charge in the case, which I don't, there is literally nothing wrong with these. (And for all of you who say they don't noise cancel, use different ear tips).

Did not dislike anything. It is a really good watch

I was skeptical of purchasing airpods as I had a pair of Bose QC 35s, which are amazing. However, I went ahead and got these thinking that if I don't like them, I'll just return them and stick with what I know. Needless to say, that won't be happening. They sound good, cancel outside noise very well (although Bose over-ears remain superior in this regard but that's due to different design), and I can use these seamlessly with Siri whenever I want to listen to some music or take calls. Love 'em. Oh, and I went for the Pro model as I needed the noise cancellation feature to help me focus while studying/working.

I got these for my wife thinking we would share them. Jokes on me, she loves them. So my review is for the 10 minutes I got to play with them after charging. The sound quality is amazing. The noise cancelling is a huge asset for loud environments or mowing. I guess I will have to get my own pair now

Absolutely love the noise canceling, now of course with any earbuds if you get really sweaty during a workout they may try to fall out after awhile, but ifs not super frustrating bc it’s not a consistent issue, you can simply take them out dry the inside of your ear a little, pop them back in and get back to jamming while you workout! Highly recommend buying the AirPods Pro’s if your looking for an upgrade.

I purchased this for Christmas for my son. It was missing one airpod and was clearly used and filthy. How does this even happen? Obviously no quality control. I am extremely frustrated and my son is so disappointed. Returning this garbage immediately.

I did compare these to the Bose.  I liked the Bose, the sound seemed better.  But the Bose seemed bulky and stuck out of my ear too far.  Also, they didn't seem as easy to use.  Bose did not come with very good directions on how to use.  the Apple Brand was very easy for me to operate and had very nice clear directions compared to the Bose

Bought AirPods Gen 3 and used it for a week, It didn't fit my ears canals, Got the Airpods Pro With a MagSafe Case during Black Friday Sales. I thought ANC will come in handy if I were to travel on the plane.,The only downside is the battery life for the Pro is 24 hours VS AirPod Gen 3 30 hours.

Was so excited to use these when I received them, until the right Airpod started having a ticking noise when using noise cancellation or transparency modes. Tried to get a replacement pair from Amazon, they couldn’t. Troubleshooted with Apple, they took them in for repair, sent them back saying that they were fixed, and the right airpod is still making strange noises. I’m sending them in again to get them looked at, however, I almost wish that I had just gotten the refund. Not happy at all so far.

Its functions - sounds & noise canceling etc - are fine.,It may work for many people but doesn’t fit in my ears.  It keeps falling off while running. But with the Comply foam, AirPods drops only sometimes and become usable.  I am still not sure if I can use AirPods for trail runs.

Nice things cost a lot. It's kind of a theme in life. These AirPods are nice and cost a lot but not as much as some other pieces of plastic that usually end up being shoddier or more difficult to use (looking at you Sony).,For the money, these are probably the best in ear noise canceling headphones with stupid long descriptions that you can buy.

**This review is not based on the performance of this product but addresses the authenticity of the item(s).,These were ordered during Black Friday and arrived ahead of their ETA. There was a white stain on the right Airpod and the seams on the pods looked dingy and had random debris on them. Theres no arguing that these are good headphones however I have had many problems going from Iphone to Mac. I was drawn into something that could "seamlessly switch" between the two and to my great disappointment this just doesn't happen. I have constant problems getting my Mac to detect the airpods when they auto connect to my phone. I have also had the headphone just have terrible audio quality until i disconnect and reconnect them to my Mac and occasionally all sound will stop playing until I disconnect and reconnect again. The bright side is if you are getting these purely for an Iphone I haven't had a single problem well connected and/or getting connected to my phone and the audio quality has always been great.
Did not know I needed cellular. By the time I realized, it was too late to return. I need cellular to have unlimited WiFi - this was disappointing. I thought I could exchange.
Can’t say enough about the camera! Photos are beautiful!
This is my first 'ipad'.  Have owned various other tablets in the past.  Because I prefer Apple phones, decided to try the Apple ipad.  So pleased.

I never liked the wired headphones that come with the iPhone so I was reluctant to buy these. However, they fit well and I especially like they don’t come out when running. Work well for phone calls. These are the first Apple headphones I’ve had that I like and I even retired my Bose over-ear headphones in favor of these.

Sounds really good, compact, fits in ears nicely however, it came with a charging cable that doesn’t fit. What am I supposed to do with the cable? 🤷🏼‍♀️ I had to buy a separate charger which I think is ridiculous being I spent so much money in the first place. That part is very disappointing.
I listen to audiobooks while on a treadmill at a gym. Although I have to frequently push them in they are great at cutting out the noise.
They came in a resealed package, had polishing compound on them, squealed and were previously paired to another device. Returned for refund

These are great. The one thing I was not expecting was that it felt like having a terrible cold when your ears are completely stuffed up. It took a bit to get used to, but the sound is great! It also cancels most noise on my side for those I’m talking to. I can have the car window open while talking on these AirPods and the person I am talking to can’t hear that!

I have had for many years used a Jabra for my Bluetooth. When I went to order new, and I guess being out of the market myself I discovered all ear buds were in sets of 2. I researched earbuds and these rated the highest, and I love them. They paired themselves to my iPhone and iPad. The sound and comfort are exceptional. Well worth the money! Kudos to you Apple!

I received the item tampered. The box had clearly been opened and re-taped. My mailroom is secure and has cameras so it had been tampered with before delivery. I opened the box and the airpods were missing. Only the charging cable and instruction manual was there, the airpods were stolen.
I received these in the mail today with nothing in the box but the various ear pieces. Unacceptable.

Apple, is it enough of a money grab for these expensive earbuds that you PURPOSELY did not include a power adapter, just so most normal human beings with no USB-C power adapter have to shell out another $20? Has the greed level reach a new high? This was a Christmas present, which WAS NOT OBVIOUS it was missing crucial parts make this "work". WOW. Get over yourself apple, and thanks for ruining a Christmas present.
Buy them they’re legit. I was nervous about buying these from Amazon thinking they would be knockoffs but im pleased to report i was wrong.

Before buying I heard that as soon as you keep it in your ears the sound becomes very clear. And it is true. I really liked how it is linked to the phone, for example if one of them falls out of your ear, it pauses the video, it resumes the video once you keep the ear buds in ear again.

I’m so angry! I don’t know if it’s Apple or Amazon that no longer includes the ability to charge Apple devices. I feel cheated. I can no longer trust both! It is deceptive & unethical! The top line on ur descriptions should read DOES NOT INCLUDE CHARGING BRICK & it’s different than before.

I waited way too long to buy these but I’m glad I finally did. Perfect for airplanes, blocks out almost everything when in noise cancellation mode, even without anything playing. Sound is clear and they create a immersive environment when watching a movie or show. The charging case is awesome too. Highly recommended.

I'm not an apple fan.  These are for my son. I think these buds look like his ears need help draining or something and the color doesn't help. He loves them but couldn't charge them so he only used them once so far.  For the price I feel like I got stiffed on the charger.  To be fair.  Samsung does the same thing.

i love most of the features that they have like noise-canceling or transparency,it fits in your ears nicely and stays there,it says that they last for 4-6 hours fully charged but i tend to find that it depletes batteries really quickly if im using the noise cancellation,no other problems,connects to apple products really well

The AirPod Pros are a pretty good overall earphone when used with your Apple products. Great sound quality, nice perks in noice cancellation and spatial audio. Much better fit in the ear verse the original AirPods, so if you’ve had a problem with ear fit with the original AirPods then these are a much better improvement. Battery life is decent, not the best (ran me about 6 or so hours off of multiple charges in the case) A word of caution, the charging case did stop recognizing the right bud when being placed in to charge, but not sure if this is due to a defective case I received or something else had occurred. Regardless, I’d recommend these as the standard earphones to get with your iPhone.

Sound quality is excellent, better than my old LG Tones that they replaced. Battery life s the one Draw-back. The charging case also seems fragile. Over all, they work well and I am very satisfied that I purchased them! I won’t go back to the around he neck style now that I’m use to the in ear pods.
If your sitting on the fence on this one, get off! Sound quality is incredible. Great battery life. I got sone and lived so much I purchased these for my son!

Probably some of the best sounding earbuds I’ve EVER heard. Too bad the noise cancellation messed up my ears a bit after long use making them feel clogged.,Perhaps this won’t be an issue for you but it’s worth mentioning.,Note: you can turn off the noise cancellation feature (but you may as well buy the AirPods 2/3s for half the price if that’s the case)

iPad Air offers so much more than the base iPad. It's worth taking the step up if you can afford it. For the increase in price, you get a larger screen, stronger audio, faster networking, a much more powerful processor, better Apple Pencil support, and a superior build. That makes the iPad Air a good long-term investment.

I'm happy with it. The body feels great and doesn't show finger prints. The screen is vibrant and responsive. The battery lasts 1-2 days on regular to moderate use but dies much faster on long video calls.,The main issue I had was with Skype and Zoom as it would drop the audio. I just needed to update iOS in settings. Works fine now.,I use mine for drawing, animations, entertainment and work and I have not had any permanent issues with my device so far.,I got the higher storage option and I think I made the right choice based on my needs.

I purchased this for my adult daughter.  She is always pleased with all her Apple devices.  This continues to be a great addition to her other devices.  She bought this to compliment her Macbook Air.  She uses it to mainly take notes at univesity, draw portraits, and so much more.  It arrived well-packeaged in mint condition.  We continue to be pleased with Apple.  Thank you for another great product!

The screen tends to not recognize touch. The battery life is very limited when using it. I purchased this for my home business and it is not user friendly for many things. The tablet freezes up at times. Many apps will will work only in portrait mode. I am not impressed.

It's awkward to use and is not user friendly.  My ipad 2 was a better tablet.  The slide one's fingers across the ipad to open an app or close is really not the way I want to operate a tablet.  Buying this apple tablet was,a mistake.

Replaced my broken ipad2. This Air4 is AWESOME. Solidly built. Picture quality is amazing. Fast processor. Really liking the new Ipad.  Set up was a breeze and screen quality is perfect.  Get the Zugu case to go with it.  A bit disappointed at how fast the battery runs down, could just be I have a lot of apps.  Pleased overall.

This is my third iPad upgrade over the past 10 years (and yes they all still work). Love the compatibility with Apple Pencil 2.0 for quick on the go notes if the keyboard was left behind.
its too heavy to use everyday. wanted to replace it with another iphone or kindle, but return window was closed already.

I have had five iPads, they are all in use. iPads are so easy to use when compared to other tablets. I ordered the sky blue and it’s very elegant yet simple. I love it, I’ve already downloaded so much from jwapp and hasn’t slowed down at ALL. I also downloaded two art apps as well and still works like a charm. The speakers are outstanding, the touch sensitivity is extremely accurate, etc. Worth the wait and buck.

I have the iPad Pro 2018 and 2020 and this iPad Air is just as good. I love the color which is complained about the most. It’s meant to be a light green and it doesn’t disappoint. I don’t get why apple won’t make their iPad pros in different colors (same with the phones).

I like the tablet this the second time I buy a iOS on Amazon and both times the tablets were legit and brand new , it came with App Store arcade subscription for 3 months and my other iPad which I also bought off Amazon came with Apple TV free 3 months as well. Haven’t had issues with either of them and they are legit but cheaper from Amazon then the Apple store by like $50. It still comes with a warranty just as if u bought it straight from Apple

The noise canceling feature literally makes it feel like the air is getting sucked out of your ears to create a airtight seal… it’s not actually doing that, but it feels like it. It’s literally life changing. I wear these around all day and the transparency mode acts almosssst like a hearing aid. It’s not the best for conversation but i swear it strongly increases ambient noise in my surroundings. For example: I was grocery shopping with these on just on T mode and no music playing. I was jamming out to some music that the store was playing overhead… I took them out and all of a sudden I couldn’t hear the ambient store music anymore! Overall love these and battery life is pretty great!

I love everything about these ears buds except that they dont stay in my ears. I love how compact they are and they sound amazing, but anytime I do any activity other than sitting they fall out if my ears. I tried all three size ear tips and the result is all the same. Sad to spend this much on a pair of earbuds and I cant even do any activities while wearing them.

Sound is incredible and the noise cancellation is like magic.  These stay in my ears where the original AirPods would always fall out.  I bought them because the noise cancellation allows me to focus and hear the content.  Second reason was looking for a pair that stayed in my ears.

I tried two different pairs of these that are off brand and only $30 or so. Horrible horrible. Finally splurged on the AirPods and I can’t believe what I was missing. Great sound, notifications for texts and calls, nose cancellations, don’t fall out of my ears. Love them!

There is nothing I dislike about the Apple Air Pods Pro.  The sound quality is fantastic and the comfort is outstanding., The experience of having the capability to listen to Spacial Sound via Bluetooth in lieu of having wired head phones is a real nice feature.

I had to get these because Apples are the only thing that stay in my tiny ears. The sound quality and noise cancelling are great! Wore them to the gym and I’ll admit I still had one earbud fall out a couple times but way less than others I’ve used and mostly to do with my smaller ear opening.

Great at noise control, making everything go silent.,Transparency mode is like a hear aid kinda,Great audio performance and sound,However they still need to work on keeping it in the ear. My left ear keeps bushing it out, making it drop

I’ve had the AirPods 2nd and it had no issue with connecting. Not the care for the AirPods Pro. Right airpod is always not pairing. I usually put in both AirPods into my ears and their always connected and in sync. These are not and now the case is flashing white and will no longer show up on any Apple device when opened.

They are great! I read the reviews and got worried but the ones I received are clean no seem true apple airpod pros. Couldn’t ask for anything better. Was amazed by the noise cancellation, but can still hear my rock tumbler a bit. Love how it still lets you hear a person talking to you, so cool! Bass is not bad, not as good as my wired beats but they are good. Bought for work so I can eat lunch and watch my phone and not bother anyone, so these will be perfect, also wireless charging works really well too! Just be super careful not to put a hard case on it unless you want it on there for awhile, really hard to take off a hard case.

The sound was amazing and I was surprised when I could not hear other people talking. The battery life is great. The only problem I have is they do not stay in my ears. I have changed the ear buds and they still fall out. I want to love them but I’m afraid that I will lose them.

Have had it for about a month. The charger stopped working after it fell from average-ish height (my desk). However, the watch itself is great. I use it for my runs, the phone feature when I’m driving, and the health app. The best feature is the find my iPhone. I use it daily and it saves me the time of logging into the app. I rate it 4.5/5 because of the fragile charger.
Upgraded from a series 3.  Love all the new features including the oxygen level monitor.

Are they worth 550? If you have an iPhone yes. Android or anything else, maybe not. The iPhone will give you audio editing/tuning options that you will not find elsewhere. On the iPhone make sure you are updated to the latest iOS that help the phone truly recognize the headphones, and then update the firmware of the headset itself. I consider myself an audiophile, and when I try new headphones, the sound test I put them through is fairly simple, and I play 5 key songs of different genres that I would say have “hidden sounds” or instruments that cheaper headphones would not catch. These pass the test, and surpass the Bose and Sony headsets in separating instruments, the “soundstage” effect. If you are a person who can’t tell the difference in good headphones versus others, don’t waste your time, because you won’t be able to justify the reasoning for the pricing. The comfort is amazing, and I can wear these for 4 hours plus with no discomfort. They look great, and noise cancellation is amazing on these headphones.

I had actually just recently bought the latest Sony noise canceling over ear phones when these came out. Because I am a big Apple user and have been happy with the AirPods Pro, I figured I wanted to give these a shot.,Pros,- Build quality - nothing beats it. The metal makes a big difference. Am curious how well the mesh will hold up. And the earpads are easily replaceable, so I expect long life.,- Looks - try as I might, I always felt the Sony phones looked too big and bulky, and often they would not sit evenly without some effort. And they are just plain black plastic. I'm not trying to win a beauty pageant, but I prefer how these look for Zoom calls. :),- Knob - OMG, I LOVE the knob/button (similar to the crown on the watch). It is soo much nicer having a physical control to turn the volume up and down, as well as easily pause and play. One thing I kinda hated about the Sony (I had an older model as well as the more recent) is how stupid easy it was to accidentally trigger their touch controls. Also, sometimes swipe up/down was interpreted as forward/back. Just not good. But the knob is way better and far harder to accidentally use.,- Sound Quality - I'm not a crazy audiophile, but I am one. These are just better sounding out of the box for sure. Very clear on mids and highs. Not muddy on lows but enough punch unless you are a bass head, maybe. I like bass, but not too much on headsets as it quickly becomes tiresome. These do a find job of finding the right balance for most types of music w/o touching the EQ. And in fact, I find most of the EQ changes sounded worse than better.,- Ease of Switching - I admit the latest Sony's made it relatively easy with their app. But pairing and switching between (Apple) devices is almost seamless and pretty near impossible to beat given their special support for their own headsets. Every so often, I have to manually tell it to use these, but most of the time it switches smartly. Sometimes, though, I don't want it to switch over when it does, but no big deal.,- Sharing Audio - not technically specific to these, but it's pretty slick to share audio on the Apple TV, so my wife and I can watch and listen w/o disturbing the sleeping little one across the hall.,- Pause/Resume - specifically when taking them off and putting them on. Very responsive and works almost perfectly.,- Spatial Audio - I first noticed this on my AirPods Pro. I kind of couldn't believe my ears. It's a neat effect. I hope they add it for Apple TV.,Meh/OK,- Noise Canceling - It handles a lot of the more obvious white/pink type noise, but it could do better with things like kids yelling in the background. I want to say the Sonys are a bit better on this.,- Standby Battery Use - I do not understand why yet, but when I just hang them on my headphone holder on my desk, they drain relatively quickly while not in use. Supposedly Apple claims they should go into low power mode without putting them in their case, but I'm not convinced. I think they should essentially lose no power when not in use, but they do.  Playback is fine/good as other options, so far as I can tell, though.,Cons,- Price - obviously. I've bought various sets for around $3-400 in the past. So these are by a good bit the most expensive set I've owned. But for all the Pros above, I think it is justified--especially if you are heavily in the Apple device ecosystem.,- Case - everybody hates it. I don't personally care cuz I only use these at home, but if I had to use that thing a lot, I think I'd not be happy with it.,In Brief,I think these are a great headset, especially for Apple folks. I sold my Sonys in favor of these. If you care about the Pros listed above, and you can afford (or want to afford) it, definitely go with these, as of now.

They do compete with the Bose and Sony $300-400 offerings - the extra $200 is strictly for the brand. Which the logo would be nice to have on the product since you pay soooooooooo much for it. So the ANC is both qualitatively and quantitively lesser than Bose - it blocks out not as much and has a quality to it that exacerbates the "pressure in my ears" feeling. The transparency mode is class leading though, have to give them that. They're pretty comfortable, though when the ear pads rub together, the sound and feeling make me want to die. And finally, the sound is mostly sub-par - nice around mid-low and bass,  contemptible at mid high; all else is unremarkable. If you want audiophile, buy real headphones and if you want ANC, spend much less on better products.

I see people raving up and down about the perfection and wonderfulness of these headphones; I’m not as completely blown away by them as those people are. Quality of construction does seem to be excellent (although because Amazon doesn’t lower all prices at the start of Prime Day but only lowers some of them well after Prime Day has begun, I had to send back the first pair I bought and purchase another pair to get a discounted price, and the piston things for extending and compressing the size of the headphones was smoother on the first pair I had) and they’re comfortable enough to wear for extended periods, but while it may be a limitation of Bluetooth (I don’t know), I haven’t noticed myself being amazed by their bass response. No, in fact I just now watched the video for Shake It Off and listened to a couple of Lana Del Rey tracks and these headphones are definitely lacking in bass response – as in, there’s very little, and what there is gets completely lost under any midrange and high-end sounds that may be playing at the same time. They’re tinny-sounding. I have to wonder what the people are listening to with these who are praising the sound quality so enthusiastically.,On the other hand, I don’t ordinarily listen to music anymore, but only to talks and lectures; While I’m watching movies is probably the only time I’m going to really want big bass, and I watched The Revenant last night and didn’t feel like I was missing anything…,So their construction is much more solid than that of probably most other headphones on the market, they’re comfortable to wear, and there’s a nice ecosystem of accessories out there, but I personally find the sound quality quite lacking and I’m going to have to decide whether to hang onto these or return them.

Overall these things are amazing. Battery life is great, transparency mode is amazing, isolation mode is jaw dropping, and sound quality is very impressive for Bluetooth. Buttons are excellent and controls are intuitive and accurate.,Things I don't like:,Occasionally, they just won't connect correctly or turn on, I have to do various button combinations until it decides to turn on and connect.,Sometimes while charging and listening, there's a horribly loud sound squealing/hissing out of the right side right into your ear, also happens when pressing any buttons that cause a sound to be generated. Almost painfully loud!,I'll be contacting Apple support about this.,Edit 7/15/21:,I dropped the headphones off at my local apple store on 7/2/21 before the holiday weekend in an effort to get them in for repair as quickly as possible, but apparently they got lost and magically found again on 7/14/21.

The noise canceling is superb and the battery does not drain once they’ve been left alone for 5 minutes.

If you don't mind a really heavy set of headphones maybe these are for you but I would recommend the lighter Bose headphones.

I'm losing my vision, so sound has become more and more important for creative stimulation. No joke, these AirPods Max were a bit much on the wallet, but it's been a long time since I've experienced so much satisfaction from an extravagant purchase. I've owned decent quality bluetooth ear buds & headphones, and I've listened to ultra high end headphones with a dedicated amp that were WAY outside my budget reality. At a certain price point, the performance curve of audio equipment tapers off and it becomes an escalating expression of gaudy esthetics. Like most Apple products, the AP Max's have an attention to detail that transcends the market. Their simple ergonomic design, surface textures and materials feel like $550 worth in a way I didn't expect. These aren't the disposable electronic design I'm used to, but harken back to the expectation of quality and design of the past. The weight of these phones is significant but well distributed over the mesh rest and ear pads. I'm not going to say it isn't noticeable, but it's pleasantly reassuring to be reminded I have something special on your ears. Truthfully though, the tactile part is a distant second to the sound quality of these headphones.,Driving your new Ferrari for the first time, you won't likely find satisfaction on a dirt road. That said, to get a sense of what the Aripod Max are really capable of, steer clear of the streaming Mp3 dirt road and open them up the best mastered music you can find. I used the 24bit mastered album Point by Yello for this, and the 2021 collection of bineural 8D Audio recordings by 8D Tunes. I thought I'd heard these recordings, but my AP Max's reproduced a whole new range of dimension and detail.,I've played with different settings listening to the same song and turning the noise canceling mode off does produce a slightly higher level of depth and detail. The design quality, sound reproduction, and  noise canceling of the Max's is better than the Bose I got my Dad for his B-day. I understand total sound isolation would be dangerous, but Apple still has room for improvement there IMHO. The transparent mode on the other hand is nothing shore of holy crap remarkable. Very natural sound like taking the headphones off with a button. I don't know if it denigrates any sound quality, but I admit I like to turn on the extended bass in the sound settings of my MacBook and iPhone.,Thanks Allie, I'm more than satisfied.

Having had the opportunity to own most if not all of the big guns, Sony WH10003 and 4, Bose 700 and currently living with Apple AirPods Max and Shure Aonic 50. I do have wired Shure  SRH1540 and 1840 used with a HiBy FC3.,Now, the AirPods Max are definitely to my ears one of the best at reproducing or presenting music the way I like it. I think this is where sometimes things can get a little off track. This is my preference and to my ears these things present a huge sound stage, almost on a spooky level. Hence my title question. They just have such a full and rich presentation and from the top to the very bottom these rock!,I could never get into any version of the Sony WH1000 and after a couple pair of those I gave up. The Bose 700 I found to be very good to my ears but the annoying voice if I made a change to noise cancelling it would pause my music and for some reason it happened more often than not because my fingers couldn't stay away from the buttons, whenever I adjusted the headset I would activate something (my bad) but I still liked them a lot and kept them until I tried the AAP Max's. The Shure Aonic 50's I've decided to keep as well because these things deserve a listen too.,The price is not right for these things, too too expensive but I have to admit compared to every other headset I've had the AAP Max's put them to shame with the premium feel.,I like every aspect of this headphone and could complain about not having the ability to turn them off, or the dumb "Bra" you have to use to put them in low power mode and whatever else other people are not liking. But when i use them  I forget about all those things because what these do, they do it well. Even the "Crown" knob, for me it works great and for some reason I naturally turn it in the correct direction for my purpose.,There are definitely other notable BT headphones I've owned but the Bose 700 are now gone, my open back Shure's are gone (I have so Sennhieser 700 in stash and some AudioTechnica things) and my HiBy and closed back Shure's now see less duty because things aren't getting any more clear and defined pleasing, and just darn right enjoyable without the wires.,Your mileage will I'm sure vary...
