Hello. I’ve been eying the Series 7 for awhile as I had a Series 5 for a year and a half so I finally upgraded. I enjoy the slightly bigger screen, and brighter dispay along with better charging speeds and being able to use my old case and bands is a big plus in my book. To me it’s not much of an upgrade but you’re coming from a Series 3 and below then the upgrades will be major. People that complain about not having a charging brick in the box need to read the description as the description clearly says it doesn’t come with one so why complain about something that you should’ve known from the get go? They should do better research on what they buy next time and plus if you bought a new smart phone or even tablet within the last few years you should have a spare USB C charging brick laying around if not just suck it up and buy one Apple doesn’t include one so it can save on waste and declutters their packaging. The USB C Apple Watch cable allows the Series 7 to charge faster so I rather have a cable that allows me to charge my watch faster just in case if I forget to charge my watch or if I’m having a jam packed day ahead of me and need to charge it as much as I can so I can either get my day started or continue my day.

The screen alone beats all else. Once somebody gets to see the screen of the watch, the thirst is filled. The biggest feature is the screen of the watch. I picked  it up frequently to look at it and then put it away.

I have given this a lower rating of 2 because of Apple's stupidity. The watch itself is fine and should be rated higher. However, on the 7-series and on the latest iPad's, Apple has changed the charging cord on both ends. Both the insert connector to the power source and the connector to the watch (iPad) are different from previous versions and are not compatible with previous chargers. The power source can no longer be a USB port as the connector doesn't fit. And old charging cords cannot be used as they don't fit the iWatch or the iPad. This means you have to have double sets of chargers around, including automobile charges It is very annoying and irritating. Why did Apple do this?,In addition, I unplug the charger from my iPad at my own peril. When I reconnect it it doesn't always start charging. I have to fiddle with the connections on both ends, and even the AC adapter until it starts charging. This makes me leery about removing the charger to take the iPad elsewhere. It is not the cords or AC adapter as two sets do the same thing.,Is it just me or do others feel that Apple has gone downhill since Steve Jobs is not longer there.

So this is my first fitness tracker / smart watch. In fact its my first watch of any kind for a few years. I tried the cellular version and then returned it a few weeks ago for the GPS only version. Primary goal of the cellular was to free myself from carrying my phone whilst going running. too many subscription based apps, however, made this impractical, so the data plan wasn't really of much use. Plus it chews through more battery (more on that later). So yeah I think the tech ability  is finally here but Apple's ecosystem isn't very friendly to bundling your own playlists, so I continue to run with my phone AND watch AND bt headphones. Boo. Friggin. Who.,I am guessing the white band of the Starlight model probably turns a lot of people off, but you should know that bands are really easy to change, and cheap on the after market. I love the look of the starlight watch frame with a colored band. it gives the watch both the ability to be uniquely fun but can also have a more conservative look with a gun metal grey band.,The touch features are fantastic, as are the health features like vital signs. I've compared them to a real pulse oximeter and the o2 readouts are within 1% every time. Even the EKG sinus rhythm appears quite similar to a 12 lead. Remember, though, that this feature will not reliably detect (rule out) a heart attack.,Usability is quite good, also. the mini keyboard is surprisingly easy to use. Sure its not your phone, but it gets the job done. Voice to text is great and I find myself using that more than the keyboard. After about a week it primarily becomes just a time piece on your wrist as the novelty wears off, but appreciable features include the ability to glance at texts without pulling out my phone, and the flashlight feature is very handy as well.,there are a number of plastic/rubber covers on the market. I bought a two pack for use when i'll be out in the yard or an area where the watch may see more abuse. its more difficult to apply than changing the bands, which must come off to apply a protective cover. The screen naturally looses a small degree of touch sensitivity but is still quite usable. Mostly I go about my business without the cover. the 7 purportedly has a more durable screen and in a few months of use now I've yet to scratch it.,My biggest complaint, other than the music options for going running, is the battery life. I find myself charging it two or three times a day. Not that it needs that many top offs, but I don't like seeing any battery dip below 50%. the nice thing is that the charge is quite quick and painless with the so-called hockey puck. I can't imagine how frustrated I'd be with previous generations that don't charge as quickly as the 7.,if you have small wrists go for the 41mm. Medium and large will probably be happier with the 45mm.

I got this as a gift from my wife for my birthday and I love it!  I had an Apple Watch (series 2) that stopped working a bit over a year ago. My wife got me this to replace it.,The jump from series 2 to 7 was dramatic!  I did research to find out exactly what was different and I was disappointed to find out that it still had an 18 hour battery life. However, through my experience it can last closer to 30 hours per charge. But I do only use it as a watch and occasionally a timer so I imagine that having an influence on battery life.,It also was fully connected and updated within an hour and came with about 80 percent battery life.,The only downside is that it doesn’t come with a charging brick however this is standard for Apple as they stopped including bricks years ago. You still get the cable though.,All in all I love it and I love the deep red color that this watch is!

Save yourself time and money and purchase an earlier generation.  It's hard to justify this purchase price for marginal improvements from earlier iterations.  The Corporate Greed stinks, with their ruse of changing the prior iteration of charger to a USB system, so you need to purchase new stuff all around.  Yes, they include the cable with the USB-C, but the CHEAPOS don't include the plug.  Further, the one I received a couple weeks ago has been having non-stop charging issues and the battery life has been POOR.  Count on spending another $100 if you want the authentic plug and a second set.  Then again, maybe they're brilliant and they did all this nonsense to raise my heart rate to hit my fitness goals.

I have been wanting an apple watch, and finally purchased one.  I was a little leary with the battery life only being 18 hours, but it actually lasts for more than 24 hours!  I fully charge my watch each day (because I wear it to bed), and it only gets down to about 40% by the time I charge it again.  The calling and texting from the watch is awesome!  If you have been on the fence about getting one, then get off it, and buy one!

This is my first Apple Watch. I bought it from Apple and I love it. Still learning all it has to offer. I am disappointed, however, in the display. This series is touted to be more rugged than previous series. I am not that rough and, after less than 2 months, I already have 2 large scratches (see picture). At first I had a plastic film on it, but once I got active, moisture accumulated underneath. There are/were no covers available, plus I didn’t want to add bulk to the already large display. Of course the warranty doesn’t cover this. Eventually I will use my AppleCare+ to replace it. :(

So I’m only writing to say I have no idea what’s with some of these reviews. Okay no IT doesn’t come with a 9.99 block to usb-c. Big deal. If you can spend $400 bucks on a watch I think we can get that piece. It DOES come with the magnetic charger super fast charge chord that is $30 bucks. Also this watch syncs perfectly fine. I’ve bought 3 so far. For people that claim to be tech savvy but took 6 hours? I’m pretty with it still but other than saying did I want to sync it to my phone AFTER updating the phone it was fine. You buy a tech wifi product and it’s going to need updates but other than it telling and showing you how to sync up your phone there’s literally nothing to this. I bought it for my 82 year old mother . Showed her in minutes how to take an ECG, and pulse ox. Send a message, make a call, talk to Siri, set an appointment , reminder, alarm, Use the calendar , Set and measure her activity and set her ICE so if she falls and doesn’t get up the phone will contact us. For what it is and all it’s features , ease of use, this thing is amazing. I bought it on the $349. Price which really is pretty remarkable for all of it’s features. Lot’s of complaining here for something that’s a pretty amazing and bonus with an emergency alert for her to get help. I’m not sure how much people feel is okay to pay for all of this but for me it’s one of my favorite things and seeing my moms face light up and marvel over this thing makes me say it’s money well spent. Apple is a business, so is Verizon, Cable companies , service providers any many other monthly expenses that overcharge and don’t include all the accessories you need either. Apps are also money makers but some of them make our lives convenient. Go on you tube and look up how to set up your phones/watches. It shouldn’t take anyone 6 hours. From the time my mom opened it, while on a FaceTime call with my brother in Germany within literally 5 minutes it was syncing to her phone. Nothing difficult about it.

The iOS is horrible, frustrating, and counter intuitive. Want a stopwatch? Not on this device! Oh it has a stopwatch that is useless garbage. After one minute, the only thing it displays is 1:—:—. What genius thought of this? It’s not saving battery, the display is still on! You can raise your wrist and the numbers appear, but if I have a heavy dumbbell in my hand or I’m stabilizing it in my lap, I can’t move my wrist. Just have the flipping numbers on screen!! FFS. Do you want to know what minute you’re on after 70 seconds? Tough sh**, the screen switches to the time. So now you’re forced to bring up your wrist. And yes, I’ve looked up and changed every setting possible. Nothing I do prevents this. Well, why don’t you download a third part app? Hey, let’s try that. That was a massive headache itself and after I finally did download a third party stopwatch app that showed all of the numbers, the amazing, intuitive Apple iOS darkens and reverts to the time. Un-flipping-believable. Want to turn that setting off? Tough sh**, Mr. Customer, you can only look at the app for 70 seconds, so screw your three minute timer, peasant. “What you need to do is toggle the hide sensitive complications options on or off.” Guess what, that doesn’t work. Not after 70 seconds. While I’m talking about the display, sometimes an app view screen shows up randomly and I literally can’t do anything to get out of it. The only option I have is to turn it off and back on again. That’s extremely frustrating. Also, they need to figure out which direction the scroll when is used for. One screen the scroll wheel moves the screen in the direction you push the wheel (up is up and down is down), but when you go to move the cursor to edit text, down on the wheel moves the cursor up. Why? Why would they do this? Well we’re on the subject of text, the talk to text on this watch is atrocious. I can say the exact same thing on my iPhone and it works great. The watch simply does a turd job at understanding talk to text. When I do scroll down to go up and select a word to change it to something that I actually said instead of what it wrote, the options simply aren’t there. Ever. Also, when I’m on the workout app tracking my heart rate and I switch to a Stopwatch app to track my time in between sets, I looked down at my watch to check the time and it switched back to the workout app! That’s so extremely frustrating. When I switch to another app I want to look at that flipping app. I don’t want you to change to the time, I don’t want you to change apps regardless of what you think I want to see. It’s little stuff like this that makes me want to ask, will it blend? Sometimes I think putting it down the garbage disposal or in a Vitamix would make me much happier due to the frustration I have with the iOS. What stops me from doing that? The hardware. The hardware is really amazing. I love the way it feels in my wrist, I love the heart rate monitor which never drops my heart rate (unlike every Fitbit or Mio watch I’ve had). The screen is fantastic, the haptics are really nice and not overbearing. For the amount that this thing cost the fact that the software is so crippling there’s no way I can recommend someone purchase this until they get the iOS fixed.

Overall a super great experience with these way better than my last AirPods I had the second generation. I don't understand why people - even real techies are complaining about the charging situation of the watch.  Can't you read?  Need to do your due diligence before buying.  It says what's in the box.  You can buy an Apple 20W charging block for $20.00.  I guarantee you'll need it for the future.  You can also buy adapters.  If you just read what's in the box, you could have avoided lots of stress.  Everything would have arrived together.  As to the updates, from what I understand the updates need go in sequence.  If you don't have the latest, you need to update.  If you don't have one or 2 previous updates you need to add those updates first.  I am an old dog who hates to learn new tricks, Apple make things easier and I'm happier for it.  Thanks Apple

This watch comes with no means of connecting it to electricity to charge it.  It has as C connection and they want another $19 for a plug that allows you to connect to the electricity to get a charge.  I went elsewhere and bought the charger, I refused to give them extra money.  It was not the $19 it was the fact that they would sell a product that could not be used out of the box.

I speak for many in the track and field world who have tried and tried to enjoy Apple Watch as a fitness device. Problem is the lack of a physical start/stop button makes timing short races impossible. Whether you are timing yourself on repeat 400s or timing other athletes on 100s, 200s, 800s or miles. Fact is we sweat a lot on the track especially during summer workouts. We need a start and stop button!! Apple clearly hasn’t asked a track athlete’s opinion on this. The Watch is a great device for daily life. However it shouldn’t advertise as a fitness device. If stoping the clock during a summer workout is not possible this it is not a fitness device.

I’m sure the product is fine, I can’t check because it’s a Xmas gift and I don’t want to mess up the setup process for my wife. However, the watch came already opened. This obviously did not come from the factory, nor did they even attempt to present it that way and it’s very apparent that somebody has gone through the box it comes in for who knows what reason. Just takes away from the presenting aspect. My wife now has to open a $400 Apple Watch on Xmas that looks like it came in a used box. Very disappointing.

I had the series 3 for three years, and never scratched the screen — I use the watch daily and have a very active lifestyle. The series 7, within two weeks, I noticed a huge scratch on it and did not have any incidents where I would have scratched it like this. I googled this problem and discovered many people are experiencing the same thing. Apparently while it's more shatter resistant, it's less scratch resistant. Wish I knew. Definitely get a screen protector, I'm extremely disappointed to have such a gouge in a VERY expensive watch.

My Apple Watch series 7 was a great investment because I use it multiple times every day: day of the month for writing checks, set timer for cooking, outside temperature, outside weather, battery charge, DJIA, tracking sleep. The quarter hour chimes keep my on track throughout the day and serve as a good antidote to procrastination.  The Infographics watch face allows instant monitoring of up to 7 functions ("complications") simultaneously.  For me, one device on my wrist is more convenient than multiple devices in various locations:  in my pocket, on my wall, and on my desk.

Amazing - I received this watch as a gift.  Turns out the charging cable is faulty.  Chatted with them online, they told me to go to an apple store who confirmed the cable was faulty after a long examination.  They didn't have any of the new usb-c charging cables and at first said they couldn't send one to me, that I had to come back to the store.  After pressing them, I was told that apple care would call me that night which they did.  They would send one to me as long as I sent the faulty cable back.  9 days later, it hasn't shipped and support continues to fumble around for a response.  They could send me an older model cable...they could send me a new dual mag cable...but no, they continue without a clue.  So much for a premium product and excellent support.  I'm sure the cable costs them <$1.  What's my time and frustration worth?  What's a bad review worth??

The watch face had a very visible scratch right out of the box. When I contacted Amazon support they directed me to Apple support and said I would have to send the  BRAND NEW watch in to be replaced. I think that is kind of ridiculous that I spent this kind of money on a watch that was damaged before I got it, and now I have to send it to someone else for repair. The Apple support sight is no help what so ever unless you have a software problem. I can't even just send the watch back to Amazon for a refund without going through Amazon support. At this point I just want to send it back for a refund, but Amazon and Apple are making that difficult!

I was hesitant to buy one of these Apple watches, I thought they looked a bit clunky and I was not sure I was going to use all (any of) the features. But I’ve been wearing it now for a couple weeks and I absolutely love it. The phone even rings on this watch and I can answer it and speak into my wrist watch, just the way they used to do in the old sci-fi TV shows… :-)),The ECG is great to use, as is the exercise and activity app.  Also I get news flashes.  Just love my watch!

I received this watch yesterday. I may rewrite or add to this review later. Day one didn’t go well. The first problem encountered was software update. That took over 30 minutes and then I had to put the watch on the charger to finish updating. An hour later, I began setting up the watch. Each click screen (Accept - do later), the watch froze up. Two hours after starting, the watch finally works, almost. The cellular phone feature didn’t work until 24 hours later. I placed the watch on charge again at 8:00 pm that night. I put the watch back on at 10:30 pm to go to bed with 100% charge. I use the watch as an alarm clock. I was awakened at 7:30 am. The watch showed 79 % charged. So far I have had to charge the watch twice a day. The watch comes with two small bands and no charger.

This was a great Christmas present. My significant other really enjoys to wear the watch, the original band that comes with it is also small enough for people with very slim spindly antenna like wrists to wear comfortably. It has many nice features including weirdly enough a strange ability to read how much oxygen is in your blood that has something to do with lights and colors and sounds and the feeling of being on a giant rock that is moving through space at incredible speeds, you are alive. Look up, look up, I see you now. You look nice, take care of yourself. Enjoy this product by Apple, goodbye!

WHAT I LIKE IS THAT TAKES EKG FOR YOU, WILL PICK UP ANY E REGULARITY'S.

I love the color, but wish the strap were leather.

like new heart beat pickup. good watch

A experiência de comprar com a Éden Store superou as minhas expectativas.,Além da qualidade dos produtos e agilidade, destaco o atendimento do Leandro, que conduziu todo o processo de compra de forma impecável.,Uma experiência de compra diferenciada, mesmo! :D

Estou extremamente contente com a compra. Produto veio original, lacrado, intacto e em perfeitas condições. Comprei via fornecedor New tech e chegou em DOIS DIAS!!! Chocada com a agilidade ela qualidade, tanto do produto em si quanto do serviço prestado

Acabamento muito bom. Produto pra durar. O SO é muito bom, a oferta de aplicativos é boa. Funciona muito bem pra leitura e pra uso como 'prancheta'. A câmera não é excelente mas é suficiente pra um tablet.
Adorei a compra! O produto chegou muito rápido. Fiz o pedido no sábado e na quarta chegou! A caixa veio um pouquinho amassada, mas o ipad é perfeito. Recomendo.
Não existe concorrente à altura. Mesmo custando mais de 3 mil reais, vale demais a pena. É o melhor tablet custo benefício do mercado mundial.

Ótimo iPad, rápido,bateria que dura o dia inteiro ligado,áudio muito bom, câmera muito boa. Essas foram as palavras da minha mãe, pois agora terei que comprar outro pra mim.,Uma pena que não veio uma capa protetora e não acompanha mais um fone de ouvido.
O produto é perfeito, original e com nota fiscal!,Chegou em 12 dias, ou seja, antes do prazo estipulado. O vendedor mandou um adaptador de tomada. Eu amei!!
Vale a pena, muito versátil, sempre à mão.

profile-name: ERCILENE DO NASCIMENTO SILVA DE OLIVEIRA
review-body: Estamos satisfeitos com a compra. O aparelho chegou no prazo estabelecido (embora um pouco longo, mas dentro do prazo). E o produto está de acordo com o ofertado no anúncio de venda.
Ipad excepcional! Muito rápido, prático e eficiente! Vendedor atencioso e solícito, comprei na quarta e chegou na sexta, só elogios!

I was walking my dog wearing my new AirPods and a big pickup truck went by and I could hardly hear it. I thought it was a fluke when more traffic went by and everything sounded like an electric vehicle. I didn’t realize the noise canceling feature was an aspect of the AirPods.  They fit perfectly in my ears right out of the box. The only thing I was disappointed in was that they didn’t come with a USB charger.
I can’t believe I waited this long to get these. The sound quality is amazing and the noise cancellation works great too. All of the options are also really cool.
Worth every penny.

I bought these primarily for conference calls and I honestly think they are amazing! The transparency mode allows me to hear my surroundings while maintaining a conversation. Battery life is great and the sound quality is very good!
I was promised a new product, and given a use product.  Also the right head phone is making a buzz sound.
Will make mr grandson very happy

Love this airpod pro, everything they said is true. Noise cancellation is very good. The buds fit perfectly ( small ones ). I changed out the ones that comes with it. I did the fit test, it was perfect. I love these airpod pro. The price was right too. Buy these. Don’t hesitate!!!

Comfortable.  Good noise cancellation.  Sound quality is the most disappointing thing about the Air Pods Pro.  For $249, there are MANY alternatives even under $100.  Not the best battery life.,Look at SoundPeats H2.

So at first I was a little bit skeptical about buying AirPods through Amazon BUT these are legit and it says visit the apple store near the ratings so that’s another sign it’s legit. I owned a previous pair of AirPod pros and they are the same! So don’t be afraid to order them like I was! Money well spent and they came completely SEALED! Some other people seemed to have some bad experiences but not on my part, definitely buying another pair!

Gave these to my son for Christmas. Came packaged as new. When we linked them they were already named “mom’s AirPods” and the right one would not work. These were sold as NEW and were obviously not and repackaged as new! Very disappointed!!! Requested replacement and I will be looking closely to see if we are sold NEW or used.
My apps from my old iPad didn’t transfer over to this new one
Great love it
The one thing I was disappointed to see it didn’t have was Face ID , you would think it had it being the newest model but it doesn’t so no Memoji facetimes for me 😢
screen quality is way better than my iPad 8th gen, battery life is amazing, honestly no complaints about this iPad. if you’re looking to buy, you will not be disappointed!
iPad cómo yo esperaba excelente y fácil de usar

This iPad is amazing. I got it for calligraphy and art design and it has been fantastic! I have also used it as a notebook for my classes in college. I would definitely recommend buying the Apple Pencil or any stylus really along with it.
Great features, easy to use,  what not to like?
Outstanding battery life
My old iPad was so slow and always locking. This new iPad Air is fast!!
LOVING my new iPad!!
Just got it but so far I love it
I didn’t dislike anything
I like Amazon on Christmas deals. Gave me$50 off on series 7 and new blue color looks so good. It matches my iPhone color.
Excellent product

Why is there NO CHARGING BLOCK! Apple is doing its customers an injustice!  (Very expensive paper weight!)  We are being  forced to spend more money for something that should be included with watch!  Disappointed ☹️
Save your money and get a used 4 or 5. I upgraded from the original series 1 and it’s “meh”
okay if you like strapping a phone on your wrist...
Arrived on time. Which pleased me.

I’ve been using the airpod pro from Apple store and I bought this last Black Friday for my son. But when I tried it, it connects and have all the features like the original airpod pro but the noise canceling showed that it is either fake or refurbished. Transparency and noise canceling sound the same.
Wife loves these
I have tried multiple other EarPods and nothing compares to these if you have an iPhone. They simply are the best even if you have to pay for the brand name.

I had the regular airpods and debated springing for these but they are SO WORTH IT.  The sound quality is amazing and they fit in my ears so much better than the non-pro ones!  If you are debating it, debate no longer.  They are great!
I used this product for filling my ear canals. works much better than Q-tips wadded together!,As a plus you can listen to music or mute the kids!

I’ve been wanting the Pros for so long, I finally got them and I’m super happy about it. You need to adjust them in your ears to get the noise cancellation to work and definitely get apple care if I was you, so they can fix it or get you a new pair for free.

Big Bang for a small package!  A+ on sound quality and weight. Other AirPods didn’t fit my ears well at all “always falling out” but these pro’s stay in place pretty well. Wish the battery would last longer, but not bad life for how small these are.

The absolute best earbuds I’ve ever owned!  The noise canceling feature is a game changer!  I only wish I had 2 pair!!!  I really like using them for work (I work from home), and the sound is amazing!  Problem is, they only last for 4 hours, a second pair would be ideal!!!  😂
I had no idea what I was missing out. My friend told me to upgrade but I blew her off. But then became curious. I’m glad these were priced so well. I’d never upgraded. I love them.
Excellent fit and high quality air pods at the typical Apple premium price. Noise cancellation not as good as some high quality headsets but quite good for an ear bud.
Very nice watch. Very responsive
got a nice deal for the new 7 series. works well for me.
It’s nice to get new generation,,But not good as like G-6.,But good looking and different look
The new series 7 allows bigger fonts to fit within the watch face, makes everything easier to see.
Love the color

My Wife🌹 is in the healthcare business and holding her phone is a no-no on the floor and therefore having an iwatch is perfect in her case. She loves the quality,functionality and me. Need I say more. Thanks Apple for making me look good. :-)
Purchased this as used from Amazon. It is in perfect condition! No scratches or anything. Great price for a basically new watch.,(Green band purchased separately)

Tablet muito bom, de ótimo custo/benefício considerando o altíssimo custo dos demais modelos de Ipad da Apple. O SO é muito eficiente, o touch screen é bem responsivo e o equipamento responde rápidamente aos comandos.

Aparelho original e novo  , com durabilidade de bateria como de fábrica, tomada do tipo americana necessita de adaptador . Gostei da agilidade na entrega , comprei em um dia e no dia seguinte já chegou , parabéns!

O produto chegou certinho, bem embalado. Até o momento a performance do produto está tudo ok.  O único ponto do produto, que infelizmente é um problema da Apple e não do vendedor, é a demora ao carregar.
É um iPad, portanto não há muito o que se falar!

Excelente aquisição, chegou direitinho e ainda veio o adaptador do carregador. Chego dentro do prazo, só não tem nota fiscal. A bateria é durável, super fácil de manusear. Custo e benefício excelente.

Quanto ao ipad dispenso avaliações. Porém tenho que comentar a respeito da entrega extremamente demorada. A caixa veio suja e amassada, além das manchas de tinta que vieram na oarte superior da caixa.

Love the color and it’s user friendly but you must down load Manuel for better understanding of its operations if your a first time user.  It explains the operation in detail, Being 70+ appreciate the fall feature, heart rate and oxygen saturation rate app. Also has a EKG app to Verify if you are in atrial fabulation

Adoro os produtos da aplee, tenho Mac, iPad, Cel! Resolvi comprar o iwatch série 7 e não vem com conector de energia.... como assim? paguei 4 mil em um relógio e tenho que comprar um conector separado para conseguir ligá-lo!!!!!

Eu amei o relógio, é lindo e é original! Vem com nota fiscal também.,A bateria não dura muito, eu esperava que durasse mais. Ele dura um dia inteiro, e se vc desligar a noite para o dia seguinte ele vai durar o outro dia inteiro também. Mas se ficar dia e noite ligado, só dá um dia! Acredito que seja, pq ele não desliga a tela, fica sempre acesa.,Mas eu amei o produto e o vendedor, o meu pedido chegou antes do prazo.,Vem com o cabo pra carregar, só não vem com o plug da tomada!,Recomendo!

Fornecedor impecável, chegou bem antes do esperado! Encomendei e recebi no dia seguinte! Produto em perfeitas condições.,Não vem com a fonte para carregador USB-C (programem-se para isso, para não se frustrarem na hora que chegar). Consegui carregar com a minha fonte do MacBook
O produto é perfeito, original, veio lacrado e bem embalado, com nota fiscal em meu nome. A entrega chegou antes do previsto.
Produto Excelente conforme padrão Apple, contudo esperava mais da bateria.
Entrega rápida, produto bem embalado. Vem com todas as instruções para lermos antes de abrir a embalagem.
Nao vem com carregador, quando você consegue um a muito, muito custo… não funciona !!!
Produto maravilhoso, fui a alteridades Apple e é original! Único problema foi a caixa que veio um pouco amassada. Mas resto tudo excelente. Aliás, entrega SUPER rápida!
Produto original Apple, veio td certinho, NF enviada por e-mail e tmb junto com o produto, chegou extremamente rápido e muito bem embalado, estou muito feliz com a compra
O Apple Watch funciona super bem! Navegação fluida e várias aplicações para acessar.,O vendedor é mega atencioso e responde rápido.
Produto original e confere com o número de série! Chegou bem antes do na prazo de entrega! Acompanha apple watch, a pulseira em 2 tamanhos e o cabo para carregar tipo C.
Produto original apple, veio com todos os lacres íntegros, chegou rapido no RJ, logo no primeiro dia do prazo estimado!
Best
Upgraded from an iPad 5, it’s straight.
I bought this device as a gift for my wife, I was surprised at the quality, from the amazing screen to the audio that at times seems to be coming from behind you. Really happy with this purchase

First IPad upgrade since the iPad 2, it feels light fast and the battery life is good. I’ve had no complaints I didn’t need to extra power that the pro offered as I just use it mainly to surf the internet in bed. Read, and watch videos.
Ok
Battery life could be better but love it
Bought this for my granddaughter, she is an artist and she loves it.
Upgraded from iPad gen 5 and very happy

Love it! Overpriced obviously but I’m buying the logo so it is what it is
Tomada é padrão americano, mas com um adaptador resolve tudo. Utilizo o dia inteiro para estudos e a bateria dura bastante. Se soubesse que era tão prático tinha comprado antes!!
Chegou muito rápido, a embalagem veio um pouco violada, mas nada que danificasse o produto! Apesar da preço ser um pouco salgado, vale super a pena! Meu carregador n veio modelo americano
Há meses pesquisava por um apple e nunca encontrava um bom valor. Achei por aqui!,O produto chegou na minha casa em apenas 2 dias e é simplesmente incrível. Estou apaixonada!,Obrigada!
Esse IPad é incrível. As vantagens dele estao na memória que já é a partir de 64 Gb, sistema IOS 15 perfeito, muito rápido, abre Procreate e outros Apps pesados quase instantaneamente.
Excelente, muito satisfeita
Nao sei como, mas o iPad chegou em menos de 3 dias!!! Tô muito feliz com a minha compra. Chegou todo embaladinho, com nota fiscal, em perfeito estado! Vendedor 100% confiável, indico demais.
Perfeito!!! A bateria é bem duradoura, o produto chegou rápido e bem embalado. Precisei fazer uma solicitação a empresa e fui prontamente atendida.
Produto sem nenhuma avaliação negativa. Duração da bateria, design, touch e programas incríveis. Produto chegou antes do tempo previsto.
O ipad é fantástico, chegou tudo direitinho, bem embalado! O carregador é padrão EUA, mas o vendedor mandou um adaptador. Maravilhoso!
O produto chegou antes do esperado, fornecedor de confiança, e o preço mais em conta que achei. Recomendo esse produto
Produto excelente. De fácil manuseio, touch sensível, alta velocidade, design lindíssimo
Mesmo sendo um modelo de entrada, atende todas as expectativas, lindo, bateria maravilhosa, tela ótima, melhor investimento que poderia ter feito
O novo iPad 9 geração realmente me surpreendeu… eu uso ele pra desenhar e ele não esquenta e é super fluido. Eu super recomendo!
Produto muito bom, chegou rápido e em ótimo estado. A caixa veio um pouco amassada na ponta mas provavelmente foi correios. Tomada veio formato brasileiro mesmo, amei.
Gostei pq conferir e é original no site da Apple só deixa a desejar por que a fonte fo carregador e tipo americano e vc vai precisar comprar outra.
Comprei pela MW-Distribuidora, chegou em um dia e meio. Excelente revenda, excelente produto. Junto ao produto veio um adaptador de tomada para o padrão brasileiro.
Comprei na Amazon via marketplace. Confesso que fiquei bem receosa por não conhecer a loja, mas....chegou mais rápido do que o previsto e veio tudo certinho! ;)
Chegou extremamente rápido e tudo certinho com nota fiscal! Amei!
Eu não troco os produtos da Apple por nada! iPad num preço muito acessível! Eu tenho o 5ª geração, mas comprei esse para usar a Apple Pencil.
Este produto é excelente e gostei muito da loja onde comprei pois são muito atenciosos e o preço foi sem dúvida o muito bom.
Love the new iPad Air 4!

I was a bit worried about the condition of the iPad since normally I buy right from the Apple store. The only thing was the box was dented when it got to me. Other than that the iPad was in good condition
I absolutely love my APPLE IPAD :),Thank you very much,Zaynab

This iPad can do everything you need. It feels solid and light in the hand. iPad os feels really snappy even if it lacks pro motion. Sound is really good but it only has TWO speakers besides 4 grills.,It feels "Pro" without being "pro"
Really great tablet. 64 GB storage isn’t great, and the ram isn’t great... but everything else is basically like an iPad Pro. I love it!

when I lost my charging box last year, I purchased an off-brand replacement that was never very reliable. So, when I saw this great deal on a new pair, I jumped at it and have been very happy with my decision.
A huge upgrade from my wifes older set.  She loves them and uses them for work conference calls, listening to music and drowning out my cpap noise at night.
Another Great product!!  Sound clear and comfortable.  Only down on it is the battery does not last as long I would prefer.  I would recommend this product.

These are awesome. The noise cancelling toggle, the sound quality, the seamless Bluetooth pairing, everything. But I am returning them because I simply could not get the right air pod to fit. None of the 3 different sizes worked nor did some memory foam tips I bought - the right one kept falling out. I had no problem with fit with the 2nd gen air pods and if Apple ever fixes this problem with a Pro version, I will definitely buy them.
Order twice and returned twice due to defective product. It’s better to buy it from store directly.
These AirPods are excellent. Very easy to connect to an iPhone or Mac. Sound quality is superb and also great at noise cancellation. Highly recommended.

I've been looking at getting these for a while now, I am glad I waited to get the pro's, love the noise cancellation they have, it really blocks out the noise.  I had them on the airplane and it shut it all out.

These are very nice for school and work. The noise canceling works very well, but it also has spatial awareness mode where you can hear everything around you. The price is steep that’s why i can’t give 5 stars but i definitely recommend these!
I had the knock offs and thought kinda “so what”. These. Are the “Real Thing” ! The sound quality is great and the ease of use and connectivity super !

I got mine air pods Pro but today and the left airpod was giving some Beep sound continuously for every 20seconds. Initial though it was music but later on noticed it’s the sound from my AirPod. and after 20 minutes of usage my Ear was started paining. Without returning I took the AirPods to Apple store and the technician confirmed there is a problem in left AirPod and as it was in warranty Apple replaced the left AirPod.,I don’t suggest to get AirPods from here.
Sound is clear and full.  Noise cancelling is amazing and I like that it can be disabled or placed in transparency mode for those times when you need to hear your surroundings.

Lots of tech goodies. Easy to charge, light to carry, fit well and good sound isolation. Easy communication with iPhone & Apple Watch. Sound was not as good as my Master & Dynamics but better fit.  Sound a little muddy.
The price was lower than others a d they are absolutely noise canceling!! The fit is nice.  They shipped fast .Excellent service and quality!!! Highly recommended!!

I bought these because my regular 1st generation ones fall out of my ears regularly and were running out of battery life. While they definitely fit better, it feels like my ears are always clogged when they are in and yet, everything is still noisy. I have tried every setting.  The only reason I am keeping them is because they don't fall out.  But I am actively searching for another brand bc it is definitely not worth it.

opened these up and instantly had problems with it. I had problems connecting it and it would take so long that the screen changed to that (the 1st picture). It kept connecting and disconnecting to my phone saying it was “not your airpods” after i would repeatedly connect them. i spent 2 hours trying to figure out whats wrong with them with countless google searches buh my only result was money wasted on airpods that dont even work now i have no headphones to use
Love these over my beats as the phone call quality is way better. Battery is good not long lasting as my beats but for work these work wonders.

Great audio quality. Lots of bells and whistles for the Apple users. They fall out of my ears after 10 minutes. I always have to readjust them. I ordered connector pieces so they can stay in my ears. The issue there is I can charge them with the rubber mounts around them. I ordered Beats and they stay in perfectly. I use the AirPods around the house and the Beats when I’m on the move.

I have never in my life had to better earphones. My only problem is that these will randomly pause sometimes (but that might be my fault). The noise cancelation blows my mind every time I turn it on, Siri is super helpful, phone calls are easy and good quality for both parties. Overall, these earphones are phenomenal. Great work Apple.
The rubber on the ear pieces.  3 sizes so you can find one that fits perfectly.  It’s a big upgrade from my old iPods that hurt most of the time.

Amazing product if you are an Apple user. Connects quickly to iPhone and charging is fast as well, for both case and pods. Bought it during Thanksgiving at almost $60 off from amazon while the airpods pro were still being sold at MRP in apple website. Genuine product from amazon. Battery drains pretty fast, so carry the case fully charged with you at all times. Noise cancellation works great as well.
I like all of my ipad
Upgrade from my original iPad Air from 2013.  Much faster and more memory.  Very happy with this purchase!
Bigger screen; excellent picture quality.
But it’s a gift
AMAZING! THE PICTURE QUALITY IS THE BEST! The sounds? Oh gosh PERFECT! This is really good if you dint want a big pc but still wants one just in case you need it in a smaller package.
Not a big fan of apple due to hard they try to put you in there ecosystem. And sketchy business tactics. But this Ipad is A-Plus Plus Ultra. Top 5 best electronic to buy.
Works well. Good side kick if you trade all the time
Love the new iPad ,so fast and easy to use and navigate. Well worth it ! 😁
Unfortunately there are inly 5 stars. Great for my project. Taking great pictures. Very versatile. Battery last for long. Much better that my iphone
Great  price my daughter loves it. Fast shipping
O Ipad veio bem embalado, sem qualquer avaria, completo. Está funcionando perfeitamente e estou satisfeita.

Gostei do produto mais achei que a qualidade de imagem é inferior a versões anteriores, bateria tem boa duração ! Bom custo benefício!
Foi presente e a pessoa presenteada adorou
Representa perfeitamente a discrição do produto. Não adianta querer mais pelo valor e modelo, mas dentro do que foi mencionado, não foge da realidade.
Produto original conforme descrição, bem embalado. Chegou antes do prazo previsto porém sem o adaptador de tomada como descrito no perfil de venda.
Chegou certinho, excelente qualidade, cuidado com a embalagem. Minha namorada amou o presente, muito obrigado pelo atendimento extremamente rápido.
Não queria notebook pq queria algo menor e mais prático e funciona muito bem pra mim. Leio meus livros, estudo por vídeo aula é perfeito pra mim.
Excelente produto. Rápido, com boa bateria e armazenamento. Recomendo acompanhar capa e a Apple Pencil

If you’re looking for a pair of headphones for going to the gym or any sort of activity i’d advise not buying these. They are known for consistently falling out, a low max volume, the sound quality is honestly very disappointing. By all means this is not me hating or leaving a nasty comment just to be rude, i just personally think you would be happier if you spent your money on something better. I heard the Gen 3 air pods are super good.

sound is great, noise cancelation is great.  But they didn't include a charger.  you get a USB-C cable but unless your wall outlets are fit for USB-C you're going to have to buy a usbc wall brick.  Seems like a silly choice for them.

Ive gotten other airpod pros before and didnt know the pair was fake until I got these... serial number was valid at apple, way better sound quality and way better features... I was lowkey scared to buy these bc of some of the reviews, but Ive had these for about a week now and they continue to exceed my expectations... I LOVE these... especially the noise cancellation so i dont have to hear my grandmas stupid birds squealing 24/7 lmaooo
So far, so good. I’m glad I went with the pros because I have small ears and I can choose the tip that fits best. The regular shaped pods hurt and always fall out.
Amazing noise cancellation easy to maneuver with calls ending, forward to the next song and they pair perfectly with my Apple Watch 6 series
It fits perfect, I though I was going to return them, BUT, the sound is excellent and the noise cancellation is in another level, I love it.

These AirPods connect every time. The difference between transparency mode and noise cancellation is dramatic. The original AirPods had lots of problems connecting and sometimes 1 earbud wouldn’t charge. I’ve had no problems with the Pro. They also connect much faster.
Love the convenience and how easy they connect to my Apple devices. Downside is that there are better headphones in the noise cancellation and sound quality. But, overall a great buy.
I bought as a girly for my partner. He loves it. They are very comfortable and they have a good quality. I tried them with my iPhone and they definitely make a difference. Recommend!
I opened box, synced w iPhone and music, tucked in my ears, and nearly fell over!!  Sound is awesome, simply awesome.  Worth every penny.
Like that they are simple to use. Was hoping for a little more options when it comes to sound preferences but overall good sound quality.

Product was fantastic except for the very annoying clicking noise in the right ear bud. Most of the time it was every few seconds. And at its best, the clicking noise was every few minutes. Returned after several times of trying to see if it would go away. It didn't! After googling on how to get rid of the clicking noise, I unfortunately realized other people had the same problem with their Pro ear buds. Apple needs to fix this before they make more!
They are making me buy a completely different charging block!!! What is wrong with apple? So I’m returning and trying some of the other reputable and known for sound and comfort.,Jeez!!!
The sound is great both to hear the audio and as a microphone on calls. Sweet feature when SIRI kicks in as a talking Virtual Assistant
Good
I use these AirPods when I do my daily walking at the rec center.  I had used a different brand before and was not happy with the reception. I like every thing about them.

I was going to buy the new AirPod Pros but, I went ahead and bought this instead. The AirPods squick and get this ringing sound in your ear and is loud. I was using these when my "friends" were "talking" when I over heard them talking about me, so I recorded it. I left them behind and bought my coffee and left them miles away where they lived. I've been waiting a year for version 3 to come out. I preordered these and they came in the day of release. I was super excited. THEY SUCK. They constantly fall out of my ears, they feel much bigger than the old air pods and hurt my ears. They controls are way harder to use(if they work) than the old way you just double tap to pause.,Buy the version 2 not 3 it isn't worth it.,I've submitted them for a refund through apple and as soon as they refund the money I'm going to buy version 2 again.  What gives Apple?
Heads up! These may be too big to fit properly in your ears. Terrible new design. Feels like they are going to fall out all the time. The original design style was perfect.

My first impression when I bought these was "No way!". They looked too big compared to my 2nd gen Airpods .. I bought them from a retailer that has a 6 months return policy so I decided to give them a chance.,The airpods felt large in my ears and my ears started hurting after about an hour. I used to keep my 2nd generation in my ears all day and I never had any issues. I continued to give them a chance and I can say that my ears adapted to them pretty quickly. It is one of those situations where you start using a new muscle. It may hurt at first then you get used to it. After a few days, they feel 95% as comfortable as the Airpods 2nd gen. I used to carry both and now I haven't used the 2nd gen for about a week..,Aside from the size, the sound quality is night and day difference from Gen 2. You can actually enjoy music with them. They do have bass which is non existent on the Gen2.,The battery life is super good. I charge them in the morning and I can go until 2pm. I used to have to charge the gen2 at 11am.,My advice, is give them a chance and give your ears some time to adjust. There are a lot of users that ended up returning them and you can tell they are getting discounted fairly aggressively for an apple product. If you can get them to feel comfortable, they are a huge leap from the gen 2.

I ordered these directly from Apple and will be returning. The spacial audio features and connectivity are amazing, especially compared to previous generations. While Gen 1/2 fit my ears perfectly, these fall out of my ears after about 5 minutes of light movement. Even a simple yawn is enough to dislodge them for me. I understand the first 2 gens only fit 70% of ears (or something close to that) but now it seems like they created an issue for a different 30% of users.,Happy for those of you who can now finally wear these, but Apple should be ashamed and should have made multiple models. Now I’m sure they’ll just try to funnel us to the pro version.
If you were a fan of the Airpods 2, these are definitely not an upgrade. They do not fit, they are basically the airpods pro without silicone tips. Returning promptly.

OK, I'm not listed as a "verified purchaser" because I received these as a gift, but I do have them in my possession...even in my ears as I write this.  First, I think the sound is better (listen mostly to classical music) than the 2nd generation (which recently succumbed to getting water on one of them).  BUT I find them "fatter" than the 2nd Generation and they simply don't fit in my ears as well and the right one just fell out...sitting still (no aerobics).  So that is a concern.  So far the "spatial audio" hasn't made much difference to me.  I was in love with the 2nd generation before their unschedule/planned baptism.  These sound wonderful...but I don't want to superglue them into my ear !!

I've used Bose Noise Canceling and other AirPods Noise cancelling AirPods - couldn't handle them. Stuffed up my ears after just a few minutes and took days to unstuffy them.  These seem to be different. Perhaps because no active noise cancellation and they sit in the ears rather than being stuffed into them with a tight seal.  Have just had them for a few days, but like them. Sit very steady in my ears and don't feel like they will come out at all.  Ears a bit sore after taking them out but I think that is getting used to them a bit. Will see how that goes. Like how easily they pair with a device (iPad, Apple TV, iMac) as you switch devices.  It would have been nice to have a volume up/down on it vs having to control that by the phone, tv,etc.  When using for telephone use, the other party said they sounded fine and I could hear them fine.  Definitely no noise cancellation - outside noises are all there (which is a safe thing in a way), but on a plane, train - would not be good - you would need the Pro's for that.  Have watched a few Dolby Atmos tests on YouTube- very impressive.

These are an improvement in every way over the AP2, which includes better sound (spatial audio makes a huge difference), battery life, shorter stem, water resistance, and shorter stems. But the one huge area, and the reason that I decided to return them, is that they do not fit my ears. I could leave the AP1 and AP2 in my ears all day and I would essentially forget that they were there. But these new Airpods do not feel as comfortable, the head that sits in your ear is much larger, which probably helps with the sound but they do not stay put in my ears. They never fall out but they shift and are not comfortable after about 30-45 minutes.,If Apple would have made the same head profile as the AP2, with shorter stems, these would have been perfect for me, but as they stand, I cannot endorse them, at least for my particular ear shape.

I really hoped I liked these because I wanted some that didn't set in my hear canal due to discomfort. I had beats but my ear canal still hurts and they were uncomfortable around the ear. With a mask on and these you are too likely to lose them.  Compared to Gen 2 these just don't set safely in my ear. I find them slipping the first time I tried them. I want all the features of these but they are a bigger fit than Gen 2 or actually even the Pro.  We were able to compare them since each of my daughters have the other versions. This by far are fat and loose, so not as trustworthy that you won't lose them. Especially during this winter and with mask around the ear, they could easy fall or get caught up in your scarf and you won't know it until it's too late.  True any can fall but unless you have deep ears these are just too easy. Nope too expensive to lose like that so I got rid of them. I can only hope Apple make some that have these features but actually rest in your ear like Gen 2. I'm sure not likely but one can hope.

I'm not sure how it happened, but I find myself...at age 60+ an avid "Apple FanBoy". It's become an almost crazy obsession to keep buying the latest and greatest Apple products. These Apple Airpods 3 are another example since I had the 1st generation and the 2nd generation AirPods. While the first and second were okay (not great...just okay), this 3rd generation is getting closer & closer to perfection.,Pros: 1) shorter stem,  2) improved bass,  3) spatial audio,  4) longer battery charge,  5) solid bluetooth connectivity,Cons: 1) lack of noise cancellation,  2) open back design,  3) stem pinch controls,Admittedly, when I'm in-the-mood for serious music appreciation (listening), my headphones of choice are still the Apple AirPods MAX around-the-ear cans with noise cancellation.

Lets say, you're shopping for Chevy... and Caddy comes your way! You get more than you bargain for! I hope you can catch my drift!,Update: few weeks later…,I’m very happy with these AirPods. Very happy and fully satisfied! They’ve kinda grown up on me. They are NOT suitable for jogging. Not for me. Their new design (without silicon tips now) is lacking somewhat secure, carefree feeling, that you may lose one/both of them while running. It’s just my opinion. Other than that - they’re SUPERB in every aspect! Sound quality… They come with Apple Music 6 months free subscription. And, when you turn spatial audio on… OMG! You’ll see the difference, for sure! One of the best features is they’re fully operated by Siri. Volume up/down, next/previous song, etc. So convenient, I must say! Battery life - more you’ll ever need, trust me.

Have all the apple air pods. This sounds just as good as the pro's without the noise cancelling. I really like them. However, when music or video is paused, the right earbud starts making a high pitched hissing coil whine sound. I've tested 3 separate new pairs and all of them had the problem. I even had one shipped back to apple for repair but the same problem persisted upon its arrival. Great product but there may have been a manufacturing defect on the first batches from the factory.

Returned these for a new pair of AirPods 2. These have WAY too much bass and low end. It muddies up all my tracks! It sounds like they let the high schooler with a modified ‘99 Honda Civic thumping bass loud enough to set car alarms off do the EQ on these. Not everyone enjoys loud bass. It sounds like crap to me. And I refuse to use EQ on all my music to accommodate the bad sound mix of these.,They also sit in the case awkwardly. Are a little larger fit and don’t feel secure in your ear, and oddly sized case. I do like the shorter stems but not much else to justify keeping these. The controls on the stems are hard to use without knocking them out.,Poorly designed generation. AirPods 2 are superior!

I really wanted to love these. I've had AirPod 1's for ages and when they recently died, I decided to get these because I prefer the open feel over the enclosed feel of the AirPod Pro's. The 1's fit my ears fine, however the 3's simply don't. Everything about their functionality is superb and I love the sound or them. But... just simply keep falling out of my ears, and I'm a little disappointed.,So no, these aren't a one-size-fits-all product, and I don't even have large ear canals or anything - I'm as ordinary as it comes. I recommend trying them on before buying.

Great features and sound, but Airpods 3 are too big to fit in-ears (especially the right side).  I have no issues with Airpods 1/2 and Airpods Pro.  They made the Airpods 3 too big so I returned them to Apple.

Enjoy high audio quality with long battery life in a sleek form factor sure to grab peoples attention to the fact that you have/had money? Has your recent Botox job left you with a face reminiscent of the Mona Lisa? Suffered a stroke leaving you with an inability to show complex emotion? Got a heavy case of RBF? These headphones are for you!,Bottom line: as long as you don’t chew, smile, turn your head too fast, or inquisitively at an angle- they might stay in your ears. Or you can always spend more money on peripheral attachments which might help them stay in your ears but also renders the sleek styling and convenience of the charging case moot!

I really wish Apple would make these for smaller ears. I put one in my ear, moved it about 10 different ways and it just kept falling out. I have the Pros, (they stay in but are also a little large) but I didn’t love the squishy tip. After reading reviews I thought these would do the trick. They just aren’t for smaller ears. If you have lots of room for the Airpod Pros, these are for you. My ears worked way better with the OG design. We’re all different, thus the 3 star review. If you have ears that fit, they are amazing. Smaller ears, stay away.

Buy these headphones. They suck at staying in your ear (hence why mine fell in a river and then down a waterfall), but just buy whatever you have to so they stay in your ear; it will be worth it.,I grabbed it and had no doubt in my mind that it was definitely dead, so I just left it in the mesh pocket of my backpack. After 5-10 minutes, I guess something on my backpack leaned on the clicker and paused the song, so my left headphone went dead. I then took the now dry headphone and put it in my ear and the song resumed playing as if nothing happened.,In my own opinion of what can go wrong tech-wise to destroy something, just about every one of those happened to that headphone and it took ten minutes to dry and sounds good as new.,Durability is off the charts.

Overall, the sound is great with a lil base that makes  listening to music soothing and cool. Battery life could be better for the price, and since this suppose to be an upgrade from the previous air pods the battery seems no better than the last generation to me. Also, the main thing that makes it not so great for me is the pods makes my ear hurt and they become sore after only a short while of using them. I can bare with the battery life, but just not this, issue. I’m not sure if my ears are just small or what. I think my ears are normal size to me. However, after about a good 30 mins or so my ears are sore, and I’m forced to take them out. Because of this, I only wear one air pod in my ear at a time because once one ear gets sore, I take that air pod out of that ear and then insert the other air pod in my other ear. I keep rotating just to make it through, which I shouldn’t have to do for the price because I paid around $179 without tax at my local Target store. I started to get the next generation up that looks basically the same as this air pod, but have a soft piece to cover the air pod which u can switch out according to your ear size. That might have been better for me. Good luck, especially if you have small ears.

Sounded great at first but I quickly noticed they fit only very very loosely in ear. Feels like you need to constantly adjust them or they will fall out. Works well only if you are sitting absolutely still and not doing anything vigorous at all. They fit so loosely that if one falls out you don’t even notice it until it’s too late and gone forever. I cannot recommend these at all the fit is so horrible. Go with either the Pro or another product altogether. Swing and a miss Apple.

I have always loved apple ear buds. From the OG circle buds, to the new gen egg shape. Ive used the Gen2 airpods for 2+ years and love them. Decided to upgrade to Gen3. I have in ear psoriasis so rubber tips are painful for me so i was pumped for an upgrade.,So the speakers/mic are both obviously better. Lightyears better than Gen2? No, probably not event noticeably so, but better nonetheless. Spatial audio is pretty cool, Magsafe charging is always nice. And just light upgrades all around.,Gen3 are clearly larger and will probably fit a little too tight in most cases. The shape is weird, they just chopped off the rubber tips from the pros and called it a day, but without them you dont have the same anchor point. So with normal/smaller ear canals it wont feel as secure.,IMO If the Gen2 fit comfortably in your ears then I would stick with them. I dont think there is enough here to be worth the $60 price difference.

When Apple used to bundle devices with EarPods, I realized the fit was terrible. So I avoided the AirPods and only used the AirPod Pros (with the in-ear silicone tips). Sound is great on these and visually with the shorter stem they look good.  The issue is the controls on the AirPods themselves, with the 2nd gen you can skip tracks by double tapping on the outside of the AirPod so it stays in your ear, but with these (and the Pro) you have to hold the bottom of the stem in a certain indented spot to skip tracks.  This is an issue as the AirPods fall out each time I touch them.  My work out gloves get in the way as well, I hated it and will be returning.  If you don’t use your AirPods in this way (I.e use your Apple Watch to control music) then these are great but if you use this functionality like I do at the gym, on planes, etc. you will not enjoy this experience.  I wish they had the double tap as well on the back of the AirPods and then I would love these….

As with any Apple product, these sync'd beautifully with multiple phones/computers.  The sound quality is above average compared to other earbuds, but (as should be expected) will not compete with over the ear headphones.  There is no active noise canceling feature, but they do a fairly good job of blocking out background noise.  The "Hey Siri" function, auto pause on removal from your ear, and notification support all work very well.  Others have validated for me that the microphones do a good job of picking up your voice, so you can feel confident using these on calls.,My only gripes are the size and accessories.  These are slightly larger than the Apple wired headphones (and gen 2 Airpods from what I've read) and that can cause some discomfort when wearing for long periods.  I'd recommend twisting them slightly towards your mouth, which seems to help, but that will likely vary by ear!  In typical Apple fashion, a USB-C to Lightning cord is supplied, but no accompanying brick.  So unless you already have a brick, you'll need to use an old cord for charging.  Not a huge deal, but annoying nonetheless.,Overall, I'd highly recommend these!

These earbuds fit me comfortably well, luckily. They felt super lightweight being sweat resistant, snow resistant, and rain resistant, as long as myself not being soaking wet. They were made small enough to be touched and controlled with ease by my slim fingers.,Except without having noise cancellation mode, except being one size fit all, and except came with a smaller wireless charging case, these pretty much the same things like the pro which has been used frequently by me on daily basic more than a year. I liked my pro best, and I was happy to use these new 3rd gen for different occasions too.,I have used these new gen for WFH in quiet environment, and their battery life and sound quality being as awesome as the pro. Whenever on the go, I would only use the pro because of their having both of noise cancellation and transparency modes.,If i would have to drop any star for any particular reasons, then I would criticize these new gen for not having noise cancellation mode. Well, to be fair, these new gen have got nothing wrong without the noise cancellation mode. They way cheaper than the pro … right, pricing would be the next thing to be reviewed.,For pricing of these new gen, I could be able to purchase 3 ~ 4 different good brands of android Bluetooth earbuds which ranged between $40 - $60. See? Pricing would be the top issue for many reviews … you might not like something simply because of their high price.,For me, I did purchase at least 4 different “great” android Bluetooth earbuds in the past, just for my different android devices such Fire tablets, android laptop, and android smart tvs. Why did I buy 4 instead of 1, so stupid right? I know what you mean. Right, those great android earbuds really being so cheap and so stupid as the same time. Once the android earbuds got connected with my fire tablet’s Bluetooth for example, I must disconnect its most recently connected fire tablet before I could connect it with another Bluetooth device of mine such as the laptop, every single time to repeat these stupid routines … so sick of repeating the same steps every single time ... so I had ended up buying 4 different brands of Bluetooth earbuds for each of my 4 different android devices, so that I didn’t have to repeat the stupid disconnecting and re-connecting steps every single time. The total of those 4 cheap “great” android Bluetooth earbuds got even cheaper than one AirPods Pro, but …,Unlike the stupid routines mentioned above, these AirPods can be automatically recognized and connected to any of my iPhone, iPad mini, iPad Pro, MacBook just with one touch on the screen whenever I wanted. Apple remembered its setting once for all without having a need for me to know how they did it by themselves. Simplicity, I liked best.,Liked it or not, these are not cheap, and these are way too expensive if you compare its price with any of the “best” android Bluetooth earbuds out there in the market. Just be honest with yourself for one simple question … why do you need these, or do you really need to buy them?

Sick and tired of the way Apple FORCES AirPods to connect to ALL your Apple devices, and if you attempt to remove them from one device, Apple warns you it will remove it from ALL your devices. If you do that, it will just he added back to ALL your devices once you pair them with your phone again.,I swear Apple employees don't eat their own dogfood. What an entirely stupid behavior. And how unbelievably arrogant to not give the customer the choice in which devices are paired.,So you put them in your ears, and you hear the connection chime, play something on your phone, and nothing comes out of the AirPods, because they connected to your CLOSED MacBook. A CLOSED, SLEEPING computer. What in the ACTUAL!! This is beyond stupid. Apple has truly lost the plot under Tim Cook. They sure make money, but they couldn't write decent software if their lives depended on it.
Just straight up amazing sound is amazing and I don’t know about noise  a cancellation yet will update.

Got them for $115 at costco. Bought them for my son as well for Christmas. These are better than the gen 2s and have better noise cancellation without them hurting your ears like the AirPod pros. Worth it if you can find them on sale! Air pod pro cases do NOT fit!

The sound quality of these wildly overpriced headphones is about on par with the set that came for free with my iPod shuffle 12 years ago, minus the wires. The microphone is pretty bad too, and I usually have to just take them off and hold my phone to my ear for people to understand me.,Eventually the microphone stopped working entirely after around 10 months and I tried to take them in to be fixed under warranty. The “genius” that helped immediately decided that there was water damage due to some nonexistent corrosion on the metal grating over the speaker holes (despite these not being remotely near the microphone section) and helpfully suggested that I buy a new pair for retail price, with the extra charge for Apple Care  of course! Since the headphones have never been wet before I asked a few clarifying questions and was told that maybe they got some sweat in them. Honestly it’s possible since I run in them, but I was hoping that was somehow accounted for in design.,So to sum it up, these headphones are not good for listening to music, not good for talking on the phone, not designed to be worn while working out, and not covered by any meaningful warranty. On top of that they are some of the more expensive wireless headphones on the market. If you’re at all on the fence about AirPods, I’d recommend going with one of the many competent competitors and avoid awarding this poor design and predatory business practice with your hard earned cash.

BUYER BEWARE: Make sure the product package your AirPods sit in is factory sealed. If not, you got scammed. It seems some somewhere along the distribution path (probably at Amazon’s warehouse) are swapping out the new AirPods intended for you with used ones. Multiple customers have experienced this including myself. These were a gift and when the recipient tried to pair them with his phone it said they were already associated with someone else’s Apple ID (and the start date for the warranty had begun two months prior).

Compared to the AirPods pro, these only lack transparency mode and active noise cancellation - with the trade off being an extra 1.5 hours of listening time on a full charge, and an extra 6 hours stored in the case.,Compared to the previous AirPods 2, these have the following improvements: Spatial audio, adaptive EQ, sweat + water resistance, MagSafe charging.,The problem is the shape - they don't really go in your ear as much as they just rest on the cartilage. At even a casual walking pace it felt like they were going to fall out at any moment.,Will be returning these before they fall out and get lost.

Excelente calidad de sonido, personalmente me gusta mucho el diseño. Hay mejores audífonos probablemente, mas baratos definitivamente, pero lo que me convence de Apple ademas de su diseño e innovación, son las comodidades que presenta manejar un ecosistema Apple, gracias a su chip H1.,El único inconveniente que veo es el precio. $4,500 me parece un buen precio para el AirPods PRO, que la única diferencia con estos es la cancelación de sonido. Tengo que confesar que no leí bien la publicación y pensé que había comprado los PRO por muy buen precio, un poco mi decepción al darme cuenta de mi error, pero no pienso pagar 1,500 mas por el cancelamiento de sonido. De ahí en mas, muy feliz con mi compra

Doesn’t fit like like AP2 or APP. A step down in comfort so the sound being better is nothing.,It’s quite clear based on the reviews that everyone has their own opinion on the fit. That’s a clear sign to test the fit yourself. Online it looks like an even 50/50 on comfort- I’m speaking on my experience which is that the AP2 is the best fit to date, APP in second (silicone tips are annoying), and the AP3 are the worst. They’re not only too large, but they also feel loose In your ear and will fall out simply from smiling… crazy these are the real design.

The previous gen AirPods and EarPods would easily fall out of my ears, but after reading some reviews about the redesigned shape of the 3’s, which apple did to fit more ears, I decided to give these a try and was shocked by how perfectly they fit. I can walk, run, jump, shake my head, laugh, yawn, put a mask on and take it off — these things remain snugly in my ears while also hardly feeling like anything is there.,I was so worried when I ordered these that I’d be in for disappointment that I double checked the 30 return policy with Amazon over live chat before they arrived. It’s been two days now since I got them and no way am I sending these back.,I love the fit and comfort, the low profile, the convenience, the charging case is small enough to live in the same front pocket as my wallet, and they actually sound pretty good. Don’t expect audiophile levels of sound but they’re not bad at all.,Very happy with my AirPods 3 and love that I finally get to own a pair without having to worry about them falling out like the previous design would.

I will start with what is probably the best features of the airpods, which is by far the form factor. Both the headphones themselves and the case are super easy to go anywhere with. My old wireless earbuds were way too large of a case to fit in my pocket, whereas these feel like they could actually properly replace my wired earbuds due to their (shockingly compact) form-factor. I can get my phone and earbuds in one pocket, or my wallet/keys/earbuds in one pocket and my phone in the other, which is very nice. Tie in the wireless charging making it easy to keep my phone and headphones charged (though I've never come close to running them dry), and they work pretty well. But...,For how expensive they are I am going to critique them much harder than my last set of wireless earbuds (which were $40 and sound better than these). I primarily use these for working out, and while they are resistant to sweat it does make them slide out incredibly easily for me. That generally is my biggest complaint of all, the fit in the ear. I get you can't design a hard-shell for every ear, but I found the old design much more reliable than these, and also much easier to clean (the angle makes wax stuck in the crevice hard to get at). This is probably the most annoying aspect of the earphones by far since I bought them to work out in, and I constantly have to worry about them popping out, breaking, and having wasted the better part of $300.,Likewise I have a few other complaints:,- The actuation doesn't activate properly for controls when I have chalk on my hands all the time.,- Generally one-ear listening is very unergonomic with constant pairing abnormalities (going from paired to not paired), not to mention switching to one ear listening from two ears is a pain in the ass because your music pauses (they could fix this by having music restart when the other ear is back in the case),- The actuation feels weird with the haptics. Specifically because it is (I assume) force touch haptics you don't actually feel like it's clicking, but there is a slight audio cue that often gets drowned out by music and makes it hard to tell if you've hit it,- The fact that many of the features (adaptive eq, spatial audio [which I personally think is garbage anyways], and the more reliable h1 pairing) are not actually features of the headphones, but rather IOS features that these happen to implement since they stop working on android,- The price is insane for the actual quality of the sound in the headphones. Overall they sound *fine*, but again for nearly $300 I would like more than fine,So overall, if you happen to fit them well they're alright. They really are good as a pair of daily driving headphones with the form factor. Every other wireless pair of earphones I would not bother to take around with me, and would just use when working out cause of how bulky they are.  If you're on android be aware they will sound worse than the already mediocre sound they have on IOS (VERY open-back and pretty flat), and if that doesn't bother you fire away Just wait for a sale or buy them second hand cause they are not worth the insane cost..

Simplemente el sonido es muy bueno , tiene un evolución en las frecuencias graves. Con un mayor cuerpo en el sonio en general.  En cuanto a comodidad tambien mejoro , lo unico es que tenia el temor de que se me cayeran pero para nada , hasta me he dormido con ellos puestos. Creo que a algunos no le pueden quedar pero a la mayoria que se quejan del fit, es por que no se los saben poner.  Por otro lado también tienen una mejora en la conexion con el iphone , es mucho mas fluida y de momento no me ha fallado ni una vez desde que los compre, cosa que si pasaba en algunas ocasiones con la segunda generación. Y ya por ultimo el incremento en la carga de bateria si cambia la experiencia, con esas dos horas extra ya no me ha pasado que se me termine mientras los uso. En general muy buen producto.

They're a bit bigger, with my small ears I was worried they'd hurt or be uncomfortable.. but no, they fit as well as the airpods gen 2.. just more snug, no need to push them in far.. just place them gently and they stay put.,The sound is amazing.. nice bass! 👍,Call quality also improved.. very clear and the person at the other end also says my voice sounds clearer than the gen 2 airpods.,BUT... somehow apple has yet to figure out how to filter out the background noises picked up by the mic.. For the person you're talking to, every noise around you is amplified x10.. washing your hands will pierce their eardrums! 😳  What's up with that?,Always have to be mindful not to do anything that makes a sound while on a call.. 🙄,Other than that I luv them 👍

The Airpods (v3) are super easy to set up, and work very well with multiple Apple devices.
