I needed a new Tablet to replace my aging Nexus 7, which I gave up using a while ago as even with custom firmware it couldn't be upgraded past Android 6. With Google being idiots and halting development in the tablet space after the failed Pixel tablet 2 years ago, it appeared that Apple was my only option for a high-end tablet.,This 4th-gen Ipad Air is a real treat. It has the same A14 Bionic Chip that's on the iPhone 12 flagship, which means it's one of the fastest ARM-based tablets in existence right now. It's arguably better than even the Ipad Pro, since it's on a more power-efficient 5nm process, so it's a better choice until they refresh the Pro next year. This new Ipad is incredibly snappy, and has no problem running graphically intensive mobile games or doing video encoding with ease. Unlike past Ipad Airs, this tablet provides great value and is a serious contender to the Pro at half the cost, while still maintaining a decent screen size at right under 11".,IOS 14 is still missing a few key features only available in Android, but I think for most people it will be more than sufficient for most common tasks. My main complaints are the lack of notification toolbars like in Android, which allow for powerful shortcuts using IFTTT and other protocols within quick reach. Additionally, adblock support is still limited to plugins for Safari, and utilizing a DNS-based approach. DNS will work system-wide, but only works on your local WiFi network and not over a cellular network. It also misses some types of encrypted ads that are becoming more commonplace these days. It's too bad that Apple limits actual adblock plugins to Safari, as I much prefer using Chrome, but it's better than nothing. IOS is also still quite locked down, and I doubt that IOS 14 on the new Bionic Chip will be jailbroken anytime soon if at all, so modding is still very limited. That means no transferring of save games between Game Apps that have a Windows or Android counterpart, and limited support for gaming emulators, though quite a few are available which do not require root access.

Finally decided to upgrade and bought the new iPad Air 4th generation. What a POS. Like another review mentioned, the battery life was not as advertised, used it for 3 hours and battery power was down to less than 30%. Would need to charge this thing multiple times a day if I were to keep it. Also, it would not let me set my password preferences, there was no check mark to indicate I was making a change, and then after asking for my password after EVERY song I tried to download in 5 min, then it mysteriously stopped accepting my password. Couldn't change preferences. Spent a total of 4 hrs on the phone with Apple support, (2 hrs one day, 2 hrs the next) and got transfered to total of 6 different people,including senior managers.  I was told It was a software problem, NOT a hardware issue and thus the iPad was fine.  Did a total reset 3 times, last time hooked up to a computer, reinstalled the software and.....still nothing. Same problem continued.  I returned it today and was told there are no more available ( of the one I want).  Meanwhile my 1st gen iPad Air is still working beautifully.  Apple has really gone downhill. So frustrating!!!

I'm new to apple, they seem to punish you for only owning 1 apple product.,Everything works wonderfully! I bought it for digital art and this IPad Air and the Apple pencil are WONDERFUL! So dang awesome.,However, I've owned it for a week. Set up required like 3 passwords, log on password, apple ID password, Apple touch password, all with different length and requirements. It was a nightmare to remember what needed which password and so naturally I got locked out and I desperately tried to figure out why it wouldn't accept any of the passwords I tried. Unfortunately I am at the "Ipad is disabled, go to Itunes" part. Trying to Reset or "Restore" the ipad out of just giving up didn't help either! It just error codes me to death when I follow all the instructions to do it from itunes!,If you don't have an iphone, another ipad in your household or a mac- you are doomed to pull all your hair out!,So- to summarize- it is fantastic to draw with, the pencil is like butter and the ipad works with it seamlessly!,It is not user friendly or forgiving if you don't have any other apple products and are forgetful (like me! I have ADHD. need to write down these passwords somewhere!) On the bright side, if you are super private and want to discourage anyone from getting into your stuff? This is great for you.

A few years ago, i purchased the Ipad mini 2. i have had a on/off realtionship with tablets over the years. I really enjoyed the ipad mini 2..i switched to andriod tablet (BIG MISTAKE) and recently purchased this Ipad.,I primarly use this for checking email, facebook, reading and listening to music. I can't comment on the gaming aspect because i'm really not into games on a tablet.,Pros-,-Solid build (feels solid in your hand) no cheap construction,-Beautiful screen. colors are bright and vivid.,-touch screen responsiveness is second to none, no lag or delay at all,-long battery life (need i say more?),-great speakers! i have hearing loss in one ear, and wear hearing aid. ive found that even without my hearing aid in, the volume is adequate to hear.,Cons-,-USB C charging. I have mostly lightning cables (where i own a IPHONE XR) and i was really disappointed that apple changed to the USB-C cable. but that's good news if your switching from android, you don't have to buy any additonal charging cables. but where i have been using apple products for years now, it was disappointing to see that apple has gone onto usb-c cables.,-screen shows tons of fingerprints. (i do have screen protector on order, so hopefully it will fix the issue),-EXPENSIVE accessories (keyboards, and the apple pencil)- apple products do cost more but you know this going in..,Conclusion-,this tablet will serve your needs well, and there are tons of aftermarket cases and accesories for it. and depending on what you are using it for, it can almost replace your laptop. I find that the build quality of apple products is second to none..yes you will pay more up front, but that is the way things are..you get what you pay for.,I bought the wifi only model. didn't feel i would be using it outside of areas that didn't have wifi avalaible.,for the price paid, i'm very satisifed..apple tends to support their products longer than the competition, so you can easily get a good 5 years out of your ipad before it starts to become obsolete.,if you want a fast, relaible tablet with a beautiful screen, go ahead and get this ipad.

I was initially in the market for a new iPad as an eReader. Figured I’d get the new iPad mini. Perfect size for reading. Maybe even 64gbs since my current library isn’t more than 64gb. I also know a thing or two about drawing. Considered a bigger iPad. Then I was given an iPad Air. 256 go. Since it’s better for drawing and because I may outgrow the 64 Gb one lol. I was very thankful and love my present. I have tons of apps/games/books. If I were to store all of that on my iPad it would take up like 150 gb. My phone has all of that on there. Currently just have procreate on my new iPad and my library of books. No music. Yet. Maybe. Unsure yet. I love the size for drawing. Got the Apple Pencil gifted to me as well. I’m having lots of fun with procreate. I got a paperlike shied. Absolutely like the matte finish and grainy ish texture. I do like the iPad Air for reading but it’s huge lol. I still have my mini and enjoy reading on that way more. I’ll most likely keep using that for reading. Occasionally read on iPad Air. Mostly draw on there. Lol the iPad feels like a bit of overkill for my needs. Maybe it’s because of all the storage I’m not utilizing. Maybe I’ll upload my LumaFusion app on there someday if I get back into editing home videos.,Update. Forgot to add that I had to return my first iPad Air 4 to Best Buy because of this shadow that shows up. Someone else in reviews calls it waves. But when you apply pressure to the screen, like testing your hand on it while drawing, in one particular area I’d get these shadows or screen disruption when I’d write near it. It bothered me so much. My iPad was returned. Exchanged for another. Same thing happened. Got another and it did the same. Now the one I have doesn’t do it at all. So happy for that!!! Smh. I did google this and turns out lots of others have had this screen disruption or what have you when drawing or writing on the iPad Air 4. Some people said the display models did it too. They called apple support and they’re all “unaware” of the issue. Some say they can’t exchange it if the display modes do it too because that means that’s what all iPads do and people can’t just keep exchanging them lol i have high high standards for apple and this amazes me. That they have this issue with the iPad Air 4. It’s disappointing and I’m just relieved that the one I have know doesn’t do that. Yet.. lol the other iPads did it like a day or two after some use. I’ve had this iPad for like a month. Maybe 2 months. No issues with it.

Background/use-case,Background:, WFh, was mainly using linux, it got a little difficult with some of the support for application like Teams and Ms Office which for me are a must in that i write a lot of specs and such.  White boards. i find it really difficult to read though everyones docs, and follow meetings online, I'm just visual. Having an tool that really nails the writing aspect; i mean it really works has been so helpful. I retain information better, and i am visual so i can draw things out faster than i can in modeling software. it's really great. The performance of this is also really good.,What i ddon't like.,Feel strongly,- the battery life isn't as good as I would expect for this kind of device. I'd like to see all out usage 2 days (double). it drops fast if you are using it heavily. It eats though the battery pretty quickly.,- screen. it's an apple screen, but it doesn't seem as bright as all that. this is an issue if you go work outside. it's good, but an area for improvement. I suspect they are trying to compensate for the power usage, and possibly why they kept the refresh at 60(that was probably a good tradeoff given the lacking battery),- power button. Volume and touch button tedious. it' s an apple move. I want to hold down the touch button and have it turn off. Power down a device is a great way to conserve more battery, get a fresh start. it's not a bad thing,- storage, it costs too much. the base should be 128, for this price. I can get a 64 usb thumb drive for nothing. Give me a break.,Less strong (there are alternatives),- the keyboard case (not really this product) but i don't like that it doesn't protect the device, so i didn't buy it (well the cost is insane too) but i'd like to if not for those. Related -> Bluetooth is weak on this. if you pair a keyboard and a mouse you get lag. This sort of trade off i expect from cheaper devices not 600 dollar tablets. It's annoying. this might be the most annoying.,I know a lot of cons. They aren't all deal breakers. There's a lot of 5 star reviews, i feel like this is a 4 start product. Not 5. It's just that most other products in this category are 2-3. The touch, writing and media consumption are fantastic. As are the USB-C this was another fact that let me start using apple products. I'm not going to mess around with lightening connectors.  I do feel like though you could combine the capabilities of a MacBook Air/ or 13 pro with touch. I know there are some issues with where to place the speakers, charge a bit more and make a 2-1 device, like the surface. That said with the screen sharing I use the iPad and Mac in dual screen mode, and that makes it even more valuable. Your getting an external/monitor computer combo for 500 honestly not a bad tradeoff. That's why I left this last bit out of the cons. I feel a little mixed.

Apple has finally understood the concept of what the middle child iPad Air is all about which is “Providing iPad Pros features, at a more affordable price”. This tablet is perfect for the average consumer, or students that want something better than the standard iPad but less expensive than the iPad Pro., I upgraded from the 2014 iPad Air 2 to the 2020 iPad Air 4th generation and I gotta say I’m very impressed of what they did. While the iPad Air has known to have most of the features that the iPad Pro has, such as USB C connector which is a huge improvement for people in business or education. But this tablet has to sacrifice some features, especially the 120HZ refresh rate, and Face ID to keep cost low but it’s something that the average consumer, student, or a business person wouldn’t care about, unless your an artist, a creator, or someone in the designing industry, then I would say an iPad Pro is necessary purchase to make if you're career requires the higher refresh rate and the higher GPU processing for graphic designing, video editing, or creativity.,Otherwise this tablet is perfect for anything from entertainment to web surfing, I even took notes with the Logitech crayon, even with the lower refresh it’s not the top of the line in class, but for my needs, it works just perfectly. I tested the landscape speakers and they are a huge improvement because the speakers are on both sides.,The only thing, I’m disappointed is the base storage on average 64GB works for most people, but at $600, it should be at least 128GB and then a $150 charge for the 256GB. But with apple focusing on keeping cost low, especially  being $200 cheaper, I guess they wanna keep the 128GB base storage exclusively for the top of the line tablets.,Overall I’m very satisfied with this iPad, I’m recommend this anyone that wants something better and more modern than the standard iPad without breaking the bank. For the love of god, please don’t buy the iPad Pro unless you’re work requires that higher refresh rate, and the GPU especially in designing, don’t waste money on features that you don’t need or ones your not gonna be using much.

Truth be told, we’re an Apple family. Latest iPhones, multiple iPads, MacBooks, watches etc.. So I already came into this one expecting some good improvements, but did not expect it to be something pretty great. I decided to retire my 1st gen iPad Pro 12.9”, it was a great tablet, had it since day one it was released, but wanted something different, and a little more low profile. I was torn between the iPad Pro 11 and this new Air. The air, as far as internal specs, matches and even out performs a little than the iPad Pro 11, so with the lower price point, I figured why not. But man, hands down, this thing is pretty awesome. It feels great, with the square off edges, the thin bezels giving way to more screen real estate, and of course as mentioned, the performance. I was pretty pleased with the decision. But wait.. there’s more.. lol.,I decided to splurge on the steep price tag for Apple’s Magic Keyboard, which fits the Pro 11” and this Air. And hands down, this just elevated an already great purchase to the next level. With the track pad now being able to be utilized on the latest iOS and tablets, the backlit keys, and just the snappiness of the keys. Paired with a super easy magnetic pad to quickly place your iPad on and off. This thing is just next level. I find myself rarely reaching for my MacBook or getting on the desktop iMac. The USB-C’s versatility when paired with devices that can either output to HDMI, input SD cards, or utilize various different interface devices, this thing’s a power house.,For me, it works and then some. Only drawback is if you’re someone that wants the bigger screen, at 11” this is more than what I need for what I use it for. Other than that, I can’t think of anything negative. Sure you could argue it’s still using the Touch ID technology, albeit a much better improved version and it being on the power key to get rid of the old middle circle button, you may miss out on the Face ID apple offers in it’s Pro models. But other than that, highly recommended if you’re in between wanting to spend on the Pro models but also needing something with a little more “umph” than the standard iPad.

The title says it all. No home button, which means you have to swipe up to close an app and try to do so without touching something on the app that you didn’t want to touch. Also a problem when the Ipad inside the holder I have as the holder gets in the way of the very bottom of the screen. The lack of non-screen borders also means you don’t have much to grab onto with your fingers when picking it up, and subsequently again touching something you don’t want to.,Then there’s the lack of an audio jack. Sorry Apple, but I’m not spending hundreds of $$$ on a set of bluetooth earbuds! Had to spend more money instead on a USB plug/audio jack splitter.,All in all, this generation of Ipad is a step backwards. My previous two Ipads were far better than this disaster.

I got my iPad Air 4 from a different site, but I'll review it for shoppers here. The screen is 0.1 inches short of 11 inches, so it's not really noticeable in use unless you compare it side-by-side to the pro. The Apple Pencil works flawlessly. I did have to update to get the double tap feature to work. Please note, THE Apple Pencil DOES NOT COME WITH THE iPAD. I got mine customized from apple. The performance is very snappy and the battery life will last you almost all day depending on how much you use it and what you use it for. Switching out the proprietary Lightning port for a USB-C one was a great improvement, as now you are able to use USB-C Hubs and other connectors. The TouchID sensor in the top button recognizes my finger instantly. The iPad goes great with a wireless keyboard and mouse for typing anywhere you don't have access to a laptop or desktop. Overall, I think it is a great device who people who want good performance and don't want to pay the price of the Pro, but if you're thinking of getting this for a young child, you should probably go for the 7/8th gen regular iPad.

Overall rating is for Amazon’s handling of defective unit. For the short time we had it, it was a nice tablet. The USB C connector is a negative for those of us who have a lot of Apple tech.  Problem is that after a couple weeks we put it on the charger (battery sill had reasonable charge, so not dead).  But it could not restart. Exhausted all known forced reboot/reset methods. I got this on the black friday 2020 deal for $50 off on the space grey color. Yes, I wanted the pastel colors since they're so brilliant but I figured if I can get some money off why not take the leap of faith and buy the regular old space grey? It arrived a lot sooner at my house then expected which was extremely pleasant. It is 10.9 inches as advertised, I got the 256 gb version since I am an artist, gamer, movie watcher and reader. I like to store a bunch of stuff on my ipad. This goes anywhere from art books/tutorials, videos, music, games, and all the good stuff the ipad is capable of doing. It's super light and very fragile looking so I put it into a case almost immediately. I also bought the apple pencil to boot. I am coming from upgrading the 2017 12.9 inch ipad so I downsized when I made this purchase. I really wanted a small computer to draw on and carry with me and this fit the budget and the need. If you haven't bought an ipad before or are considering upgrading don't hesitate. Buy it now! The color of the tech doesn't really matter once you have a case on so I didn't really whine too much about the loss of color. So far I've been really enjoying the quality of the product. Everything from the display colors (pure brilliance) to the ease and speed of utilizing the higher end technical features of the product has been a blast. Thank you Apple for making such an awesome product and Amazon for the incredible sale.
I updated from an iPad mini 1st gen, it’s a game changer. Super fast, great screen, great battery life. Using the pencil is super accurate and fast too. There’s not a thing I can complain about.

During my time in college I needed something that has great battery life, small and portable and that can get work done.,Seeing how you can have keyboards with iPads, I went to buy one for the first time and the shipping came sooner than expected.,At first I didn’t have much confidence on Amazon since I don’t buy much online, but I’m glad that I made this purchase.,The battery life was amazing. Before I had a 14 inch windows laptop but I can’t take it anywhere without the confidence that the battery will stay alive. The iPad lasted me a whole day, sometimes 2 on a single charge (depending how I use it).,The screen quality was great, the screen moves easy and was capable of doing all of my work on it. It works so much better when you have an iPhone, with it I can copy and paste things from my iPhone to my iPad and not worry to type the entire link.,This is my first iPad and I would recommend this for anyone who has a bit of extra change for an amazing device.

The noise cancellation feature is so amazing that my cat was literally sitting on the back of the chair I was sitting in and she projectile vomited onto the ground and I didn’t hear a peep.

As someone that uses earbuds on a daily basis for multiple hours a day, I can say that there is nothing exactly wrong with the earbuds themselves. The problem is that I just didn’t use them enough for it to be worth it. I own a pair of $30 typical knock off earbuds that are just fine! I really don’t notice a serious difference in sound quality, and after a few days I ended up returning the AirPod Pros. I would recommend buying these to try out, and if you like them than great! But if not, take advantage of amazons free return policy and buy a cheaper alternative. Have a great day :)
These AirPods paid for themselves when I blocked out the sound of my dad telling me what a disappointment his kids were

The description of these as “New AirPods Pro” is not accurate. The only AirPods that just came out are the third generation AirPods with the MagSafe charging case. It’s incredibly disheartening to see this misleading listing and description, and frustrating that no one at Amazon has noticed and corrected it. To be clear, I have the AirPods Pro and love them. What apple just announced and released are not AirPods Pro, they are the third generation of regular AirPods.

Purchased directly from Apple, not from Amazon.,Sound quality wasn’t bad, but it wasn’t very good either.,AirPods worked without issues 5 times over two weeks and then developed issues. These were babied—no harm came to them in the two weeks I owned them. One of them began desynching from Bluetooth one morning, then then could not be resynched by the end of the day even with help from tech support.,Returned directly to Apple per their return process and awaiting refund.

So I have every kind of earbuds you can imagine. Everything from inexpensive Skull Candy to Jabra and Bose. These are my favorites. I was skeptical and thought it was Apple hype, but these are outstanding.  They are soooo comfortable and don’t fall out when I’m running or working out. The noise cancellation is outstanding as well. The transparency mode is a nice option when you need to hear what is going on around you.  These are the first Bluetooth earbuds that I have liked so much that I carry them with me all the time.,Charge time is great and the case helps keep them topped off. I have worn them on cross country flights and never ran out of juice.,Also, they look good in your ear. I’m not a fan of how some of the other brands look, but these are great.,The sound quality is a trade off.  It is ok for every day use, but isn't as good as Bose or even Jabra.  The sound can get a little distorted at higher volume and is a bit muddy even at lower volumes.  For the price of these, I expect better but everything else is so excellent that I put up with it.  This is the best I have used for working out and activities, so I put up with it.  If I am wanting to really listen to music, I am using a different pair or my Sennheiser earphones.  I know it is odd to like earbuds where the biggest negative is sound quality, but the NC, charge, tracking, spatial audio, etc. is worth it to me.,Overall, a great purchase. I just wish I had gotten them sooner.,**********************************************************************************************************************************************,I rely on reviews when I make purchases so I put a lot of time into reviewing everything I buy on Amazon for personal and my business. Please show your appreciation by clicking the "helpful" below when it asks if the review is helpful!!!

I'm giving it 2 stars because these are premium buds. When it works, it's amazing. But noise cancelling stopped working to a known manufacture defect ( common problem, feel free to look up). Apple was kind enough to replace them the first time ( it took a week or so ), but my replacement's noise cancelling also stopped working. Its pretty aggravating for the amount I paid for this...

(I PURCHASED THIS ITEM FROM A FRED MEYER),I switched to apple last month. I'm in the process of buying all of the apple goodies! I got a FANTASTIC deal on a pair of these at Fred Meyer so I decided to pull the trigger. I see almost everybody walking around with a pair of Airpods. I didn't understand the hype until now! These earbuds are AMAZING to say the least! I currently use a set of Sony WH-1000XM3 over-ear headphones. I wanted a comfortable earbud that matched or exceeded the amount of ANC (Active Noise Cancelling) that the Sony's offer. these Airpod pros do just that! the first thing I noticed when I put them in was the ANC. with just ANC on with no music the background noise is muffled pretty well. Once you get some music playing, outside noises cease to exist! the call quality is fantastic and I'm a huge fan of their slim size! My only complaint so far is how they tend to slowly slip out of my ear over time. due to this I always have to re-adjust them. this problem is easily fixed with a different set of ear tips made out of a less slippery material. as for the battery life, It's pretty decent for what your getting. I can get about 4 hours or so of listening time WITH ANC on before I have to recharge them. the case charges them up in a jiff and I'm back in business! the case allows me to get through my entire workday and both commutes with some gas left in the tank. I have yet to fully drain the case. all in all, I am very happy with these. I know that the sony WF-1000XM3 buds edge the pros out ever so slightly but I think the Sleek look and portable size make these superior!

I have had a number of generic headphones and on Black Friday I thought I would splurge for a premium brand to see the difference. I do like these earbuds however, I wasn’t blown away., Pros. I love that the case has wireless charging. These are the first earbuds I’ve owned with spatial surround sound and it makes watching TV more enjoyable. Apple added a button on the stem of each earbud instead of touch controls which I like. I find when having to adjust earbuds in my ears touch controls can be easily pressed by accident. It happens much less with these. The sound quality, I could go either way on. Yes they sound good and clear and there’s some bass there. But I wish you had more control, an EQ within an app or something., Cons. There really aren’t many. They could use more bass. I was surprised your not able to control the volume from the earbuds themselves unless you use Siri. The ANC is ok but not much better than some generic earbuds I’ve tried.,  Overall, I’d definitely recommend them to Apple users. Because all of Apple’s products work flawlessly together. I don’t think they are the best out there but there good. If you’d like cheaper alternative, I really like the Boltune Elite headphones for $35 at Walmart. Great sound quality for the price.

They're just good earphones. They've got a reasonably long battery life, unless you listen to music for longer than 5 hours at a time which I do not recommend since it will damage your ears. Sound quality and noise cancellation are excellent, especially for such a small pair of earphones. They're easy to pair and simple to work with. Voice calling is great, messaging and Siri are great. My ear canal is small but they gave adjustable tips that fit in my ears perfectly.,Two things to mention are that they are most worth it when you're using it with other Apple products, like iPhone/iPad/Mac etc., and that the maximum volume is not as loud as I had hoped, but it is still loud enough to hear anything clearly enough with noise cancellation mode on (and I have a slight hearing impairment so they may be more than sufficient).

I've never been big on Apple products, came from 10 years of Android usage, starting in 2009. My wife loves Apple and after giving her my Androids, I decided to switch to Apple for her. When I first seen the price tag for these things, I instantly thought ew.,However, after tons of research, I found that these are only second to a similarly priced set of Sony BT IEMs. I picked these up for $100 off though, and I'm glad I got them. The sound quality, the integration to the iPhone 13 Pro Max 1TBs we have, and the features on them are outstanding.,I wish the molding seams were more flush though, for the cost, you'd expect some smoothly assembled pieces. Thinking of taking a super fine emery board to them. Those ledges/creases are gunk and dirt prone. I've seen some nasty looking airpods out there lol.

I love Bluetooth ear buds! These AirPods pros are the best at everything - except staying in my ears! Doing dishes? They’ll fall onto the floor or into the sink. Vacuuming? Same thing. Eating, taking, or quietly sitting at a desk doing nothing? They’ll fall out every 5-20 minutes.,They are the best product I’ve ever owned that cannot be used. Bought a pair for my girlfriend - she has the same problem. Weird, neither of us had this problem with cheap buds. We are both switching to Bose and selling our AirPods :(,Note: We both tried every size ear tip and also bought expensive aftermarket tips. Aftermarket helped but the buds still fall out constantly - really sucks the joy out of music. Selling both pairs of AirPod pros to a person with ears designed for them.

They are easy to use, comfortable, and sound quality is good, but I bought these specifically for the noise cancelling feature.  When I first bought them I was absolutely in love with them.  The noise cancellation was unbelievable!  I have a loud car and when I put these in (while parked) I could not hear my car at all.  However, with each forced firmware update the noise cancellation got progressively worse.  I tried different tips that were supplied thinking that I needed a different size, that didn't work.  I then bought two different sets of tips off of Amazon (including the Comply Foam Tips) and the noise cancelling was still awful.  The newest firmware update, made the noise cancellation virtually obsolete!  So, I gave these to my daughter and bought an $80 pair of ANC earbuds off of Amazon and they blow these away!  My only guess is that Apple is trying to improve battery life by sacrificing ANC, but that is only a guess.  If you want these for other reasons, besides ANC, go for it I guess or just buy the base AirPods and save some money.  But, know that Apple is apparently messing with the ANC on these because a simple web search shows I am not the only one experiencing this issue.  These went from being able to drown out almost every sound to now I can hear my dog eating across the room with ANC on!

I bought these fall of 2020. Worked well for a long time but developed a crackling and buzzing. Some research and I found out this is a known problem with a recall. I haven't figured out getting mine fixed yet. Don't know if theses are the same batch but being cheeper than the apple store makes me nervous

I wanted to love these so much. The sound quality was OK. But, if you wear them while being active, do NOT buy these. They will not stay in your ears, and tend to fall out at the most inconvenient times. My husband tried them, and they fell out while he was upgrading computer hardware . . . into the depths of the hardware. I tried them. I bend down to pick up the laundry, one falls into the washing machine, etc. What finally did it for me was when I moved my head slightly and they both fell off and into the garbage disposal. A complete and utter waste of money. Again, if you have a sedentary job, this could work for you. But, if you are active during the day, forget this product and try Powerbeats Pro.

I really liked the ease of use of the airpods but the sound quality was poor and they always started to slip out of my ears after a while. I also had uneven sound and some issues cleaning the airpods after some time. After trying some other vendors in ear headsets, I finally decided to buy some refurb airpod pros and I have to say I really like them. They fit well and stick in my ears even if I am working out or go for a run. Sound quality is night and day compared to the regular airpods (2nd generation) and they are as easy to use as my first airpods. for iphone / ipad users, I recommend. You pay the Apple premium tough. I don't use the ANC hence I didn't rate.

I use these almost everyday.  I have Apple TV so use these AirPods to listen to my shows without bothering anyone else. ( Do you know someone who has trouble hearing the TV?  These are GREAT!! ) I have Apple music on my Apple watch so I can use these Air Pods to listen to music as I walk the beach (and I can leave my iPhone at home.) Oh, be sure to buy a colorful silicone sleeve for your new air pod pros ( available in lots of colors from AMAZON ) for about $10 or less.  These make great gifts!  Did I mention how useful they are when you are flying????  Noise cancelling means a lot less stress!

It’s true these AirPods are no doubt the best version the ear tips can be changed for smaller versions to go in your ear better. These don’t fall out of your ear once they’re in they stay in better than normal AirPods their battery isn’t as good but the sound quality is so much better. The passive seal the earbuds have in your ear as well as the active noise cancellation means you can hear your music in the noisiest of places perfectly. These do not come with a power brick, but they can be charged wirelessly and even on MagSafe charger. You are going to love these

I wound up in the hospital with a very bad ear infection. I still have problems in my now. It causes an allergic reaction with some people. Even with proper care. Worst purchase wish I seen a warning review before purchase.

These are the best headphones I have ever had. I’ve always been a BOSE girl but I’m not turning back from these. Great noise cancellation, and the special audio is incredible. It’s like surround sound in my brain. INCREDIBLE. Some people are complaining about the weird shape of the end of the power adapter (it’s not the regular usb) but it’s literally the same as an iPhone charger.., you just use your iPhone charger to charge the headphones. So I don’t get why people are complaining. If you don’t have a usb-c power adapter just use a regular one with your Apple charger. I know I keep repeating myself, but jeeze so many people are complaining about this and it’s ridiculous. And also kind of hilarious.

Sleek and hard to grab, you better have hails to grab these little sleek suckers. They try to mimic a surround function to make up for and overall bad sound quality and a fully charged battery won’t last more than 4 hrs of use. I don’t mind the price if it was a decent product but this being an Apple product, it feels and performs like a knockoff. Better try Bose or anything else, Apple hasn’t put their stuff together regarding sound devices.

I wear this AirPod Pro with me all the time when I go out for eBiking on the trail. It has the greatest sound quality as if I was listening to a 7.1 surround sound system. Also work great for Zoom meeting at work or just meeting with friends and relatives. It is so convenient. I can wear it while multitasking at home like gardening, cooking, doing laundry, biking, joking, hiking, you name it. Take back you life. Use AirPod Pro.

Had to have three pairs replaced before they fixed the static issue. Now, with the new iteration, I cannot use them for phone calls. Sound is great but the mic cuts in and out and whoever I'm talking with reports I cut in and out. These headphones need work to fully iron out all the issues. I feel like I've been using a product in beta lol. I've learned much about dealing with stress and disappointment over the last couple of years with these.

Usually not a huge fan of earbuds because they fall out or make my ears hurt. These are great. I can wear them for an extended period without sore ears and they don’t work themselves out if I’m chewing gum or eating. The noise canceling doesn’t really work as noise canceling per say, but it does allow you to hear what you are listening to better and and allows you to keep volume lower. I am very happy with them & will be buying another pair for my daughter.

I first discovered this product when I was looking for some good quality wireless earbuds but were also affordable and then I came across these Apple Aipod Pros. These are wire-free earbuds with great quality, sweatproof, noise-canceling, transparency mode, and spatial audio.,The main strengths of this product are the noise cancellation, the sound quality they provide, and being sweat and water-resistant.,The strenghts of the Airpods Pro is they are water and sweat resistent this can be very useful in the circumstances of work.,Another instance that it would be useful is if you are using them to work out.,Two more strenghts of these Apple Air Pod Pros are they are noise canceling and have transparency mode.,Examples of when you can use these modes are if you have a noisey household or you just don't want people to bother you can just turn on the noise canceling mode and if you still want to hear then you can turn on transparency mode.

Great for sound cancellation but that’s all your going to get. It’s waaaaaaay to touch sensitive that if your hair even touches the side off it, it turns off. It’s horribly annoying. I’m have to constantly turn it back on. Battery life isn’t great either. After a whole night of charging. I only got 30 minutes of use from one, until it was screaming to recharge.  The sound is actually very disappointing for being such a expensive product. Honestly just get a normal AirPod or any other wireless earbuds. Because yikes this is not worth the money at all. Feeling very scammed from Apple.
They are garbage , keeps disconnecting when I’m on a phone call. Nothing else to say

If your looking at these after they have been out for 2 years, you probably know what your getting yourself into, and you probably know why you want these.,Yes, they are worth it!,I got mine from Apple directly, but should have checked on Amazon first for a price discount.,If you get them for a discount and there was a scratch on the package, that's probably why they were less and as long as they function well then the package did it's job to protect them.,I looked at my earbuds and they do say that they were put together in Vietnam.,Obviously nothing wrong with that, in fact the build quality is so excellent I can see why Apple choosed these manufactureres to assemble their luxury product!  Well Done Apple!

These are a great upgrade to the AirPods I had. The noise cancellation has greatly improved. I sound quality is much better & the battery lasts much longer. I love the size reduction. They fit in my ear so much better. I’m very happy I purchased them from Amazon at Christmas time at a reduced price. Genuine Apple quality.

Ear attachments come off in the ear.  no grip to them, easily dropped. Engineering horrible - can't adjust them without activating controls (skipping sone, stopping).  Can't get them to stop randomly playing songs even after turning off iPhone music app. But something else.

I bought these directly from Apple website. The noise cancellation makes a weird scratchy noise when I have them activated. That started maybe 6 months into using them. I’m a audiophile so I need good highs lows and mids when it comes to music, these just don’t cut it. They sound very cheap like if they were the fist generation ear phones with the cord. I have some jbl ear buds and those sound waaaay more cleaner and crisp then these. Don’t just buy these because they are Apple. Throw your ego out and actually buy things that are good. These Apple AirPods. Not that great at all.
I love them, but they did not fit my ear shape well. I ended up swapping in third party foam tips and this made them fit way better, as well as having a better seal.

I received these as a gift 2 Christmas as a go and I have barely ever been able to get them to connect to my Samsung phone. I have tried 2 different phonis 2 different phones and almost always it cannot even read the airpods being anywhere nearby. If it does somehow sense and see the airpods when I try and connect 50% of the time it says there was an error and it can't connect so I end up spending 15 to 30 minutes of my workout time just trying to get my phone to acknowledge these airpods and I would say 70% of the time I end up not even using the airpods because it's too much of a hassle and I can't get them to connect

Noise cancellation feature is amazing. I can tune out my inconsiderate roommate who likes to party on work nights and get some sleep. Spatial audio is great too! Battery life is a little weak compared to other headphones, but phone call quality and music quality is great. People are able to hear me clearly as well.

I wasted money (probably around $200 total?) on multiple cheaper pairs of ear buds. These are still the best. They’re even decently durable; I’ve painted a house, taken showers (neck down), walked through the rain, and dropped these. They’re good little head phones.

I upgraded from the regular Apple ear pods and glad I did. They sound better and have more features. The noise cancellation is great when needed and the 3 sets of buds makes it easy to fit in your ear. Definitely worth giving them a try.
Stopped working within first week of use.  Requested return label and sent back; have proof of delivery 2 days after I shipped.  No refund, no response.  Status says still on the way back!

I put them in at the gym right after work, aka peak hours, and the only thing I could hear was the faint noise of the awful music they play from the gym speakers. The environment went from loud conversations and slamming weights to almost silence once I put them in.

Pros: noise canceling, Wireless, Easy to connect out of box and case when needed, battery life is great so far, call quality good and perfect to just listen to music, you can use one at a time, and can be a good distance from your device before it gets staticky,Cons: They may slip out from time to time depending on your activity, could be a little smaller to fit better in the ear in the future

These are the real deal. I seen someone complain about say that the AirPods were made in Vietnam therefore it’s bad quality, but that’s not the case. These are official Apple AirPods with official parts just in a different manufacturing site. Also saw someone say that these aren’t “New”, and sorry to say it but they aren’t new, but upgraded. They now include MagSafe charging. The noise cancellation and transparency is perfect, packaging was top tier! Also seen someone say that this doesn’t include a power adapter, of course it doesn’t! When have you seen headphones nowadays that come with an adapter!?!?

This is a huge step from the original ear pod Apple me… I was astonished by how good the quality of sound is especially dynamic surround where as you move your head the music follows and noise canceling is a game changer… I’ve never had a noise canceling headphones but now I don’t think I can ever go without another pair of noise canceling headphones,My initial impression before the package arrived is this would probably be marginally better than the original Apple EarPods however it is a night and day game changer and a huge step up from the first generation

I’m already in the Apple ecosystem, so for my first earbuds, I wanted a seamless connection experience. These do not disappoint at all and the spatial audio blows my mind.  I did not realize NC tech had come this far. The only minor issue I have is with battery life. Wish it were a little longer. These fit comfortably in my ear and more importantly the noise cancellation has changed my living space to one of peace when needed (mostly  during WFH hours). My neighborhood is full of noise during different parts of the day and I WFH; I need the ability to focus without distractions, I.e. loud cars roaring by, new home construction across the street, kids screaming during playtime next door. 🙄 The previous earbuds and headphones I had do a decent job of blocking noise but I needed something much more effective for my FOCUS time. The airpods pro have been a game changer.

We bought these for my son who is always listening to music while doing homework, doing nothing, and doing chores if we can ever get him to do them...lol! He has a set of 2nd generation Air Pods that someone had gifted him last year, and they seem to work well for him. He's an enthusiast for his choice of music and we thought he'd enjoy these as he doesn't seem to like the Beats over ear headphones. Well we were right, he hardly takes them out, and the noise canceling works pretty well as he doesn't hear us half the time from the other room. I tried them myself and there's a major difference between the 2nd gen and these Pros. The bass is a lot more profound and I don't hear as much outside noise either. I would recommend these over the 2nd Gen, and I would imagine that the 3rd Gen can't compete. If you love music and the quality you hear then don't waste your money on anything less than Air Pod Pros.

Purchased these as a gift for my son. So far he’s in love. Says, “ the sound quality is better than before, noice cancellation, he uses at work, & play, it is not 110% the best, but good enough for a apple product”. He’s had all apple products, some he hasn’t been too happy with, earbuds that utterly suck from the apple store. “These have been made way better thus far”, well so he claims. We will see in a couple weeks. He did say, “battery life not all that”.

Wow! These are awesome. Sound quality is crystal clear, noise cancellation is life changing! And battery life is perfect for me (use about 4 hours a day) I just charge when battery starts go get a little low, which for me is every other day. Unfortunately for me I already dropped one and it’s scratched pretty badly. Do I definitely recommend some protection if you’re clumsy like me! I give them a 10/10 way to go apple!

I am not a headphone person. But I could not resist the BF price. Turns out that I like it! I was really surprised how much of noises it cancels out. And the pairing is quite easy —especially  after watching some videos on YouTube on how to set it up. It is comfortable to wear as well. The only problem left now is that I have to remember using it.

These are almost on the top of the market but far from perfection. First, the battery life is way too short. Amazing sound quality, clear, true, and great bass tones. I tested them out by first listening to 2112 by Rush - that’s what I judge good earphones by. Astonishing! Then went on to classical, rock and jazz - these are just perfection! They are pretty comfortable too. I couldn’t ask for more, and I highly recommend them!!!

I had high hopes for the “top of the line” Apple AirPods Pros. After using the Sony WF-1000XM4’s these are absolute garbage. The Noise canceling shouldn’t even be considered as such. The only thing I see good about these is convenience, and for some, “status” or “flexing” on others who can’t afford them. Even that isn’t why you should buy these.

La neta son preciosos, y te ves bien fresa, pero no le veo nada de mejora al sonido con respecto a los AirPods normales. El aislamiento es leve no es tan bueno como en unos Senheisser, Bose, Sony o inclusive los Beats Studio. No se me hace que realmente amerita ese precio con sus cualidades, para mi te deja debiendo. Como siempre excelentes audífonos para iPhone, totalmente compatibles y súper fácil de enlazar a tu teléfono, una vez que los configuras y después ya solo abres la caja y se conectan automáticamente a tu iPhone, si estás escuchando musica y te quitas uno del oído automáticamente se pone pausa, lo mismo con los videos. Muy Buen Noise Cancel sin ser el mejor y buena calidad de música pero le falta en los bajos. Si los quieres para llamadas y escuchar música casual son los mejores, si son más para musica me iría por unos Sony, Beats o Klipsch.

This Product has great quality sound compared to a lot of other buds out there.  The noise cancelling uses the external mics to measure itself with the outside noise to quiet it down.  This means that quality will flicker very low occasionally when loud random noises occur.  For example, constant loud, bumpy roads will make the quality flicker.  Aside from this, the noise cancelling is quite good.  Transparency mode is great, you can hear outside noises well.  The quality and build is great.  Great sound too.
L'utilisation est plutôt intuitive et le réglage du volume est automatique ce qui enlève un peu de flexibilité d'utilisation. En général, je suis très satisfait du produit.

I'm an old man.  My hearing is shot. I can't afford $2000 hearing aids.  I've tried inexpensive ones but they aren't customizable and don't have Bluetooth.  The Airpod Pro is perfect for me.  Has almost all the features of fancy ones including customization.  I can hear conversation again.,If you've got everything running (transparency, Maps, phone calls) the battery runs out but you can recharge in a couple of minutes and get multiple charges from the case before charging it.,I'm getting my wife a set.

Had the original AirPods for years till the batteries gave out. The Pro version is a major upgrade. The mouse cancellation is simply excellent. I use these mostly during exercise. Can’t even hear the belt running on the treadmill.  Worth the upgrade price.

Sinceramente es la primera vez que tengo unos AirPods Pro y el sonido es bueno, más no es lo máximo, supongo es debido al tamaño de los mismos. Cumplen con su función que es permitirte escuchar música y hacer llamadas. La cancelación de ruido es buena para ruidos fijos como los de un motor, pero si estás en un ambiente muy ruidoso, no esperes que desaparezca por completo, ya que ese no es su fuerte. Llega un momento que se salen de tu oído aún usando las almohadillas sugeridas, no es que salgan volando, pero van saliendo poco a poco y pueden caerse si no las volviste a ajustar.

These are very good quality pods. The noise cancellation is awesome I wasn’t expecting they would perform as good as they did. Also they do fit perfectly but you do need to go through all 3 sizes to see which fit perfectly for your ears.,The only issue is that they come off easily if you sweat so during workouts they are not good. Also they are quite pricey.

Llegaron 5 días antes de lo previsto.,Venían muy bien empaquetados, me llegó mucho tiempo antes, al momento de abrirlos se emparejaron de inmediato con el celular. No había ningún inconveniente al destaparlos, una observación que quiero hacer; después de más de 2 hrs con los auriculares la oreja me dolía un poco, cabe mencionar que tiene las almohadillas que vienen de serie, otro punto que veo mal es que con el uso del abrir y cerrar la tapa tiene un poco de juego esperaba un poco más de calidad y no estoy seguro si regresarlos o no. Pero es un hecho a tener en cuenta, puede que con el tiempo o tapa llegue a caerse.,Dejando de lado todo eso los AirPods Pro son unos auriculares muy buenos.
Took me some time to get a handle on accessing my music,But now that I have  am enjoying theconvenience

Llevo una semana usándolos y esta es mi opinión:,Son muy cómodos al usarlos, vienen con diferentes tamaños de almohadillas para diferentes tipos de oídos, la cancelación de sonidos y el modo ambiente son súper buenos y útiles.,El único detalle que tiene esque no viene con adaptador de corriente, se debe de comprar por aparte.,Para que los que tengan dudas en comprarlo, son 100% originales, vienen con garantía de fabricante.
No sincronizaban con mi iPhone, al llevarlo a Macstore para que me ayudaran me dijeron que no eran originales y a parte estaban reparados. 😠

I was skeptical about a large company like Apples attempt to recognize good sound. But this airpod pros are actually unreal. The balance is very nice and has clear lows and highs. The noise cancellation is literally worth every penny, was blown away at how well they cancel noise and how much better it makes the sound without cranking the volume. Gonna live these for a long time.

The pair I got wouldn’t pair to any device. After all troubleshooting was done still wouldn’t pair. Had to take them to the apple store the day after they arrived then proceeded to do more troubleshooting. Then they tested them to make sure they weren’t fakes. Not a great experience.

Aún sabiendo que existen mejores opciones en el mercado por un precio similar yo me decanté por estos debido a la versatilidad del dispositivo, soy una persona que diariamente sale al trabajo y ocupa transporte, camino largas distancias, hago ejercicio, estudio y como punto personal es que a veces me da un poco de ansiedad los ruidos que generan las multitudes como las voces y así, así que el hecho de tener cancelación activa en un centro comercial, en la calle o en el transporte público me genera mucha tranquilidad y felicidad; el modo transparencia es sorprendente aunque hay una cantidad de ruidos muy específicos que se saturan un poco, lo cual habla del buen alcance que tienen los micrófonos incluso para captar sonidos a distancia larga o media, el modo transparencia es tan bueno que no necesitarás quitarte los audífonos para hablar con alguien, su batería nunca me ha dado problemas incluso cuando los ocupo durante todo el día, la conexión cuando abres la caja y los sacas es muy veloz aunque siento que podría mejorar para la próxima generación de airpods ya qué hay veces donde quiero consultar la batería y se tarda unos cuantos segundos en desplegar la pantalla de información, y por último y lo más importante para muchos de nosotros, su calidad de audio es más que suficiente, no es para nada mala, aunque si lo único que te interesa es calidad sobre funcionalidades y versatilidad puede que no sean para ti, pero el hecho de tener una calidad ligeramente por encima del “suficiente” (lo cual podría etiquetarlo como una calidad de audio buena-excelente) en unos audífonos tan pequeños y versátiles se agradece demasiado. Perfectos para aquellos que estamos en constante movimiento todo el día, eso si, las gomitas sellan muy bien el canal auditivo por lo que tienes que tener cuidado con el tamaño que seleccionas para las mismas, al igual que siempre será recomendable que primero conozcan qué tan bien se adaptan ustedes a los audífonos de gomitas ya que es por ello por lo que mucha gente no logra acomodarse a estos audífonos.,PD: También depende mucho del ecosistema en el que te desenvuelvas, su funcionalidad con dispositivos apple es perfecta pero si cuentas con un android o la mayor parte de tu ecosistema es android puede que existan mejores opciones.

Buen sonido, las notificaciones se escuchan de los audífonos, sin embargo ninguna de las almohadillas se ajusto a mis oídos y tuve que adquirir unos ganchos de plástico adicionales para que no se salgan de las orejas y se estropeen, el cargador MagSafe es cómodo y se integra completamente con Apple Watch para subir y bajar volumen, cambiar canción y seleccionar aislar ruidos o escuchar sonido ambiente, un poco arriba en precio para las prestaciones de sus competidores

Compré ambos los airpods 3 y Pro ya que estaban al mismo precio para ver cuáles eran mejor.,Para empezar, los 3 se me caían cada minuto y en mi opinión no se escuchan tan bien como los pro. El noise cancelling de los pro hacen una gran diferencia y por el mismo precio valen más la pena aunque tengan 2 años en el mercado. De seguro los Pro 2 serán anunciados dentro de poco tiempo pero por el descuento que tienen actualmente es muy buena oferta.

Some of these issues may be individual to me but no matter what size silicone tip I used they fit one ear but the other always felt like it was falling out,,Also, noise canceling would change mid meeting unprompted and they would often turn off while I was walking and I’d have to keep turning them back on (something I’ve now heard extensively in other reviews).,For over $300 I expected better than the no name $24 ones I’d been using and I got worse.

We bought a set of the AirPods Pro for my daughter's birthday, and she loved them the minute she put them in her ears. She's had issues in the past with ear buds because they kept slipping out, but the AirPods come with a few different sizes, and they now fit her perfectly. Finally, a birthday gift from her parents that won't be returned!  They were also on sale for a reasonable price given the quality of the product.

Tengo unos Airpods 2 y la diferencia es muy grande! La cancelación de ruido es excelente. Anoche me cortaron el cabello y cuando usaron la secadora de pelo, apenas percibia el  sonido. I have never had an Apple product though my husband and son love's them. I was a solid android person. But, after having a tablet that did not last more than a few years when his laptop lasted over 12, I decided to give it a try. It is very easy to use. I was afraid I could not manage it but it is easy to adapt. I might have a harder time with the Laptop but this is just like any other tablet in regards to ease. It's quicker than my old tablet. I've had a couple of questions but answers are easy to find. My husband always wanted to buy me one but I stuck by android tablets. I am so happy I bought this. So worth the money.

I've been using an iPad 6th Gen the last 2 1/2 years and loved it. I really didn't _need_ to upgrade, but I started watching tech reviews on YouTube (out of curiosity to find out what was out there) and ended watching a couple dozen before deciding I wanted a new iPad.,During the process, I 'decided' on every model from the 9th Gen to the Air to the Pro 11" to the Pro 12.9". The only one I didn't consider was the mini. Had one before and didn't like the tiny screen. I could afford any of them, but I realized there wasn't one single thing I do that requires the new M1 chip and the other upgrades in either Pro model. The Air, however, would be a HUGE upgrade over the 6th Gen and more than I could make use of.,So, the practical side won out and I opted for the Air. I've had it for several weeks and absolutely love it.,Data transfer from my old iPad to the new was an absolute breeze, and within 15 minutes, I was using the new Air. I now have twice the storage (64gb), more RAM, and everything loads in remarkably fast. The screen display is markedly better and watching a video on it is simply amazing. I'm still convinced I wouldn't have noticed any difference (or not enough of one) to justify the extra money for a Pro.,Apple is launching a new iPad Air in March or April, but it doesn't have enough new bells and whistles on it to be worth waiting for so I chose to buy an "older model" which was still a huge upgrade and have no regrets.,I had a few Android devices maybe 10 years ago or so, and I will never go back. Say what you will about Apple, but I love the whole 'environment' and the way my iMac, iPhone, and iPad all integrate.,I a word I couldn't be happier. Oh, and I got it for $30 less on Amazon.

I have a laptop, smart phone and always felt what void would a tablet fill…?,I bought this one on a deal because I wanted to sketch and read some PDF ebooks, papers etc.,now I use this a lot more for so many things. It’s wonderful tool for painting and sketching especially with some really good apps there are. It’s also good for photo editing and taking down notes with Apple Pencil.,Fun making music on garage band.  It’s not a must have, a luxury item.,A bit disappointed that there is no flashlight no default calculator app and the camera is alright.,Maybe a bit old school, but I still need my laptop

Great small notebook! Quiet and competent, really light, great battery life, decent size hard drive. I use it mostly for PhotoShop and Lightroom, with photos stored on network drive and LR catalogs on USB hard drive. I do wish the machine had more than 2 USB C connectors, or add a USB 3; more connections are needed!,I have a keyboard and mouse and an external monitor attached via hub with USB 3 and HDMI, plus an RJ45 Ethernet connection  to network, and have had a couple of hubs that don't work properly with the Mac.

Amazingly Close to IPad 11 Pro!!! Same cases, screen protectors and many other accessories that are interchangeable. Nearly the same performance minus camera/movie capabilities at 2/3’s the base cost. Just a little problem using the Touch ID on power button with cases. A lot of times it doesn’t get all of the print and forces you to use PIN code before you notice its attempted to many times. Other than that I’d get the IPad Air instead of iPad 11 Pro unless you plan on making tons of high quality movies.

I assume Face ID will be available in the next iPad Air version, right after we purchased this one!

The iPad itself is good. The issue I have is with the charger. I purchased the item in Australia and I was sent a USA charger which meant I was unable to charge the iPad. I contacted the seller who advised that in the small print under the model number, a bunch of letters and numbers means it’s from the US! Seriously, as if a reasonable person would know that. From reading the reviews after the fact, I can see this is a repeat reported issue. They should be more up front with this rather than trying to hide it. When I emailed them I was offered an adapter and the picture attached is what I received!,So, the small amount of money I received on this iPad was spent on purchasing a genuine Apple charger for Australia! My advice, would be to enquire first and ensure you are receiving a product that you can actually use immediately in Australia.
